author: {'steamid': '76561198106849049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 66, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1712371604}
review:
The movement and camera controls are so clunky. The game looks beautiful so far and is intriguing to play but man the movement controls are just so bad. Like did the creators outsource the movement to some third party company that half-assed it? It feels like this game was completely designed before the movement and feel of the character and then they ran out of money. It just feels bad to play. I have no other problems with it so far. Don't get me wrong there are other flaws but this game would deserve Very Positive reviews if the movement wasnt a 1/10.

P.S. maybe its a bad port? Was this game not made for PC?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971117334', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1709864366}
review:
8/10

Great and relaxing adventure/puzzle game with no narration or voice acting and no text either but well made

Graphics--------8/10 (Gorgeous and cute)
Level Design----8/10 (Some times is confusing know where to go, mostly at the beginning but amazing scenarios)
Music-----------9/10 (Beautiful soundtrack)
Sound-----------8/10 
Story-----------8/10 (Start with no clue and only in the end is revealed the touching and hard story)
Gameplay--------7/10 (Simple but with good and creative puzzles, it's enjoyable to explorer)
Difficulty------Easy (Easy puzzles but enjoyable)
Game length-----6h   (Small game but worth to buy on sale)

review:
Another all style, little/no substance game. Graphically the game looks fantastic, but everything else is a snooze fest. The puzzles and exploration are rudimentary, the cutscenes drag on and are way too frequent. Just not my type of game at all and I have no desire to finish it.

Also, the game is very poorly optimized with even my 3800x, 32GB, and 3080Ti system having pretty significant frame drops in spots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106511544', 'num_games_owned': 1627, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1707362672}
review:
[b]Sights & Sounds[/b]
- With all the crumbling ruins, magical animals, and puzzle elements strewn about, Rime manages to capture the look of Wii-era Zelda title (but with much smoother edges and twice the frames)
- I was also weirdly impressed by the skybox. That sounds weird to say, but it felt really nice to crawl out of the dank underground dungeon you've been puzzling your way through for 45 minutes and emerge into a lush meadow crowned with an expansive sea of blue or a rocky coast below a twilight sky beset with twinkling stars. Just a nice touch that helps the surprisingly small overworked feel bigger and realer than it should
- It feels like every game with wordless storytelling has a soundtrack full of keys and strings with a woodwind or percussion instrument occasionally dropping by to see what's going on. That isn't to say Rime's soundtrack isn't good (it's quite nice and features some beautiful vocal work), but you can look at the cover art and basically guess what it sounds like

[b]Story & Vibes[/b]
- The entire game is a metaphorical journey through grief from the perspective of a young boy who's been shipwrecked on an island. Given the fact that there's only snippets of story and essentially no voice acting, you'd be excused for expecting environmental story telling. But there's not any. Rime is just one of those games with a two-sentence plot and a lot of puzzles
- That lack of exposition lends a mysterious air to the game that only lifts when you find a hidden keyhole, view a post-dungeon cutscene, or finish the game to see the ending sequence
- Speaking of the ending, be sure to get keep an eye out for collectibles as finding them all will net you a much better ending
- The narrative did kinda bother me. Not because it's low quality, but because it feels so disconnected from the gameplay

[b]Playability & Replayability[/b]
- The world of Rime is a dense tangle of puzzles crammed into a 1-acre island. I enjoyed how very little space felt truly wasted. Every fork in the path and climbable surface feels like it leads to a new puzzle or collectible
- About a quarter of the way into the game, you'll reach the main puzzle hub: the giant tower that looms over the island and features prominently on the box art. I loved how the staircase progressively expanded to reveal new areas. It was gratifying to reach the end of the game an look down into the pool at the bottom. Little visual representations of progression like that always feel nice
- Controls are very straightforward; there's no combat, so don't go into the game expecting much beyond running, jumping, climbing, swimming, and the usual box pushing and relic carrying you'd expect from a puzzle game. You also have a button that makes you shout, but that's just how you activate magic items when you encounter them
- One gripe I have to raise involves the camera. It works fine most of the time, but it has a bad habit of zooming in far to closely in cramped spaces. It's hard to jump from one narrow stone column to another when half of the screen is covered by your character's model

[b]Overall Impressions & Performance[/b]
- It took me a while to get to this review, and that was mostly because I was having a hard time deciding how much I liked the game. Every time I thought about bumping up the score, I kept remembering the weird disconnect between gameplay and narrative. It makes the story feel a little extraneous; the plot framing could be entirely replaced and the game would barely need to change. It's so strange that a game with such great art direction should feel so discordant and out of proportion with one another. If Rime's gameplay were a great white shark, the narrative would be a little remora nibbling bits of food from its teeth
- Rime ran very well on the Steam Deck, but I wound up wishing I had just hooked my laptop up to my TV to appreciate the art a little more

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
- [b]7/10[/b]. I'd still recommend Rime to anyone who loves a good Zelda-like puzzle title, but not very enthusiastically. Don't get me wrong--it has plenty of virtues. The price feels fair for the content (unlike The Pathless, a similar title). But the story reveal at the end made me wonder why I had bothered solving puzzles for 8 hours. It's a bit long-winded for a metaphor

author: {'steamid': '76561198032415878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1706448304}
review:
[h2] RiME - Игра Произведение искусства! [/h2]
Шикарная музыка, приятный стиль, красивые виды. Отличные головоломки с разными, всё новыми механиками. [spoiler] Притом что герой не станет обладать сверхсилами и в общем имеет всего два взаимодействия - перемещение предмета и крик. [/spoiler]
Превосходный сюжет. [spoiler] Если при появлении фигуры в плаще я ещё подумал о временной петле, то после появления теней сразу понял что игра по сюжету как Arise (ещё приходит на ум Sky). [/spoiler]
Очень трогательная! Эмоциональный финал - уровня GRIS, Arise.
[h1] Шедевр - рекомендую всем! [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198410787804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1706037417}
review:
[h2]Prós[/h2]
 Ele é LINDO, completamente belo, deslumbrante, enche os olhos e a história é interessante.
[h2]Contras[/h2] 
  Tudo nesse jogo vai ficando repetitivo com o tempo, praticamente TODOS os puzzles e parkours vão se repetindo do começo para o final e isso é muito ruim por que você acaba querendo rushar o jogo.
[h2]O jogo vale 55 reais?[/h2] 
Não. Apesar de ser lindo, a variedade de puzzles e parkour vão deixando o jogo tão repetitivo que você fica: "Isso não vai acabar nunca?". O final quando você descobre tudo é até legal, mas até lá o jogo enche um pouco o saco e ele não instiga a curiosidade de saber mais, ele foca muito em puzzle e não seria um problema se eles não ficassem se repetindo. Espere uma promoção.
[h2]Minha recomendação pra quem quer jogar[/h2]
 Você tem que jogar com a mentalidade de "quero saber o que aconteceu nessa ilha e como vim parar aqui" se não você irá dropar. Recomendo explorar, vá em cantos nos quais o jogo não te manda ir, explore o mapa e se concentre em querer saber a história, os puzzles vão ser só um plus no jogo, não se concentre neles por que eles não tem nada demais.
[h2]Conclusão[/h2]
É deslumbrante, uma obra de arte belíssima, mas a jogabilidade se tornar repetitiva foi um tiro no pé, tem altas chances de você parar de jogar por causa disso, por isso eu digo: EXPLORE!! Não rushe o jogo se quiser ter uma experiência melhor. O ritmo dele é lento, então tem que ter paciência. É um jogo legal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018288692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1543181564}
review:
━━━━━ TOTALE: 8/11 ━━━━━

▶ [2/2]
━━━━━ STILE GRAFICO ━━━━━
☑ Stile unico e originale, crea un nuovo stile da zero o amalgamando alla perfezione più titoli
☐ Stile già visto, comunque bello o apprezzabile
☐ Disegni, stile grafico o grafica non all'altezza delle produzioni odierne

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ INNOVAZIONE NEL GAMEPLAY ━━━━━
☐ Introduce molte nuove meccaniche mai viste prime o unisce alla perfezione gameplay da generi differenti
☑ Prende spunto da altri titoli e ne migliora alcuni aspetti
☐ Non riesce ad innovare quasi nulla o nulla

▶ [2/2]
━━━━━ AUDIO ━━━━━
☑ Orchestrale, immersivo e curato nei dettagli
☐ Di qualità buona anche se non eccezionale o non troppo vasta
☐ Jingle scadenti o ripetitivi

▶ [0/2]
━━━━━ DURATA ━━━━━
☐ Giocabile per anni
☐ Longevo o end-game completo, supportato da sviluppatori e community
☑ Breve o molto breve

▶ [2/2]
━━━━━ IA, LEVEL DESIGN, SETTING E/O PLOT ━━━━━
☑ Il suo punto di forza è almeno uno tra IA innovativa, Fisica realistica e simulativa, Level Desgin sorprendente o Plot con esperienza unica ed indimenticabile
☐ Gli aspetti tecnologici e narrativi sono buoni ma non rivoluzionari
☐ Nessun aspetto tecnico e nessun aspetto narrativo riesce a sorprendere

▶ [1/1]
━━━━━ BUG ━━━━━
☑ Assenti, divertenti o relativamente trascurabili
☐ Compromettono il prosieguo di alcune missioni

author: {'steamid': '76561198427073449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1705217323}
review:
[h1]Enfrentando a Realidade abraçando a Fantasia[/h1]

Observações:

1. Uma experiência emocional;
2. Trilha sonora lindíssima;
3. Jogo curto, que pode se tornar desafiador ao buscar a Platina;
4. Se você é fã de ICO, este é um título imperdível.

[b]RiME[/b] é um jogo de plataforma e quebra-cabeças, daqueles que te fazem parar para apreciar os créditos finais ao refletir toda a findada jornada e revisitando-a com o mesmo frescor que à primeira vez. Este é um daqueles títulos que transcendem o conceito de jogo e se tornam arte, uma experiência. Emotivo, desafiador e contemplativo.

Apesar deste maravilhoso produto ter sido desenvolvido pela [i]Tequilla Works[/i], preciso falar de [b]Fumito Ueda[/b].


[h2]Conexão Madrid - Japão[/h2]

Apesar de ser nítido que [i]RiME[/i] nos remete a um conto infantil (daqueles que facilmente seriam transpostos em livro ilustrado) e que de acordo com a própria produção do jogo, a inspiração veio de clássicos como [b]O Pequeno Príncipe[/b] e [b]A História Sem Fim[/b] (que estão postos, firmes e soberanos, em minha estante), não há dúvidas que o jogo bebeu da fonte de um gênio da indústria, talvez não tão badalado quanto outros, mas que possui grande relevância: [h3]Fumito Ueda[/h3]


Com ele, tivemos o privilégio de jogar 3 clássicos instantâneos: [i]ICO[/i], [i]Shadow of the Colossus[/i] e [i]The Last Guardian[/i]. Com ele, pudemos perceber que jogos podem ser mais do que apenas seus pilares de [i]Design[/i], alçados no mesmo patamar que outras formas de arte. Não falo de aspectos técnicos, mas de [b]forma de expressão[/b].

Por sua influência [b]Hidetaka Miyazaki[/b], outro Titã da indústria de jogos (como [i]Dark Souls[/i], [i]Bloodborne[/i] e [i]Elder Ring[/i]), decidiu enveredar por este mágico caminho. O gatilho? [b]ICO[/b]. Como curiosidade, tanto RiME quanto sua referência possuem como inspiração o mesmo artista (O pintor surrealista, fundador do movimento de arte metafísica, [b]Giorgio de Chirico[/b].

Não há qualquer possibilidade de jogar [i]RiME[/i] e não se lembrar dos moinhos de vento de [i]ICO[/i] (sendo esta uma relação superficial e apenas um exemplo sobre uma fonte de inspiração marcada pela fuga dos elementos que compõe um jogo).

[h2]O Design de Subtração[/h2]

O minimalismo, a ausência de diálogos, de [i]NPCs[/i], de mapa, de percentuais estatísticos, [i]HP[/i], [i]Level[/i], [i]Stamina[/i] ou de quaisquer elementos de jogos exibidos na tela nos levam à uma imediata imersão, suspendendo qualquer descrença e abraçando o mundo tal qual nos é apresentado. Apesar disso, [i]RiME[/i] se comunica de forma mágica com o jogador, seja pela maravilhosa trilha sonora, pelos visuais estilizado e de cores brilhantes (que me remeteram à [i]The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker[/i]), além das interações que ocorrem no decorrer da Jornada.

Interações estas, de uma realidade dolorosa, transformadas em fantasia - a fim de vencer uma etapa importante da existência: [spoiler]a morte[/spoiler]. [i](Spoiler)[/i].

[h2]A Cíclica Jornada do Ser Humano[/h2]

Serão 5 estágios a serem enfrentados (relacionados ao tema central do jogo), aos quais a partir de linguagem visual e musical você conseguirá relacionar uma linha narrativa. No decorrer da jogatina, você eventualmente poderá refletir sobre determinados elementos e situações que poderão ser significados como representações de cada um destes "estágios" (não quero especificar para não cometer [i]spoiler[/i]), passando por belíssimas paisagens, monumentos de engenharia surrealista que me remeteram às grandiosas civilizações que povoaram as Américas Central e do Sul (Incas, Maias e Aztecas), além de [i]puzzles[/i] construídos na medida certa, em um [i]Level Design[/i] muito bem realizado. Dificilmente você se perderá, pois além de exibir de forma muito sutil os locais de interação física, os elementos visuais presentes e o jogo de luz/sombra o guiarão (e o surpreenderão, em um jogo com muitas descobertas!).

[b]Resumindo[/b]: jogue ! É uma experiência plenamente satisfatória, com tempo de jogo razoável se você quiser platinar. Se apenas seguir a história, não terás dificuldade e avançarás com rapidez. Porém, recomendo que deguste toda a experiência, que te trará um final triste, emocionante e reflexivo.

[i]Em memória de todos aqueles que amamos e que se foram fisicamente, mas continuam vivos em nossos pensamentos.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198408986968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1705238138}
review:
从一开始的单纯欣赏风景到后面的解密和代入剧情，轻松欢乐到沉重无奈，一个很美的故事，很伤感的故事，一个讲述失去的故事。
解谜环节还是很简单的，收集就复杂了，还是需要看攻略，画面很棒，很喜欢~

author: {'steamid': '76561198044970887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1705160384}
review: Rime is nice to look at, with an intriguing abstract story - but the gameplay is mediocre. It's about 80% looking for ledges with a white border so that you can jump up to them, which is not fun. There are a few interesting puzzle elements and mechanics, but they're used in a limited way. I wouldn't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000334671', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1704657135}
review:
Took me to over 4 years to finish this game (as younger didn’t really appreciate games where you needed to look for the information from the game world than following the given information of the game world.)

[b]RiME[/b] is magnificent visual presentation of world building. Also, it’s again one of those games where dialogue is not necessary to have to deliver the story forward. In-game animation is real eye candy to live through.

Collecting each collectable isn’t necessary but highly recommended, so give a good time to yourself and invest time to map around you. 

Feeling stuck in the puzzle? Take a deep breath and think a few steps back to get back on track. After finishing the game had an urge to visit the Greece for some reason…

[h2]Final score: 9/10[/h2]

author: {'steamid': '76561198094925183', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1612148171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020578404', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1704972351}
review:
Что хочу сказать, мир большой и красивый, приключение насыщенное головоломками, но очень большой порог входа, потому начало игры на большой открытой локации, что сразу ставит в ступор "Где я? Что? Куда идти? Что делать?", даже никакой цели нет...Долго привыкал к механикам и возможностям. Но "погрузившись", уже легче понимать происходящее. Но потом локации становятся более коридорными(чья это гениальная задумка?), а не в начале, когда стоит научить игрока механикам и мир показать. Сюжет так и не понял до конца, но если играть, как простое приключение, то отлично. Из недостатков оптимизация, местами сложные загадки(не сложность, а фактор открытого мира), постоянное чувство "что делать", уровень с птицей(это субъективно). Давно покупал, но из-за плохой оптимизации, полностью проходил через облачный сервис GFN(нет задержки, моментальный отклик).
Честно, думал, что проходил часов 20, а вышло 5, местами, конечно, становилось скучновато продолжать, так что выполнять все достижения не буду, не хочется возвращаться в этот мир, так как очень проблематично там ориентироваться и передвигаться.

author: {'steamid': '76561199360897351', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1704367639}
review:
This has been on my wishlist for a while without fully aware of what to expect. At first I expected to mostly play in the starting island with beautiful weather all the time. Kind of like a vacation experience. But the setting changed with every chapter (5 total). I was also initially unimpressed with the gameplay being mostly exploring, solving simple puzzles, climbing a la Tomb Raider/Uncharted and trying to understand the story without voice acting or a single text. It slowly won me over to the point of getting hooked and crying with the ending after completing the game a second time. 

Positives:
-Gorgeous graphics and moving soundtrack
-Relaxing gameplay where time moves quickly without noticing 
-Some of the puzzles are well thought out later in the game. What’s more, it strikes a fine balance of keeping interest while not being complicated for the most part
-Almost all the collectibles are meaningful additions to the story, they’re there for a reason
-Achievements (and collectibles) that enhance the joy of exploration (more on that later)
-Figuring out the story and how it’s an impressive accomplishment to be told so well despite the lack of words
-How every element comes together to create a game where the developers know what they want and they succeeded with their goals

Flaws:
-Animations can be odd sometimes when climbing or jumping down 
-The graphics can have some minor visual bugs when you’re swimming underwater
-Very few collectibles/achievements are 100% impossible to figure out without a guide or pure luck
-The quality of the soundtrack is not very high. You don’t hear the music with full clarity, like there’s a minor muffle. But it might be just my headset
-The chapters are long, you can’t start from a different point in chapter select for specific collectibles/achievements 
-The game needs time to grow on you and show you all it has to offer. You also need to go out of your way to put the pieces together. At a first glance you might think the game is boring and don’t understand the appeal because of this 

The achievements are the star of the show. Aside from the story progression/collectibles, there are unique achievements that beg you to explore. Each achievement has unique icon and description. Those are especially effective after completing the game once. Because you will then vaguely remember what is being referenced and then you go there to confirm. It’s such a pleasant feeling when you get things right. The best way to play this game is at least a complete first run without looking things up. Just enjoy the game, try to find the secrets on your own and then look things up with chapter select. I did my first run completely blind, second run I mostly tried doing things on my own with some pointers/hints to send me in the right direction and then it was chapter select getting everything missed with a guide. The last step is not as bad as it sounds as the game saves the moment you find something. So you don’t have to complete a chapter or reach a checkpoint. 

Even though I haven’t played games like Abzu and Journey yet, I think Rime is often compared with those games. I know that those games are more well known and popular. I’m guessing that Rime is not as good as those best games in the genre but it should definitely be played if you’re a fan of those type of games. Don’t play it if you’re planning on running quickly through it without giving the game the attention it deserves in terms of observation and thinking what you’re witnessing means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343132442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1703974969}
review: Great game, terrible port, and it's basically been abandoned. I've installed RiME on no less than three builds, from a Win10 system with and RTX 2080S and an i9 9900K, to an MSI GE66 laptop with an RTX 3080 16GB, 125 watt, and an i7 10870H... All of them have been buggy messes, that defy every attempt at troubleshooting. Between the unrelenting camera issues, and the totally random performance oddities, the game is basically unplayable, and that's a damned shame, because it's otherwise a sweet little experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077867732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1705201672}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118773741', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1703072172}
review:
Oh man...!
Ich bin jetzt noch komplett fertig von dem Ende des Spiels.
Wer Erkundungs-Spiele mag findet hier ein wundervolles Exemplar, was verhältnismäßig schnell durchzuspielen geht.

[h3]Positives:[/h3]
Das gesamte Spiel kommt ohne Dialoge an sich aus. Alles passiert über Musik, tonale Unterstützung und einfach das was man auf dem Bildschirm sieht. Das hat einen besonderen Charme und ist überhaupt nicht störend. Die Musik ist einfach immer genau passend und wunderschön!
Die Rätsel sind meist recht einfach, aber dennoch schön gemacht.

Die Story lässt immer mal wieder durchblicken, wenn man sich drauf einlässt und rätselt.
Am Ende hat es meine Zuschauer und mich einfach komplett aus dem Leben genommen.

[h3]Negatives:[/h3]
Bei einer Steuerung mit Tastatur und Maus zumindest (Controller nicht probiert) ist die Kameraführung bei manchen Kletterpassagen einfach nicht gut und störend. Zum Glück halten sich diese problematischen Passagen in Grenzen.

Im ersten Durchlauf habe ich 10 Std. gebraucht und hatte ungefähr 70% aller Sammel-Stücke, die anderen 10 Stunden waren dann für die 100% nötig. Wenn man direkt genau hinschaut etc. sollte man das in 15Std. schaffen.

Absolut empfehlenswert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062497488', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1703127498}
review:
Edited to include more detail, instead of a two sentence review that doesn't provide a ton of detail/context.

[hr][/hr] 

I really want to like this game, because the overall visual aesthetic and soundtrack are excellent.

That said, there were a lot of issues with this game that ultimately led me to stop playing this game after starting Chapter 4 (of 5):
[list]
    [*] Platforming controls aren't very good
        [list]
            [*] For example, jumping backwards off a ledge to grab another ledge had some finicky controls that required experimentation to figure out how to get consistent at
        [/list]
    [*] Movement feels clunky and isn't as forgiving as it should be
        [list]
            [*] Most notably, coyote time isn't very forgiving if you jump a bit too early to cover a gap
            [*] Note: This may be the developers' and/or designers' intention to make the player feel weak/insignificant (similar to [i]Shadow of the Colossus[/i] and [i]Ico[/i]); however, it's all the more grating given the issues with the platforming controls mentioned earlier that mean you have to backtrack to start your attempted solution again
        [/list]
    [*] Puzzles have bad signposting/previews - some examples in the first chapter alone:
        [list]
            [*] Ledge highlighting is [i]usually[/i] (but not always) done with white paint streaks; however, these are exceptionally hard to pick out when placed on near-white stone, which occurs with some frequency
            [*] Archway assembly puzzle - [spoiler]specifically the one where you have to move the block towards the entry doorway & aim the pedestal to add the partial arch to the block's arch segment[/spoiler] - isn't hinted at before the first time it's used as a puzzle mechanic, and to add insult to injury, [spoiler]it's never used again (at least through the beginning of chapter 4)[/spoiler]
            [*] Shadow puzzles (where you have to align shadows with glyphs/pictograms on walls) aren't shown off very well - the first time it's shown towards the end of the first chapter, it's not obvious [spoiler]that the player's shadow is also a part of the puzzle[/spoiler] and should have had 1-2 additional puzzles to "explain" the shadow puzzle
        [/list]
    [*] Story pacing is too slow and/or abstract for its own good
        [list]
            [*] First chapter is fine - establishing cinematic of the shipwreck & the tower as a weenie/objective is excellent
            [*] However, subsequent chapters don't have as compelling a narrative
            [*] Metanarrative is only revealed in between chapters, but is so obtuse that it doesn't really start to make sense until the transition/interlude between chapters 3 & 4 (out of 5)
        [/list]
    [*] Collectibles feel poorly planned out and added as an afterthought
        [list]
            [*] The first chapter has 2-3 categories of collectibles that can be grabbed, which should be sufficient for a game of this scope
            [*] However, it feels like each subsequent chapter introduces another category of collectibles on top of the known categories
            [*] The only categories that feel well thought out IMO are the [spoiler]lullabies and keyholes[/spoiler]
        [/list]
    [*] General lack of Quality of Life improvements
        [list]
            [*] There's no button that can be pressed to snap the camera to the current objective and/or the fox, which can be especially annoying when you have to listen to the fox yips but you have no idea where the fox is
            [*] No hint system is available when stuck - not looking for a dedicated button to automatically "solve" the puzzle, but would like hints if I've spent 5+ minutes trying to find the right solution (again, see "Puzzles have bad signposting" section above)
            [*] Timed doors/mechanisms don't have any visible timers/indications of how long they'll be active for - this is most frustrating/notable when some platforms are only temporarily activated and require good timing to reach/use (again, see "bad platforming controls" and "clunky movement")
        [/list]
[/list]

Overall, if you want a similar story, excellent visuals, and a game that overall feels much better, do yourself a favor and play [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/683320/GRIS/]GRIS[/url] instead. While it's a 2D platformer instead of a 3D platformer, the removal of a dimension really helps with the narrative focus of GRIS.

review:
This is probably one of the greatest games I have ever played. The emotional touch it has left on my life and the lives of my friends (that i made play this) will probably be with me the rest of my life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018534275', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1701485557}
review:
Disclaimer: I'm not generally into puzzle games. This game drove that home for me.

I found the puzzles uninteresting and the presentation overly minimalistic.
The game mostly tells you what to do, but not why you should care.

Why am I a child?
How did I get here?
Why am I yelling at these pots?

With the story revealing nothing for the whole first act, I expected some big reveal when I got to the tower.
That would have made up for the lack of explanation and false starts (the fish ball, the dead stone octopus, etc.)
It didn't happen.

When I got to the tower, I had a weird sand boat dream and the second act began. Big angry weird bird started chasing me and I was thrust into a new open area with nothing interesting in the immediate vicinity. I was out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314120470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1701387384}
review: Rime offers a captivating experience with its visual spectacle and a narrative loaded with profound meanings. The game's atmosphere, accompanied by its music and puzzle-solving mechanics, takes players on an emotional journey. However, the difficulty levels of some puzzles can be uneven at times, affecting the overall flow of the game. Overall, Rime is an appealing choice for those seeking a visually rich game with a compelling atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084399051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1701277902}
review:
The story is touching, but it's only about 5% of the game. The other 95% is running around and doing the same puzzle over, and over, and over, and over again. Then after hours of walking slowly, climbing slowly and doing the same puzzle slowly, the story just ends very anti-climatically. 
SPOILERS: 
The moral of the story is that the father has to accept that his son is gone and is not coming back. I guess that's ironic since the time I used on this game is also gone, and it's not coming back. Touche game, touche.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998332408', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1700876342}
review: Gorgeous 3d puzzler.  The main character is silent, but had a lot of personality and you get some "silent" companions along the way who are equally charning.  The story, when it's revealed later on, is a bit muddled and the game never really turns into something special, but it is well worth a playthrough.

review:
Very nice puzzle game. If you like puzzles and exploring, you would love this. If you are looking for an in-depth story, this game does not exactly have it. The story is very symbolic, and could be easily lost until the end. 

There are collectibles about the maps, totally optional but have prevalence at the end of the story. Nothing major, but they do have more purpose than just collecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996339188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1697296740}
review:
"Ну не шмогла я, не шмогла"

RIME - яркий пример того, как идеи разработчиков заканчиваются, не успев начаться.  
В игре по факту три уровня (или главы). Разработчикам просто то ли времени не хватило, то ли идеи закончились, но на четвёртой главе их хватило только на одноклеточный паркур, никаких загадок там нет. Зато беготни в последнюю, маленькую часть игры засунули с избытком.
Вообще видно, что с геймдизайном авторы знакомы лишь понаслышке. 
Вот лежит каменный блок с белой отметкой - на него можно забраться, рядом, в качестве препятствия - точно такой же, но, извините, на него забраться нельзя.
Вот вам загадка со светящимся шариком. А в соседней комнате ещё светящийся шар, с помощью которого эту загадку можно было бы решить быстрее, но мы вам не дадим этот шар закинуть в комнату, просто потому что. Весьма тупо. 
Если ещё заморочиться поиском всех дополнительных коллекционных предметов, беготня в игре займёт около 2/3 от вашего игрового процесса. Как вы понимаете, это разработчиков характеризует весьма плохо.
Сюжет. 
С ним вообще беда. Если у вас становится чуть более понятно, что произошло с мальчиком только в заключительном ролике, ну, значит вы, как разработчик и в сюжет не смогли. Но, опять же, остаётся куча вопросов, на которые не будет ответа. Кто эти тени, что за остров, что за механизмы, что случилось с мамой мальчика, кто фигура в красной накидке, если красную накидку носит пацан? Ответов вы не найдёте, а значит, с повествованием у игры серьёзная беда.
Да, неплохая картинка, но оптимизация местами хромает (я раз пять проваливался сквозь текстурки).
Неплохая фоновая музыка, но в отрыве от игры её и не вспомнишь.
Даже как инди игра на любителя. Её большим достоинствои является то, что она достаточно короткая. Хотя, если убрать всю бессмысленную беготню, проходится она часа за три, что по мне маловато.
Ну и напоследок ещё камешек в огород разработчиков. Я люблю исследовать открытые миры игр, но если уж даже я, пройдя игру и облазив почти всё, что мог, открыл 11 ачивок из 31, мои полномочия как бы всё.
6 из 10, и то авансом

author: {'steamid': '76561199386494818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1694718636}
review: Absolutely love this game, the emotional context and complex backstory left me happy and sometimes left me with tears in my eyes. I've finished the game twice and could see myself coming back for a third.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138535163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1694429224}
review:
RiME hat mich sofort in seine geheimnisvolle Welt verschlungen und das Spiel war ein andauerndes Erlebnis vollkommener Immersion und bezauberten Staunens.
Kaum ein Moment verging, ohne dass meine Neugier, Faszination oder Bewunderung hellwach waren. Im Verlauf des Spiels hat mich die Handlung mehr und mehr gefesselt und zu guter Letzt sehr berührt.
Statt findet diese Erfahrung als Adventure-Puzzle.

Ich fand es unglaublich schön, so von einem Spiel verzaubert zu werden und seine Handlung so intensiv zu spüren.

Ich möchte RiME allen ans Herz legen, die gerne die Schönheit in Dingen bestaunen und denen, die erzählte Geschichten sehr einfühlsam erfahren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178133586', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1694331654}
review:
※ 먼저 선물해주신 개굴님께 감사드립니다.
계정 내 100번째 도전과제 100% 달성한 게임입니다.

1장이랑 2장에서는 밝고 웅장한 그래픽과 ost, 그리고 귀여운 여우 덕분에 힐링하면서 플레이 했으나...
3장에서 분위기가 바뀌더니 4장에서는 개인적으로 처절하다고 느꼈습니다...;; [spoiler] 내가 키운 센티널이 ㅠㅠ [/spoiler]

퍼즐 난이도는 어려운 편은 아니나 맵이 넓어 시야를 크게 봐야합니다.
달리기 버튼이 존재하지 않아 빨리빨리 성향이 있는 저는 답답하다 느끼기도 했습니다 [strike] 점프 키를 계속 누르며 [/strike]
벽에 부딪혀서 주저앉을 때가 있는데 자주 부딪히면 본인 성질 나빠질 수도 있으니 안전주행(?) 합시다

퍼즐류, 아기자기한 그래픽, 좋은 노래, 여우 사랑 의 성향(?)을 가진 분들께는 추천드리고
답답한건 절대 싫다, 스토리 이해하는 것에 머리 쓰기 싫다 하시는 분들께는 비추드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050697025', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1693486049}
review:
[h1] Damn this game really hit me so hard im still reeling whilr writing this[/h1]  

My only gripe with this game would be then endless corridors of running that exist everywhere in this game. The cynic in me thinks it is so prevalent just to pad out the runtime but the game is really gorgeous so i dont really mind it too much. Also the gameplay aspect of this is lackluster. The platforming is uninspired and linear and the puzzles are practically non existent. There was only one point in the game where i had to think about how to solve it.

[i]I had a lump in my throat and tears in my eyes that entire last act. I do not think i will be able to play through this game again anytime soon[/i]  
  
TL;DR:- Buy this game on a deep sale and play through the main story

author: {'steamid': '76561198385290956', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1688946826}
review:
It is one of those games that you recommend to a person that has never played a video game before, wholesome, the night sky is beautiful, the animation is awesome and like many reviews say, it is refreshing to have a platformer/adventure game  with no attack button, it does take elements from other games like crystal dynamic's tomb raider climbing and jumping from cliffs part and it feels like TLOZ: Wind Waker animation wise......but still being it's own original game, it is one of those little games you want to enjoy and just look at the details and look for secrets and the way the story is told without words could mesmerize anyone new to gaming, again, I would love to see more from this studio and I know I haven't finished the game yet but it reminds me of my dog soooooooooo much that it's kinda special when I boot the game up so even if it takes me a year to finish a 10 or so hour game, I will do so at my own pace, 10/10, if you are looking for something to just enjoy and feel with a good story, this is it, give it a go and thank me later.

Gracias Julio.

review:
✔️ ESTILO ARTÍSTICO: Excelentes.

✔️ RENDIMIENTO: Muy bueno.

✔️ CALIDAD/PRECIO: Debes comprarlo.

✔️ REQUISITOS: Casi cualquier PC.

✔️ HISTORIA: Excelente.

✔️ BUGS: No tiene o al menos no encontré con mi experiencia.

✔️ JUGABILIDAD: Excelente.


🌟 OPINIÓN PERSONAL🌟

- No tengo palabras para describir esta maravilla, no lo he podido jugar antes por falta de tiempo pero desde que lo he jugado, me ha parecido uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en mucho tiempo. Te transmite mucho y a parte el mensaje que te deja es muy valioso. Es un juego que si o si tienes que jugarlo en caso que no lo hayas visto en tu vida, te prometo que habrá valido la pena. Yo me lo compre hasta en formato físico para PC para tenerlo en mi colección como uno de los mas valiosos para mi. 

Espero que mi reseña te haya sido útil y puedas disfrutar de esta maravilla.

Este juego se lleva el sello de ⭐ MUY RECOMENDABLE ⭐

author: {'steamid': '76561197990189049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1692283655}
review:
É um jogo que é belo e vazio ao mesmo tempo. A premissa lembra muito um survive começando perdido em uma ilha, mas conforme vai desenrolando o jogo, você percebe que a unica coisa que você faz é contemplar o ambiente, coletar itens perdidos no mapa, e resolver puzzles. Há também a falta de cuidado com a experiencia do usuário em alguns pontos do jogo, pois alguns eventos/puzzles não se conectam logicamente, e se você quiser resolver todos os mistérios da ilha provavelmente terá que ver algum tutorial na internet.

Se houvesse mais elementos ativos de sobrevivência também, ao invés de apenas dia e noite, seria mais divertido a interação.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049467162', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1586399951}
review: Made me cry

author: {'steamid': '76561198829677687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1691882576}
review:
J'ai terminé ce jeu et voila ce que j'en ai pensé : 
Une immersion totale dans un univers et une île dont on ne connait rien, les paysages et l'ambiance générale sont à couper le souffle.  Ces derniers changent et permettent de ne pas de lasser pendant le jeu.
Rime est un parfait mélange entre jeu contemplatif et de réflexion et les émotions sont présent du début jusqu'à la fin, surtout la fin !

je ne peux que recommander ce jeu, d'autant plus qu'il se termine en quelques petites heures seulement, un petit bijou de Tequila Works !

author: {'steamid': '76561198064364662', 'num_games_owned': 2075, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1691595876}
review:
私のような家族愛に飢えきってしまった人にとって、このゲームはあまりにも深く刺さりすぎる。
ささいな不満点はあっても、その強力な感動でどうでもよくなってしまう。
一番言いたいことがネタバレになってしまうし、非常に個人的な理由もあり抽象的にしか書けないが、
ひとつの理想というものを、それがフィクションであっても具現化されるということは、
言葉にできないような苦痛や悲しみをなんとか形にして乗り越えようとするきっかけになる。
すぐれた物語にはそのような力があり、それが真価になる。
この素晴らしい作品はゲームという形式を通してそれを実現したのだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561199213743706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1691119245}
review:
Me: this game is perfect for modern activists.
Someone: how do you figure?
Me: because this is the only game I know where yelling at the top of their lungs gets them anywhere.

[h1] Introduction [/h1]

RiME is an puzzle/adventure game developed by Tequila Works, with heavy emphasis in visual and environmental storytelling. To be honest, I played this game before cracked, but I decided to buy it to support the developers, because I liked it... a lot. Let me explain why.

[h1] Worldbuilding [/h1]

It's difficult to talk about worldbuilding in a game like this, because the player visits several worlds, each with its own theme and aesthetics, but one thing they have in common is their rules. The way puzzles are resolved is consistent in every world, and seem to function the same, no matter where the player are in the game, which implies the existence of some sort of magic. And given the overall intentions of the writers with this game, I'd say it's pretty consistent in essence. If the rules were different for each world, taking into account the main storyline, that would be jarring, and would disconnect the player from the flow of the story. Fortunately, that doesn't happen.

[h1] The plot [/h1]

Surprinsingly, the plot of this game is very simple. It's just the story of a person going through the five states of grief. Why this person is grieving I won't mention, because it'd spoil the whole story and would robbed it from it's punch, because the story of this game packs a punch alright. I said this game relies heavily, if not completely, on visual and environmental storytelling, and it does it wonderfully. It conveys a hard-hitting messsage without any line of dialogue. Seriously. This game has no dialogue, but the story is written and designed in such a way that they didn't need to. It takes the "show, don't tell" mantra to a whole new level. And that's applicable to either the story and the gameplay (which I'll discuss in the related section). Pro-tip: getting all the white shades makes the ending way more powerful. Refer to guides if you are lost.

[h1] The characters [/h1]

This game features only two characters, a father and his son. The player controls the son. Since there is no dialogue, it's hard to evaluate goals, motivations and personalities. But his actions throughout the game speaks of someone who is kind and compassionate, because of how he interacts with different elements or sentient beings in the game, and the father obviously loves his son, because of some things that happen at the end of the game. Some beings, like the fox, the sentinels and the giant bird are allegories to things in the world the child used to belong to, and represent the five stages of grief perfectly.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The gameplay is also pretty simple. The character the player controls can jump, roll, crouch, grab to ledges, the works. Basic platforming, in short. There are underwater zones too. He can also interact with several objects, like blocks, keys, balls of light and other elements. The puzzles in this game are basic but curiously satisfying. There are basic perspective puzzles, light and dark puzzles, activate all statues puzzles, and so on. The player can also make the playable character to use his voice to a number of purposes, like breaking jars, light up fires, even to solve most of the puzzles in the game (hence, the comment at the beginning). Because the controls are simple and intuitive, the main character is easy to control, and makes traversing the world a breeze. There are no tutorials that break the momentum of the game, only unintrusive control pop-ins when performing an action for the first time that don't stop the flow of the game whatsoever. Oh, and there is plenty of collectibles, too.

[h1] Artistic and technical elements [/h1]

The art direction of this game is lovely and somewhat cartoonish, but fits the setting and the tone of the game. Sure, this game hasn't the best of graphics, but, with a story like that, who needs ultra-realistic graphics? Plus, the art direction more than makes up for it. But one thing this game deserves praise is the music. It combines with the story to give it extra punch, and makes all the emotional highs of the game even better. Since there is no dialogue, I won't mention voice acting quality, but the sounds the boy makes fits the actions he performs and the context he is in. The performance, though, is a mixed bag. I played this game for the first time with a laptop GTX 1060, and the framerate dropped like a rock, even when the visuals doesn't look demanding at all. I had to lower the settings to get a playable framerate, so optimization was an issue then. I wouldn't know now, because my RTX 4070 runs everything just fine. The collision system needs work, though, because there were places that the character won't move, even when there wasn't any collision object, like a step or a wall.

In conclusion:

[b] Pros: [/b]

-Excellent story with a hard-hitting message.
-Superb visual and environmental storytelling.
-Simple but functional gameplay.
-The music was just awesome.

[b] Cons: [/b]

-Some performance issues (and that's tentative)
-Collision system is imperfect in some instances.

I wish more developers told stories the way this game does, because dialogue, if not done well, can do horrors to a story-driven game, Forspoken being a prime example of this. This game, on the other hand, thanks to the strength of its visual and environmental storytelling, its no-frills gameplay and tear-inducing ending, has no need for it. It's amazing how much this game achieves with so little, and that's why I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199443833600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1690754950}
review:
En mi opinión personal tiene un apartado artístico impresionante tanto a nivel gráfico, como a nivel de banda sonora, la trama es buenísima y muy emocional, es un juego muy original, artístico, relajante y profundo.

A pesar de que el juego me ha impresionado mucho, tengo que reconocer que en los niveles con muy poca luz hay algunos tramos o recorridos muy confusos, para mi gusto demasiado, también podría estar algo mejor optimizado (rendimiento gráficos) y hubiese sido un puntazo tener más horas de juego.

Para acabar y por si alguien ha llegado hasta aquí, me planteo si el juego ha sido inspirado en los famosos casos de experiencias cercanas a la muerte, viajes oníricos o cosas por el estilo.. Muy buen juego, totalmente recomendable, ojala hagan más así.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141892234', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1689847992}
review:
[b] 라임 [/b] / 플탐:4.2시간
[b] 섬 바람 닿는 미려함 [/b]

스페인 게임사인 Tequila Works에서 개발한 퍼즐 어드벤처 게임으로
유적으로 가득한 외딴섬에 표류한 왕의 아들인 주인공이 여우와 함께
곳곳에 숨겨진 비밀을 파헤치며 섬에서 탈출해 왕에게로 돌아가는 여정을 그려냈다.

무명 영화처럼 자막과 설명 없이 스토리를 풀어내게끔 했으며
간단한 퍼즐과 고요한 섬을 탐험하는 듯한 효과음, 감동적인 OST로
이 게임만의 섬마다 같은 아름다운 분위기를 느낄 수 있다.

조작이 애매모호한 편이고 명시적인 목표가 없어 헤매기 일쑤이다.
이쪽으로 가면 된다는 식으로 길을 알려주니 살짝 불친절하다고 느낄 수도 있다.

▷ 〔 어드벤처 / 퍼즐 / 탐험 / OST / 다채로운 〕
▷ 〔 ★★★☆☆ 〕

author: {'steamid': '76561198006496533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1661447448}
review:
If you want to watch the full video review on [u]the Cheapness Reviews [/u] YouTube channel:
https://youtu.be/3pXinw_cvXE
Quick Text Review:

You seemingly washed up on an island, almost no voice and guidance. Try and figure it out in this artsy game... where the protagonist has a mullet!
-Simple 3D platforming (Like a stripped down Prince of Persia)
-Inventive, if easy, puzzles to solve
-Some collectables to find (If there is a feeling of forward momentum and backtracking is discouraged)
-That may sound negative but the game is fun
-Implied/ symbolic story telling that at first felt like common indie fare (With some predictable elements) but there was a symbolic layer that only revealed itself at the end when I saw the cut scene and took a look at the level selection screen that paid off emotionally (If that screen is available before the end of the game I STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU AVOID IT TO PREVENT A SPOILER!)
-No dialogue though
-Lovely sombre music that drives the symbolism home
-Great cell shaded visuals depicting beautiful Mediterranean environs
-Really worthwhile but ultimately an artsy game where the game play isn't the point as much 

Practical Concerns:
-Bad value for money (R13.93/ hour for me - $ and £ values in video)
-Fairly big download size (7.26 Gb on the hard drive)
-Not THAT easy to run
-I'd argue it's kid friendly in spite of the more grim elements

review: RiME is a very beautiful game that's definitely worth your time and money (on sale, it's not that long). It's an atmospheric platformer kind of like Journey, but without the fun movement mechanics to carry the experience. The platforming was a bit tired by completion, but the environments and the music really carries the experience. Narrative-wise, you have to look for collectibles to get a deeper understanding of the story, although the mystery of what's going on is still revealed at the end. Although I expected the ending by the time it happened, I was still moved by it. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198447525986', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1687815512}
review:
RiME é um jogo que me encantou desde o momento em que o vi e joguei pela primeira vez. Sua estética visual é simplesmente deslumbrante, com cenários coloridos e detalhados que me deixaram maravilhado a cada nova área que explorava. A paleta de cores vibrantes e o design artístico cuidadosamente elaborado criam uma atmosfera mágica e cativante.

A trilha sonora de RiME é um dos aspectos mais marcantes do jogo. A música, é emocionalmente envolvente e se funde perfeitamente com a jornada do personagem. Cada melodia me transportava para dentro do mundo do jogo, intensificando as emoções que a história tentava transmitir.

O fato da história de RiME ser contada de forma simbólica e abstrata, deixando muitos detalhes abertos à interpretação individual de cada pessoa que o joga, é um ponto que eu gostei muito dentro desse jogo, porque você pode interpretar da sua própria maneira o que acontece, diferente dos jogos de hoje que perderam um pouco dessa essência.

RiME é um jogo que eu recomendo para qualquer pessoa que valorize a beleza visual e a atmosfera emocional. É uma experiência única e memorável, que me conquistou com sua estética deslumbrante e sua trilha sonora cativante, e definitivamente é um jogo que continuarei a lembrar.

PS:. Obrigado Tio Daninho por me dar de presente esse jogo maravilhoso, permitindo reviver as emoções que tive ao jogar essa obra de arte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198306942316', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1684339255}
review: Originally I thought this was just a cute puzzle game, and honestly, during my first playthrough I didn't quite grasp the true story and the meaning behind the game that the developers were trying to portray. As far as story goes, because it is so subtle at least to me, I don't think they did that great of a job, however, I did enjoy the puzzles as they were quite challenging. If you enjoy a nice puzzle game , this is a great one to pick up. For completionists I'd recommend following a spoiler free collectible guide that way it allows you the freedom to figure out the puzzles on your own and saves you the time of having to play the game twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354944948', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1683413583}
review:
Obra maestra, y una clara demostración de que el videojuego puede ser un arte. 
El arte solo es arte si te transmite sentimientos de una forma inteligente y expresiva, y este videojuego cumple totalmente con esto.
Spoiler a continuación:

[spoiler] El juego trata de un padre que pierde a su hijo en un accidente mientras estaba viajando en un barco, y cada nivel representa uno de las cinco etapas del duelo, para verificar esto una vez que terminen el juego pueden ir a la selección de niveles y leer los nombres de cada nivel. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198213730563', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1683412473}
review:
Man, where do I even start. I was expecting a game somewhat in the style of TLoZ, and sure, the beginning looks like that. Bright and fun. But the story continues, it goes dark. Really dark. This game gave me an insane amount of goosebumps. The aesthetics and soundtrack are superb. It has a beautiful yet very depressing story though. This game is a masterpiece. I cannot really tell anything about the story without giving any spoilers, so just try it for yourself. I have to admit though, that some parts really gave me the creeps. But then again, I am no horror fan, and get easily frightened playing a game :') 

Overall I loved it a bunch.
All together I'd give it a solid 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092836933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1683204074}
review:
This game was a big surprise! It's a beautiful looking game with an amazing sound track to go along with it. It has a lot of mystery to unfold and once you do uncover the mysteries this game is hiding you'll get to the end credits which had me in tears. 
It's a beautiful visualization of tragedy that everyone will regrettably go through in their lives. Great game and amazing story. Well worth a few hours of your time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383913361', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1682706452}
review:
"Rime" oyunu bir çocuğun bir tilkiyi takip etme macerasını konu alan oyun fakat bu yolculuk bolca duygusal sahne, mükemmel  sanatsal grafik ögeleri, platform ve bulmaca eklentileriyle çok heyecanlı ve gerilimli hale geliyor. Rime oyununu oynarken sürekli bu ne, şu ne, bu neden var diyeceksiniz fakat oyun, sonuyla sizi fazlasıyla tatmin edecek ve hatta ağlatacak.

Oyunumuz küçük açık dünyacıklardan oluşmakta olup her açık dünyada çeşitli bulmacaları farklı mekanik ve platform ögeleri ile yapmamızı bekliyor. Bunu yaparken size tatlış mı tatlış bir tilki eşlik ediyor. Size belli başlı yerlerde nereye gideceğiniz konusunda yardımı dokunuyor fakat bunun dışında kendi yolunuzu kendiniz buluyorsunuz.

Bu kısa giriş sonrası aşağıda hafif eksileri, eksileri ve artıları sıraladım. Eksiler, oynayanı rahatsız edebilecek ögeleri; hafif eksiler ise rahatsız etmeyen ama olmasa da olur denebilecek özellikleri temsil etmektedir:

[b] Hafif Eksiler: [/b]

[*] Oyun oldukça kısa. Ben oyunu 3.5-4 saat içerisinde bitirdim. Belki daha fazla mekanik ve harita eklenip oyun daha uzun yapılabilirmiş.
[*] Belki de karaktere ses eklenebilirmiş. Bu haliyle de çok iyi ama az da olsa konuştuğunu görebilsek daha iyi olabilirdi (en azından son sahnelerde).


[b] Eksiler: [/b]

[*] Oyunda çok ciddi bir optimizasyon sorunu var. 4070 TI ekran kartım olmasına rağmen yer yer FPS değerleri 60-70'lere düştü ve rahatsız etmedi değil. Bu tarz bir oyunda bu derece bir FPS düşüşü görmek hoş değil.
[*] Hikaye sonlara doğru tamamlanıyor ve anlaşılabiliyor. Herkesin bir hikaye anlatma şekli var ama benim beklentim oyun içerisine dağıtılabilecek alt hikayeler konması.
[*] Oyunda bazen nereye gideceğinizi bilemeyebilirsiniz. Açıkçası ben 1 veya 2 yerde yaşadım ama bazıları bu durumu fazlaca yaşayabilir çünkü harita sistemi bulunmuyor. Fakat bunun için oyun bazı yerlerde sizin turuncu bir tilkiyi takip etmenizi istiyor. O belirli bölgeler harici kaybolabilirsiniz. Belki belli bir süre geçilemeyen bölgelerde yardımcı olabilecek bazı şeyler eklenebilirmiş.


[b] Artılar: [/b]

[*] Aslında oyun çok duygusal bir hikayeye sahip ve her ne kadar bu hikayeye başlamayı ve bitirmeyi oyun sonuna bıraksa da insanı oldukça duygulandırıyor. Sinematik sahneleri ve grafikleri ile oyuncuyu hikaye açısından içine çekiyor.
[*] Grafikler sanatsal açıdan çok iyi bir seviyede.
[*] Çeşitli mekanikleri oyunun farklı bölgelerine serpiştirmişler ve bu yüzden oyundan sıkılmıyorsunuz. Sürekli yeni bir şeyler vaad ediyor.
[*] Müzikleri muhteşem. İnsanın içine işliyor. Ayrıca yeterli sayıda müzik bestelenmiş, hep aynı müzikleri duymuyorsunuz, bu yüzden içinizi sıkmıyor.
[*] Karmaşık bir tuş düzeni yok. Bazı oyunlar gibi 10-15 tuşla oynatmıyor. Gayet de 5-6 tuş ile çok farklı mekanikleri büyük bir zevkle oynayabiliyorsunuz.
[*] Çok fazla şaşırtıcı bir şekilde oyunda bir tane bile bug'a rastlamadım. Genelde bu tarz konularda bahtsızımdır ve ayrıca bug bulmak için her şeyi yapmaya çalışırım ama bu oyun çok temiz yapılmış.
[*] Save sistemi sizi üzmüyor. Yanlışlıkla bir yere düşüp öldüğünüzde oyun sizi çok çok yakın bir yerde tekrardan doğuruyor. Bu sayede üfleyip püflemiyorsunuz.
[*] Oyunun atmosferi harika. Fazla söze gerek yok.

Genele bakınca oyun harika bir seviyede. Her yaştan oyuncuya hitap ediyor ama daha çok bulmaca, platform severlere öneririm. Ben bu oyunu 10-15 TL gibi bir fiyata aldım ve kendi adıma söyleyebilirim ki bu oyun fiyat-performans oyunu. Verdiğiniz fiyatın karşılığını fazlasıyla veriyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018926752', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1682001402}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123854434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1681761588}
review:
Una experiencia intimista y psicológica disfrazada de alegorías que se resuelven a través de una consecución de puzzles. "Rime" es un hermoso viaje sobre la pérdida y sus consecuencias.

- Historia y ambientación: 7.
- Narrativa: 8.
- Jugabilidad: 6.
- Diseño artístico: 8,5.
- Banda sonora: 6,5.
- Apartado técnico: 5,5.

- LO MEJOR: Su estilo artístico.
- LO PEOR: La cámara genera muchos problemas visuales al girarla.

- VALORACIÓN FINAL: 6,9. Recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031531556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1638200028}
review:
I've played the game in one go, because it was very addicting to play and find out more about the story. 

The art is just beautiful in it's own way and I love games with foxes. So following the little fellow around was just my kind of thing. The story got more and more interesting over time and I didn't really want to stop playing it. 

And yes... the ending made me cry. I kind of knew something about the ending but not all. A very beautiful story indeed. I played it at a time of my life that was making me work through something in RL too, so I could feel with it in every way. Even the slightly creepy parts. 

It's been a while since I played it, but I do remember it fondly. I love the art and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015351752', 'num_games_owned': 2623, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1681038771}
review:
這款遊戲怎麼說呢,有出色的畫面和BGM,但開頭兩小時在風景美麗的小島探索好像就是這遊戲的精華部分,玩完第一章基本上已經在疑惑主角為什麼要繼續探索這些遺跡呢,直到結局都感覺不到主角的目的,也感覺不到主角有所成長,海難後留在資源充足的海邊求生不好嗎?

如果你注重畫面和BGM營造出的氛圍,journey比較釨

畫面和BGM:10
劇情:4(整體的呈現真的不太好)
整體評分6.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198866060715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1680988819}
review: What a beautiful, epic game! I had it on my wishlist for a long time, but hadn't bought it because people said the game was somewhat short and the puzzles easy. While it's true that it wasn't the longest game, it felt much longer, in a good way, because the world was so rich and engrossing. The puzzles weren't the hardest, true, but they weren't boring. It was perfect for where I'm at right now, which is a bit tired and not wanting to be doing the hardest puzzles. Really glad I played this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076088687', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1680901057}
review:
I really was not expecting this kind of experiencie. The music, the environments, the mechanics are very well done for a game if you just want an inmersion and explirative game.

But, to be honest, this time, in which I am writing this review is a very difficult time in my life, I am passing through several mourning in my life; and, getting to the end of this game, and acknowledging the whole narrative, the whole landscapes and things we did in all the game reflected a mourning was a huge shock for me.

Not a bad shock, I mean, it made me a little bit sad, but it also made me appreciate all the effort, and it made me reflect on the mourning stages I have been going through. Exiting to the main menu to see the names of each stage blew my mind too.

I simply recomned this game, it is beautiful, well done, and very emotional.

Thank you to the developpers for making this, it made me happier to play this game, and to know that this was done with such care and love, thinking in the emotional journey we all are in as human beings.

¡Muchas gracias!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024623426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1680559509}
review: Exactly what I'd expect from a game following in the footsteps of Team ICO.  From the opening area, I expected it to be a little more open and more consistently be a collectathon, but it does eventually oscillate back to that mode of play.  In contrast to what a lot of others are saying, I think the length is maybe longer than it needs to be, and I think it's incredibly silly to treat length as a longer = better metric.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024962947', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1680407659}
review:
PC settings are on the light side with not a ton to mess around with.   That being said, the game ran well enough, just make sure to turn of ssao, or whatever the most expensive form of antialiasing is.  My computer is a titan an was stuttering all over the place trying to run with those settings.

So, on to the game.

It feels like it wants to be more like Ico with solving puzzles and having a mysterious story.  Though, I don't really care about the setting and it takes far too long to get to something even somewhat unsettling.  I was on autopilot for a while and continued to be bored.

After getting the trading cards, I called it in on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249587272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1679997048}
review: 还没有通关，玩的有点难受。画面和音乐都很好，剧情表现力也很出色，基本就是你心中的艺术类独立游戏该有的样子，不过可惜主题的阳光明媚不是一直保持，跟剧情有关系，有些场景过暗导致引导不明确，到此为止还算是能接受的一款佳作，但是我要提一下这个操作……由于主角是个小孩所以所有的动作幅度都特别大，如果手脚不利索玩起来就像多动症一样让人难受，相机自动视角会跟你自己的操作打架，原来不晕3D的在这个过程中都变得有点晕3D了，一些判定非常迷惑，而且经常有非常长线的跑酷内容，加上部分场景引导不明确，视角打架，导致有些关卡游玩非常不畅通。如果是喜欢操作更爽快一些的游戏还是不推荐尝试了，玩到中间我就已经丧失了自己解密的耐心，只想赶紧通关。

author: {'steamid': '76561198008636059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1678936267}
review: It wasn't for me. Fundamentally, the problems with the game all arise from the fact that moving around is slow, not particularly enjoyable, and does not involve meaningful gameplay vis a vis challenge or interactivity. The puzzles aren't fun because they too often revolve around you painstakingly meandering around the area, moving things back and forth and forth and back. The exploration isn't fun because it's slow but also requires no mechanical effort or skill. The collecting and discovering isn't fun because the game's linearity means it feels like a chore you have to complete before you move on instead of an opportunity, exacerbated by the game's intentional vagueness (which I otherwise do not find fault with) making it unclear when you are actually pushing yourself past a point of no return. It's trying to be meditative but ends up feeling plodding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264025583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1678021661}
review:
Es difícil encontrar un juego más bonito que este, en el sentido más amplio del término. Todo en él va de la mano para crear una experiencia emotiva y preciosista. 

El apartado artístico es una pasada. Cuenta con escenarios tremendamente bellos (con diferentes paletas de colores), y con unos personajes adorables. En cuanto a la banda sonora, puedo decir que es de las más bonitas que he oído nunca en un videojuego.

Por otro lado, la jugabilidad es la clásica del género. No deja de ser un walking simulator con algo de plataformas y puzles sencillos, pero funciona todo a las mil maravillas (controles muy sólidos y fiables).

Lo único malo que tiene es el rendimiento. No está todo lo bien optimizado que debería y, a veces, sufre bajadas de FPS sin sentido. Al menos, ya no tiene Denuvo (espero que hayan aprendido y no vuelvan a usarlo nunca más).

Me sorprende que este juego y su banda sonora no hayan sido más reconocidos. Desconozco los motivos, no sé si adoleció de publicidad en su momento, pero para mí, dentro del mundillo de los [i]juegos contemplativos[/i] recientes, RiME es, sin duda alguna, el mejor de todos (ligeramente por delante de GRIS, y bastante por encima de otros más conocidos como Journey o ABZÛ).

En resumen, RiME es un imprescindible si buscas algo relajado, bonito o emocional.

✪✯✪✯✪✯✪ [h3]8.2 / 10[/h3] ✪✯✪✯✪✯✪

author: {'steamid': '76561198022701080', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1677962198}
review: Like a better, modern ICO. Great story, great puzzles, great environmental art, the collectables aren't annoying. The soundtrack deserves a 10 by itself. Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167935422', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1567364356}
review:
A princípio não esperava muita coisa, mas foi um jogo que me surpreendeu. Os cenários são simples, mas ao mesmo tempo são incríveis e os puzzles são interessantes. No entanto, o ponto forte é a história que é contada aos poucos durante a jornada do garoto em busca de respostas e o final é bastante emocionante que faz você refletir em aceitar as coisas como elas são, respeitar o passado e amadurecer para seguir em frente
Sobre a platina é super tranquila, não tem mistério

author: {'steamid': '76561198112936760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1676725650}
review:
beautiful relaxploration game with lightweight plattforming and environmental puzzles

the minimalist interface let's you take in the serene beauty of the fantastical environments that you explore

steam deck experience: generally plays well with occasional frame rate drops. I opted for medium to low graphics settings to get more battery life. That's fine because the game is carried by its art style and world design. I do recommend that you adjust the default controls though as neither back buttons, nor bumpers, nor triggers, nor gyroscope are enabled by default.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210974183', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1675598761}
review: 操作和视角有点蛋疼，黑暗迷宫需要把亮度拉满，其他的还不错

author: {'steamid': '76561198012667128', 'num_games_owned': 2128, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1674923042}
review: После финала игры - ком в горле. Не ожидал от игры вообще ничего, а в итоге получил невероятно красивую и сильную историю. To the Moon по сравнению с RiME - вообще ничто. Одним слово - мощно. Удивляюсь, как игра прошла мимо массовой аудитории. Эмоции, которые после себя оставила RiME, сравнимы с тем, что было со мной после прохождения SOMA. Я под большим впечатлением. Отходить буду несколько дней точно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128930363', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1674724323}
review:
퍼즐, 연출과 BGM 등 정말 훌륭한 게임. 다만 스토리적인 부분에서 다소 아쉬운 느낌이 들었다. 대사 없이 인물 및 연출로 스토리를 짐작하며 가야하는데, 스토리의 핵심적인 부분은 수집요소로만 볼 수 있어 아쉬움이 들었다. 기본적인 스토리는 수집요소 없이도 알 수 있되, 보다 세부적인 내용을 알 수 있게 했으면 좋았을텐데

또한 길안내의 편의성과 매달릴 수 있는 부분의 색이 지역별로 다르지 않아 구분이 힘들었던점도 아쉬웠다.

그렇지만 전반적인 퍼즐의 짜임새와 연출 그리고 엔딩도 마음에 들었던 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091326859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1674502395}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075573784', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1653588360}
review:
Was expecting this to open this game once and then forget about it but it was surprisingly good! The story will take you on a emotional roller coaster without using any dialogue and will be one to remember. 

[h1] [b] The Good [/b] [/h1]

+ The art direction looks simplistic at first but the world is gorgeous. Made me just stand in a spot for a few minutes and admire the view.
+ The story was unexpected and really memorable. 
+ Puzzles and travelling around world is pretty fun and relaxing
+ Later levels are pretty intense and a good climax to the ending

[h1] [b] The Bad [/b] [/h1]

- Some collectables can be annoying to find

All in all, would highly recommend playing this game! It's always on sale or in bundles as well so you could get it for very cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048826272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1674180736}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968557109', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1556477554}
review: A pretty little puzzle-y platformer. The visuals stand out to me the most in this game. The gameplay is a pretty straightforward mix of platforming and puzzles. I enjoyed the lack of combat; it's cool to see games make engaging gameplay without requiring violence. The story was cool, told without needing to use a bunch of text or voice lines. It didn't blow my mind, but it was a fun little experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046516103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1711878231}
review:
L'Equipe de développement de RIME a tapé dans le mille en jouant
sur la fibre émotionnelle de l'aventure, c'est la trame du jeu.
En effet on a de la sympathie et de la compassion pour ce bambin
chétif et un peu gauche perdu sur cette île.
Dans le premier niveau ce sentiment est renforcé par ce ciel bleu
inondé de soleil et l'environnement désert de l'île.
Ce sentiment de solitude s’accentuera tout au long du jeu.
La musique colle parfaitement à l'ambiance du jeu,
elle est très belle, bien que répétitive à la longue.

Pour la jouabilité :
Le Renard ne sert qu'à vous mettre la pression pour avancer
au plus vite en vous indiquant le chemin le plus court.
Tout au long de l'aventure, vous serez verrouillé dans votre
avancement sans pouvoir revenir en arrière, il vous faudra
refaire le niveau pour explorer en détails et trouver les 
divers objets proposer.
Une fois que vous avez compris le principe de superposition
des portes en perspectives pour les ouvrir, il n'y a plus 
de réelles difficultés.
Vu la faible difficulté et l’absence de violence,
ce jeu conviendra parfaitement aux jeunes enfants;
bien que la fin soit dure en émotion.
On reste un peu frustré, il y a peu de choses à faire.
J'aurai aimé :
 1- que le Renard soit impliqués, comme un temps
    le robot, dans les énigmes (genre TRINE)
 2- que les niveaux soit plus nombreux ou plus long
    le jeu est trop court, quatre niveaux en fin de compte.

Ce jeu est une belle histoire, triste, ou se mêle les destinées
du fils du roi et le fils du pêcheur, du moins c'est ce que j'ai
compris.
L'intérêt c'est que l'on se pose encore des questions sur RIME.
Il mériterait une suite ... on en redemande.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964840532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1672703177}
review: RiME is a beautifully  and truly special game that transports players to a breathtaking and immersive world/storytelling, crafted puzzle-adventure game that takes players on a journey with a delightful soundtrack. The graphics are really nice and the puzzles are ok and satisfying to solve. Overall, RiME is a must-play for fans of the puzzle-adventure genre and is sure to delight players of all ages. I played with my 2 year old son, explaing the story to him, and at the end he almost went to tears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198868246308', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1672636962}
review:
[h1]Pensa num jogo lindo e muito bem feito do início ao fim, em cada pequeno detalhe.[/h1]

A história desse jogo é surreal, simplesmente linda, o jogo te prende do início ao fim [spoiler]e faz você chorar muito no final[/spoiler]. O gráfico é simples porém muito bonito, estilo cartoon (e muito bem desenhado), a trilha sonora desse jogo então, impecável. Quem gosta de jogo estilo mundo aberto com puzzles e muitos coletáveis e áreas secretas, além de uma história envolvente e misteriosa, esse jogo é um prato cheio. Comprem sem medo.

[b]Rodou a 60fps numa GTX 1050 com gráficos altos (FXAA), então ao meu ver é bem otimizado.[/b]

[u]Dica pra quem for jogar, explorem bem cada área se quiserem fazer o 100% sem ter que ficar voltando depois que zerar, o jogo não é bem mundo aberto então algumas áreas acabam se fechando conforme você vai progredindo na história.[/u]

[list]
[*]Gráficos: 10
[*]Trilha Sonora: 10
[*]História: 10
[*]Jogabilidade: 10
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198849229745', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1678422921}
review:
我认为这个游戏是两部符合三一律的剧的组合，结构上有先后关系，但是内容上构成了一种交织。

大量剧透，谨慎阅读。

[spoiler]

剧目A：主题（逃离），场景（岛屿），时间（对于玩家来说在一天内）
剧目B：主题（缅怀），场景（家庭），时间（我认为是自夜晚到日出这一段时间）

首先来谈论剧目A。逃离是一个经典的主题，而逃离和岛屿的联系同样是紧密的。岛屿是“孤立”的常用象征（“孤岛”），不仅仅在物理上（或者生态学上）表现为独立，同时还表现为构造联系的失败。岛屿与岛屿、岛屿与陆地的联系是断裂的，或者说岛屿在联系上是失能的。举例来说，加拉帕戈斯群岛就因为这种孤立和割裂诞生了特有的生物，而许多岛屿上的网络一直到星链的诞生才有所改善。这时候反观人类社会，观察人类社会的本质——语言。语言的特点是其效力终止于人类活动的边界，这意味着语言的特点就包括联系。人类通过语言表现其渴望联系的特征，由此与孤立形成了对立。于是，“逃离岛屿”这个游戏中常见的母题就有了其存在的基础，即对人类本性的表达。剧目A中我们也可以看到语言在这里是缺席的。

接下来谈论剧目B。缅怀是一个游戏中不算非常常见的主题，这个主题往往有着较慢的节奏和微动作（眼神、颤抖、心理活动等），这些在游戏中不太好表现。但是RiME选择了这个主题。为什么说是缅怀，是因为缅怀实际上暗示着放手，暗示着一种精神上的葬礼。那么在RiME中是如何表现的呢？首先是基础的微动作和心理刻画，手握钥匙着钥匙（内心的纠结），缓慢颤抖的步态，开门前的回望，发现儿子幻影瞪大了眼睛，毫无迟疑的闭眼拥抱（闭眼很关键），放走红色披风前的迟疑，放走红色披风后闭上眼睛（怅惘）。这些实际上已经非常到位，但是他们做了更多。儿子房间的窗外，给人的第一印象是夕阳，那种昏黄的光线分明就在应和着这个悲情、令人断肠的故事，最后一幕父亲脸上打上的昏黄的伦勃朗光，更是把整个故事拉到悲伤的高潮。然而，最后答案揭晓，当红色的披风缓缓飞走，一轮日头冉冉升起，原来那并不是夕阳，而是一轮朝阳！这种手法让人想起透纳的《被拖去解体的战舰无畏号》，画面中的太阳结合画作的主题，常常被第一眼当作夕阳，昭示着前工业时代的落幕，然而最后又可以根据泰晤士河的朝向判断，太阳此时正是在东方，那边只有可能是朝阳。这种手法暗示了一种情绪变化（接受现实，迎接新生活），在人物退场之后把剧情进一步演绎，让剧目B的完整程度达到了前所未有的程度。

这两部剧目本身都已经相当完善，都可以单独演绎。剧目A可以在跃入星空时通过星辰的光切换到全屏白色后结束，也可以在最后切换水平镜头让红色的披风回归大海，正如开头一样；剧目B则无需什么修改。当然这些都是我瞎想的。正如我们看到的，最终作者把这两部剧目合并到了一起，它们就像对着放的镜面一样，产生了无穷的倒影。A中出现的诸多物件以及海洋、帆船等，都在B中找到了对应。而B在结束后呈现出的章节名称（死亡后情绪的五阶段），又把A给诠释了。如果按照一种奇幻式的理解，认为儿子“显灵了”，就让整体显得过分平淡。就我的理解，我认为剧目A是父亲的梦境，充满了奇幻的元素，最后的坠落可能是肌抽跃（也就是你在梦中会感觉从高空坠落那种体验）的一种表现。如此绮丽的梦，让人怀疑，父亲到底在多少个夜晚经历这个梦，又多少次因惊吓而醒，在离儿子房间最远的屋子静坐。他在等待戈多吗？心中期许着奇迹，又害怕梦的破碎。爱斯特拉冈和弗拉季米尔没有等到戈多，好在父亲等到了。玩家扮演的戈多驱使着父亲打开门，又让父亲见证了奇迹，这种自责与懊悔的闭环终于得以打破，父亲终于是走出了悲痛。

可是这是真的走出悲痛吗？父亲是否仍然在梦中，我们不得而知，但可以知道的是，如果没有玩家的操控，父亲将会一直坐在那张椅子上，他将永远无法迎来奇迹。这个游戏的主题是相当罕见的反崇高。我们知道感知崇高（Sublime）是一种认识到强力（绝对的大）不具有强制力（服从）的过程，诸如登顶珠峰、血战得胜中都有崇高，这也是许多游戏中的主题。但是RiME中是一种对感知崇高的反对，一种对所谓“健全知性”存在的否定，最终落脚在对人的关怀。如果对崇高的感知不可避免牵涉于梦境、游戏、超现实、神灵，那么这种所谓的感知崇高于现实中的崇高又有什么意义呢？再多的对崇高的感知，巨塔、海洋、天空，梦境中的仿拟需要多少次才能在现实中构建起来，这个时间会是永远吗？然而人不适合永远，“永恒”对于人类是无意义词汇。这说明死去的不只有孩子，还有所谓的哲学和理性，“永恒的相下”成了可笑至极的无用之物，一并消亡于真实。

[/spoiler]

于是我们唱起一支没有歌词的挽歌，落下几滴不知去向的泪水。
