author: {'steamid': '76561198397349826', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1575087391}
review:
总体来说，游戏体验还算不错，说说评测，第一章真的可以说非常惊艳了，意境，场景，包括动态的天气和昼夜真的非常让人惊喜，我站了好久截了半天图。但随后而来的就能感觉到明显的缩水，场景变成室内，建模缩水，光线经常十分昏暗，地图大而又没有提升。解密虽然不难但真的毫无成就感，结局是不错的，但整个游戏大部分时间都很无聊，第一章的惊喜已经荡然无存。
对比我喜欢的独立游戏，风之旅人五星，abzu看火人见证者四星，那这游戏很明显只能三星了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198876299604', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1575869128}
review:
[H1]Amazing! Enjoyed every moment. Reminiscent of [I]Ico[/I].[/H1]

RiME is a delightful three-dimensional platformer sprinkled with symbolism that soupçon deeper, more emotional meanings. Gameplay is straightforward and casual with no expositions or character dialogues that detracts from the story, but still conveying it perfectly. (Please don't ruin the experience by looking up spoilers.) Audio accompaniment is well-suited; albeit, not as dynamic as one would hope for. In addition, there were no timed events, inventory management, or other annoyances; thus, one can really take in the world around the main character. Despite this and the apparent care put into the game, the game is simply overpriced on Steam; get it on sale.

[H1]At-a-Glance (5-pt Scale)[/H1]
[List][*]Fun Factor / Gameplay: 4
[*]Story: 3.5
[*]Visuals: 4
[*]Audio: 4
[*]Personal Tilt (±1): +1[/List]
Fun and simply beautiful.
Score (rounded): [B]8.3[/B]

Edited for formatting only.

review: I thought I would like this game because it seemed similar to Journey. I didn't play a lot, but it's because I can't play more than that. Even if the graphics and the music are beautiful, this game is that boring. With Journey, I had no problem with exploring, but in this one, I just couldn't figure out where I was going. I really wasn't that interested in the story. Plus, the frame rate is bad and annoying. Really a disapointment for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041359589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1575400388}
review:
Lo único necesario para disfrutarlo es jugar con la música original y sumergirse en la historia.
La prueba de que una buena trama no necesita de grandes gráficos.
El que busque puzles complicados se equivoca de juego, el que quiera emocionarse por la narrativa ha encontrado un tesoro.
Es mi primera reseña en Steam, pero este juego no se merecía dejarlo pasar sin más.

review: 《RiME》的主角是一名小男孩，漂到一座美丽又神秘的小岛上，目标是进入高塔。通过传声、叠像等一系列操作解谜，一步步踏入高塔的深处。既有巨大的怪鸟，又有高耸的机器人，甚至还有操控时间的滚珠。从小岛的阳光明媚，到大雨瓢泼的海岛，光线越来越暗，预示着埋藏的秘密被渐渐挖掘出来，待结局被找出，即是一个令人震惊的故事。在此不剧透了，再见。

review: A really great story based puzzle game. It reminds me of Journey but with some simple puzzles mixed in. I don't want to spoil anything but this game has a powerful message. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys artistic and compelling stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996248677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1574916920}
review:
The first chapter is smaller than it looks. Explore, and get used to the controls.

The second chapter is nerve-wracking, and longer than you fear. If you're stuck, consider your surroundings more carefully before venturing into the sunlight.

The rest... get ready to start getting angry at a game for making you feel things. It will wind up its punch, and aim it straight at your gut.

review:
[h1]“轻松愉快”的旅行[/h1]
[b]7/10[/b]

小男孩在小狐狸和轻快的音乐的伴随下，在小岛中自由探索着。过程中伴随着一些很轻度的解谜，主要还是被较清新的风格和氛围吸引着玩下去的。

待逐渐深入了解小岛的秘密之后，相信你也会喜欢上这一趟巧妙的旅行。

[spoiler]Let it go...[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198955653417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1574495359}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996719470', 'num_games_owned': 1325, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1574570756}
review: A perfectly great puzzle platformer with plenty of collectables to find via exploration. Aesthetically pleasing, not too long and a perfect game to introduce someone to the genre with as the puzzles aren't very difficult, but it manages to evoke a lot of emotions with its wordless story told throughout the game. See if you can pick it up for under $10, I think it's worth ~$20 at most, Fanatical has it in bundles now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977293332', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1574031150}
review:
Throughout their continuing history, video games have defined and redefined what it is to be a video game: confounding puzzles, horrific experiences, cinematic journeys, thoughtful meditations, everything in-between, and every combination of the aforementioned. There is one quality that all video games endeavor to share, though: that they are entertaining, that they are fun. Lamentably, and as much as this reviewer wishes it were not the case, [i]RiME[/i] just does not deliver on that front, despite being created with so much apparent care.

[i]RiME[/i] sees you filling the sandals of a young boy shipwrecked on a mysterious island populated by ancient ruins, curious statuettes, a delightful red fox, and plenty of mysteries. Throughout your time on the island, you'll look to discover who you are and how you managed to end up here in the first place. Your journey will take you through a variety of beautiful locales, dizzying heights, and treacherous lows, all of which have been beautifully (and stylishly) realized with Unreal Engine 4. All the while you're accompanied by a haunting and lovely soundtrack. It's these qualities that make it so unfortunate that [i]RiME's[/i] gameplay is such a woeful slog.

Rest assured, it's not the lack of combat or the heavy focus on exploration that make the gameplay drag so. In truth, at the outset of the game there was hardly any notice of a drag at all. As [i]RiME[/i] proceeds, though, the block-pushing, climbing, and even the decidedly clever puzzle elements that are introduced early-on begin to wear thin. Bear in mind, this is not something that would make or break a game. It's the fact that on top of this, the simple act of movement in [i]RiME[/i] starts to become an irritation. It began to feel like every action made by our curious hero was mired in some way: his running [i]just[/i] too slow, his climbing [i]just[/i] too sluggish, the cooldown on his interactions [i]just[/i] too long. This even lead to a moment of shouting, "Move faster!" at our hero. At this time, the very game itself had become a draining experience and it was the curiosity about its story alone that kept me pushing onward to the end.

That being said, [i]RiME's[/i] ending is touching and heartfelt in a way that was unexpected...but getting there had felt like such a chore that the impact was lessened. I was shocked to find it had only taken around 4 hours to complete when it legitimately felt like it had taken five times longer. This is all written with a pang of regret: [i]RiME[/i] has so much good about it but moving around its world is simply not fun and the player spends most of the game doing it. I feel that the best way to express this is to point to Giant Squid's [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/384190/ABZU/]ABZU[/url], which has no combat, is only about exploration, but is an absolute joy to move around in.

There are so many things to appreciate about [i]RiME[/i] but it just was not enjoyable to [i]play[/i]. On top of this, the price of entry (at time of writing: $29.99) is far too steep a price for what [i]RiME[/i] brings to the table. All of this being said, I simply cannot recommend [i]RiME[/i]. As beautiful as it may be, as lovely as its soundtrack, its fatal flaw prevents it from being something that all games should aspire to be: fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065525173', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1574383100}
review:
WOW ! La grosse claque !

Via les reviews Steam, je savais que le jeu était triste. Mais vraiment... c'est la première fois que je me prends une telle claque émotionnelle en jouant à un jeu. J'ai adoré.

[i]Points positifs[/i] :

- Le jeu est très beau.
- Les décors sont variés et grands.
- L'histoire est très jolie et surprenante.
- Les temps de chargement sont peu présent.
- La possibilité de rejouer le chapitre de notre choix à la fin du jeu. Parfait pour viser le 100% succès.

[i]Points négatifs[/i] :

- Léger problèmes de maniabilité lorsqu'on joue au clavier/souris. 
Finalement j'ai terminé le jeu avec le pad de la 360. Et je n'ai plus eu de problème.

- Le coup du "au pixel-près". Pour raviver les flammes des braseros, il faudra parfois se mettre au pixel prêt et dans le bon angle c'est un peu chiant.

- Peu de diversité dans les énigmes qui sont d'ailleurs un peu simple.

Mis à part le problème de maniabilité (esquivé avec le pad) les autres points négatifs ne sont pas handicapant. Je trouve juste un petit un peu dommage qu'il n'y ai pas d'énigme un peu plus complexe. 

Autrement le jeu est vraiment pure et beau. L'histoire est à faire chialer un mort.
Je me suis laissé emporté par le petit renard qui nous guide dans le jeu avec grand plaisir. Je vais suivre les prochaines création des la Team Tequila :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198517003956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1573838661}
review:
Безусловно, КРАСИВАЯ игра. 
Красивая во всех отношениях. Мягкая графика, всё более интересные по задумке локации по мере прохождения игры, доброта (чего только стоят нежные отношения с огромными шагающими механизмами, помогающими ребёнку в этом пустынном и всё более тревожном мире), погружение в мир переживаний души, а не только "приключений тела". 
И, конечно же, ФИНАЛ. О нём можно, наверное, догадаться... Но пережить его - это восторг. Такая тонкая и, опять же, красивая в своей простоте и неожидаемости увязка всех магически-фантастических приключений с самой что ни на есть обычной нашей человеческой жизнью - это, считаю, огромная удача игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353198148', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1573930124}
review: I enjoyed Rime. It felt like returning to Ico but with Windwaker Graphics. I have a full AMD setup and this game would crash my pc super hard and was not playable for more than 10min at a time. I ended up playing it on my partner's Nvidia-based PC. Very linear, but I expect that with many "games as art" titles. I felt engaged until the last level, which was very different that all the previous both in gameplay style and tone. Didn't realize there were collectibles until at least halfway through. Would recooment though if you like short, indie story games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193337643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1573346087}
review: Jogo fantástico, com visual incrível, trilhas sonoras maravilhosas e uma história sensacional com personagens extremamente cativantes e expressivos. Não há diálogo no jogo e a história e de livre interpretação deixando sempre muitos mistérios. Me prendeu bastante. Os puzzles são bem simples assim como a jogabilidade. Zerei em 10 horas, mas dá pra fazer em menos tempo se não ficar procurando os segredos e colecionáveis. O final é surpreendente e ao mesmo tempo emocionante. Recomendo muitíssimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051791347', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1573235952}
review: RIme has some awesome music and scenery but It's not a must-play game.. And even gives some good feels. This game is more for those looking for casual, atmospheric, story and light puzzles. I played this game after a heavy game to unwind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123973041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1573100046}
review: Rime is definitely  the most creative game I've ever come across and the meaning is as heartbreaking as it is empowering! It starts very mundane  and  casual but it is all a smoke screen for what you are about to endure and boy is it exciting! The world building is the best I've seen to date and this game is a testament that stylized graphics can equally compete and hold their own against their photo realistic counterparts. The Puzzles here are outstanding and follow a single solid line of thought from beginning to end so as soon as you get a feel of how the game thinks all the challenges will become a breeze. But the game is not about the puzzles, it is a journey to the depth's of one's soul. The game is an epic poem filled with emotions that will completely consume you and transform you. It is an absolute masterpiece that will leave a permanent imprint on your mind, heart and soul. Similar game that comes to mind is Submerged and if you haven't played it you should. The movie Tree of Life by Terrence Malick is very much like Rime and the song Painted On My Heart by the band The Cult says it all. I would be very happy if my review convinces someone else to play the game, I am  paying my experience forward by telling you about it. I am proud to say that I am a completely independent person who is not in any shape or form influenced by any means to post positive reviews for this or any game. I am the average Joe who enjoys playing video games and in my opinion Rime is an Experience that can not be missed. Thank you for reading my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004781997', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1545519299}
review: Okay, hands-down, one of the best games I've played all year has been RiME. The world is breathtaking and immersive, and the game has a very minimalistic aproch to guidance and story (lack of dialogue, etc.), which only seems to immerse you more, as you get invested in the curiosities of this world. The puzzles are great, with lots of use of the 3D world and terrain. ... I really wish there were more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022207400', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1572994207}
review:
Im Grunde genommen eine sehr gute Geschichte malerisch erzählt.
Das Problem an dem Spiel ist ganz einfach, dass es wesentlich kürzer sein könnte und besser programmiert.
Einige Stellen wirken unglaublich langatmig. Die Rätsel sind die meiste Zeit zwar sehr gut aber irgendwie ist es häufig nur eine Beschäftigungstherapie.
Ich mag Rätselspiele aber so richtig wie ein Rätselspiel hat es sich dann auch nicht angefühlt.
Blackwood Crossing erzählt meiner Meinung nach eine ähnliche Geschichte... aber viel besser auf dem Punkt.
Rime lebt unglaublich von Atmosphäre, die sie auch teilweise sehr gut und malerisch rüberbringt... wenn es auf der anderen Seite nicht so langatmig wäre.

Ich empfehle das Spiel... aber nicht über 5 Euro, weil es einfach dafür teils "unfaire" als auch unnötige Passage hat für eine gute "schön traurige" Geschichte

author: {'steamid': '76561198206340652', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1656256472}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980167683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 353, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1572866216}
review:
Приятная шагалка и лазалка по стенам с элементами головоломки в несколько нелепом минималистическом графическом стиле (типа The Witness или ABZU). Впрочем, даже так довольно часто будет очень даже красиво.
Трогательная неплохая история, интересные локации, не сильно сложные головоломки.
Чудовищная оптимизация, некоторые баги, уродская система сохранений без возможности вернуться в некоторые места из-за чего собирательные достижения превращаются в муку сильно портят впечатление от хорошей игры. Ну и хотелось, что бы пацан пошустрее был.
6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074376929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1572724711}
review: Mas que un juego lo consideraria una experiencia audiovisual, te hace sentir mas que diversion en si, pero si es gratificante jugarlo y disfrutar de sus entornos de su musica y sus emociones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128330153', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1572719793}
review:
Sorpresa mayúscula. Aventura sencilla y tremendamente conmovedora cuya finalidad es más narrativa y audiovisual que puramente jugable. La jugabilidad se basa solo en resolver pequeños puzles bastante sencillos en su mayoria.

Para mí lo mejor del juego es la historia, la cual se entiende en la parte final del juego y es realmente emotiva. Audiovisualmente de 10, el juego es realmente bonito y la banda sonora preciosa.

Lo peor es que el framerate es algo irregular en algunas zonas y que hay un par de situaciones que se repiten o se alargan en exceso en mi opinión, pero poco más.

En definitiva, un juego perfecto para relajarse y que es capaz incluso de emocionar. Recomendable para quien busque una experiencia de este tipo. Particularmente disfruto mucho de jugar este tipo de propuestas de vez en cuando, y más cuando son de la calidad de este.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995858015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1572869086}

review: Le jeu comporte quelques défauts de caméra mais c'est sporadique. Dans l'ensemble, il est de très grande qualité. L'escalade, la découverte, et les énigmes sont ses atouts, l'histoire peut en émouvoir certain, de mon coté je la trouve assez confuse. Visuellement, c'est superbe et on se laisse facilement embarquer. Le petit coté aztèque du personnage se perd dans le dénouement mais ça reste une perle. Je le recommande fortement, d'autant qu'on peut le trouver à des prix presque déraisonnables (je l'ai acheté 1 euro dans un bundle).

review: O jogo tem uma mecânica bem simples, tem todas as qualidades de um jogo de exploração. A jogabilidade é boa, mas atrapalha um pouco nos momentos mais "plataforma" do jogo. Os puzzles são interessantes, mas nada desafiadores. É possível terminar o jogo em menos de 4h se for direto aos objetivos, mas há bastante espaço para quem gosta de explorar cada detalhe dos mapas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1572333011}
review:
The problem with RiME is that it feels more like a tech demo for Unreal Engine 4 rather than anything substantive. It's certainly not a bad game; a positive of being so simplistic, but visually competent, is that there is nothing fundamentally flawed in the underlying structure. But it's not a game I can say I will remember or recommend people spend the time playing if they can play anything else.

Technically RiME looks fantastic, and will really work your PC if it doesn't have the most recent of cards. Your graphical options are fairly minimal, and even on max settings you aren't missing out on a lot from there to low settings and SSAO aliasing off. Regardless you get the visual equivalent of a water-painting, and even if you didn't have any choices with graphical fidelity the game would still stand on its own due to the good work underneath it. Ironically I can't say that this game blasts, say, Windwaker out of the water, but that's more a testament to how cel-shading endures the passage of time.

Typically I don't talk about 'graphics' in my reviews, and this next section should explain why.

RiME is a competent, albeit shallow experience. The game is a puzzle platformer, with you travelling 5 somewhat open but fairly linear areas. I'll give the developers a pat on the back for making this feel like an open-world game whilst not being one-that takes a bit of map design skill. The game mechanics focus on either pulling on objects, grabbing ledges, activating mechanisms, or rolling spheres to change shadow trajectories. There is no additional equipment to collect, which means that you never feel like you shouldn't be in an area, as every puzzle can be solved upon encounter.

With minimal narrative tools, the game really should be applauded over its ability to give no information whilst not leaving the player in the dark. Part of the fun is figuring out just what is expected of you, and perhaps as an outgrowth of its simplicity it's never too complex.

There is a story here, and a lack of narrative doesn't necessarily [i]hurt[/i] the game...but it also doesn't [i]aid[/i] it either. See, there's a twist at the end of sorts, but it's less impactful when its the only piece of information that makes any sense. In the end there wasn't much of a story to begin with. I can explain it in a sentence but it would spoil the whole thing. Just as shallow as everything else, the story is a lot of fluff until the reveal.

RiME's development history was tumultuous, and in the transition from an open-world tower defense/survival game the developers likely stripped everything to basics to get a finished product. It's a fine product, but a thoroughly unforgettable one that was perhaps too stripped down to amount to anything memorable. It will get praise by the "artistic" gamers in the crowd, but I can't find any solid merit to recommend this over anything else on the market. 

4/10: Below Average

author: {'steamid': '76561198343780818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1646598559}
review: Bardzo polecam tę grę. Jest piękna graficznie. Widoki zapierają dech w piersiach, a każdy zwiedzany przez nas świat różni się od siebie klimatem. Muzyka przygrywająca w tle bardzo pasuje do tego klimatu i potęguje go. Sterowanie postacią jest wygodne, a eksploracja sprawia przyjemność. W grze znajdują się poboczne aktywności, które z chęcią zbierałem. Gra jest krótka, zdobycie wszystkich osiągnięć jest możliwe podczas jednego podejścia do gry, ale polecam najpierw zapoznać się z mechaniką, fabułą i zatopić się w klimat. Później dostajemy możliwość wyboru rozdziału, aby móc zebrać resztę rzeczy i osiągnięć, które pominęliśmy. Fabuła jest intrygująca i zmusza nas do przemyśleń, ponieważ nic nie mówi nam wprost. Zdecydowanie warto kupić tę grę, ponieważ pomimo jej długości ma inne atuty, które sprawiają, że produkcja jest fantastyczna.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410751231', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1570671973}
review:

画风非常清新自然第一感觉非常舒服
在环境中攀爬的感觉很像低配古墓丽影

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1897282918
引导不太明显很多提示比较抽象
有时小狐狸会出现带着主角前进
也有很多时候不知道该往哪里走

收集物品种类挺丰富的但大多有点鸡肋
走主线的时候去收集容易迷路割裂剧情
但错过只能重玩章节选择起来挺纠结的

С чувством "хочу еще" после финала. Rime 7 часов и я забил на 3 главе. Скучно, нудно, некрасиво (после 1-ой главы), затянуто и дииииииииииииико меееееееееееееедленнооооооооо. author: {'steamid': '76561198046147646', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1599419418}
review:
I recommend this to everyone. Absolutely everyone.
A 10/10 game, no glitches, beautiful story, challenging and inventive puzzles and nice collectibles. Solving the puzzles gives constant rewarding feels, and the game looks absolutely breathtaking (even with a stylized look!).

As for my recommendations:
- Take the time to play this. Make sure you have a few days close to each other, because you want to keep this story fresh in your mind. 
- DO NOT look anything up about the game. Seriously, I mean it. Just press play and do not look at anything else besides the settings. This will allow you to self-discover the story, and I promise you, you do not want to know beforehand.
- Explore. Explore everything and everywhere and you will be rewarded with background story and just general feels.
- "yell" at everything.

Cons: 
One of the chapters (bird) has a large, open map that is very easy to get lost in. Otherwise, the game leads you on very well, but this chapter is simply not linear and got me frustrated. I spent a long time running back and forth trying to find the next place to go. Ugh. I have seen many a streamer struggle with the same issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987143801', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1691876601}
review: Rime is melancholy adventure of alone wanderer young boy who has to solve a variety of environmental puzzles to complete tasks. The world of the Rime is so beautiful that you will never get tired of looking at. I must say this is one of the most beautiful games I have ever played in my life, but the ending really got to me and I finished the game with tears on my face :(( One day, I would love to play it again and find all the collectibles I missed. And I know for sure, I will cry again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003770847', 'num_games_owned': 10222, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1558892431}
review:
[b]UNA METÁFORA INTERACTIVA ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️[/b]

[i]Jugar, no es una palabra para definir como interactuas con este obra de arte, la palabra que mejor define la experiencia seria contemplar, con una pizca de "descubrir" puesto que la historia que pasa por delante de tus ojos requiere de ciertos momentos de exploración.
De gráficos preciosistas, con banda sonora acogedora, llenan la pantalla unos escenarios que perduraran en tu retina durante mucho tiempo. Disfruta de una paleta de colores y un diseño de escenarios que lo convierten en una obra atemporal, no tiene HUD, ni lo necesita; tampoco unos controles complejos, le bastan con un par de acciones; es un juego que te engancha porque emociona, y eso lo pueden decir muy pocos juegos.
Quizás todo esto sea fruto del orgullo patrio, de ver otra vez a GUERRILLA WORKS haciéndolo bien, creando un producto completo, que no tendrá los presupuestos de otras obras del genero, pero que sabiendo donde poner el esfuerzo, son capaces de crear esta historia, que seguramente, te jara esbozar alguna sonrisa... o soltar alguna lagrima

Un juego, una película, una aventura, que se merece un hueco junto a JOURNEY, con el que comparte muchas mecánicas, pero que a mi parecer, lleva mas allá el genero.

Este juego me lo he pasado junto a un niño de cuatro años;[i] mientras yo paseaba por el escenario el no quitaba ojo de lo que pasaba en pantalla, lo vi asustarse, chillar de emoción porque salia "el hombre de la capa roja", o alucinar porque de repente el escenario se transformaba por completo.[/i] Si estas buscando acción seguramente este no sea tu juego, pero si quieres jugar una película (y no me refiero a un Metal Gear) esto es lo mas cercano que estarás de esa meta

💻 Nvidia M 
🎮 Compatible con Mando

Síguenos [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/2535301-no.Problems/]aquí[/url] y ayúdanos con nuestro mentor 🤟

Valora para que llegue a mas gente, gracias! 👍[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1571270137}
review:
[h1]Overall[/h1]
If I could give "RiME" a so-so rating, I'd do it.  Since I'm not all that enamored of it, I really don't think it's worthy of a Thumbs Up and I feel bad about giving it a Thumbs Down.  But, since there are plenty of positive reviews here, I guess I'll go the negative route and Not Recommend it.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
Aesthetically, "RiME" is a beautiful game both visually and aurally.  It's got a good, solid theme.  And, mechanistically, my only gripe is that the game tends to grab and reorient the camera for its own purposes instead of leaving it where it belongs for mine.  

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
Unfortunately, there are several big faults with it:
[list]
[*]The story is very weak, and, when you get down to it, what the story has you doing really has no logical connection to the end result.
[*]You don't even get an inkling of the story until you've completed the vast majority of the game.  Coupled with that, or perhaps because of that, you play the game without having any idea of what you're supposed to be doing or accomplishing (or even why you should be doing it).  I spent much of the game wondering if I was letting some vast, old evil loose into the world.  After all, someone locked all this stuff up for some reason, didn't they?
[*]Outside of aesthetics, the game doesn't know what it wants to be.  Is it a platformer, puzzle, adventure, or exploration game?  Well, yes and no to each of them.  There's platforming, but it's fairly pointless and easy (it works out to a search for guano since that marks places where you can climb).  There are puzzles, but they're all trivial.  The adventure aspect is marred by your having no idea what your goal is or why you're doing the things the game wants you to do.  And, exploration is scarred by the game locking paths behind you for no reason and having no way to go back since it's a checkpoint game.
[*]The game introduces some kind of "shadow people," gives no explanation for them or what you're supposed to do with them.  Heck, in most places they're entirely passive (basically, landscape).  But, in one area, they attack you for no reason.
[*]At the same point where the game introduces those shadow people, it starts putting sand statues of people in.  Again, with no explanation or apparent use.
[*]And, finally (and I have to be vague here because of spoilers), in one stage of the game, it uses a very silly thing as a key to a lock.
[/list]
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
It took me 8.6 hours to "finish" the game with only 13 out of 31 Achievements (41%) complete.  Aesthetically, I'm pleased with the game.  But, gameplay-wise, I'm not happy with it.  Also, at its current list price of almost $30, it's certainly not worth it.  Normally, I 100% all Achievements.  But, since I'm not all that happy with the game, I'm not sure if I'll be going back to complete them.  But, even if I do, I highly doubt they would add enough to the game to make it worth that price.  So, even though I'm mostly on the edge with the game, I'm Not Recommending it.

EDIT:  I went back through the entire game with an Achievement walkthrough just to get those Achievements I'd missed.  It took me another 6.9 hours to do so (totaling 15.5 hours for 100% Achievements).

author: {'steamid': '76561198154435156', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1571161151}
review:
Первое впечатление обманчиво...
Когда впервые запустила игру, показалось, что это что-то очень детское (совсем простые загадки, медлительность, история про императора (?) и его сына...), но, черт, детям здесь лучше не доходить до финала. Начало очень медлительное и безобидное. Однако с середины игры возникает непреодолимое желание выяснить, кто же наш герой, что с ним случилось (хотя все аллюзии достаточно прозрачны). Чтоб еще раз я играла во что-либо, где сюжет строится на [spoiler] прохождении пяти стадий принятия... И каждый раз ручьи слез. Вот крайне напоминает из-за этого небезызвестную Грис, которая также оказала на меня сильное впечатление, однако в Грис не было конкретики, а здесь - полноценные слезовыжимательные кат-сцены. [/spoiler]
Графика очень порадовала, вот просто рай для любителя делать 100500 скринов.
Музыка - прекрасна. 
Всякие собирушки - люблю. 
Геймплей - спокойный и не рвущий одно место на части. 
Из минусов могу отметить:
Топористое управление (играла с геймпада, сперва было ну ооочень медленно, а потом как-то приноровилась)
Некоторые проблемы с оптимизацией. Играю на средне-приличном железе, почти все время рисовало 60 фпс, но периодически встречались фризы, в основном в первой локации.
Ну очень простые загадки. После Талоса, Портала, Миста... Такое себе. Если для расслабления - супер. 
Непродолжительно. :с Да, все прекрасно приходит к логическому завершению, но... я бы еще побегала по этому миру [spoiler] фантазий погибшего ребенка... [/spoiler]

Итог: если вы впечатлительная девочка где-то глубоко в душе - придется глотать слезки. А в общем душевная и приятная вещь. Чесслово, не отдала бы полной стоимости, но по скидке - отличный вариант.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088085711', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1530017369}
review: 这是一款在你玩过之后你的心灵会感受在艺术与感悟上的洗礼的游戏。RiME无论在环境意境的营造，BGM的选取配合，还是关卡的设计都是极具艺术的。例如当你走近那座巨塔的过程，你会惊讶的发现于巨塔如此宏伟，岛屿如此渺小的错位感。可以说是这个游戏给了我如此多这样的惊喜。虽说这是一个以小男孩在心灵世界（也可以说是穿越生命的世界）里去寻找真相与慰藉，并最后接受的故事为背景的游戏，可以说是心灵鸡汤也可以，但是它的关卡却是十分精妙并且有些许难度的，所以你玩起来并不会乏味。这个游戏是不可多得的艺术品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198302831631', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1590116929}
review:
#霜华#，很慢热的冒险解谜游戏，画风清新，bgm尤其是最后两章很能带动情绪，全程没有文字表达。前期剧情隐晦，请务必玩到最后，结局揭示之后很感人。隐藏元素和收集元素丰富，而且对剧情有补充。
优化差的问题集中在抗锯齿上，调成FXAA后瞬间丝滑，1050ti全高稳定60帧。还要记得把亮度拉到最高。尽管有不少问题存在，但瑕不掩瑜。
Fanatical一刀包，无官中。
汉化补丁： https://keylol.com/t400311-1-1

2019-05-24，epic平台限免又领了一份。（早买早享受）

author: {'steamid': '76561198836477318', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1570389444}
review:
九小时，暂时只通了一次，后半段才意识到有收集品开始有意识地跑地图全收集。从晚上到凌晨，一口气停不下来，难度不完全在于解谜，还在于操作手感不尽完美，不过没有达到影响解谜快感的程度。玩的时候意识到某些地方是在有意引导，有些地方则需要特别细心或者强迫症才能发现收集品，这个过程宛如借着手柄和制作者大佬短暂地心灵相通。
喜欢这个类型的买就对了简直戳中我全部的点（

author: {'steamid': '76561197999134652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1570926568}
review:
WONderful game.  It's original Tomb Raider without the sh#tty combat, Ghibli without anime, has an absolutely [i]beautiful[/i] score and a subtle dose of and/or nod to (if you're old enough to remember) the original side scrolling Prince of Persia.

The fox annoys me with its inCESsant barking when I'd rather explore than go and see wt[b]F[/b] he's banging on about however he's rarely about, and I loved him in the end.

Yes, I gender assumed the fox.


___________________


80 out of a 100 chocolate starfish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075754019', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1570303612}
review:
A primeira vista, não parece ser um jogo atraente, porém, quando se começa a jogar, torná-se prazeroso com linda trilha sonora e belos cenários.

O único "problema" é dele ser linear, ou seja, se você quiser voltar por onde passou para pegar um colecionável, o jogo não te permitirá isto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142212284', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1570283431}
review:
玩了5個小時，大概有1小時解謎，3小時找路跟迷路跟在找東西的路上，剩下1小時AFK因為真的很暈。嘗試處理這個問題但沒什麼效果，不建議容易3D暈的人挑戰。

Rime的大部分場景配合音樂都營造出很棒的氛圍，但就設計細節上操作方法跟這些地圖不成比例真的讓人耗盡耐心才能玩下去。因為至今沒以文字呈現主軸劇情，會顯得解謎片段、沒有方向，很多時候不知道自己在幹嘛，最後只能單純的看風景。

Though I want to say that I enjoy this game and truth is no. I've already experienced much dizzy once playing the game for 10 minutes. I tried graphic modification and windowed mode and it's still not work for me.
There are many collectable items and technical achievements on the road. At first I'm much fond of them, but when the screen shatters(because of the plot or what) and the path sometimes far from you expected, this looking-for-red-guy trip won't be delightful at all. Items will be missed easily due to the weird paths and sometimes you can't go back from the checkpoints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100297691', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1570270417}
review: Good game, but some areas are not pc friendly and I had to lower grafic's quality

author: {'steamid': '76561198173666058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1705481007}
review:
Rime é um híbrido de "Journey" e "The Last Guardian" mas tão emocionante quanto "Ori and the Blind Forest". O destaque fica para a direção de arte e trilha sonora que são impecáveis. A história tem uma aura de mistério e a narrativa é construída conforme você avança e vai decifrando o enigma do garotinho náufrago que foi parar em uma ilha aparentemente deserta. Os cenários são belíssimos. Os puzzles, intuitivos. 

Tendo dito isto, o jogo está pouco otimizado e você experimentará quedas graves de FPS até mesmo nas configurações mais baixas. 

Há grandes porções do mapa que parecem ser de mundo aberto e não há senso de direção, e os ângulos bloqueados da câmera podem ser frustrantes. 

Bugs que o impedirão de avançar no jogo podem ocorrer. Tive um desses bugs e a única solução que encontrei foi começar um novo jogo para fazer com que o bug desaparecesse. Entrei em contato com o suporte da Greybox relatando esse bug e enviei o vídeo que gravei mostrando como ele acontece. Se acontecer o mesmo com você, informe-os! 

Considerações finais: uma linda e comovente experiência que vai te cativar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000900287', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1694484325}
review:
Bom tenho que começar dizendo que RiME não é um jogo para todo mundo. É um jogo que deve ser jogado com paciência e absorvido com muita sensibilidade. Tendo isso removido do caminho, vamos aos pontos.
- Você joga com uma criança que desperta na costa desse mundo lindo e enigmático. Logo se percebe que se está numa jornada mágica onde o fim realmente não importa, mas tudo o que se aprende durante a jornada é que conta.
- Os gráficos são minimalistas mas de muito bom gosto, feitos com bastante carinho e pensados para transmitir essa leveza e beleza conforme você avança nos mundos.
- Os controles são bem simples e fáceis de dominar. O jogo é praticamente um sandbox com trechos de plataforma e muita exploração e alguns puzzles simples, mas deliciosos de resolver. Por diversas vezes a mecânica me remeteu aos Prince of Persia do PS2. Dentro desse mundo bem desenhado, existem colecionáveis que o ajudam a entender os motivos da jornada, mas não o preparam nem um pouco para o final.
- A cada novo cenário, o jogo te atinge com uma bela trilha sonora que , ao meu ver, foi meticulosamente composta para estimular uma grande variedades de emoções. A cada acontecimento, descoberta ou avanço, o jogo te atinge com uma combinação de acordes que fazem o coração palpitar, tudo para construir e manter essa atmosfera leve de descobrimento.
- A história não é muito complexa e é estimulada pela simples curiosidade de entender o que está se passando e qual será o próximo cenário com o qual você será presenteado. E aqui vem um ponto importante.
- VocÊ consegue ter uma noção do que aconteceu ao procurar por pequenas fechaduras. Elas provém um pano de fundo para a pergunta "por quê ele foi até aí?", mas a resposta para o "por quê ele está aí" só vem bem no final e, se você for como eu, é melhor está munido de lenços, pois para mim, conter a emoção foi muito difícil.
- Em suma, é um jogo simples, lento e projetado para, além de contar uma história, lidar diretamente com as emoções do jogador e ser uma experiência  de sensibilidade. E isso por si só já basta para convencê-lo de que esse é um grande jogo. Uma obra de arte interativa.
10/10 na escala Leomaníaca e recomendado para todos que buscam profundidade e emoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009156904', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1569899664}
review:
เมื่อ 5 ปีก่อน ผมเคยเล่นเกม Papo & Yo ซึ่งเป็นเกมสไตล์แฝงความหมาย คือเกมดูเหมือนมีพล็อตนึง แต่มีอีกพล็อตนึงซ่อนอยู่ผ่านทางฉาก ดีไซน์ เกมเพลย์ ฯลฯ

RiME ให้ความรู้สึกแบบนั้น เราเล่นเป็นเด็กชายเรือแตกโผล่มาที่เกาะแห่งหนึ่ง มีจิ้งจอกกับชายลึกลับในผ้าคลุมแดงคอยนำทางเราไปแก้ปริศนาต่างๆ ระบบหลักคือปีนป่ายตามกำแพงหรือของต่างๆ (ไม่ได้ให้อิสระมากแบบ Assassin's Creed หรือรวดเร็วเหมือน Prince of Persia) และแก้ปริศนาซึ่งเน้นไปที่การผลักวัตถุต่างๆไปรอบๆและใช้การตะโกนของเรา ปริศนาค่อนไปทางง่าย แต่อย่างที่บอกคือจุดประสงค์ของเกมนี้เหมือนต้องการถ่ายทอดเนื้อหาที่แฝงอยู่ในเกมเป็นหลักมากกว่า โดยเฉพาะ Collectible ที่จะเล่าเรื่องราวในเกม เพราะในเกมไม่มีบทพูด เราต้องตีความเอาเอง

เกมดี เล่นเพลินๆ สนุกกับการตีความเนื้อหาในเกม

แนะนำคือ ควรสะสม collectible โดยไม่เปิด Guide ก่อน แล้วค่อยไปเก็บรวบยอดทีหลัง ด้วยเหตุผลคือเกมนี้แต่ละบทจะมีชื่อบท แล้วพวก Guide นี่ก็ชอบเขียนชื่อบทให้เห็นมันเลยสปอยล์นิดนึง

author: {'steamid': '76561197992689577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1672485303}
review:
I recommend this game because the experience you can have is beautiful and great. I must say however, that I didn't have such an experience. The game didn't feel very optimized, which partially ruined the experience for me. Besides that, the walking speed of the character is relatively slow. Usually I'm fine with this, but as you have to walk long distances regularly, it can kind of feel like a nuisance. I even lost interest in the game and didn't finish it for a while. I first thought this was an experience exclusively to me but it seems that other people found the game boring as well.

Otherwise the game looks good and has an interesting story. Though it does feel a little overhyped and definitely overpriced as the game is relatively short for it's price tag. The game is worth a cop but only on a good sale, the game is *not* worth it full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013874263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1555773222}
review:
This game is short and beautiful. If you enjoy meandering around picturesque landscapes solving not-particularly-taxing puzzles, and getting a bit of atmosphere and narrative thrown in, then you'll enjoy this game. I did prefer the first half more than the latter, but the story definitely comes into focus in the later areas.

Great art style, tight controls and good length - perfect for turning up the sound system or headphones, sitting back with a controller and being taken on a journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989973877', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1569545478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111663418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1568917289}
review:
I cant recommend this game enough. Probably not for everyone but its story is definitely worth it. Most of the game was relaxing and the parts that weren't were gripping and exciting to experience. The exploration is fun and easy to lose yourself in, and the mechanics feel unique and give the game character. Plus the soundtrack adds to the atmosphere very well.

The only problems were the controls based around the climbing in the game which felt like I was fighting the camera, but you can get used to it and by the end I figured it out and it wasn't a problem any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145029070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1568892213}
review:
RiME is a Puzzle/Plattformer game and an adventure in a beautiful world. The game is kind of open world and mostly relaxing. It has a line path to the story but you can explore any areas around. 
This game is more about story than gameplay, players who want complex and challenging puzzle games will probably not be satisfied here. 

[u] Story [/u]

Rime starts with a little boy being washed ashore on a mysterious island. There are many ruins and a huge tower in its center. When the boy, with a spiritual guide, a fox, explores the island, he encounters several times a mysterious man in a red cloak, whom he can never reach. 
[spoiler]As the boy climbs the big tower, the first level ends and he comes to the four other levels of play. It becomes clear, that the individual game levels represents each of the five stages of mourning and dying after Elisabeth Kübler-Ross:

Deny
Fury
Negotiate
Depression
Acceptance [/spoiler]
One wonders what we are doing here, why we are here and what our goal is. Gradually, we get to know the "before",  but at the end, there is a (surprising) disclosure, that reveals a much bigger picture of the storyline.
[spoiler] The feels man...[/spoiler]

[u]Graphics [/u]

I really really really enjoyed the grafics (took screenshots every 5 mins lol).
They create a magical world that changes more and more as the game progresses. Each section has its own well-rounded atmosphere.

[u] Music [/u]

The music is beautiful and creates the atmosphere of the game sections combined with the visual aspect.

[u] Overall / Achievements [/u]

If you only focus on the Storyline, you will probably get through the game in 6-7 hours. But you will miss a big part of the RiME-world. Most of the Achievements are collectibles, for which you have to explore and experiment a lot. Some of them are easy(er) to find, for others I needed a guide, because they were really hidden or you had to do some extra rounds. With that part of exploring, it doubles or triples the play time. Overall ,it is really fun to do them, mostly because there is so much so see and do, but some Achievements are a pain in the Ass [spoiler] "Hold your breath" had cost me all my nerves lol [/spoiler] 

I really liked it and enjoyed it very much. It was just the right mix between relaxation and excitement (even if the story at the beginning is confusing. Keyholes may help a little -. IF you can find them)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983369798', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1616337129}
review:
Don't let this game trick you by it's vibrant and beautiful graphics. 
I have never ever played such boring adventure game, it actually feels like demo with unfinished gameplay mechanics, the game really lacks something exciting to keep you playing.
It was a real challenge to complete slow and tiresome underwater levels, overcome buggy puzzles with lights and shadows, and to pass through black phantoms/demons. These parts are not challenging or intriguing a player with something new, the whole game brings nothing but a boredome. 
Don't even want to waste time finishing it as the story is not catchy at all. Disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318229822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1607726544}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133119160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1568802775}
review:
tl;dr ONLY A FEW HOURS MAX OF CONTENT, BUY ON SALE, STORY BASED GAME WITH LIGHT PUZZLE SOLVING. There is no "action" per se. If you don't want to lay back and relax with your videogames this isn't for you. If you still want to experience the story then watch a silent playthrough of the game or something.

RiME is a story told through the medium of a video-game and it's absolutely stunningly beautiful. It's "a book come to life" sort of "game". There are little secrets you can go out of your way to grab but they don't mean all that much in the end, it just meant you explored more of the world that was built. I personally don't recommend it cause it will take away from the experience of the game. What you're really here for is the meat/story of the game which is throughout the entire way through, incredibly vague and puzzling but intriguing which keeps you hooked constantly. The payoff of this game comes in the final parts where it all finally snaps together because the story is told without words. The game is adorable, the colors are vibrant, and the sound design is stunning. I could go into more depth but it would take ages. If you want to play this game I would suggest playing with a controller so you can lay back and relax from your bed or couch when playing this game. Being hunched up in a chair while trying to play the game will really take away from the experience. Comfort is key. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048200319', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1568575500}
review:
Прекрасная игра с совершенно невероятным саундтреком - музыка здесь лучше любой, что довелось слышать в видеоиграх, а может, и в любом художественном произведении. Особое удовольствие доставляет то, как саундтрек срежиссирован - музыкальное сопровождение удивительным образом подчёркивает происходящее.
Также в "RiME" замечательный художественный стиль. Некоторым образом перекликается с AER, но "RiME" даже лучше.
Игровой процесс представляет собой сочетание ходьбы, карабканья и решения головоломок. Механика повторяется (игра несколько длинновата), зато делает игровой мир удивительно сказочным - что, кстати, оправдано сюжетом, который, вопреки отсутствию слов (звучат одни междометия), в игре есть. 
И вот сюжетно, кстати, игра совершенно не похожа ни на стилистически близкую "AER", ни на "Toren", из которой были явные заимствования и сценарных ходов, и механики. Очень своеобразная история.

В общем, рекомендую ознакомиться каждому. Один только минус - чуть-чуть затянута, можно было короче.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098609508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1568520573}
review: Estamos acostumbrados a juegos triple A semipornograficos (visto desde lo hecho para excitar los sentidos), donde nos hemos enfocado mas en las sensaciones efimeras que nos producen. Rime a pesar de ser un juego a nivel grafico impresionante y con un estilo precioso, a parte de tener una estetica muy caracteristica, nos sumerge en una gran historia que, nos mantiene al borde de la silla todo el tiempo. rime es la clara muestra de que hay que poner demasiada atención y apoyar estos estudios pequeños, quienes con esfuerzos inimaginables sacan a la luz estas obras maestras, estas alusiones a la perfección y el trabajo duro de comunidades pequeñas. Me voy con un gran sabor de boca, aplaudiendo como tonto frente a la pantalla ,como si los productores lo fueran a ver. Me queda poco mas que agradecer por darme este huracan de sensaciones a nivel visual y emocional. Sin duda un juego por que el todos deberiamos pasar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044049652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1568465151}
review: A world full of metaphor, great value to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096079278', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1568502929}
review: This is quite a beautiful game. It is visually stunning and has beautiful music. It is very much an exploration game with some interesting puzzles to figure out as you navigate a strange world, figuring out the rules and logic of that world as you go. The story is almost secondary to the experience of the gameplay, and is a little fuzzy, but bittersweet. There are plenty of achievements to get, if you want to take the extra time and explore. The overall presentation of the game is quite polished and helps to immerse you in the world as you try to figure out where you are and what's going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990700486', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1568490222}
review:
The whole game you are wondering about what it is about, and have no clue, and only in the very end it all comes together and it finally makes sense. [spoiler] It is about a boy's venture through the limbo, accepting his own death and in the end letting it go.[/spoiler]

It was a very chill game for the most part, with some platforming and some puzzles that were not breaking your head. I never felt stuck in one place. 

The art style was wonderful and there were all kinds of clues and alternative storytelling things that still, only made sense to me in the very end, so it would require a replay to fully get the meaning behind all of the paintings on the walls, hidden memories, messages and similar things found along the way.

The music was one of the best aspects of the game. It always created an atmosphere that felt other-wordly together with the visuals.

It was not running the greatest on my machine, and there were not too many options to bring down a lot of graphical settings, but all in all the game is a gem, considering I got it almost for free in one of the Humble Bundle game bundles. 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198049022399', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1569649117}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111920424', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1568302196}
review:
[h1]ถ้าคุณชอบเกมผจญภัย-ไขปริศนา 'RiME' คือเกมที่ควรค่าแก่การเล่นสักครั้งในชีวิต[/h1]

[b]RiME[/b] เกมแนวผจญภัย-ไขปริศนา รูปแบบเดียวกับ ICO, The Last Guardian, Journey โลกของเกม RiME ดำเนินอยู่บนโลกแฟนตาซีในกราฟิกสไตล์ Cel Shaded ที่เหมือนกับ Journey มากๆ องค์ประกอบศิลป์ การเลือกใช้โทนสีในเกมมันดูเข้ากันหมด แถมการเคลื่อนไหวของตัวละครก็ทำออกมาได้นุ่มนวล ทำให้ตลอดการเล่นเหมือนกับเราเคลื่อนไหวไปบนภาพวาด ทำให้อินี่กด Screenshots รัวแบบบ้าคลั่งมาก 555+ แล้วยิ่งได้ BGM ที่บรรเลงโดยวง Orchestra มันเพราะและเข้ากับตัวเกมสุดๆ

ในเกมเราจะได้รับบทเป็นเด็กชายที่ตื่นขึ้นมาแล้วพบว่าตัวเองอยู่บนเกาะร้างไร้ผู้คน มีหอคอยตั้งตระหง่าน ด้วยเหตุนี้ทำให้เขาต้องเดินทางเพื่อค้นหาหรือพิสูจน์อะไรสักอย่าง?? ระหว่างทางจะมีคนในชุดคลุมสีแดงคอยปรากฎตัวราวกับต้องการสื่อสารอะไรบางอย่างกับเขา โดยเราจะได้น้องจิ้งจอกมาเป็นเพื่อนร่วมทางคอยนำทางให้ ซึ่งบนเกาะเต็มไปด้วยอารยธรรมโบราณ สถาปัตยกรรมรูปร่างแปลกประหลาด ซากปรักหักพังที่รายล้อมไปด้วยธรรมชาติที่อุดมสมบูรณ์ และมีสิ่งมีชีวิตอาศัยอยู่ บางฉากนี่แอบคิดถึงโลกของ Nier Automata เลยแหละ แถมตัวเกมยังมีระบบกลางวัน กลางคืน เกมจึงดูมีชีวิตชีวา แต่ก็แฝงไปด้วยบรรยากาศเหงาๆ ในเวลาเดียวกัน

รูปแบบการเล่น เราต้องออกสำรวจพื้นที่และไขปริศนาเพื่อหาทางไปต่อเรื่อยๆ การบังคับตัวละคร เราต้องใช้วิธีปีน กระโดด ว่ายน้ำ ดำน้ำ ลากวัตถุ และการเปล่งเสียง ซึ่งการเปล่งเสียงมันมีกิมมิค อาจจะใช้จุดไฟ ทำให้เกิดคลื่นสะท้อน หรือแสดงอารมณ์ต่างๆ เมื่อไปกดกับวัตถุใดวัตถุหนึ่ง ส่วนระดับความยากของปริศนา มียาก-ง่ายปนกันไป บางอันนี่ต้องยอมรับว่าทีมงานมีความคิดสร้างสรรค์มากๆ ซึ่งรูปแบบปริศนาไม่ค่อยหลากหลายเท่าไหร่นัก แต่จะเพิ่มความซับซ้อนขึ้น อยู่ในขั้นที่เล่นได้สนุก ไม่กดดันมาก และตัวเกมจะแบ่งเป็น Chapter แต่ละ Chapter จะมีสิ่งแวดล้อมต่างกัน ซึ่งพื้นที่ที่ให้สำรวจมีขนาดไม่เล็กหรือใหญ่เกินไป และให้อิสระกับผู้เล่นว่าจะสำรวจตรงไหนก่อนก็ได้ ซึ่งเกมมีเส้นทางลับที่ซ่อนของต่างๆ อันเป็นส่วนสำคัญกับเนื้อเรื่องเกมค่อนข้างเยอะ ดังนั้นถ้าเล่นแบบเก็บ Achievement จริงๆ ต้องเดินสำรวจมันทุกซอกทุกมุม แต่เราจะเล่นให้จบก่อนแล้วค่อยไล่มาเก็บก็ได้นะ สามารถเลือกได้ว่าจะเล่น Chapter ไหน แต่แนะนำเก็บให้ครบก่อนก็ดี  เพราะของในเกมมันมีความหมายกับเนื้อเรื่อง ซึ่งระยะเวลาที่ใช้เล่นจนจบราวๆ 5-7 ชั่วโมงได้ แต่ถ้าเล่นแบบเก็บบรรยากาศ เก็บ Achievement ก็ราวๆ 10-20 ชั่วโมง

และอีกสิ่งที่ตัวเกมต้องการนำเสนอ นั่นก็คือ 'เรื่องราว' เริ่มต้นตัวเกมไม่ได้บอกอะไรกับเราเลย อยู่ดีๆ ก็โผล่มาเกยตื้นที่ชายหาด แถมยังไม่มีบทพูด บทบรรยายอะไรทั้งนั้น ดังนั้นเราต้องอาศัยการตีความจากสิ่งที่พบเจอกันเอาเอง มีการใช้วัตถุกับสัญลักษณ์สื่อความหมาย ดังนั้นใครที่ไม่อินกับการเล่าเรื่องลักษณะนี้ อาจจะเล่นแล้วรู้สึกตัวเกมไม่มีจุดหมายเลย แต่ส่วนตัวชอบเกมที่เล่าเรื่องแบบนี้นะ ซึ่งตัวเกมก็ทำให้เรามีอารมณ์ร่วมกับเกมได้ดีมากๆ มันทำให้รู้สึกอยากจะสำรวจ อยากไปดูตรงนั้น ตรงนี้นะอยู่ตลอด แต่ถ้าเราสำรวจตกหล่นไปบางจุดก็อาจจะทำให้เราเก็บองค์ประกอบเรื่องราวได้ไม่ครบ แต่ก็ไม่ใช่ปัญหาอะไร เพราะบทสรุปจะทำให้เรากระจ่างแจ้งได้ด้วยตัวมันเอง และฉากจบของเกมมันเป็นเวลาแค่ไม่กี่นาที แต่ส่งผลกระทบต่ออารมณ์คนเล่นมากกก 

[b]สรุป[/b] ถ้าใครสอยเพื่อระบบเกมเพลย์ ปริศนาแบบโหดๆ ท้าทาย เกมนี้ไม่ใช่ตัวเลือกแรกๆ แน่นอน แต่ถ้าใครชอบเล่นเกมแบบซึมซับบรรยากาศ เสพย์งานศิลป์ และชอบเรื่องราวที่ค่อยๆ เล่าผ่านการผจญภัย เกมนี้คุ้มค่ามากกก คุ้มจนรู้สึกผิดที่ซื้อเกมมาในราคา 30 กว่าบาท ฮืออ T^T กดราคาเต็มยังไม่เสียดายเงินนะบอกเลย เป็นประสบการณ์การเล่นเกมที่ดีมากๆ ขอบคุณคนสร้างมากนะคะ :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198805519898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1568361895}
review:
本游戏有优秀的画面和音乐，但有三点我忍受不了：
1.黑的地方完全看不见
2.调亮度后，狭窄的地方会卡视角，而且贴图消失
3.主线引导时有时无，有时候会不知道去哪

author: {'steamid': '76561198311267097', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1568321187}
review:
to be completely honest I went into this game without high expectations and thinking it would be just a fun/entertaining adventure game but I sure was wrong:


the Rime sets itself as an adventure for you and me to play through and the Rime sets the world and its characters to tell us a story about the rise of fall of you and me, and the Rime sets its lights, water and dust, drawings and artifacts as a way and a mean to gaze into ancient cultures and civilizations that tells so much without words, that tells so much without trying to and that tells so much without changing the reality of that a child who wakes up to find himself lying on a sunny beach somewhere in the world

the Rime excels at telling an adventure, a history and most importantly, a tragedy

You wake up on an island which seems overused but soon enough you start to realize that your voice is a way to control a certain...things lets call them for now, certain things in the island as if you were destined to wash up on that island's beach and if things were built for you and you only, you and me


but where are you and where did you come from and who are you and why are you doing what you are doing?
I had the same experience in many other games, as where some of them failed to explain the situation or give a simple explanation the Rime not only succeeded but it excelled at not only explaining itself, the world and its characters, you and your past and your future but it dug up ancient tribes and realms all through drawings on walls and on pieces of wood and cloth just as in real life because the Rime is nothing but an attempt to imitate real life... or perhaps an attempt to refuse the reality of real life and replace it?

Acceptance, Depression, Bargaining, Anger, Denial is what the Rime is and what it is here to tell and it does it so well that it makes it not only a puzzle adventure game but a puzzle within a puzzle which can only let the player think about the possibilities and options and perhaps... 
the realities 
it will leave the player wondering about life's worth and everything's price, freedom price and what's the captivity price too

from denial to acceptance, the eternal light controls all,  it guides us and it enables us to keep going, to never stop no matter what the price is, sacrifices are to be made and tears to shed because the price of freedom and the price of us and them raising from the ashes is never too much.

the Rime allows us to experience all that while us being nothing, a soul looking for guidance and the eternal light provides but will we make it? where to though? we don't know, we only know that we are just a soul, a lost one that is trying to reach its final destination to reach its ''acceptance''

the ending of the Rime re-frames the whole game, it re-frames everything, and allow us finally to be something and to finally let go, let the pain and let the past go and accept reality, that is most definitely not a denial that is indeed acceptance.

recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1567977875}
review:
I thoroughly enjoyed this game, and found it contained a surprising amount of story considering it lacks text or speech. Anyone who enjoyed AER: Memories of old will likely enjoy it. I highly recommend it to people who enjoy puzzle games and being able to explore.

Pros:
- Beautiful, colourful art style similar to AER: Memories of Old
- Puzzles were not too complex for the most part
- Tells a story via cutscenes at the end of each chapter
- Collectibles expand on the story, but are not necessary to understand it
- Plenty of nooks and crannies (many containing collectibles) to explore

Cons:
- Some of the collectibles are *very* well hidden - I can't imaging many people would find them without a guide
- THAT EFFING BIRD IN CHAPTER 2. I was so happy with the finale. I found it discouraged exploration and made some areas frustrating as it gave me mere seconds to try and figure out the puzzle before dying
- Some areas, especially chapter 3 and later, are too dark. I understand the desire to make it atmospheric and realistic, but I found myself getting of the couch and up close to the TV to try and make out what was going on. I could have increased the brightness, but then non-dark areas look washed out. 

Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109715533', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1568228150}
review:
Una maravilla visual y acústica, la historia esta muy bien, la cual no contaré nada para no spoilear, el manejo es lo que falla en algunas ocasiones, un poco tosco, pero es acostumbrarse a el, respecto a los puzzles, algo fáciles pero siendo una aventura visual de ir para delante y en algunas ocasiones recolectar objetos, no está mal.

Es totalmente rejugable, ya que hay que buscar por los mapas objetos secundarios para coleccionar, de los cuales me faltan algunos y mas adelante lo rejugaré para sacarlos, que tengo muchos juegos pendientes de terminar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021043712', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1622122978}
review:
一进游戏，30帧，惊了。把抗锯齿改成FXAA，画面没任何缩水，帧数100+……
=================================================================
这是我近阶段玩过给我触动最大的游戏。答应我，一定要玩到最后。
游戏画面非常非常好，尤其第一章节，不管是白天还是夜晚都美爆了，超级超级漂亮
游戏性总的来说不错，解谜难度不大
总之非常推荐，希望你们也能在游戏中获得那种触动

author: {'steamid': '76561198052753213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1652531671}
review:
Głównie skocz, ooops, nie trafiłem, skocz znowu,skocz znowu......
Do tego głupiejąca kamera - gdy to się zdarzy, a zdarza się często - zmieniają ci się klawisze kierunkowe - często w chwilach gdy kosztuje cię to zaczynanie od nowa bo nie trafiłeś - BO KLAWISZ PRZÓD ZAMIENIŁ SIĘ W np. W LEWO !!!

Ale najlepsze, że po przejściu ciężkiego poziomu z ptakiem, i zobaczeniu ikony save. po wczytaniu znowu byłem na początku tego poziomu !!!

Piękna graficznie, klimatyczna ZRĘCZNOŚCIÓWKA :(
Trochę puzzli, trochę eksploracji ale GŁÓWNIE zręcznościówka. 

OK, ale bug z kamerą, bug (niewybaczalny) z save...

Naprawdę żal...

author: {'steamid': '76561198026839442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1570663518}
review: Nice!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998473100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1567962701}
review:
This is my first review EVER (I guess, lol), but this game made me do it.

I've been a gamer for 31 years and I'd say Rime is a beautifully crafted piece. It has great design and a nice soundtrack, with good enough challenges throughout the game (easy ones, but still entertaining). Rather short game, I was able to finish in under 6 hours, but you can get a lot of value on this game on various stores. The story is obviously great as well, and I surely hope you don't get any spoilers before playing the game yourself.

Rime, as many great games, is not just a simple puzzler or platform or walking experience. Don't expect a hard, unforgiving game, with loads of action. It is rather an all-around adventure and an emotional thrill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407401949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1567882511}
review:
First of all ,lemme tell you one thing right of the bat, Rime is an amazing game which has been made by passionate devs.

pros(+)
Amazing level design and scenery
Beautiful sound design
Nice and subtle animations
Good platforming and puzzles(not very hard and pretty enjoyable and tolerable too)
If you like Fez,then there is a chance you will like this too(The Fez 2 we never got i guess)

cons(-)
Unoptimized in some areas (Turn off antialiasing completely for better results but still....)
+/-Story : [spoiler] Its pretty obscure till the very end .Its basically about a father who lost his son and is going through a greifing process and is trying to cope with the loss of his son[/spoiler]


OVERALL: I recommend this to people who like fun/relaxing puzzle games and have a decent enough pc to run this cause its pretty demanding at times.
: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198169486791', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1567861333}
review:
RiME is short platformer and puzzle-game that you will immerse yourself in over a relaxing weekend. The soundtrack is excellent, the art-style is nice, the story is simple but captivating and the puzzles are not very difficult. The story may be cryptic at times, especially in the beginning but if you decide to pick up the many collectibles available, then you may be able to decipher the story before it all unravels.

I highly recommend giving this game a shot, it's a short one. Treat it as an "interactive movie" and you will certainly enjoy RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069042874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1567133514}
review:
I didn't know much about this game when I got it, but it turned out to be a really fun and interesting game. The game was really well designed both from a story perspective as well as visually. The puzzles were difficult enough to keep it interesting, but not overly difficult that it turns you away in frustration. Its a really relaxing game to play (other than the desert level with the big bird).

Steam has it listed (as of this review) at $29.99. I got it as part of a bundle for less than $2. While I enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it, I don't think I would pay almost $30 for it. I finished it in under 10 hours, so I don't think that warrants $30 in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021498639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1567363397}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750789', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1567159201}
review:
[h1][b]About game[/b][/h1]  
[b]RiME[/b] is a Puzzle adventure  game  and attractive beautiful world. the game has kind of  half open world and relaxing game [b]. [/b]it has  a line path to the story but you can explore any areas around.

[h1][b]Graphics [/b][/h1]
when i saw  the graphics in store page i thought it is a normal game nothing special [b], [/b]but after i played it i impressed by high graphics.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Solve puzzles in a different areas either in floor , under the sea , or  climb up in  high buildings.
in the beginning i found it a little bit weird  [b], [/b]because still didn't know anything also there is no tips to where i go and what i do , then after time i learned the way how to solve the puzzle and it has the same style  when proceed in game , but even more complicated.
[spoiler][b]in chpater 2 was  well made and challenged i enjoyed it[/b].[/spoiler] 
some people maybe can find this game so [u][b]EASY [/b][/u]and finish the game in[spoiler]3-5[/spoiler] hours to obtain everything.

[h1][b]Overall[/b][/h1]
this kind of games don't have strong story and mostly it focused on [b][u]gameplay [/u][/b]and [u][b]idea[/b][/u] , however It has a sweet end and the game gives excellent mystery And good depth without spoken characters.

        i complain and i always keep complaining the lack of performance and some stutters in open area only "shadow" from Low to High eats 40 Fps GPU trying hard up 96-99% all time never goes down  well i loved it and i give this game 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970545339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1566885444}
review:
Strong powerful story line.  This game ranks as a work of art right up there with Grave of the Fireflies, Barefoot Gen and Night on the Galactic railroad.  If you pay attention, the ending will hit you hard.  The game play is nice and simplistic.  The developers want you to finish this game.  The reason to play this game is for the story line and the beautiful scenery.  The music, featuring Lindsey Sterling, is stunning.  Often times peaceful and sometimes mournful and sullen.  I will sum up this game in five words. Denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance.

I hope you enjoy this game as much as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121270977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1592001875}
review:
Incredible game. Poetic, beautiful, and with a wonderful work, in terms of visual, sound, and story.

The act 4 is a TRUE PIECE OF ART, wnithout any exageration imoh. Graphicaly, it's simply amazing, probably the most impressive artistic performance in a video game, to me. I will not tell anything else about it to not reveal anything, juste play it on a good screen with a good resolution.

Just do this game, take your time, try to understand the story, what happened to this boy, and just enjoy your 7 hours of gameplay, it is truely worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812162622', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1566744979}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961969805', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1566182450}
review:
It's very pretty. I recommend it if you just like running around big old ruins for no particular reason.

The game is extremely linear, so I never got any feeling of exploration. The puzzles were trivial to solve and very disappointing. I was hoping to work through them with my wife because we love puzzles, but they didn't even warrant discussion because they were so easy. Also, while the idea behind the story is kinda interesting, the way they decided to tell it divorces it entirely from the gameplay so for almost the entire game my wife and I had literally no investment in the character.

I would not call this a puzzle platformer. It might be a good choice for a younger gamer or someone who has never played a 3d game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1566181500}
review:
A beautiful puzzle/platformer with a seriously bitter-sweet theme (that ending.....damn, that ending.....was someone chopping onions nearby?!?).  The graphics are good, the music is phenomenal, and the puzzles are easy enough that you don't feel like beating your head against a wall and/or consulting a walkthrough, but challenging enough that you feel like a smart person when you solve them (well......some of them......most are truthfully on the "push a button to win" side of things, but that's okay once in awhile), and the signposting is largely good (there's a few points where I wandered around a bit before I figured out where to go next).

There are a few minor issues with the camera which can prove troublesome when trying to perform a jump of some sort from place to place, but they don't appear often (I only noticed it four or five times, so roughly once an hour....not bad at all!).

All in all, I quite soundly recommend Rime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993617589', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1566035002}
review:
A visually sublime journey of a young roboticist and a guiding fox.

I enjoyed the game but think it is misguided to use mundane gamey busywork as a metaphor for working through emotional issues. It only distracts the player from thinking about the author's message and ends up justifying playing rather than using it to advance understanding. It would have been more effective and far cheaper to deliver the message in a short film.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015292040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1566052924}
review:
Really nice atmosphere, graphics and sound track amazed me! When heading back to the selection menu it got me, the different worlds how they are setup. 

The puzzles in the game are not that hard to solve - I would recomend this game if you like adventure games.

Bought the game in the steam sale for 5,59€ - and I am suppprised by the story and feeling this game gives you.
I would not purchase this game for the 34,99€ - since i saw the ending in 6 hours and took my time to look at anything in the world.

Would deffinitly recommend if its on sale again. Its the most special game atmosphere wise I played this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1566044069}
review:
[h1]Overall = 8 / 10[/h1]

A relaxing and imaginative game about a journey of discovery and puzzles that spends a lot of its time in the darkness.  The levels still look good and having beaten the game I understand why the levels are designed as they are, but they can’t compare to the bright and colourful initial impressions you get of the game.  

It’s relaxing to play, beautiful to look at and an enjoyable experience throughout, but there are times it could have done with more signposting as to where to go next and it had a lot more enemies than I was expecting.  The platforming is a bit clunky at times, but the great music, character animations, story and overall atmosphere more than make up for this minor issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085833839', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1566400369}
