author: {'steamid': '76561198067361840', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1690012494}
review: Un juego bellísimo en todos los aspectos. El diseño artístico es bastante único, con unos escenarios repletos de arquitecturas y paisajes que evocan a Italia, España o Egipto, sin dejar de ser un mundo fantástico y onírico. Si a ese imaginario propio le añades una pizca de Ghibli y otra de Ico, te puedes hacer una idea de lo que verás en Rime. La música raya a un nivel pocas veces visto en un videojuego, y menos en uno independiente como éste y será la que irá conformando la parte emotiva y emocional de lo que vamos a ir experimentando durante el viaje. El juego nos irá presentando distintos escenarios que deberemos recorrer de una forma más o menos lineal (dichos escenarios están llenos de coleccionables que podremos encontrar siempre que nos alejemos del camino marcado), resolviendo puzzles lo suficientemente retantes como para distanciar al juego del walking simulator, pero que en ningún momento suponen un reto que frene el fluir de la aventura. Estos puzzles son bastante entretenidos en términos generales. La historia es metafórica y se irá desentrañando con imágenes y simbolismo, pero sólo al final comprenderemos en toda su magnitud lo que hemos visto y vivido. Y esa comprensión te va a romper algo por dentro. En fin, un juego muy recomendable, un viaje único y una experiencia de las que dejan huella.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402636939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1566014452}
review: 啊~~~~~~~~~~到最后是第九艺术的感觉！特别是第四章，音画绝配，吹爆

author: {'steamid': '76561198025195712', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1566443370}
review: Pretty nice adventure puzzle game. Very peaceful and zen with nature. The artwork is gorgeous, the world complex, soundtrack superb and it changes subtly with the progression of the levels. The puzzles and the gameplay make me think of this as a more kid friendly Tomb Raider. The puzzles feel like they are the right amount of hard for me, with some decent queues on how to progress without much back-tracking or head scratching, younger players not used to the genre might get stuck on some of the sections of the game though. Overall, it feels good to explore the different locations of the world as the game progresses and that's it's main selling point. The feeling of wonder didn't seem to vanish. You do need to be in the right mindset to enjoy your sessions without the progression feeling like work (i had to keep them short and occasional) but the whole cinematic ambience is very quick to make you feel at home at once when you come back to it. It feels a bit pricey, i got it on a sale/bundle, otherwise i probably wouldn't have purchased full price, but you can see where all the development money went into as you progress through the game. I agree with some negative points mentioned by other reviewers that the camera movements sometimes feel a bit counter-intuitive and the character moving too slow to really make you want to explore every nook and cranny. The ending is pretty memorable and well worth the full play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088054524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1565644311}
review: I didn't expect it to hurt...

author: {'steamid': '76561198161079661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1565527669}
review:
Rime es un juego de exploración y plataformas en 3ª persona ambientado en un mundo imaginario basado en el paisaje de las costas mediterráneas. Durante unas 7 horas manejaremos a un niño por espacios abiertos mientras recorremos acantilados, cuevas, bosques y templos resolviendo pequeños acertijos y descubriendo sus misterios. Nos cuenta una historia más sencilla de lo que creemos en un principio, siempre utilizando la metáfora como recurso. Un juego que comienza muy fuerte con unos escenarios abiertos y jugosos y que, con el paso de las horas, va ofreciendo unos mapas más sosos y se olvida completamente de introducir nuevas mecánicas jugables o hacer más complejas las que ya existían. En general los retos más interesantes y los mejores escenarios los encontraremos en la primera mitad de la aventura, resultando la segunda mitad mucho menos inspirada, lo que puede provocar cierta decepción tras el inicio tan bello del juego.
En cualquier caso es un hermoso juego, que transmite múltiples sensaciones, con un gameplay básico de plataformeo y exploración, pero con un potente diseño artístico. Una aventura original, sencilla y muy personal que disfrutarán los jugadores más calmados que no necesitan de grandes dosis de acción para divertirse con los videojuegos.

8'2

Más: https://yexreviews.wordpress.com/2019/08/11/rime-2017/

author: {'steamid': '76561198211553000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1565769884}
review:
I liked this game, isn't the greatest platform puzzler, couple of parts I found a bit boring and a slog, but would still recommend for the themes and beautiful visuals, which make for some great screenshots. No glitches or bugs found during my playtime.

Out of the games I've played I'd say it was similar to INSIDE, LIMBO, The Witness & ABZU. So would recommend to people who enjoyed those experiences.
Also the story and themes are very similar to GRIS, but I'd say I liked RiME's take on them better... the heart-wrenching ending especially.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258702242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1565522367}
review: 用6个小时把rime通了，好游戏，但不推荐玩。优点是，它拥有优秀的音乐，好看而且掉帧的画面，占了大多数的不错的解谜，让人深陷其中的剧情。缺点是，屎一样的操作，及个别屎一样的谜题。关于操作，你见过哪个游戏跑步停下来会顺手来个划铲？又有哪个游戏跑跑步撞墙上能给自己撞个跟头需要4～5秒才能爬起来？另外，角色跑到墙边会自己停下来，明明下面很矮的墙，直接跳能接住，结果一停，再一个大跳，直接不知道摔倒哪儿去了，又或者一停，来个翻身下墙的动作……去他妈的，整个节奏都乱了！至于屎一样的谜题，游戏中有一个一直用来做光影用的石块，结果到了后面竟然需要用它堵门！而且只有那一次！还有，后面 有个谜题，一眼看去应该是A,B,C的顺序，那就先A吧，看起来也不复杂。先抱着球吸引机器人按住按钮，跑上楼，跳上移动过来的台阶(？)时间不够，那把球扔上去再爬上去总可以吧。尝试了7～8次以后发现球竟然能弹飞…………结果看攻略，需要先做一半B，会拿到一个石块压按钮………………神他妈！！！…………消消气，结论还是，好游戏，但不推荐玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198007623275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1565471319}
review:
Les  énigmes successives, faciles à comprendre et relativement faciles à résoudre, font évoluer dans des décors oniriques, au dessin apuré, dans une ambiance sonore qui contribue à la poésie du jeu.
Le jeu est plus long que je ne le pensais, mais avancer est un plaisir, dû à la résolution des puzzles et à la découverte des nouveaux décors.
Un peu fastidieux par moment, le tout constitue globalement une expérience agréable que je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987199515', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1565453917}
review:
Ein sehr schönes Spiel mit einen tollen Soundtrack. Nach langer Zeit hat es mal wieder ein Spiel geschafft mich zu Tränen zu rühren. 
Technisch ist Rime leider nicht gut umgesetzt. Ich hatte des öfteren nur 15FPS und hatte fast durchgehend nur 30 FPS. Nur an wenigen stellen, hatte ich meine Konstanten 60 FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971050707', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1565243260}
review:
I like platformers. I like puzzle games. I like exploratory "emo" games. But for whatever reason, Rime was just supremely boring. I managed to plod through the whole game and the overall story is... sad, I guess? I don't know. It just felt like it was a lot of random imagery trying to convey "something," but I never really got exactly what that something was.

Visually, it's beautiful (although taxing even on my 2080). But the gameplay is just... so... boring. It's like it couldn't decide if it wanted to be an exploration or a platformer or a puzzler, so it just half-heartedly tried to be all of them, and none of it is even remotely challenging and, for me, none of it was engaging. Actually, it felt a *whole lot* like Abzu, just with a sadder story. If you really loved that game then you'll probably like this. I greatly prefer Limbo/Inside, which this game also seemed to rip off (or "pay homage to") near the end.

-------------------更新------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

八小时通关，这个游戏最大的优点我认为就是音乐，气氛渲染的不错，然后解密前期大部分看攻略，后期自己玩，感觉也没有那么难，主要是前期适应了这个游戏的解密套路，后期自己玩就容易多了，剧情的话比较简单，就不剧透了，玩到结局甚至有些小感动，emmmmmmm，总之，肥宅愉快的八小时，好评给你了

author: {'steamid': '76561198002950350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1564873012}
review:
[h1] Когда вода стала небом	[/h1]
Обзор на игру RiME

[i] Жанр этой прекрасной испанской игры - головоломка.
Вместе с мальчиком мы оказываемся на чудесном острове. 
Шум моря, крики чаек, чарующая музыка. 
Кажется, что это рай. 
Но нам нужно выбираться, а поможет нам быстрая огненная лиса ( не про браузер ли это?).
В этом путешествии мальчик встречает разных существ. 
И только в самом конце мы понимаем, что произошло..
Красивая и бесконечно печальная история.[/i]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1793300016

author: {'steamid': '76561197970701213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1564431744}
review:

Thank you Tequila Works

author: {'steamid': '76561197971276058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1564343853}
review:
Better than expected. Pretty long (maybe even too long for me; disregard my playtime, Steam does not count offline mode playtime). Exceptional control, easy movement, no impossible platforming sections in sight. It's a shame other games do not follow this path and ramp up the technical difficulty in fear of the game becoming "too short". 
Puzzles are easy, but original. And speaking of the story, let me assure you it is not what you think and it is not what you will think while playing it, untill the very end, that is. Which is great. On the other hand, the story is somewhat cheesy and pretentious (supposed to be deep and meaningful for the typical folk), but execution leaves no sour taste in the mouth, even if you're not into the spiritual bs. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289121929', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1564192303}
review:
除了菜单界面跟游戏结束的一长串制作名单.游戏内容无对话无文字.看不懂英文菜单的3DM上有汉化.
关于游戏体验。开局轻松治愈，往后面将发现这个故事的全貌。治愈变致郁。水下那两张图让我找路找吐了。路痴要能配地图才能更好食用。解谜方式略无聊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198145813277', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1564159369}
review: Possivelmente o melhor jogo que ja joguei em toda a minha vida, a historia te prende nesse game te fazendo sempre querer mais e mais, os graficos do jogo são espetaculares, a musica te prende ao game e a cada ação sua a musica muda e te faz entrar na vibe que o jogo quer, os personagens mesmo nao falando eles tem seu carisma especial o que te faz prender-se a eles, qualquer pessoa pode jogar esse jogo e em qualquer idioma pois ele nao tem falas o que facilita o processo de aprendizagem sobre o game, sua intuição começa a resolver os enigmas que vc nem espera resolver, sem contar que os momentos de tensão realmente te deixa apreensivo de fazer certas escolhas, a mensagem que o jogo deixa é incrivel, assim fazendo com que esteja no meu top 1 de melhor game que ja joguei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018572438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1708461132}
review: As you progress in this game, you begin to grasp what the theme of the game is. Once you play like half of the game, every puzzle you have solved starts making much deeper sense. This game moved me greatly and I recommend you all to give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073367997', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1564126705}
review: Хорошая игра. Это 3d паззл платформер. Ноль экшена, только исследование. Щедро поработали над уровнями - они огромные. К минусам можно отнести, что игра скучновата и чем ближе к финалу, тем мрачнее, но это субъективно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181891162', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1590286504}
review:
I now have another game that i have a love-hate relationship with... So beautiful... but damn you game... Why do you do this to me...?

Great game, Beautiful art style, Cute as well...

As for the story no narrator or text but, words are not needed to understand it... The story begins to make full sense near the end of the game, but all-in-all its a truely touching story

author: {'steamid': '76561197972039973', 'num_games_owned': 8254, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1578257075}
review:
[h1]RiME[/h1]


[b]Einleitung:[/b]
Ein fleißiger Leser meiner Reviews meinte zu mir, ey ich hab das Spiel gespielt, mach mal bitte nen Review. Ich hab gesehen, es war in meiner Liste und ich habs dann doch einfach mal installiert und nun anderen Games vor geschoben. Ich bereue es nicht, denn es ergriff mich direkt allein durch den tollen Sound und der malerischen Grafik.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893010  

[b]Handlung[/b]
Man wacht an einem Strand auf, man wurde wohl an Land gespült. Schnell merkt man, das hier absolut ein absolut Gewaltfreies Spiel gestartet wurde. Auf der Insel leben wilde Tiere und man kann Objekte finden und sammeln. Schnell sieht man auch, was man tun muss um weiter diese Insel zu erkunden. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893146  

[b]Pro:[/b] 
[list][*]+ atemberaubende Musik
[*]+ malerische und wunderschöne Landschaft
[*]+ kleine Puzzle immer wieder
[*]+ versteckte Objekte zum Sammeln
[*]+ traumhafte Welt mit Geheimnissen
[*]+ regt zur Erkundung an
[/list]

[b]Contra:[/b]
[list][*]- schlechte Performance
[*]- teilweise schwammige Steuerung
[*]- kein richtiges Sprechen 
[*]- hoher Preis / wartet auf einen Sale
[/list]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893341  

[b]Fazit:[/b]
RiME hat mich in den ersten paar Minuten schon so in seinen Bann gezogen, dass ich kaum raus gekommen bin, obwohl ich noch was anderes spielen wollte. Ich will hier auf jeden Fall auch nicht zu viel verraten, denn wenn man das Spiel einschaltet und dann beginnt, wird man gleich merken, warum ich daraus ein relativ kurzes Review mache, damit jeder selbst sich davon überzeugen kann. Allerdings solltet ihr auf einen Sale warten.


Ihr möchtet mehr Reviews von mir sehen/lesen [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32556113-Ratea%C2%B4s-Reviews-give-away%C2%B4s/]hier abonieren[/url] und bei gefallen auch gerne meiner [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/rateasreviews]Gruppe[/url] beitreten und bei meinen Give Away´s teilnehmen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989754266', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1564010283}
review:
Bored me to tears and I couldn't finish it. It's neither fully a walking simulator with a gripping story (story is too absent), nor a true puzzle game (1 easy puzzle every few minutes), nor a zen ambient stroll-about (you have to do puzzles/platforming to progress), nor a decent platformer (controls are meh, sections are meh).

Not sure why this has such high reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182812506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1640062476}
review: I love this game!! I couldn't even finish the beginning part of it without sharing about how much I enjoy playing it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087469548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1563673964}
review:
Amazingly beautiful game. Incredibly designed from the rewarding puzzles to the unique nature of environmental dangers that drive the challenge to the astounding soundtrack that instills emotion.

Zero dialogue, No words or captions, and still this game spoke to me.

My only qualm is the mechanics of the game are a little slow. Traveling the world can feel a bit tedious with the run speed, but it obviously didn't stop me from no lifing it in 2 days. Pretty short story, main quest takes about 4 hours, and 6.5 if you want to 100% it.

review: I don't usually write reviews but this was WORTH IT! I bought this during the Independence sale and HOLY CRAP DID I GET MY MONEY'S WORTH! My favourite game of all time is "Journey" and this game had a LOT of similar themes and tones. Stick with the game until the end...please! This is the type of game that you'll find yourself thinking about weeks after you finish it. So many inspiring elements in this game...AGH. MY HEART. 10/10 would play again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045945692', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1564119184}
review:
This was a absolutely wonderful game with beautiful graphics and AMAZING soundtrack. It was so moving, and was just so originally emotional. This was a silent game in that there was not any talking at all, and I believe that it enhanced the effects of the game. The puzzles were decently hard, and it was just overall amazing. I got stuck once or twice, but otherwise I loved the game and found it to be well worth buying. I had been wanting this game for a while, so I'm happy it went on sale. 

IF YOU CAN, BUY THIS! ITS JUST AMAZING!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054842591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1563577744}
review: On the positive side, the OST of the game is excellent. Especially in the last level. Other than that, it's one of the most frustrating experiences I ever had with a game. Barebones story with key plot points hidden behind collectibles, huge levels without the ability to sprint in order to pan out the time needed to complete the game and even though the game is heavily inspired by Team Ico's works, there was nothing truly memorable at the end of each "chapter" for me. If the game's length was a quarter of what it is now and there was some concrete storytelling and direction, I would probably recommend the game. As it stands, a pretty safe pass for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095927987', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1563155290}
review:
I'm giving this a thumbs up because overall it was a pleasant experience and I'm sure it will be amazing for a large group of people.  I want to start with what I don't like about this game first before I get to the good.  Beware of exactly what type of game this is.  Steam recommended it to me because I play a ton of puzzle games, and the trailer made it seem like it was going to be very puzzle intensive.  Well if you're a hard core puzzler, DO NOT expect to be challenged whatsoever by this game.  The puzzles were extremely easy.  There were less than a handful of times I was stuck very briefly, and that was always because I literally couldn't find an object I needed or a ledge I was able to jump to.  It was "pixel hunting" stuck, not mentally stuck.  I feel like this game had much bigger potential to take advantage of the types of puzzles it used.  Some of them were heading in the cleaver direction but the moment there would be the slightest hint of a challenge, that was the end of the puzzle.

This game also had huge potential to be challenging in a different way but again was made far too easy.  The platforming aspects.  It is heavily influenced by the original Tomb Raider games.  Often times that type of platforming can be puzzles in and of themselves.  Once again, this game touched to surface of that aspect but never presented an actual challenge.  It left it very ambiguous as to whether I was playing an atmospheric walking sim, or if I was playing a puzzle platformer.  

The game seems like an open world exploration game at first but it's actually straight up on rails.  Which I have no issue with.  That part is done very well because you feel like you're in a large world but you're always subtly steered in the correct direction without it being overtly obvious.  That's not an easy feat and they executed that well.  There are hidden bonus items scattered variously off the path, however I stopped purposefully looking for them early on.  I don't feel like this game rewards exploration because there is no way to make your character go any faster, and these areas can be quite large.  So if you go all the way to a far corner of an area just to find nothing, you have to trek all the way back to the main path every single time.  It really gets old after a while.  There needs to be a sprint key.

Onto the good.  The game is downright beautiful and the music compliments it perfectly.  I was very absorbed into the atmosphere of the game and I kept playing it just to see new areas.  Your character is very entertaining with all of his little quirks that you can trigger with the "shout" button.  He sings when he's in a good mood, pouts when he's frustrated and in a difficult area, shivers when he's scared, says hello to strange creatures.  The art is simply incredible and sound design is also outstanding.  There is no dialog at all but there is most certainly a story with an emotional twist.  I kind of predicted the ending but it was still very powerful.

If you are on board for a feel good experience with only slight challenges then this game is a 10/10.  If you love games like The Witness, Portal, Stephens Sausage Roll, etc., and are looking for something along those lines, then this game is a 2/10.  So choose based on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268165916', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1563449922}
review:
[h1]Сложные вещи простыми словами[/h1]

Разработчики Tequila Works дебютировали с хоррор игрой [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/211400/Deadlight/]Deadlight[/url][/u] про выживших в зомби апокалипсисе. И вот еще одно их творение RiME, которое не уступает первому по проработке персонажей, но кардинально отличается по сеттингу.

RiME завораживает с первых минут своей атмосферой и музыкальным сопровождением. Последнее не пытается тянуть на себя одеяло, а лишь добавляет объема общему повествованию.

В распоряжении игрока окажется несколько крупных и разных по духу локаций. Но особо интересным в этом моменте становится то, как главный герой реагирует на каждую из них. Вроде бы мелкая деталь, а привносит свою толику реализма.

Благодаря тому, что это 3D-платформер с головоломками средней сложности, то он не заставляет лезть в прохождения, но в то же время и не чересчур расслабляет, чтобы просто бежать по локации из точки А в точку Б.

Как [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/48000/LIMBO/]LIMBO[/url][/u] и [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/304430/INSIDE/]INSIDE[/url][/u], игру захочется после основного прохождения перепройти, чтобы поразмышлять в процессе над сложными вопросами, которые ставит RiME, обратить особое внимание на детали, скрытые в дополнительных материалах или вписанные в локации.

Хотелось бы также провести параллель между RiME и [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/225080/Brothers__A_Tale_of_Two_Sons/]Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons[/url][/u], которые очень похожи в своей основе: сказочная вселенная, интересные персонажи, общающиеся на непонятном языке и, конечно, неожиданный финал. Поэтому если Brothers в своей время понравился, то RiME тоже обязательно стоит пройти.

Плюсы
[list]
    [*]Атмосфера.
    [*]Музыка.
    [*]Сюжет.
    [*]2 концовки зависящие от сбора предметов.
    [*]Вызывает эмоции.
[/list]
Минусы
[list]
    [*]Подлагивающий ГГ во время перемещения кубов.
[/list]

P.S. Несмотря на то, что критики встретили RiME довольно средними оценками, для меня она вошла в топ любимых.

[h1]Огромное спасибо, что дочитали обзор до конца ( ･｡･) ˜ ♡[/h1]

Похожие игры:

author: {'steamid': '76561198031264272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1563409023}
review:
Un très joli jeu, à l'esthétique soignée et à la bande-son merveilleuse qui, comme certains l'ont déjà remarqué, semble être inspirée des œuvres de Joe Hisaishi (le compositeur favori d'Hayao Miyazaki).

     Il n'est pas très long, comptez 6 heures pour le faire et le double pour compléter les succès, sachant que l'on peut revenir sur le chapitre que l'on souhaite revisiter une fois le jeu achevé. Le jeu de plateforme et les puzzles ne sont pas très ardus et cela permet de profiter des environnements magnifiques et des personnages assez attachants, comme le garçon et son renard.

     Seul bémol : une tendance à la chute de FPS dans certains endroits (début du chapitre 3 notamment).

     Dernière chose : prévoyez des mouchoirs pour la fin, vous allez en avoir besoin... 

                                                                                  <<<>>>

     A very pretty game, with a polished aesthetic and a wonderful soundtrack that, as some have already noticed, seems to be heavily inspired by Joe Hisaishi’s work (Hayao Miyazaki’s favourite composer).

     It’s not very long, give or take 6 hours and double if you hunt for achievements, and you can replay any chapter as you please once the game is finished. The platforming and the puzzle aren’t so hard, and it allows you to enjoy the beautiful environments and the endearing characters, as the boy and his fox.

     Only let-down: the framerate tends to drop in some areas (like in the first part of chapter 3).

     And last thing: don’t forget your tissues at the end, you’ll need it…

author: {'steamid': '76561198194129261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1676204385}
review:
Ich muss sagen, es ist einfach ein fantastisches Spiel. Es erzählt die Geschichte ohne nur ein Wort zu benutzen. Zudem ist die Story sehr sehr schön gemacht. Genauso sind es auch die Level. Die Steuerung ist sehr angenehm. Um die aufkommenden Emotionen noch einmal zu unterstreichen, wird die Musik perfekt eingesetzt.
Das Spiel erhält von mir 12 von 10 Sternen. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198000816254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1598185606}
review: RiME is one of my new favorite indie titles. It's simple, intuitive and gorgious. The storyline will hit you deep in the heart, even though it's presented without a single word. The game is well integrated with the steam achievment system - theres a lot to do, see, collect and listen to, while you're solving the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198886277020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1563371646}
review:
为这款游戏献上首评(๑*◡*๑)
跳崖投海（划掉）赏景好去处！
美术&音乐满分，所以各种氛围营造都非常到位，有种低配但是高演绎的感觉。画面真的又美又壮观，一周目下来我就截了50多张图。
照顾手残，自带悬崖勒马的机制，但是也不会完全让你掉不下去，失去真实感。
谜题难度适中，有些难度来自于「这都能跳过去&这都跳不过去」，手法确实有些重复，但不会完全一致，所以也还不至于厌烦。游戏性这块不吹，就是还行。
主题挺好的，值得品味思考。
我一看到男主就想起ICO，男主结尾还兼职了一下LIMBO的男主hhhhh。男主会跳会滚会唱歌，我对这种可爱的日式小男孩毫无抵抗力o(*////▽////*)q没事多按Y，男主会有很多不同的反应
全收集超开心(*>∀<)ﾉ))★，就是有个憋气的成就投了N遍湖都拿不到（自己太菜了）(oT-T)尸

author: {'steamid': '76561198133388550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1563293955}
review:
Voilà un jeu bien magnifique et mystérieux. Tout est tellement énigmatique : on ne sait pas ce qu'on fait là, pourquoi, ce que l'on cherche.... justement à savoir ce qu'on fait là sans doute ? Rien n'est sûr, on progresse juste, piano piano... aucun souci d'ailleurs de ce côté là. Dès le début où notre petit bonhomme se réveille sur sa plage, on est très bien guidé, impossible de se retrouver bloqué. Les énigmes - si on peut appeler ça comme ça - sont plutôt simples, mais ce n'est pas le seul but du jeu.

 On évolue dans des décors tellement somptueux, la bande son est magnifique et je n'ai pas pu m'empêcher de ressentir un petit air de Miyazaki.  C'est un jeu d'ambiance oui mais pas seulement, ça c'est juste ce que le début nous laisse supposer : le jeu prend crescendo une dimension tout autre, sans perdre un gramme de sa beauté. C'est réellement savoureux !

Il n'est pas très long, et en fait c'est tant mieux car au bout d'un moment il devient un peu lent et répétitif, on a la sensation de toujours faire la même chose (crier et crier et re-crier ouais). Vous savez c'est comme ces livres très beaux, magistralement bien écrits mais ennuyeux à mourir... on aime bien car l'esthétique est à couper le souffle mais on a du mal à continuer et à vouloir atteindre la fin car c'est pas évident de choper le fil rouge. Où va t-on ? Quel est le but de ma vie ? Dans quel état j'erre ? Ben euh, j'sais pas didonc. 

Bon, il y a tout de même un enjeu, une histoire de fond, des dangers (attention ce n'est quand même pas un jeu d'action hein x)) et UN RENARD, diantre ! Malgré ses aspects un peu "négatifs", Il m'a émerveillée à maintes reprises et j'ai passé un bon moment. C'est relaxant et frais, sympa quand vous voulez vous détendre et chiller devant votre PC et la fin est très belle. Je ne peux que conseiller !

author: {'steamid': '76561198024640998', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1564169539}
review:
"Спасибо Эпикам за бесплатную версию игры" - Это не про меня, я всё равно купил игру в Стиме.
************************************************************************************************************
RiME - Яркий образчик мира качественных игр. Такие игры запоминаются навсегда.
Иногда не хотелось продолжать играть в эту игру, т.к. такая прекрасная сказка скоро закончится, а новую найду неизвестно когда. Не хотелось расставаться, как с близким другом.

Графику и цветовую палитру - видно на скриншотах. Но чего они не передают - красивую, но грустную историю. Очень порадовали киношные сцены. 
Вспомнил момент: там где нужно было эпично бежать к свету - умудрился упасть. В итоге эпик не получился)

Музыка в игре великолепна. Настроением напоминает музыку Johan Soderqvist в фильме Let The Right One In. Редко в каких проектах хочется купить OST, но здесь его не завезли, очень жаль.

Всё в игре хорошо, но: 
[b] Разработчики, дайте возможность купить музыку из игры! [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198056748508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1563109304}
review:
What can I say. Beautiful game, short but absolutely sad. Cried like a baby and that's what I like, having my emotions tickled.

Soundtrack was the most beautiful what I have ever heard and the best thing about it was that the songs didn't suddenly change - they adapted. I also can't hype enough the sound environment, I can feel my sandals being wet from rain  just by the sound they make. Lots of secrets to find. The game tells a story, but as a game there's not much to do. But does it need more? 

But I do have some cons too about this game, as beautiful and breathtaking as it was: 

The "puzzles" were quite straightforward so there was nothing to solve really. I was overthinking things and trying to do things ahead as I didn't know what was coming sometimes, but when I gave up I realized there was really nothing to solve as you walked ahead and the puzzles kinda solved themselves and I found out I was just wasting time. 

Also no way this game is worth 35€. This game is 4-5 hours at most when you don't know what you're doing but if you just play the game without doing excess stuff it might be an hour long. I'd buy this at sale max 10€.  Sorry devs, there's just not much to do after looking at scenery.

i'd like to see more this kinds of games but the price is way high compared to what it includes. You did amazing job with graphics and sound and everything but the GAME itself is lacking quite a lot if you want to call it a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256997789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1563683083}
review:
퍼즐은 쉬운편이지만 일일이 떠먹여주는 스타일이 아니다보니 좀 헤맬수 있음.
눈호강하는 그래픽, 여운이 진하게 남는 엔딩
다만, 음악이 이렇게나 좋은데 OST가 없다는 건 너무하다.

+수집품 모으려고 반복 플레이하고보니 1회차 때 정신없이 깨느라 보지 못했던 것들도 보이면서, 정말 세심하게 잘 짜여졌다는 느낌이든다. 그리고 여전히 어떻게 생겨먹은 맵인지 헷갈린다....

자동 저장에 스킵도 안 되므로 공략영상을 보고 수집하는 것이 정신건강에 이로움.


숨겨진 엔딩까지 찾았다면 크레딧 영상을 유심히 보시길.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090329034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1565471759}
review:
Rime é um jogo que foi feito para não ser esquecido.

Uma vez terminada a jornada, o que fica são as memórias.
O sentimento é a força que mais impulsiona a vida.
No entanto, nem sempre é fácil compreender o que sentimos e nem como agir.
Mesmo assim, devemos continuar sentindo, porque sentir é viver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872725302', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1568493669}
review: I got this game for only 4.99 which was a great deal.  The creators have really outdone themselves.  The game play can get laggy a lot, but if you lower the settings it works smoother and still works great.  I give RiME a HUGE thumbs up.  Amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156965768', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1563061376}
review:
Este juego es hermoso. Acabo de recibirlo como regalo, pero en realidad lo jugué cuando lo regalaron en la Epic Store. Las dinámicas son super sencillas; la estética minimalista, cuidada, invita a la contemplación de los paisajes y a la exploración de un entorno maravillosamente diseñado.
Al jugar, se siente reminiscencias de otros grandes juegos tales como Ico y Brothers: Tale of Two Sons. La historia se desarrolla sin diálogos, de una forma bastante abstracta hasta llegar a un final revelador que invita a rejugar y redescubrir cada aspecto del juego, ahora con un nuevo significado.
Como único aspecto negativo, voy a señalar que, en varios momentos del juego, no es raro quedarse sin saber qué hacer. A veces parece faltar un objetivo claro (más allá del de llegar a la torre) y terminaremos deambulando hasta dar, casi por casualidad con lo que hay que hacer. Lo bueno es que, en ese deambular, se pueden encontrar muchos coleccionables. Y es que el juego los tiene en gran cantidad y variedad, lo que suma rejugabilidad al momento de terminarlo.
En conclusión, RiME es un juego excelente. No duden en comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361402751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1563043068}
review: 总体来说，画风和音乐非常好，但是让人有点摸不着头脑，是因为刚上游戏，没有任何系统指示命令，你要自己查看所有的操作按键。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970252444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1544917387}
review: Enigmatic, beautiful, entrancing, romantic, tragic. And chock full of fun puzzles to play while you marvel at the subtly unfolding - almost insinuated - plot and the dramatic - sometimes surreal - visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150705021', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1561600136}
review:
I don't like this game. It looks pretty and the music is quite good, but it feels like Rime wanted to be a painting, not a game. There is practically no story, beside the atmosphere that is, there are no character to speak of, and the puzzles feel arbitrary and shoved in as required to make it a game, rather than because the puzzles are inherently interesting themselves, which they’re not. 
      While I tend to enjoy some games like these, the visual and sound design should exists to support either gameplay or some kind of story, which it doesn’t, which is a shame. The Witness visual design supports the core gameplay of puzzles, which are challenging and interesting. Wandersong uses it’s visual and sound design to support its story, characters, and themes. Anti Chamber uses its minimalist design to draw attention to its space bending puzzles. Rime uses it’s nice and stylizes art direction and music to walk you through a pretty picture, but with little substance behind it.
      If you want something pretty, then go ahead, but don’t expect anything else other than “pretty”

author: {'steamid': '76561198002191215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1563014329}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141595877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1562963036}
review:
I really enjoyed this game. The music, the artistic style, and the story were very moving, and it was through a second playthrough that I really took the time to enjoy every vista, every musical score, and every moment to really enjoy it even more. Most of the puzzles were simple enough but not so simple as to just blow past everything and not get satisfaction for completing the puzzle itself. 

I recommend this game for those who want to experience a story that is very compelling and captivating from the start to the very end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972598584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1562724187}
review: A surprisingly good game.  Metacritic ranks this at 78 - I'd rank it more in the low 90's.  Definitely one of the best games made in the last decade (uh...I play LOTS of games) and is also ESRB rated E10+.  Other than the second level, I enjoyed it very much.  The first level was an absolute treat - very relaxing, discovering what to do, easy game mechanics, beautiful visuals, long view distance, no enemies, etc.  The second level brought in the game's only real enemy that was very annoying and left me no time to freely view the landscapes.  Part of the second level and a good chunk of the third level missed a huge opportunity to have relaxing underwater puzzles.  Instead, the underwater bits involve frequent racing through the water just to get to the next section before the character would die.  Plus the underwater bits are quite beautiful but there's just no time available to simply stop and look around.  There's some replay value in the game to go back and find all of the missed secrets and to get the achievements.  Revisiting/playing the first level again is totally worth it but you'll have to decide for yourself if the other levels are worth revisiting.  The game can be beaten very casually in about 6.5 hours and the story is solid even though none of the characters really say anything.  The music and audio are fantastic and timed to the actions of the character.  Definitely recommend.  RiME is a game that gamers of all ages will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232440356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1562467617}
review: This is a very chilled puzzle/exploration game. Even if you die, the game just puts you back where you were with no penalty. (I though I might be able to do some cliff diving instead of going the long way around.) The graphics are styled and beautiful and the controls are mostly straightforward. They've even tried to keep the open world illusion by putting jellyfish in the water outside the bounds of the map to stop you, instead of having you just hit a transparent barrier like in some games. Took me a little bit to work out that the trackpad is your camera angle though which you really need to know. None of the puzzles I've come across so far have been particularly hard, but young kids might need some help. Only thing that's a little annoying is there appears to be no button to save where you want to when you quit. IMO if you like this kind of platform worth picking up as it's currently has a big discount on the purchase price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263561009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1565142692}
review:
コレクションなど無視して６時間程度でクリア。
あまり謎解きやったことのない私でも割と簡単にクリアできました。
シナリオとしてはやってて謎な部分もありましたが、
BGMやグラフィックなど素晴らしく特に飽きることなく進めることができました。

ただ謎解きのやり方がかなりパターン化されており、
本格的な謎解きをやりたい人には物足りないと思うのでそういう人にはあまりおすすめできません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072548551', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1649207619}
review:
This game actually got to me in a way very few games do. So, you're a lad who washes up on the shore of this island with a big tower off in the distance and you're led along by an adorable little fox spirit. The character's primary mode of interaction is simply shouting, which distinctly reminded me of a few similar style games such as The Last Guardian. But what really drove me were the underlying mysteries I'd start asking myself in this imagery driven game, such as "What's with the tower? Why is it important? And just what is the deal with the mysterious figure that always seems to be just out of reach?" The game is stuffed full of little collectibles that encourage exploring this beautiful world.
In my opinion, a beautiful game I absolutely recommend giving a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970330601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1562365930}
review:
Märchenhaftes, malerisch schönes Abenteuer mit originellen, wenn auch eher einfachen Rätseln und einer großteils angenehmen Steuerung. Letztere macht die häufigen Sprung- und Kletterpassagen zu einem Vergnügen – hier könnten sich die Little-Nightmares-Schöpfer eine Scheibe abschneiden.

Abgesehen von wenigen Leerlaufphasen wurde ich in den gut sechs Stunden prima unterhalten. Ein ideales Spiel, um nach Feierabend zu entspannen. Das Ende war einigermaßen vorhersehbar und doch berührend. Mit dem Hintergrundwissen lohnt sich im Prinzip ein zweiter Durchlauf mit anderer Sicht auf die Dinge – bei der Gelegenheit kann man direkt die zuvor verpassten Geheimnisse lüften.

(Meine Bewertung bezieht sich auf die Windows-Umsetzung, gespielt mit Xbox-One-Controller.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964982166', 'num_games_owned': 2316, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1562557908}
review:
Not as much as a walking simulator as some other reviews may lead you to believe, but the puzzles in this game will leave much to be desired. This game takes some heavy inspirations from Ico including mesmerizing landscapes and epic orchestral scores. 

There are a lot of cool gameplay elements that seem to only be played with briefly and there are some that are frustratingly used to the point of annoyance, like the bird sequence in the desert...

I don't have to much to say about this game, but if you picked it up on sale or got it for free from the Epic Game Store or elsewhere, it's worth a playthrough. It's not too long and could probably be binged played in a weekend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799214', 'num_games_owned': 2237, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1560710518}

review:
Lovely Atmosphere. Lots of collectables, although the game pretends its guided you're actually meant to explore a lot more in the open levels than I did.
You don't really get to see much of the Fox, in fact the character you find in the later chapters gets much more screen time and has a better bond with the player. 
A few puzzles are a bit too stupid for the way I solved them to be right.
Supposedly multiple endings though I only completed the game once.
Controls leave something to be desired, and the player walks slow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278686285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1530724354}
review:
Очень красивая и пробивающая на слезу в конце история. Если бы не плохая оптимизация, то можно было зависнуть в игре надолго просто чтобы побродить по восхитительным локациям.
Хотелось бы, чтобы разработчики исправили эту единственную проблему.
История рассказывается игроку несколькими путями: через сбор головоломок и через основное повествование сюжета. Каждую деталь можно раскрыть с новой стороны, найдя новый артефакт.

review:
雰囲気が素晴らしい。自然の美しさや動物の可愛さ、不思議なファンタジー世界など最初から最後まで世界に引き込まれた。

author: {'steamid': '76561198201192295', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1562243536}
review:
[h1]Vay be[/h1]

- Bir çocuk karakteri yönettiğimiz oyunda, şiddetli bir fırtınanın ardından gözlerimizi adaya vurmuş şekilde açıyoruz. İlk başta her şey normal gözükse de kırmızı giysili silüet şeklinde birisini ve kendisini takip etmemizi isteyen bir tilkiyle karşılaşıyoruz. Başta bunlara anlam veremesekte bizi kendine çeken kuleyi ve gizemleri keşfetmek üzere devam ettiğimiz derin ve etkileyici hikayeye sahip bir bulmaca-platform oyunu RiME.

- Oyunumuz basit seviyede bulmaca ve platformlarla dolu bir keşif oyunu. Bol çeşitte toplanabilir mevcut. Bunlardan bazıları giysi gibi eşyalar olabilirken bazıları hikayeyle ilgili kesitler veriyor.

- Başta tatlı grafikli keşfetme oyunu gibi dururken devam ettikçe kendimizi korumamız gereken düşmanlar da ortaya çıkıyor. Doğrudan bir dövüşe girmesekte dolaylı yollardan alt edebildiğimiz şeyler var.

- Müzik ve ses kalitesi iyi. Özellikle huzur veren bazen de hüzünlendiren müzikleri. Grafikleri hoş fakat yüksek ayarlarda optimizasyon problemleri bulunuyor.

- Oyunda diyalog olmadığı için başlarda boş geliyor ama oyun sonunda her şey bir anlam kazanıyor. Geçtiğiniz bölümler, takip ettiğiniz tilki, kırmızı giysili adam, bulduğunuz eşyalar ve aklınıza ne gelirse. Gerçekten etkileyici bir sonu var. "Vay be" dedirtti bana. Kesinlikle tavsiye ediyorum. İyi eğlenceler, mümkünse :'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1562186797}
review:
RiME is a puzzle platformer, it isn't just decent but also cute.

The puzzles are challenging sometimes but not too hard, the platforming scenes ok, not too hard. Doable for anyone who not really good or like platformer games (like me).

The story is interesting, touching. No narration, no voice acting but you not going to miss any of those.

The graphic is decent, looks awesome, the game is colorful and beautiful.

RiME is kid friendly, you can purchase to your kid or nonadult relative.

Only thing I not liked in RiME is the camera movement/rotation, most of the time you can move it freely, then suddenly at most of the platforming scenes it moves to a fixed position and sometimes I had issue to realize which button to push for moving forward as sometimes it was A or S or D and not W.

I would recommend this game, it is very enjoyable and cute. I personally find the base price very expensive, but as an East-Middle European who cursed with West European prices, I find the full prices of all games overpriced with a few exceptions. RiME is a must to play once owned or very recommended to purchase during the sale.

[b]Hey, I am an achievement hunter! [/b]

Completing game without walkthrough would take about 8-9hours and that's the time you need to get 100% achievements in this game, if you use an achievement guide (achievement guide not means it is also include a walkthrough and puzzle solutions, simple achievement and collectible guide don't kill the fun). Many collectibles are very easy to miss. The good part is, that you can replay chapters once completed the game so easier to return to missed items and achievements.

[b]This review was created for Average Achievement Hunter curator [/b]

Follow my curator if you like to see achievement related information (completion time, difficulty to get all achievements) on store page of the games.

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30168383-Average-Achievement-Hunter/ 

The curator group doesn't mark any game as recommended so it shows useful information about achievements on the store page of the games without influencing the main store page of steam with recommendations + all games sorted to lists based on expected completion times. No point not to follow!:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991884002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1562068618}
review:
Great game with great atmosphere and a moving story. It has good, intuitive puzzles that I found compelling and fun, though they might be a bit easy for some. Good platforming and environment variety kept it from being just another Journey-clone. 

I completed it in 4 hours, which might seem short, but was just right for what the game was going for.

I noticed some visual glitches, with the geometry disappearing when the camera collides with the terrain. This only happened within caves and tight spaces, and was most noticeable in the first area of the game. 

Apart from that, RiME is a very good platforming adventure, that i would recommend to any fan of games like Ico and Journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801952881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1562090698}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083627746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1561950191}
review:
Empecemos por las cosas buenas: es un juego precioso con un arte que quita el hipo, tanto que he perdido la cuenta de las screenshots que he hecho, la música también es increíble.
Realmente el juego no tiene nada malo, simplemente cosas regulares como los puzzles, que son demasiado fáciles, quizás, para mi gusto. A lo mejor al principio no pensaba mucho en ello pero no hay, digamos, una curva ascendente de dificultad. En cuanto a la historia... (Sin spoilers) es muy bonita pero yo personalemente veo que en ocasiones quieren 'forzar' que le cojas cariño a ciertos personajes (en mi caso) sin éxito, pero aprecio el intento y eso no afecta mucho a como la historia ha querido 'conectar' conmigo.
Resumiendo, en general es un buen juego que tiene todo lo que me gusta, es precioso, tiene puzzles y buena música. Da muchas horas de juego por los coleccionables y tal, yo personalmente no me he molestado en buscar todo así que se me ha hecho mas cortito. Si te gusta la rejugabilidad este es definitivamete uno de esos juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986779330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1562533796}
review:
I really liked this game. Beside the obvious and previously mentioned similarity to Journey, I was also reminded of the Myst series (obviously not from graphics).
The game is not perfect:
[list]
    [*]I found many instances where controls were not in sync with the required action
    [*]There were far too many cases where the camera just goes wonky (usually at very inconvenient times)
    [*]The puzzles were decent, but as I only got stuck once, I'd say they could have been a bit more challenging
    [*]The length of the game is too short (like Portal 2, too little of a good thing).
[/list]
But, those issues were minor issues to me. I've read that some have had performance issues with this game. I experienced no such issues (i5-6600, GeForce 1070, 3440x1440 monitor with default game settings). I got the game on sale, and got more than my money's worth. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes this style of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067662753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1560228174}
review: I really want to like this game but unfortunately, I didn't. It seems like the developers put a lot of focus into making the game look good (which it does!) but neglected to make the game more interesting in terms of puzzles. The game basically turned into a walking simulator by the end, which is not the type of game I signed up for. The impact of the ~big reveal~ at the end is lessened by the fact that I just wanted the game to be over, and while the game was wrapping up and trying to hit me over the head with emotion, I was just exhausted and felt nothing. That shouldn't be what players take away from the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198386765686', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1561908642}
review:
不需要中文也可以看懂剧情的游戏hhh
因为全程除了键位提示没有任何语言，但是却让人能联想所有的剧情和对话
画风清新唯美，每次看到都会很震撼。但是不足的是判定比较迷，如果还想找齐隐藏需要消耗大量的耐心
解密不难
最后一章有一个剧情的反转（大概？）反正你会想说“怎么会这样！”就对了
玩这个游戏一定需要静下心来，不能有一点的急躁。只有这样才能感受到这款游戏的魅力

它就像一个晚安小故事，至于故事的结尾到底是喜是悲，也许只有你的梦会告诉你。

author: {'steamid': '76561198842238311', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1679819540}
review:
真的是一个很好很好的游戏，无论是美术风格，音乐特效还是剧情背景。
虽然后半段确实有种赶工的急促感，但是仍旧很美。
是呼啸的风声，炽热夏天的雷霆，潺潺的流水，和呼唤歌声所带来的同伴，以及那场滂沱的大雨。
是我最初走过的台阶，是我最后走过的路。
往上走的路倒过来，就是归去的旅途。
全程没有任何旁白，就连指引都很少。
确实是一个治愈且致郁的游戏。
为了摸索地图绕了不少路也卡了不少关，首通大概花了十小时（对没错居然花了10小时……），并且还没有全成就和全收集（艹地图太大真的很难找欸）
还会二周目乃至于三四周目的。

author: {'steamid': '76561197979978686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1517721977}
review: RiME was a true delight to play. I thoroughly enjoyed exploring and solving the puzzles. As the story unfolded I found myself thinking I understood the developer's message, only to be surprised in the end by how much I had missed or misunderstood. Unlike other games which have disappointed by the end of the game, this one gave me much more than I expected. The beautiful graphics are appropriate for the story being told and the musical score fits perfectly. My attachment to the little fox was greater than the one I had for a certain in-game cube, with my feelings for the 'robots' a close second. When asked to recommend games for friends, my first question is have they played RiME? I look forward to more like this from the developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209307757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1591571274}
review: This game is so beautiful, it's one of my all time favorites. The music and art is gorgeous, and I really enjoy the slow, relaxing pace of it. The story is lovely, and I love how it develops over time. It's a very simple and sad story, not too complicated or too hard to understand, but it does make you wonder when you get to the end. Definitely worth it, please play this you will not regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198811563791', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1558817144}
review:
RiME traz tudo aquilo que um bom jogo indie tem a oferecer: mecânicas interessantes, histórias simples e envolventes e inovações em alguns quesitos.
Esse é um título quase que obrigatório para quem curte jogos de quebra-cabeça, pois seus desafios são, embora simples para quem já está acostumado com puzzles mais complexos, muito interessantes e a relativa baixa dificuldade não prejudica a experiência.
Em relação à história, a narrativa do jogo pode ser um pouco confusa, uma vez que ela não apresenta nenhum diálogo e diversas criaturas estranhas simplesmente aparecem pelo mundo (algumas não fazendo nada e outras querendo te matar). Isso muito se deve pelo modo como RiME apresenta seu enredo, iniciando com o garoto deitado na praia e o jogador livre para explorar um novo universo que já existia antes da sua chegada da maneira que desejar, podendo ir atrás dos itens colecionáveis ou apenas seguir o curso normal da história.
No fim, caso o jogador esteja atento aos pequenos detalhes ao longo do gameplay, a história não será surpreendente, pois o jogo apresenta o desfecho de maneria delicada. No entanto, se o jogador for apenas passando pelo game sem prestar atenção aos detalhes, talvez o final fique um pouco confuso e seja preciso ir atrás de explicações pela internet.
Em suma, RiME é um jogo profundo e superficial ao mesmo tempo, tentado trabalhar a solidão, a companhia, o apego e o desapego do jogador ao logo de seu desenrolar.
No mais, para aqueles que querem apenas bons quebra-cabeças, esse título é essencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968610556', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1560967489}
review:
[code][h1][b]Relaxing and atmospheric[/b][/h1][/code]

RiME is a great game when you just want to chill and play a game on the couch. It's not very challenging, and therefore also very suitable for a young audience! On the flip side it can be a bit bland/slow at times because of it. Also, even though it doesn't seem like it for a while, there's actually a touching story beneath all the adventure. 

[b]Rating: 8.5/10[/b]

[h1]Halwin's 100% Completion Recommendation[/h1]
[b]Difficulty: 2/10.
Time: 7 - 9 hours [/b]
There is no challenge that comes with the achievements, and the primary obstacle is finding hidden objects. While they aren't expertly hidden, you will likely miss a few without a guide. You can use chapter select after you finish the game, yet since the game has zero replayability I would encourage you to use a guide while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057690087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1519146344}
review:
Tequila Works define su propia filosofía de trabajo como «crear cosas pequeñas, con buen gusto», ¡y vaya si lo cumplen!

Este juego es como un chupito (de tequila, no podía ser menos); es corto, deja buen sabor de boca y calidez en el corazón. Y, sobre todo, su esencia radica en el acompañamiento, en este caso el limón y la sal serían la melodía y el arte visual. Me atrevería a decir que es para paladares habituados, pues como en el caso de los licores, cada cual tiene sus gustos y, en este caso, han de gustarte los puzles.

No hay historia previa, no hay mapa, no hay diálogos. ¿Qué tenemos? Una inmersión difícil de mejorar. A pesar de estar frente a un juego en tercera persona, la forma en que está planteado hará que seamos ese personaje desde el primer instante. ¿Por qué? Debido precisamente a lo que no sabemos.

https://todasgamers.com/2017/06/14/rime-tequila-y-un-naufragio/

author: {'steamid': '76561198045604308', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1561816324}
review: RiME was a fun, albiet fairly short story with a lot of emotion, mystery and charm. The music in the game is pretty great and helps carry the story along. author: {'steamid': '76561197962066184', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1531803387}
review:
RiME is a stylish and at times beautiful puzzle and collection game that has quite the sad yet fulfilling message.  Each area has a different motif or a hidden meaning and I would say try not to spoil yourself on the ending or major levels before you buy it as it kind of ruins the experience.  You will go through a nice grassy starting island to a desert cliff side to an area that is always pouring rain with water drenched rocks reflecting what little light there is.  Visually and artistically speaking RiME is a very pleasant game to look at and experience.

You control a boy as he wakes up after being thrown out of a boat, the area is friendly in how it is presented to you and really fits the whole “starting zone” type of thing that games like Mario 64 accomplished decades back.  You progress through levels by hunting through slight mazes, hitting switches and opening doors in order to progress to the next area.  The areas are somewhat open world, some zones you can run around everything that you see, back tracking all the way to the place that you started, others you are very clearly locked out of going backwards.  

I just wish that it was better optimized, from what I’ve read the game running smoothly is a serious issue even on console platforms.  You will have a major machine but you may not even be able to break 40-50 FPS maybe see 60 every so often but it is very inconsistent.  I mean inconsistent as in you’ll be seeing 50-60 then suddenly go through a tunnel and come out of the other end and suddenly you’re seeing 30 FPS!  That’s honestly one of my biggest problems with the game is that as much as I want to enjoy the story and the emotional ride it gets jarred constantly but the poor optimization.

I would say for the visuals and story alone to pick up RiME, as I’ve gotten older I’ve started to appreciate these “walking simulators” more and more (so long as they are good) but this one is far more of a 3rd person puzzle game than just a walking sim.  I ended up playing this a few times just to grab every secret, items and story fragments that the game has and each time I noticed something new (as you tend to when you revisit games that you’ve already beaten).  Just a shame about the poor optimization.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064087655', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1561823659}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968514561', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1559607888}
review: Rime was a little on the short side. I bought this title at a large discount and I'm glad I did. While the game is short, it's still enjoyable. A good portion of the puzzles are ridiculously easy, and then there are a few that had me  stumped for a good bit. The world and visuals are beautiful, but the optimization of this game at higher graphic settings is terrible. There should be no reason my new pc with an i9-9900k and RTX 2080 Ti should be struggling so hard when I can get a consistent 120fps with all settings maxed on AC: Origins. Aside from that, I still enjoyed my time with the game. The platforming didn't really pose much of a challenge but still felt somewhat nice. Overall I would recommend this game but only at a discounted price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064407080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1556243612}
review:
When I bought this game, I expected just another puzzle game. What I didn't expect was a rich lore with deep metaphors that, by the end of the game, you suddenly click as to what everything meant. It has a brilliant art style and unique interactions with the npc's. Perfect for lovers of story-based puzzles.

10/10, Would highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198402659830', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1605905474}
review:
Après y avoir joué quelques heures , je me suis retrouvé bloqué dans mon avancement. Je ne savais plus où aller. Puis, quelques temps plus tard, j'ai décidé de m'y remettre. Une des meilleures décisions de ma vie.
Un jeu que je trouvais de prime abord fade, vide et ennuyeux s'est révélé une des plus belles expériences que j'ai pu avoir avec un jeu vidéo. Une expérience qui m'a tout simplement soufflé. Une allure enfantine, jusqu'à certaines révélation, qui font prendre à ce jeu un tout autre sens. 

En bref, des graphismes simples et lumineux, une bande son reposante, un gameplay simple et contemplatif et des énigmes plutôt bien agencées.
Si vous voulez voyager, que ce soit visuellement ou mentalement, donnez lui une chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165349880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1561838225}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963858272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1561199427}
review: Ein wirklich wunderschönes Spiel. Man erwacht am Strand einer Insel, die es zu erforschen gilt. Schnell stößt man auf Rätsel, die es zu lösen gilt um voranzukommen. Anders als z.B. bei "The Witness" sind die Räsel hier eher physischer Natur, d.h. man muss Objekte neu anordnen, Schatten ausrichten, etc. Es ist ein bisschen als hätte man bei den alten Tomb Raider Spielen die Action entfernt und nur die Rätsel übrig gelassen. Ein wenig erinnert es mich auch an "Journey" weil man nicht nur die Rätsel selbst lösen muss sondern auch herausfinden, wie die eigentliche Mechanik hinter den Rätseln funktioniert. Anfangs ist alles noch recht casual, steigert sich dann aber doch zusehends. Für jüngere Kinder also noch nicht geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140011924', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1561762605}
review:
Должен сказать, что эта игра прекрасна! 

Нас словно погружают в красивую, волшебную, детскую сказку. На протяжении всей игры нас сопровождает красивая музыка, которая отлично подходит под меняющиеся пейзажи; красивая графика, словно из старого хорошего детского мультика. Сюжет нам подаётся не спеша, потихоньку, поэтому до самого конца игры остается какой - то элемент тайны. Сюжет может показаться простым, но как итог эта игра и цепляет своей простой. 

Игровой процесс напоминает игру ICO 2001 года для PlayStation 2. То есть во время игры нет ничего, ни карты, ни полоски жизни, ничего либо еще. Нас, словно, пытаются полностью погрузить в атмосферу данной игры, почувствовать что все это словно живое! 

Итог:
Графика (для такого стиля) - 10/10.
Музыка - 10/10.
Сюжет - 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167041974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1561811186}
review:
[h1]7/10[/h1]
RiME is an artistic game, made for the story and music.
- The graphics are cartoonish but very polished, they remind The Legend of Zelda: BotW.
- There's no HUD, just music, ambient sounds and nice visuals.
- The gameplay is a platform based mostly on puzzles, and they vary a little bit from start to finish but the controls sometimes are bad and not very responsive. Sometimes even if you do the puzzles right the game still doesn't count them right so you have to redo them, but it's not a big problem.
- The music is amazing, it's the most important part of this game, it helps you feel like you are truly into this game's world.
- The story's very nice, since there are no talking scenes or written collectibles, you have to understand the story by yourself (some collectibles help you understand more though).
- Even though the game is created using Unreal Engine and the graphics are very simple, this game still manages to lag even on good hardware and I saw on some forums that it's not the only game Tequila Works made that was very poorly optimised not only on PC but on consoles aswell.
- The game's not very long, 4-6 hours for the story and around 8 hours to get 100% completion, the only achievements you have to pay attention for are the collectible ones and some hidden ones which with the help of a guide are very easy. So I think the full price is not justifiable, I recommend you buy this on sale.

Now, even though the game is very beautiful, I didn't find it very captivating, actually boring at times. I would still recommend you buy this game and try it for yourself to see if you like it.
If I would have to rate the game, without any decimals, I would rate it 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165429468', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1556561007}
review:
Jogo: RIME

Extras/Mods mais relevantes utilizados: Nenhum, uso de um guia para desbloquear todas as proezas.

Jogo terminado: Sim, com todas as proezas desbloqueadas

Opinião: Recomendado

Análise (alerta de spoilers):

RiME é um simpático jogo de exploração e puzzles com uma estranha história por trás. Não sabemos onde estamos, nem porquê, no início, e com o desenrolar da história percebemos que é algo trágico em função dos cenários e da pouca história que vai sendo revelada.

O jogo não é difícil, é relativamente curto, mas é uma boa experiência.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295302795', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1560508679}
review:
Great story telling with immersive gameplay and beautiful graphics.

Grading
''Graphics'' - 10/10
Awesome.

''Music'' - 9/10
Great music that appropriately adapts to the gameplay.

''Cinematics'' - N/A

''Story'' - 10/10
Incredible story dragging you forward to reveal the conclusion.

''Content'' - 9/10
Content can be found on each step. Variety of contents could have been a bit better.

''Controls'' - 9/10
Both using controller and keyboard and mouse will give you the experience that you deserve.

''Gameplay'' - 10/10
Fantastic.

''Overall'' - 9/10
Great story telling in beautifully designed world and stunning graphics will give you the reason to finish the game and reveal the mysterious story. All recommendations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047749315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1559977437}
review: A beautiful game. Interesting puzzles, immersive music, moving storyline, it's really quite a piece of art. I think some of the puzzles could be improved, particularly later in the game when some mechanics start to get rather repetitive, but for me that was not the sole reason I got the game. The puzzles were interesting, there was enough new ideas to spice things up from time to time, and the exploration of every nook and cranny of the world was optional. The puzzle mechanics could have been deepened with some additional development work, but the whole experience was still a very moving and positive one, and I recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017545067', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1644019510}
review:
Quick note: Don't watch the trailer. Don't watch a review. This game must be experienced firsthand; anything else would be a disservice to yourself and to RiME. Spoil as little as possible for yourself.


Original review: Unplayable. I'd really like to play this game, it looks beautiful. But I've got slightly above the recommended specs, and turning down the graphics gets me... 24 fps. That would be okay, but there's something about the extremely unstable fps and the fov that just give me a massive headache, which means I can't enjoy what seems to be an absolutely amazing game. 

This is the first time since seven years ago when I built this PC that I've needed to overclock my GPU to play a game.

Update Mar 2020: Even with a 1080ti, the game still stutters and crashes. Also, the gameplay is really, really slow. It might be beautiful, but I'm not sure it's worth my time.

Update April 2020: Welp, this game has THOROUGHLY redeemed itself. Seems like the one crash was a fluke, because the rest of the game has been relatively smooth, although still with some occasional frame drops. But now that I've played through the whole thing, I can easily forgive everything except the fact that those on less-capable hardware (The recommended specs listed, an R9 280x, are not enough to play this game at all). It's a shame, because everyone *should* have the chance to play this game, regardless of the hardware they run. It's truly a beautiful experience. Even the backtracking that I was annoyed with earlier was mostly a fluke as well. The devs really put some thought into what the player experiences. 

I would be doing a total disservice to this game if I tried to actually explain it, but typically a review is meant to tell you whether you should buy the game or not. The answer is not unequivocally "yes." But this game is not for everybody in the same way that any other game is not for everybody. It's just that "Zelda/Tomb Raider Reboot but prettier and with a more touching and more personal story" just isn't doing this game justice.

Let me put it this way:

The Witcher makes you fight.

Nier Automata makes you think.

This game makes you feel.

(The Witness makes you bored). 

...

Well, let's say you already knew that. You know you're getting an emotional story mixed in with some puzzles and some absolutely beautiful scenery. I'm sorry that I don't have much to compare this game to. Every other game that I can think of just hits different. This game is meditative. There's no fighting. There's next to no action. Its pacing is most similar to the Tomb Raider reboots, but TR_r feels absolutely empty by comparison. I can't remember the last time I played a game where the story felt this fulfulling, but I can't actually explain why without totally ruining the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065936435', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1561651031}
review:
優化差，某些場景下會突然掉幀；另外有些場景的太黑又要我攀爬，失足的幾次才過…
撇除掉上面因素，本作的聲音跟畫面都及其優秀，音樂舒服動聽，玩一下就會沈浸在遊戲的氛圍裡。
解謎的部份偏簡單，在我沒看攻略的情況下就通關了；而謎題內容不重複所以不會有無聊的問題，有些想法真的挺有巧思的。
遊戲大致上走線性的，中間會有一小部份可以讓你探索的區域，都是些蒐集的小支線，打完一輪大約6-8小時。
如果喜歡體驗劇情氣氛、輕鬆解謎的玩家可以嘗試，在特價時入手比較合適。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006744', 'num_games_owned': 3873, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1558788548}
review:
Está muy bien este "RiME", un juego de exploración, plataformas y puzles, todo envuelto en ese mundo mágico y lleno de color.

La historia está bien, jugando con el misterio hasta el final, quizás sea algo ambigua si no te paras mucho a explorar o dar significado a la narrativa visual, aun así el juego quiere dar un mensaje y logra su cometido.

En cuanto a gráficos pues ya veis, no es un portento pero si que logra crear un mundo muy vistoso y llamativo, al que dan ganas de explorar y que se siente un personaje más de la historia, las animaciones y las físicas están bien logradas así como el juego de luces y sombras, visualmente es una delicia.

La banda sonora también está muy bien cuando la tenemos y acompaña sobretodo en los puntos importantes de la historia, en otros momentos solo escucharemos sonido ambiental que también ayuda a reflejar y potenciar la soledad del mundo que nos rodea.

En cuanto a los puzles y el plataformeo pues cumplen, los obstáculos que nos iremos encontrando suelen ser sencillos de superar, dejando claro el camino a seguir o el objetivo del puzle que estemos haciendo, esto sumado a una recogida de ciertos objetos de forma fastfood, y algunas zonas de ensayo y error suman las mecánicas principales del juego.

El contenido del juego es enorme, la historia principal sin pararte mucho ya son unas 8 horas, pero es que el juego esta plagado de coleccionables y de caminos ocultos, la isla se vuelve un laberinto y por cada zona bien explorada se recompensa con algún objeto opcional o pequeñas dosis de lore, se nota que el juego pese a tener una historia muy decente se ha centrado mucho en la exploración y en dar vida al mundo que nos presenta.

En conclusión RiME es un buen juego, largo, interesante, bonito, con contenido, pero... no es perfecto, ya que quizás su ultimo tramo se puede hacer algo pesado, los puzles aunque están bien son algo repetitivos y nada que no hayamos visto en otros títulos similares, la historia aunque interesante es tan ambigua en ciertos puntos que no logras conectar todas las pistas, el contenido opcional es tan gigantesco que te da miedo dar dos pasos por si te dejas cualquier rincón sin explorar, algunos saltos, plataformas y animaciones podrían estar mas pulidas...  Pero en conjunto es un juego muy recomendable y todo un orgullo que sea producto nacional, si te llama mínimamente la atención,hazte con el. Vale la pena.

review: Com quebra cabeças simples, uma trilha sonora maravilhosa e um mundo encantador que torna a exploração recompensadora, RIME é uma ótima experiência. Claramente influenciado pelos jogos criados por Fumito Ueda, o jogo não decepciona e quaisquer escorregadas técnicas que o jogo possa ter, na jogabilidade e na mixagem de som, não atrapalha a experiência como um todo.
