author: {'steamid': '76561198111571140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1555709693}
review:
[b]TL;DR[/b]
After a painful beginning to what I thought would be an underwhelming experience, RiME really shocked me with how deep its story was willing to go. The problems I had with the game were replaced with a wonderfully gentle ride through heaven, and I can't express enough how shocking it was how much I ended up loving this game. The puzzles, the graphics, the story all made for an experience so incredible it was worth the confusing introduction.

[table]
   [tr]
      [th]Area of Game[/th]
      [th]Score[/th]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Gameplay[/td]
      [td]22/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Visuals[/td]
      [td]24/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Music/Sound[/td]
      [td]24/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Story/Characters[/td]
      [td]25/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Verdict[/td]
      [td]95/100[/td]
   [/tr]
[/table]

If you told me 30 minutes into this game that I would fall in love with RiME and it would end up being one of my favorite games of all time, I probably would have laughed. I could have given an infinite amount of reasons why I wouldn't recommend this: it was glitchy, boring, a walking simulator, and the puzzles had no challenge to them. Let me be clear about this: I HATED playing this game for the first hour of it, but a lot of my complaints slowly... disappeared as I progressed through the game.

Before buying this game, I didn't know much about it. All I knew was the graphics reminded me of Breath of the Wild, and it was a puzzle game with very bright colors. I didn't bother to look further into it before buying because it was on sale for $5 and just thought of it as a quick buy. I had very low expectations before going in, and they were pretty much met with the beginning. I had trouble with the controls, the story seemed slow and stereotypical with the [spoiler]amnesia[/spoiler] and such. The music and visuals were good from the start, though.

As I got further and further in, my opinion slowly changed. I started to enjoy the puzzles more after getting the hang of the controls, and the story took turns I really didn't expect. [spoiler]The ending was absolutely heartbreaking, and wrapped up the story in a perfect way.[/spoiler]

Don't ignore this game. It will impact you in a way no other game will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090210144', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1555629555}

author: {'steamid': '76561198951087050', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1557364351}
review:
大概玩了两个多小时，没能继续下去
倒不是因为别的，这个3D我真是晕得有点厉害，头晕恶心的那种
应该是视角转太快+偶尔锁视角的缘故，毕竟我之前玩别的3D游戏没晕过……

画面是真的挺不错的，色调明亮舒服，小狐狸很可爱。
谜题一般吧，缺乏新手指引我觉得是个缺点，特别是开头我都不知道自己要做什么。
入手的时候是史低只要十几块钱，这个价位倒也没觉得很亏。
如果是喜欢这类游戏且不晕3D的还是值得一试，有晕3D风险的真的谨慎

author: {'steamid': '76561198003238675', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 534, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1555749688}
review:
[h1]Ассасины походу опять лук где то режут [/h1]

Очень трогательная история.
Это просто офигеть.... только что прошел.. нет слов.. 
Купил на какой то распродаже и как то не добрался в итоге до этого шедевра.
Решил ка дай думаю поиграю, блин я в шоке. Так долго у меня было такое сокровище. 
В этой игре идеально всё. Сюжет, геймплей, саундтрек (снова у ушей оргазм). 
Первые 5 минут не понимал что вообще происходит, следующие 10 минут - что делать, куда идти, где что кто?
Всё. Потом оторваться не смог. 
 Прекрасный мир, которым можно наслаждаться изучая его. 
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198136192335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1555942380}
review:
Je viens de terminer ce jeu. Ça fait une heure que je pleure. C'est beau, émouvant, prenant. J'en ai encore des fourmis dans les doigts de ce mélange d’excitation, d’envie de partager et d'émotion. Je ne cesse de pleurer, parce que c'est beau et parce que la fin m'a pris aux tripes. Pour les personnes concernées par le sujet traité, je pense que ce jeu peut être une aide merveilleuse et un profond réconfort. C'est délicieux, troublant et presque parfait.

I have just complete this game and I haven't stopped crying for the past hour. It's beautiful, touching and captivating, I still have pins and needles in my fingers from the mixture of emotions and the desire to share my feelings. I can't stop crying because it's so beautiful and the ending was breath-taking. For the people concerned by the game's subject matter, I think the game could be a wonderful aide and a deep comfort. It's delicious, troubling and almost perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037982486', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1555573485}
review: This game tells a heartbreaking story with absolutely no words. The puzzles are gorgeous and well put together. author: {'steamid': '76561198157036927', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1555461208}
review:
Rime is a lovely fist person exploration game with some puzzle solving.  The story is good, but not great.  What I enjoyed most was having the ability to explore chapter by chapter, without having to worry about a huge open world.  Some people don't like collectibles, but I do and I enjoyed that part of it as well.  I also liked that once you completed the game, you could go back into each chapter and pick up anything you missed.   Best of all, it has achievements that are not ridiculously hard to get, but do require a bit of work.  Just the right balance, I think.

Issues:
 I had trouble using my 360 controller with the game -- some days it would work, the next day no.  

When I had to use keyboard/mouse the view would go out of bounds of the area you were in, especially when you were near a wall or cliff face, making it impossible to see.

The perspective was kind of wonky at times, but not enough to make it unplayable.

Overall a great game, that I would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094410904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1638164384}
review:
Having just finished this game, I almost feel like I am letting go of a good friend. Which I suppose the game devs kinda did lead me through just that sort of process. After all, this is a game about the grief associated with loss.
This was a wonderful puzzle game, but it lacks much replay value. Despite that though, I am really glad I got it. I may never play it again, but I believe I will always remember the emotional and mysterious story that they unfolded for me. I was fully absorbed throughout the process. I especially appreciated all of the thoughtful hidden extras I could go look for, or I could ignore if I wanted to stick to the story of the game without distraction. 
Overarching the rest is the wonderful artistry and vista views made the game a complete winner for me.

My one complaint:
- The controls where at times a bit difficult to deal with, especially when it was time to pick something up or drop it. It was also spotty with the call out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842751790', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1586401743}
review:
I love you so much.
So please let it go.

时隔一年来重温二周目。还是被虐到泪流满面。这是我入steam真正玩的第一个游戏。从此以后就对这种故事性很强的解谜游戏一发不可收拾。这一类游戏很适合不太有操作的萌新妹子们。

1.画风、剧情和配乐都非常非常棒，气氛烘托非常到位。游戏过程中代入感非常强。
2.解谜难度中等偏简单，不烧脑。
3.故事叙述细腻，到最后一刻恍然大悟的时候能感受到很强烈的震撼。
4.全收集的难度相对比较大，在一些地图的犄角旮旯里，建议体验一遍流程后再跟着攻略做全收集。对剧情影响不是特别大。
5.同场景的探索路径不唯一，地图也相对比较复杂，对路痴不太友好。
6.指引环节相对有些薄弱，二周目依然会遇到不知道小狐狸去了哪里的困惑，但也给了玩家自由探索的余地。
7.建议打折的时候入手。


以下关于剧透。

这是一个关于接受的故事。
叙事分为否认-愤怒-质疑-沮丧-接受五个章节，整体非常的流畅，柔和。
到最后一章发现死掉的是小男孩的时候有些出乎意料。
忽然明白前期的所有敌人伙伴其实都是在以自己的方式爱着这个小男孩。(大鸟是阻止小主人公去发现悲伤的真相。狐狸和守护者则是用生命帮助小主人公探索真相的过程。)
等到最后时空对转，一直螺旋向上却到了灯塔的底端，小男孩接受现实，和其他亡魂纵身跃向星海的那一刻直接泪崩。
一周目为小主人公勇敢接受死亡流泪。
二周目为父亲摸索着孩子的遗物，和母亲孩子再次同框，并最终接受至亲至爱离世的现实，解开心结而流泪。
就像有一个成就里说的一样
"Accept things as they are."

我已纵身入星海。
愿你余生可释怀。

author: {'steamid': '76561198447368039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1638553098}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971395135', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1555443345}
review:
I was pleasantly surprised by this game.

I tend to avoid games that are too open ended/minimalist as I don't really like to walk around trying to find what to do next. But this game does a good job funneling you towards your next puzzle/objective without putting a huge arrow on the screen. I always found what I should be doing next within a minute or two.

The puzzles are mildly challenging but not frustrating. There were maybe 3-4 of points where I was stuck for 10 minutes, but the solutions were always obvious in retrospect. I only truly got stuck at one point and it turned out that it was just an issue of screen brightness (I couldn't see a ledge that was supposed to be obvious). I never needed to stop and look up a guide to proceed.

The world & story are abstract but it avoids feeling too pretentious. It's a sad tale that resonates strongly with me due to very recent events in my personal life.

I picked this up on sale and it was well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009367298', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1573920327}
review:
或许是先接触了ABZU，让我初次接触这款游戏的时候，感觉这款游戏无处不散发着拙劣的模仿痕迹，然后我后悔购买了这款游戏，便重新把ABZU下回来游玩，好让我做个对比。
我也不知为何，重新游玩ABZU给我带来的震撼并不能像第一次那么久。在“为了不浪费钱”的约束下，我坚持把这款游戏游玩下去。
我又后悔了，我后悔我错怪这款游戏了。
这款游戏带给我的内容超乎我的意料。
RiME与ABZU拥有同样丰富的内容，但是ABZU却是把内容精华于这3个小时之内。做个比喻就是……ABZU好似一块内容丰富的琥珀，里面蕴含着大量绚丽的物品，看得你应接不暇，走几步，便要停下来仔细端凝这其中的内容。或许ABZU的原意就是想让体验者感觉漂浮于这绝美之中。
而RiME却是把内容平铺拉长，画面感官上感觉相对更简约，却也不失绚丽之美。像一副平铺开来的长幅画卷，以步行的速度一边走一边看，不用停下来，也能览尽画中的内容，更平滑的体验。让我无比赞叹的就是配乐，实在太美了。这配乐直接让游戏整体上升了几个档次。艺术体会这样主观的东西，或许是我词藻匮乏，一时间无法想起用哪些词来描述这配乐与画面结合起来让人感动的意境之美，只能推荐喜欢这类游戏的玩家进游戏自己感受这华美的诗篇了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198946011715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1671887838}
review:
Ein gutes farbenfrohes Spiel was man nur empfehlen kann!
Mit Rime erträgst du Liebe, Vergangenheit, Trauer, Wut und Depression nachdem deine Mutter gestorben ist. Reise durch eine riesengroße Welt (ohne Ladezeiten zwischendurch) und du musst ekelhafte Wartezeiten nur am Anfang kurz ertragen.  

für den Preis: ist das Spiel Sehr gut also man kann sagen ist auf meinen Top 5 Open-World Spielen. Ich habe das Spiel gekauft als es im Angebot für 5,60 Euro war.

hat es die Unreal Engine gut genutzt?
auf Jedenfall!

Und sonst allen noch einen schönen Tag und ich empfehle es dick!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074986845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1678143401}
review: RiME ist ein tolles Spiel für alle, die Atmosphäre und Melancholische Abenteuer lieben. Die Geschichte ist wunderbar rein visuell und akustisch erzählt und durch gelungenes Design und einen (ohne zu übertreiben) fantastischen Soundtrack geht sie direkt ins Herz. Die Rätsel sind eher einfach gehalten, was aber sehr gut zum jugendlichen Protagonisten passt. Wer eine spielerische Herausforderung sucht, ist mit anderen Titeln besser beraten, aber wer in eine Andere Welt entführt werden möchte, liegt mit RiME goldrichtig. Eine definitive Empfehlung von mir!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104392527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1547011392}
review:
Similar to the game [i]AER[/i] which I just gave a little review to, this game, [i]RiME[/i], is also an exploration-based platformer with puzzles, all wrapped up with artistic design. However, [i]RiME[/i] is a much longer game, with more variety in its areas and types of puzzles. Both games have some fantasy land you are in, along with some mystic themes, where you are left to figure out what is happening. The difference there is that [i]AER[/i] had lore via text and a few NPCs, whereas [i]RiME[/i] has no text or dialogue at all, to my recollection. Nevertheless, I would say that [i]RiME[/i]'s story is much quicker to realize by the time you see the ending moments, and it had a much heavier impact on me.

Anyway, I am not quite good at reviewing artistic games like these, because there is usually minimalism in the plot design (or at least for most of the game), thus I can't really discuss that. And they tend to be games where you simply navigate and progress, solving puzzles. [i]RiME[/i] is broken up into 5 sections, each with a different environment that adds onto the puzzles you have been doing, and at some points, even adds enemies for you to avoid or "defeat" in a particular way.

In the end, these types of games are mainly focused on the journey that is going on and what everything means. If you are looking for something like that, then give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872764946', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1590253446}
review: This game is very impactful not only with the stunning visuals but with a great story as well. i got this game the day it came out on Xbox one, and got every achievement except one due to a glitch but still enjoyed the game. i soon got a PC and re bought the game to experience it all over again. It is extremely fun and i would recommend it to anyone. Once you realize the tone of the story and its symbolism it hits you hard. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198319596134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1641483173}
review:
Loved it.

1) It was greatly enjoyable to search for all the hidden collectibles and discover their own meanings by myself. I think not only the collectibles but also all the other elements of this game such as the monsters, the fox, and even how you should solve some of the puzzles have implications related to the story.

2) Puzzles and controls were not that hard or repetitive, which I also liked. Some of the motions maybe a little confusing and awkward when climbing walls, but the scenery is so satisfying that none of those seem to matter that much while playing.

3) Soundtrack is AMAZING. It really  enhances the immersion to the game and the story.

4) Except the first chapter, the mood of the game may be a little frustrating but quite thrilling at the same time, which I also pretty much enjoyed.

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who liked playing The Legend of Zelda and who loves finding details with symbolic meanings.



<SPOIL ALERT> And to the ones who can't seem to unlock a door in chapter 2 because the bird comes right after you before you put the key in place: you shouldn't have put the first key into the keyhole and gone out of the room. Just start over from the last checkpoint, and you'll have two keys dangling on your back. Then go to the room again and the bird won't come to chase you anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025415796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1555113540}
review: Ico or Shadow of the Colossus it is not. I loved these games. Played through them at my pace . No as a "pro video game player"to see how fast I could finish them for achievement points. Although it may not be the aforementioned games, the game is beautiful. It has the same spirit of them and would easily fit in their game world if told it was part of trilogy.  It takes the best of many puzzle games, including these two, and incoporates them beautifully into game world. This game is more magical and more alive then ico or shadow, but unfortunately it's plagued by open world syndrome. Slowdowns and stutters. Same bugs that plaque fallout and elder scrolls series. I believe real time shadowing has a lot to do with it .Making the overall pc requirements much higher than advertised. Certain areas are more noticeable than others. But not so severe as to hamper gameplay. It's like a pebble in the  shoe. Annoying but still highly playable. If it was'nt for this, the game would of been a perfect 10. I give it an 8.5. The graphics and music are of epic proportion. I would of wished the developers spent more time ironing it out . Bought it on sale. Would of happily spent much more after experiencing this work of art. It shows that this game was developed by a gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016832500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1554998796}
review:
Оптимизация хромает конечно, но в 4к 30-40 кадров игра выдаёт. Пусть и с пониженными тенями. 
Выглядит игра очень хорошо, как с точки арт дизайна, так и графики в целом. Unreal Engine 4 использован тут на всю, особенно мелкие частицы.
  Но вот управление для клавиатуры ужасное. В моменты, когда управление камерой отбирают и она замирает в задуманном разработчиками угле наклона - начинается самый ад. Ярчайший пример - пробежка по длинному мосту до самого большого маяка (перед локацией с птицей). Камера смотрит на героя справа сверху. Нужно бежать по прямому мосту, но когда жмешь W, герой бежит и упирается в левую часть моста, W+D - в правую. Просто прямо бежать без геймпада невозможно. Так и дергаешься в конвульсиях целую минуту. И таких моментов, портящих впечатление, во время игры куча.
 Хуже всего то, что они пытаются молчаливо рассказать историю своего мира, но пофантазировать не получится. Не успеть никак. Нашел тайное место какое-нибудь - получи ачивку, в которой описывается что это за место(пр. могильный камень под водой).

Решил дропнул игру на недельку из-за всего вышеописанного, а возвращаться так и не захотелось. Так что бэкну.

Не советую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193798006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1709104432}
review:
涉及剧透
[spoiler] 一开始以为是海难，父亲死了，儿子在幻想的岛上寻找父亲。当我看到男孩浑身发光、哼的音乐变得很好听的时候，我就知道真正死去的是男孩自己了。整场游戏到一个一个机器人走出来的时候到了高潮，最感动我的部分是，男孩抱着最后一个机器人的长腿哀求它不要，但是……门终究还是开了。[/spoiler]
让我想起了《旺达与巨像》。
如果把这款游戏当做没有剧情的纯解谜游戏，那么的确这个游戏的长度是有些太长了；
但是假如理解了其所要传达的故事，那么就长度来说是恰到好处的。
细节真的做的太好了。举个例子，为了避免按左键的时候男孩朝着空气呆喊，换成了哼歌，而且根据哼的内容来表达故事的进展（[spoiler]从普通的哼歌、畏惧的声音、打招呼的声音、啜泣、天使的歌。[/spoiler]）。

+++音乐
+++细节
++画面
++故事
+谜题设计

好像没有什么扣分项？

author: {'steamid': '76561198378854963', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1555238190}
review:
Grę polecił mi kiedyś pewien koleś. Niedawno była przecena, myślę se.. a co tam kupię może warto. I jak wyszło? Warto jak sku♥♥♥♥♥♥ !! Naprawdę piękna gra, kolorowa, cukierkowa grafika, świetne udźwiękowienie - to wszystko sprowadza się do tego że serio warto zagrać w tą produkcję. Ale o czym to jest wgl? Mianowicie zostajemy przywitani sceną w której podczas jakiegoś sztormu lądujemy na dziwnej wyspie. Budzimy się, nie mamy powiedziane gdzie iść, co robić... po prostu mamy iść tam, gdzie nam się wydaje. Gdy zboczymy z drogi i zgubimy, lisek pokazuje nam gdzie mamy podążać dalej - przydatne. Gra składa się z kilku chapterów, łączą się one ze sobą i nawzajem uzupełniają. Mamy w tym świecie poukrywanych dużo różnych znajdziek, od zabawek i muszelek po skrawki emblematów czy kostiumów dla naszego bohatera. Niesamowicie się gra, można się naprawdę wyluzować, odprężyć, zagłębić w ten świat. Nie ma tu jakiegoś głupiego strzelania, badziewnej walki, jakiś zadań pobocznych (I BARDZO DOBRZE!!!) - gra jest liniowa, są elementy wspinaczek. Taki troche Tomb Raider. Zakończenie trochę daje w kość ;/ zależy jak ktoś to odbierze. Ja np jestem graczem który ceni sobie takie gry, takie które coś nam pokazują, czegoś nas uczą, coś nam chcą przekazać, dlatego też lekko się wzruszyłem :) Nie do końca jednak zrozumiałem o co mogło chodzić, nie wiem, na pewno kiedyś jeszcze raz wrócę do tego jak tylko zapomnę fabułę tej gry i najdzie mnie ochota ^^. Zwrócę wtedy uwagę bardziej na szczegóły i skupie się lepiej na historii bohatera - bo przyznaje, przy pierwszym podejściu chciałem wszystko pozbierać i zdobyć wszystkie osiągnięcia
i trochę żałuję że grałem korzystając z poradnika :/ Nie żałuję jednak zakupu, jedyną wadę w tej produkcji jaką mogę dostrzec to optymalizacja i to że zbyt krótka właśnie jest ta gierka :c daje 9,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198227714952', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1655981076}
review: 每一关的风格都是根据父亲失去自己孩子的心情而变化的。父亲一开始“否定”孩子已经失去的事实，到后面又因为自己的无能而“愤怒”，失去了孩子的父亲拿着剩下的东西去“交易”，“交易”之后又开始变得“沮丧”。随着时间的推移，悲痛欲绝的父亲选择“接受”这一悲惨的事实。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042796164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1712221370}
review:
A fun and beautiful, yet short and easy game that was easily worth the $6 I payed for it on special.
I found it to be a perfect combination of sightseeing adventure and problem solving for a game with zero combat.
For a smooth experience I played on max settings at a stable 60fps in 1080p, because the game has some performance issues, and it ran flawlessly and looked amazing.
There is always something special about playing a game with no HUD.
Gifted to a friend after completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108996934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1555194583}
review:
Absolutely love this game. The graphics are nice, beautiful music and smooth game play. the puzzles are easy enough to get through without too much trouble and just challeging enough to keep you alert. 
Despite the odd camera angel every now and then the game play very smooth. 

The story is quite amazing, there is no dialogue, no words or language and yet a whole story is being told.  Got to say though I did not see that ending coming, but that made it all the more worthwhile to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049669834', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1574795955}
review:
What i thought i was buying? Cartoon-ish walking simulator.
What i've got? One hellova feeltrip.
10/10 would get crippling depression again.

Jokes and spoilers aside. 
RiME is a lovely game where you explore the mysterious island and trying to figure the way out of it through puzzles. 
Graphics: The visuals of this game are just gorgeous and breathaking. Smooth animations with rich details. 
Gameplay: Casual, relaxing 'walking simulator'-you're exploring the island, solving puzzles (most of them are quite easy, yet with each level they are getting bit complicated), sometimes can be bit clunky during climbing (specially camera) but nothing what can ruin your experience.
Story: Without saying a single word, the game managed to 'tell' powerful story- especially when you paying attention to little details such paintings or statues. Exploration rewards players with more information (it kinda reminds me Dark Souls games when you must work out to get piece of information and also using imagination ((or you can go to wiki where it's spoiler-free, but where's fun in that?)) 
Sound: In short- it's beautiful. Sealing the atmosphere and capturing emotions excellently.
Last thought: While RiME isn't perfect (having few flaws) and the plot twist (or even type of the game) definitelly ain't for everyone, i'd highly recommended it anyway. Sometimes you just want to lie back a bit, chill & discover the unknown. 
Final verdict: 8/ 10 - It's an art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071585954', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1555200827}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035898856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1555184318}
review:
7.5/10 . Relatively simple "adventure" gameplay bolsters a story that manages to be vague without being esoteric, and which becomes increasingly understandable as the ending approaches.

Presentation: The game looks good. The art design isn't technically impressive, but it's stylistically good. The music is really, really good. The game seems a little poorly optimized, in that my Vega 56 was humming rather loudly the entire time on Ultra at 1440p (with TSAA), but it was 60 FPS throughout the game as I could tell.

Mechanics: The gameplay of Rime is fairly basic. You can run around, jump, roll, interact with things, or yell. I never encountered a use for rolling, but the others get plenty of use. You primarily solve environmental puzzles and do light platforming. Neither is difficult, but that's not really the focus of this game. There are collectibles scattered throughout the world that you can find; most are meaningless, but at least one is related to the game's story.

Story: You play as a little boy in a world with no other people, there're no voiced lines, you have an animal friend. I didn't really have any clue what was going on until maybe an hour before the end, and even now there are elements I'm unsure of. As I mentioned when talking about the mechanics, there's one set of collectibles which seems to describe the game's story, and after the game's finished there's a pretty big hint in the Main Menu, but I wasn't able to find all of the former, and even with the latter as mentioned there are still things I'm curious about. Overall I think it broaches a meaningful subject in an interesting way.

Worth pointing out: I finished this in 5 hours. Is this worth $30? H*ll no. $15? Heck no. $10? If you're desperate for a game to play. $5? Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134536517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1555179974}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329156672', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1554904528}
review:
游戏的氛围很棒，神秘，幽寂，古老，仿佛在探寻一个伟大文明的遗迹
为什么说伟大，能够操控时间流转的文明当然伟大
那为什么退款了呢
玩到大鸟的时候
要拉出两个箱子
第二个反复尝试半个小时
总是来不及就被大鸟抓了
崩溃了
此外，谜题感觉奇奇怪怪，为解密而解密，尤其是地面的提示
且游戏卡的有点厉害
配置明明够了
但还是推荐的

author: {'steamid': '76561198844129801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1555144488}
review:
Excelente obra!!! Recomendada para cualquiera que quiera ver una historia y arte hermosos. Su banda musical complementa a la perfección con algunos momentos muy altos en su nivel. 
Con respecto a la historia es un disfrute por completo, una introducción que no da muchas pistas pero a lo largo del juego se va armando la idea. Un final espectacular y claro para que pueda ser analizado y entendido por todo tipo de público.
Mecánicas de juego sencillas y fáciles de comprender, al igual que los puzzles (no tienen demasiada complejidad) pero no dejan de ser originales.
El único detalle que afecta, pero solo por momentos, es en las plataformas. Algunos saltos por la posición de la cámara no sale dirigido hacia donde uno creía (pero es un detalle mínimo, luego te acostumbras).
Sin más que decir, recomendado 100%.
Felicidades al grupo Tequila por un trabajo espectacular!!!
Lo disfruté y sentí mucho!! Gracias por esta obra!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006772462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1555110503}
review:
Am Anfang war ich echt begeistert und war Beeindruckt von einem tollen Indiegame. Schöne Grafik, handgemachte Spielwelt und interessante Aufgaben. Allerdings war ich schwer Enttäuscht als ich das letzte fünftel des Spiels gespielt habe. Das Ende ist meiner Meinung nach eher lieblos gestaltet worden. Eine magische andere Welt wird einfach durch ein trauriges Ende zerstört. Dieser Handlungsbogen ist meiner Meinung nach völlig unangebracht und schwächt das Spielerlebnis insgesamt ab. 

Wenn man schon eine andere magische Welt baut, sollte man auch dabei bleiben. Außerdem bin ich der Meinung das es wichtig ist bis zum Ende hin sein Niveau durchzuhalten. Hier ging den Entwicklern echt die Puste aus auf den letzten 400m.

review: 好游戏，给玩家留了足够大的空间去探索，百度了一下，知道游戏所要表达的那种情感，失去亲人后所表现的五种情绪。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119538980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1572589041}
review:
ICOやワンダと巨像、ニーアレプリカントのような雰囲気が好きな人には刺さりそうな、雰囲気パズルゲー。
特に音楽とグ水の描写がとても美しい。各チャプターのタイトルを見るとネタバレになる演出が好きです。

・少年
主人公。趣味は鼻歌。特技は声で壺を割る事。ﾊｧ‼（・□・）
この少年がどこから来てどこへ行くのかが、主なストーリー。

・キツネ
一緒に冒険してくれるかと思いきや、広いワールドで方向が分からなくなった時の目印マスコット。
プレイヤーが自発的にキツネをモフることはできない。モフりたかった。

・赤ずきんさん
最初はショタコンのストーカーかと思った。違った。
割と重要なキーマンでした。

・ロボ
主人公を、身を挺して助けてくれるヒロイン。なんならキツネよりも主人公と関わってる。



要望をいうなれば、コントローラーの振動をオフにする項目が欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096498599', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1554999494}
review:
优点：
1.游戏画风非常唯美，很有ICO和风之旅人的感觉；
2.谜题设计很有意思，各种光影特效都很棒。
缺点：
1.相对于地图的大小，感觉跑步太慢，在你到处寻找隐藏和收集品的时候感受特别深；
2.游戏里面很多元素感觉有点莫名其妙，感觉就是为了存在而存在，比如两条腿的机器人，通关用的雕像和那些黑影；
3.在游戏完结前我都没太看明白剧情，导致玩的很难受，后期完全不收集，只求过关了事；
4.想要回头收集只能重新选择大章节，打完大章节又得一两个小时。
总体评分：7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015894150', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1581365398}
review: Por el momento y sin fix de parte de los desarrolladores , es imposible darle un positivo a este juego, es bello? si, tiene buena musica ? totalmente, es divertido? bue.. eso.. podriamos preguntarnoslo bastante, pero lo que falla rotundamente es su performance, el juego tiembla hasta con los graficos al minimo, y cabe aclarar que mi equipo se aguanta hasta el BFV en ultra. el otro tema muyy mal manejado es la camara, definitivamente los muchachos de tequila works no han sabido implementar tecnicas solidas de camaras en tercera persona, por momentos parece que solo dejaron la camara como viene en el template de TPS del UE4. Una lastima por RIME ,porque sinceramente se ve espectacular, pero se torna injugable e indisfrutable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987044828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1554977408}
review: This game is so fucking beautiful it's painful to turn off your screen and be forced to face the disgustingly ugly reality of the crappy "real world". You can truly feel the heat from the sun, the searing stones you traverse and the salty air from the pulsing ocean surrounding the island you find yourself stranded on. Great platforming as well, and a touch of mystery that constantly keeps you moving forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069912836', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1555279387}
review:
It's boring and overpriced. There is no goal, no motivation. You have no idea, what you are doing or why. Nothing has a rime or reason (get it?)

The controls are extremly reduced and irritatingly slow. And yet they are not intuitive. The game has to show button prompts at the very end. You cannot run or center the camera. Also, the camera clips with the walls all the time what takes you out and makes this feel cheap. 

There is not enough depth to the gameplay or the narrative to make you want to explore. The world is far from open. It is very linear. There are collectibles, but they are all inconsequental. Nothing you need or that's insightful. I thought about checking out the back side of a cliff but I didn't want to walk back in case there is nothing there. No game should get you this far.

All these beautiful visuals and marvelous places are without meaning or relevance. You don't need language to convey a story, but all other rules still apply and none of these were considered, therefore the game is not capitivating. The story is pretentious, anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408919881', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1555041974}

author: {'steamid': '76561198265281974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1612082703}
review:
独特なグラフィックが綺麗。
BGMも綺麗、穏やかなものが多くてよかった。
適当に進めばクリア可能。
謎解きで若干詰まるところはあるかも。

SSを見た感じで1280x720にすればいけるかな、と思ったけど意外と重くてfpsが不安定でした。
最初の砂浜でほぼ60fpsだったけど少し進んで木がたくさん生えてるマップでは15fpsくらいまで下がりガクガクに。
「解像度スケール」で調整すれば大幅に負荷を減らせます。(75％くらいならさほど気にならない)

収集要素があるみたいだけど、既に解いた謎解きをもう一度最初からやるのはちょっとしんどい。
おそらくバッドエンドだった(?)けどしばらくはやらないかも。
移動速度アップ、演出スキップ、アイテム探知機がほしい。

ジャンプ連打でちょっと速く移動できます。

review:
“愿逝去之人再无孤苦，愿承受失去之人再无孤苦”
尽管游戏在某些方面还需优化，例如帧数偏低，但是瑕不掩瑜，作为一款十分用心且寓意深刻的精品独立游戏，它带给了我太多惊喜，唯美的风景，调皮的人设，适当的解密，如果真的体会到这个故事表现的晦涩和蕴含的深意，你可能会喜欢上这款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198402214760', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1560263649}
review:
A compelling game straight off the mark that I managed to complete in 10 hours.  There were a ton of collectibles I didn’t collect and a ton of cheevos I didn’t cheev, so maybe you can get more out of this game.  At my playtime I would consider Rime a tad on the expensive side but it has been bundled and rebundled and goes on sale often.  It is an adventure platformer game featuring a great story.  Wait for a sale if your wallet can’t handle the price tag.  If you can't handle the price tag then pick up AER Memories of Old for the time being as it shares a lot of qualities with this game.
_______________________

PROS  
+ Beautiful art style.  Everything is richly coloured and detailed but at the same time a bit blocky.    
+ The soundtrack is amazing.  There are very emotional swelling pieces of music throughout the game that add a whole new level of detail to the experience.
+ Story.  Without ever saying a word Rime gives us an amazing story in great detail.  It uses powerful visuals, music and level design to push forward its narrative.
+ Excellent level design on the whole.  It is a very corridor exploration game when it is ushering you into the next area or trying to get on with the story but there are also some tougher puzzles that will have you needing some time to think how to progress.
+The sounds.  All the sounds in the game feel very real and match the environment. Everything from the waves crashing onto the beach, the thunder, the slap of your bare feet on sand or stone to the seagulls screetching are organic and sound amazing.
________________________

CONS
- Some parts of the game drag out a bit too long for me.  
- Controls can be a bit frustrating, especially in some of the platforming parts.
________________________

I’m not going to spoil Rime in any way.  It is a game with a really strong story where you are firmly in the shoes of the protagonist and are discovering this strange world exactly as he is.  It reminds me a lot of the old school Tomb Raider games where we find ourselves in self-contained areas that we have to traverse and pull levers in order to advance.  Rime has a ton of places to explore and a tons of screenshots waiting to be taken.  If you want to delve into a world that is (mostly) non-threatening and live out a story then you need Rime in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041307113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1684117659}
review:
I was initially referred to this game by people on the Quern and The Witness game forums who were comparing it to those games and putting all three into the 'Mystlike' category; now that I've played the thing I can say that's an inaccurate comparison as while the game has puzzles in it and is set on an island there isn't much else about it that is particularly Myst-like. Nonetheless, I wanted to give the game the chance to stand on its own merits irrespective of what other people are advertising it as... and there are still quite a few problems with it.

* The puzzles are not the Myst-type point-and-click puzzles but the sort from Portal or Talos Principle which involve picking up and moving around different objects with the 'use' key. I personally prefer the Myst style, but irrespective of that the puzzles here are simpler and not especially challenging.
* There also weren't very many of them. In fact, the world seems 'larger' than it needs to be, with a lot of time spent just getting from one place to another which is not helped by how slow your top speed is. The game is arguably more of a platformer than a puzzle game, but the platforming is also pretty straightforward and isn't very satisfying: it's always pretty clear where to go, and your movement is pretty restricted; it doesn't feel nimble and quick the way, say, the Sly Cooper games did. 
* As it progresses the game attempts to get increasingly symbolic and 'psychological', but it's not especially compelling or even really all that important. There really wasn't a lot *to* the game looking back; I was able to power through it in a little under a day.

If you came here looking for a Myst-like "Island Puzzle" game you are better off playing The Witness, Quern, or even Talos Principle; even if that's not what you were specifically expecting I can't say I'd recommend it unless the game is expanded in the future to be less full of itself and more full of actual content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023891919', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1554454025}
review:
Uma ótima história contada sem ser dita uma única palavra.

 [*][b]Prós:[/b]
Gráfico muito bonito (destaque pra fase da chuva).
Ótima trilha sonora.
Ótima história.
"Personagens" carismáticos.
Ótimo level design.
Jogabilidade simples, mas funcional.
Puzzles simples, mas divertidos de serem feitos.

 [*][b]Contras:[/b]
O personagem não sobe em certos locais (o jogo tem coletáveis, daí tu vai tentar subir em algum lugar, e acaba dando de cara com a parede).

PS: Se seu jogo ficar com o FPS ridículo de baixo, tira o anti-aliasing do SSAA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028205782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1668250624}
review:
[h1]아름다운 디자인의 모험 게임[/h1]

[i][b]이코[/b][/i]를 떠올리게 하는 맵 디자인과 플레이 방식을 가졌고, 
[i]지브리 애니메이션[/i]의 분위기를 가진 퍼즐 어드벤쳐 게임입니다.

수려하고 웅장한 아트워크와 넓은 맵을 통해, 다른 세계를 탐험하는 듯한 느낌을 줍니다.
참신하지만 어렵지 않은 퍼즐들은 게임의 디자인과 물아일체를 이루고 있습니다.
이런 점들은 플레이어가 게임 속 세계에 빠져들도록 만듭니다.

한글 패치는 있으나 게임 플레이에 언어가 전혀 필요하지 않아 패치하지 않아도 지장이 없습니다.
제 플레이타임은 [b]7시간[/b]으로, 도전과제는 신경쓰지 않고 진행하였습니다.
[i]이코[/i], [i]저니[/i] 같은 게임을 좋아하시는 분에게 추천합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1652632509}
review:
[url=https://youtu.be/JqYknuRXG78][b]Video review[/b][/url]

[h1]Aaaah![/h1]

This game really surprised me. I didn’t expect much, I expected a half assed attempt at a walking simulator but I’ve a great platformer/puzzle game with amazing art, soundtrack and story.

You wake up on the beach not knowing what happened and start your journey. At first you take your time to admire the scenery because this game is really beautiful. Simplistic cell-shaded graphics was a good choice for artistic design. There’s also no hud so nothing get in a way and can fully immerse in the world.
The story is really sad in this one, it’s beautiful but when you realize what’s happening you understand how sad the story really is.

Gameplay is pretty basic. You run around in an open environment and explore every corner of it. Although it’s not necessary to explore everything, I highly suggest you do that. You progress the game by solving puzzles and collecting some items. Puzzles are not too hard so they don’t break the flow of the game. This is really more of a narrative game than puzzle, so difficult puzzles would just ruin the experience.

Every level is different and represents something else. You’ll climbing, uncovering secrets, avoid monsters, run, jump and yell. Yes there’s a lot of yelling. You interact with thing by yelling. There’s also a cute friendly fox who will guide you through the levels.
The only downsides I notices are that camera angles sometimes are annoying and climbing controls could be better.

Graphically the game looks stunning. The visual are very clean and minimalistic from the first sight, but there’s so much detail everywhere. Levels are very well crafted. Overall graphics are a work of art. Although the performance can be little disappointing. I don’t know why this runs worse than AC origins. I had to lower some settings to get 60fps and even then I experience big fps drops. Optimization is not very good.

Soundtrack just adds another layer of awesomeness to this game. It fits the aesthetics of the game very well and makes it so much better.

I recommend this game for those who enjoys good stories, well balanced gameplay and beautiful visuals. Don’t miss this game.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Beautiful graphics
[*]Great sound design
[*]Sad story
[*]Balanced gameplay
[*]Many different locations
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Performance could be better
[/list]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32930811-Kosmos%27s-Cosmic-reviews/?appid=704030][h1]My curator page[/h1][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962309025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1633094365}
review:
Rime ist ein sehr liebevoll gestaltetes Spiel mit einer traurigen aber fesselden Geschichte. Die Grafik ist zum Teil Comicartig gehalten, was aber nicht stört und insgesamt sehr gut aussieht.

Die Soundkulisse ist toll, der Soundtrack wundervoll. Die Musik ist sehr gut gewählt und passend zu Stimmung hinterlegt.
In der Welt von Rime gibt es sehr viel zu sammeln und zu erkunden, was sehr positiv ist, da man dadurch mehr über die Insel und die Geschichte erfährt. Die Schwierigkeit der Rätsel ist von leicht bis schwer vorhanden. Also ein sehr guter Mix von allem.

Einzig was man vielleicht als Kritik erwähnen kann, wäre die Spielzeit. Man ist mit knapp 10 Stunden durch mit dem Spiel.

Definitiv zu empfehlen.

https://youtu.be/IFx7D6g3d_E

author: {'steamid': '76561197992786274', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1553495519}
review:
RiME had me charmed in an instant. It reminded me of other walking sims/puzzle platformers and like others, it was pleasing to look at, to listen to and to explore. I never truly felt lost (until very late in the game), each direction I chose seemed to unlock something and get me somewhere. The pacing was also quite nice, with the sense of urgency and danger rising with each new location.

Since I was streaming, I skipped many of the collectibles. Luckily, the game has a great menu for selecting previous stages to acquire what I missed so if I ever go back to try to 100%, I don't have to replay it all from the beginning.

While I wasn't super impressed by the story/ending, it was really the paths that it took me through that mattered to me. When I struggled with a puzzle, it was generally because of some simple thing that I had looked over or didn't notice.

I definitely recommend this game to fans of the genre. It's a (mostly) relaxing look into another world, and who could get tired of doing that?

author: {'steamid': '76561198046881436', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1696087668}
review:
Reviews for Rime seem mostly mixed. Some think it's a walking simulator. Others think it's all bling no ding.

For me personally, Rime was as captivating and enchanting as some of the more well known titles such as Abzu and Shadow of the Colossus, similarly, Journey too.  

Rim is an interesting game in that yes, most puzzles are easily solvable, the story is a bit vague, and the gameplay is limited, but behind these rather minor concerns, you have an extremely vibrant, absolutely extravagantly designed game. The visuals are utterly astounding, some of the best, most timeless art style's paired with an absolutely phenomenal soundtrack that makes you weep and soar in all the right moments. 

I had an absolute blast playing this game. I had my fair share of frustration with certain aspects, but the pro's here absolutely outweighed the cons for me. Not many games make me genuinely cry. Kudos to Tequila Works for making such a mesmerising, and truly beautiful narrative that I could lose myself in for some of the most emotional 6 hours I've had in a while. Truly, thank you.

Pro's:

Timeless, bright and diverse art style reminiscent of the Wind Waker days.
Truly captivating and wonderful soundtrack that can and does take you on an adventure of its own.
Easy control scheme with some interesting game elements.
Vague, but decipherable story with heavy themes and strong emotional appeal.
A good dose of wonder and mystery as you unravel said story to unveil the meanings and symbolism. 
Not a 'hold your hand' styled game, get yourself out there and learn for yourself!
Well balanced puzzles that promote progress and a little thought without stopping you dead in your tracks long enough to get flustered.
Diverse environments to experience and explore, never feeling dull.

Cons: 

Though I listed this as a pro, it can also be a con. Puzzles are relatively easy, some more intermediate and even hard puzzles requiring multiple aspects of gameplay, such as the use of lights and your ability to create them would have been a bonus here.
Missable collectables create the need  for a rerun which ultimately detracts from the purity of a one time run, sadly diminishing  the emotional weight.
Somewhat slow character movement may prove annoying at times.
Steep price point for a standard 4-6 hour experience, and a 6-8 hour experience if you want to 100% it. Also expensive when considering the soundtrack is not included.


Honestly can't find much to fault with this game. I had a wonderful experience, and I hope you do too.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055749981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1553550211}
review:
I wasn't expecting much from this game other than it looking really pretty but its more than just that. I strongly recommend this game to anyone wanting a relaxing and heartfelt story, you can tell this game was a labour of love. 

If you like relaxing puzzle adventure games then you'll most likely enjoy RiME. There is no dialogue, combat, health or even text (apart from button prompts) in this game so it ends up just being a relaxing experience which you're supposed to unwind and take at your own leisure. The only two things you can really do in this game is walk around and interact with things, which you'll be doing a lot to solve puzzles and discover collectables. If that doesn't sound appealing then it might not be for you.

The visuals of the game is absolutely stunning in my opinion as it uses shape and form to really help the environments and structures pop, add on top of that great colour and lighting and you have some amazing looking levels that you can just stare at for hours. The use of reflections in the metals and the shaders for the water look fantastic too. I honestly can't get enough of the visuals of this game!

The soundtrack is phenomenal and you owe it to yourself to listen to it. If you love the Ghibli soundtracks then this will blow you away. During gameplay it uses audio cues and blends them with the music to help make certain moments really stand out and it really adds to the feelings you'll be experiencing throughout.

Performance wise the game is mostly great, I noticed there was a huge performance hit with SSAA turned on, no matter what other settings you changed (im running a RTX 2070 and i7 7700k) it would always dip below 60fps. Turning it down to TXAA or FXAA will increase performance greatly. Other than that it ran great for me!

Oh and the game has native support for 21:9! Which is a huge plus for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396018899', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1552440122}
review: 大概是设备性能的原因，帧数低，稍微玩一会就头晕，但是依然坚持玩了五个小时，虽然还没有玩到结局，这五个小时的体验带给我最大的感受就是沉浸感很强，当你带上耳机，风声，风吹拂过树木花草的沙沙声，海浪拍打海岸，鸟儿的叫声，甚至这个游戏竟然加入了昼夜更替，我第一次打开这个游戏时最令我沉醉的就是第一个晚上那繁星闪烁的星空，这太美了，我最喜欢的是那个在黑夜中摸索的迷宫设计，很有代入感真的是款好游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198420412024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1569568372}
review: 玩了四五遍。真的超级喜欢！虽然第一次通关看完结局后郁闷了好久，之后再玩的时候看着小男孩的红围巾心里五味杂陈，但它是个值得回味的好游戏（TAT）。我是个游戏制作方面的学生，明白做游戏的艰难，所以非常感谢制作组让我了解这个美丽又哀伤的故事！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197966835684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1553122212}
review:
This game goes right for the feels. It doesn't need a single word to tell a better story than most games with 20 times more playtime and thousands of lines of dialogue.

It shook me up, it made me cry, it made me think about the things that happened in my life and how I dealt with them. Thanks for making this artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026069616', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1552856198}
review:
The only remarkable about this game is its visuals, everything else is very mediocre.

The camera takes away the control way too often, when it is actually not necessary. The controls didn't feel responsive. I stopped counting how often I needed to press the action button twice, just because the object to interact with was a bit too far off or not finished with its animation.

And I really don't get the story, regarding it's ending. [spoiler]Maybe your journey is the manifestation of the memories and the grief of the boy's father. Because you - the boy - are basically dead.[/spoiler]

All in all the 5 to 6 hours are definitely not worth the requested price tag of 35€. Play Abzu instead!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041676116', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1552754972}
review:
I loved this game, it is very beautiful, poetic, the music Is amazing. The atmosphere makes me think of the Miyazaki's movies. I loved so much I've played two playthrough (to find all collectibles and explore more). Story is very nice. Gameplay is basic but very neat. Puzzles are a bit too simple though.
I definitely recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054848484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1552622960}
review:
ゲームとして楽しませるのではなく、雰囲気を見てくださいという映像作品
■良い点
・グラフィック、世界観、音楽　素晴らしいと思います　特に音楽は特に好きです
・モーション　主人公やそれに関わるキャラクターのモーションが素晴らしく愛着がわきます
■悪い点
・ゲーム性　ほぼ移動とクライミング、ちょっとの同じパターンのパズル
・操作性の悪さ　ほぼクライミングと移動のみのゲームでちょっとしたストレスが溜まりに溜まります
・わかりづらいストーリー　雰囲気ゲーでやりこみ要素をやりこまないとなんとなくのストーリーも理解できないつくりはどうかと
■レビュー
ICOやワンダなどの影響がみられるがゲームとして作られた上田作品に対して、こちらは世界を見せるためにゲーム部分があるように感じる
広いスカスカのステージ、一本道のパズルステージ、ほぼ移動だけのステージ
イベントだけ見せてくれよと思ってしまうレベル　雨の遺跡ステージは早くこれ終わらないかなとすら思った
が、それぞれの世界観やグラフィック、音楽の融和性は素晴らしい
もう少しゲームを進めさせる動機やゲームとしての気持ちよさを入れてほしかった
雰囲気ゲー大好きな自分にとってはとても惜しい作品

author: {'steamid': '76561198011695980', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1552536037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064783185', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1552400579}
review:
Rime es un juego de puzzles y plataformas donde controlaremos a un niño perdido en una isla, que irá descubriendo los secretos que oculta, pasando por zonas áridas, bosques o incluso ruinas.
LO BUENO:
- El gran punto a favor y lo más destacable del juego es su calidad artística. Los escenarios son putamente preciosos, y siempre te quedarás mirándolos y apreciando el escenario.
- La banda sonora es correcta, pero logra encajar perfectamente con todos los momentos del juego.
- Las animaciones están muy trabajadas: Cómo baja una ladera, la forma de rodar, la forma de correr... Todos los movimientos están muy logrados.
- La historia no parece ser gran cosa y puede parecer apenas inexistente, pero todo cobra sentido a medida que va terminando el juego, con un gran final.
LO MALO:
- En un juego donde destacan las plataformas puede ser bastante frustrante que algunos saltos no los haga el personaje de forma correcta, o que tengas que pasar sí o sí por un saliente específico, y no medio metro mas a la derecha. Además, muchas veces el personaje se quedará trabado en esquinas o con algún objeto aunque no lo estés ni siquiera rozando, lo que supongo que será un fallo con las áreas de colisión.
- Los puzzles no son para nada complicados. Quiero entender que no buscan lastrar la aventura o atascar al jugador, pero sí que habría agradecido un par de puzzles que tuvieran algo más de complejidad.
- Aunque el juego intenta que conectes con él, yo no he logrado sentirme unido al personaje y apenas he logrado empatizar (a excepción de un par de momentos).
- Durante gran parte del juego se me ha hecho divertido el juego, pero tengo que decir una cosa: El tercer nivel es, en mi opinión, innecesariamente largo, y una zona que me terminó aburriendo a partir de la segunda mitad del mismo.
CONCLUSIÓN:
En general, Rime no es un mal juego, pero me da la sensación de que podría haber sido mucho más. Lo recomendaría en caso de haber una buena oferta. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197997860863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1552172453}
review:
Un peu plus de 7h, voilà ce qu'il m'a fallu pour terminer ce jeu et vous donner mon avis que j'espère objectif.

J'étais parti pour pour parler d'expérience mais je me ravise et parle bien ici d'un jeu.

RIME se veut être l'héritier de jeu comme ICO et Shadow of Colossus (SOC), c'est revendiqué et c'est une évidence.
Mais tout le monde n'a pas le talent de Fumito Ueda ou des art designers de ces derniers pour immerger, voir submerger, le joueur.

Le scénario est original et, pourtant rompu à tout les types de scénario, je dois bien avouer n'avoir compris ce qui se passait réellement qu'au dernier chapitre du jeu.
l'immersion dans celui-ci est bi-polaire, mon sentiment est que les développeurs hésitent en permanence entre y allait à fond comme le fond donc ICO et SOC, et se retenir de nous immerger plus pour justement rendre le jeu accessible même à un enfant de 8 ans. J'entends par là qu'ils éviteraient de vouloir trop nous impliquer pour ne pas trop nous émouvoir.
Il en résulte un une fable très poétique à laquelle il manque ce petit truc nous permettant de nous attacher réellement, on est plus spectateur qu'acteur.

RIME arrive donc toucher du bout du doigt ICO ET SOC sans pour autant les atteindre.
Mais ne vous y trompez pas RIME est un excellent jeu, avec des graphismes au parti pris graphique très inspiré, un gameplay minimaliste (trop d'ailleurs? simpliste?) qui le rend accessible à la majorité des joueurs, tous âges confondus.

La camera qui suit nos aventures est ici proche d'être parfaite mais est, sans que cela soit à outrance ou de façon récurrente, gâchée par de petits couacs gâchant justement cette immersion.
On se retrouve contre un mur et la caméra est face à celui-ci, donnant à l'écran un joli écran gris clair ou gris foncé fonction du décor. les quatre ou cinq fois où je l'ai vécu sur la totalité peuvent paraître anecdotique mais personnellement, quand je vis une histoire j'aime bien ne pas en être décroché pour ce genre de choses. Et c'est d'autant plus dangereux dans la partie lorsqu'on est sur une corniche...

Ce sont sans doute ces points qui me font ranger ce jeu une fois fini, là où je suis retourné quatre une cinq fois sur ICO ET SOC.

Pourtant le jeu bénéficie d'un level design extrêmement  bien fichu, au point parfois de s'y perdre.
Du moins jamais longtemps, car le jeu saura vous prendre par la main pour vite vous faire poursuivre l'aventure.
J'aimerai avoir ce genre de level design plus souvent dans des jeux vidéo.
C'est le gros point positif numéro 1

Il reste alors à perler de la partie sonore et musicale.
Ici par contre le but est atteint, si les bruitages sont minimalistes, ils sont suffisant et tombent toujours à pic.
Quant à la musique, sans être mythologique, historique, ou inoubliable, elle reste superbe avec une montée en puissance frêle mais présente toujours au bon moment. C'est le gros point positif numéro 2 du jeu.

En conclusion un très bon jeu, un chouillat trop court (10h de jeu minimum cela aurait été bien), qui oscille entre le très bon est l'excellent mais qui n'atteint pas hall of fame du fait de ses hésitations et de ses rares petites imperfections.
Je le conseille donc mais pas au prix fort, le payer entre 7 et 12 euros me semble correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117883252', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1676856387}
review:
可能确实这类游戏不是我的菜吧，玩了一个多小时过了两关我还完全不知道我是谁我在哪我到底在干什么。。。

怎么说呢，风景确实优美，我觉得优化也还好，我是笔记本1060玩的没有什么优化问题。

玩起来就是一直在跑来跑去，也不是开放世界，很多地方近在咫尺就是跳不上去或者游不到，一小块地方绕来绕去一个小时就过去了，玩久了手指按的有点疼（跑步游泳都不快），然后也没有提示这一关要干啥。更蛋疼的是没有剧情啊，我玩完第一关，看到小狐狸，很可爱，我也很开心，以为有点剧情了，结果就是跟着小狐狸跑到新一关，还是不知道自己在干啥，绕了半天觉得太无聊了，看了网上攻略，过了第二关，然而到现在还是不知道我是谁我在哪我到底在干什么，我就gg了。

我个人的感觉是，除非你真的有一下午/一晚上的时间什么事情都找不到了连睡觉也不想睡，然后又热爱纯粹的地图解谜，否则这游戏真的是有够无聊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198842724859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1552039456}
review: Waited the whole game for the game element to start. Then it ended. The scenery was beautifully done, and some game element was there, it just needed more there to be worth $20. The controls are serviceable, the only problems I ran into were the ledge jumps, which could only happen if you pushed the analog stick at wonky angles, and the fact that you have to wait a second for the prompt to appear every time you want to perform an action with an object in the game.Which isn't a big deal at first, but in a puzzle game with trial and error, it gets tiring.  Also why do the climbing ledges look like they're covered in bird shit? [spoiler]And they kill the dog, [/spoiler]which is such an overdone cliche at this point it just sours the experience. Pick this up if it's on sale for $10 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250544676', 'num_games_owned': 3672, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1552008162}
review:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/The_dull_games_reviewer

What can I say about RIME? I'm not sure I have the words to do it justice, so I'll just use some quotes from celebrities:

"It's all been rather lovely"
John Le Messurier, actor in the BBC comedy 'Dad's army', said those words before he died. He was ruminating on his life and not this game, but he probably would have said the same thing if he'd ever played it.

"RIME was alright to play, I guess. I prefer manlier activities like sticking my boot / shotgun / chainsaw up a demons butt. No! I'm not crying! Just got some....um... acidic demonic blood in my eye...yeah....stings like a mutha! Pass me a tissue"
The DOOM guy 

"What did I think of RIME? Emotions are for girls......now, pass me a tissue. I got some, er, acidic alien blood in my eye, and it, uh, stings like the mutha-****** of all mutha-******s. I, uh, need to dab it out before the, um, acid eats all the way through my brain. Yeah! That's it. Duke, you crafty fox! Those suckers will never know you were crying. Hey! Wait! Is that thing still recording?"
Duke Nukem

I can't really sum up the plot of RIME too much, because it kind of doesn't have one - at least, not in a conventional sense. You play a boy who wakes up shipwrecked on a mysterious island, that is gradually revealed to be far less normal than it first appears. Despite looking like an ancient place in the mediterranean it has robots, shadowy creatures, strange mechanisms seemingly powered by magic, and an evil giant bird that really doesn't seem to like you very much.

How did you get there? What is going on? What are you meant to be doing? It's one of THOSE games....where what little you get told is 80% visual storytelling, and the other 20% comes from the moody / sombre / melancholy / soaring music. No dialogue. No text. 

The ending isn't too ambiguous as to its meaning, but until then it's just a "feeling" the game gives you whilst the island gets more and more weird. Not weird in a Far Cry 3 drug trip kind of way, yet enough that you'll question how this place came to be, what it's for, and what every activity you're doing in it is all about.

It's a fairly gentle platformer with some mild puzzles, and takes a few hours to finish. I honestly can't make the game play sound anymore exciting than that, because it isn't. If you can't get swept up in the beautiful, simple, music or get hooked by the emotive narrative (such as it is) / sense of discovery, then the relatively sedate action isn't likely to satisfy.

It's not a twitch platformer, or has mind bending conundrums. It's "nice", and will maybe punch you in the feels come the conclusion. I'm not that familiar with games of this type on PC, and the only one that springs to mind would be a dead giveaway as to the ending of RIME if I named it as the two aren't all that dissimilar. It's relatively comparable to the playstation games ICO / Shadow Of The Colossus / The Last Guardian mechanically, and in it's themes of love, loss and regret.

I wouldn't have said it matched the last two for emotional oomph, but it's a moot point if you don't own a playstation, and to be fair to RIME it plays better than any of them. If a long play time is your thing then this may disappoint, as I think it took about 7 hours to finish. Though that's not so short for the type of game that it is, and what's there is really well made. 

The production values are quite high, it's glitch free, and runs fairly well, so I'd recommend it...if it sounds like your "cup of tea", of course. I just can't say what that "cup of tea" exactly is without spoiling it....

If you found this review to be helpful then why not check out my curator page here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/The_dull_games_reviewer

author: {'steamid': '76561198069998768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1551821688}
review:
Es lo más aburrido que he jugado últimamente.
Sin ni quiera una introducción o una voz en off que te ponga en situación, te pasas todo el rato persiguiendo un zorro y gritándole a luces y estatuas.
En ningún momento sabes lo que está pasando ni por qué tienes que seguir avanzando.
Al final me cansé de perseguir al zorro. Invertiré mi tiempo en juegos más interesantes.
No entiendo las puntuaciones de este juego. No lo recomiendo para nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299957024', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1551962332}
review:
本来是我很喜欢的解谜类，但是游戏的体验实在糟糕。

1：之前用rx560d玩全程ppt，最高15帧，换成rx580 2048sp之后虽然能60帧，但还是不流畅

2：很多地方都设计一些看上去似乎有隐藏但实际上进去之后什么都没有的场景

3：已经打完了怪鸟，然而不知道是卡bug了还是迷路了，在走了整整五六分钟的重复重复再重复的走廊之后，把里面的道路探索完，回来时发现路没了，重进也还是在这里面，就这样被困死了（探索了半天还没发现一丁点收藏要素）

这游戏我先撂个差评，删游戏回复一下被喂屎的情绪，等什么时候我突然想把这游戏下下来，重新打通关再改

author: {'steamid': '76561198050884234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1551971146}
review: great mix between Prince of Persia , a bit of Zelda, ICO and  Heart of Darkness. beautiful atlantean architecture reminiscent of some of Abzu , with a similar melancholy of a lost civilisation. chapters names are the stages of loss, which makes it conceptually and gradually from action adventure platformer more  akin to many a walking sim.  gorgeous music, tailored to the scenes . No  battles, just puzzly solutions to combat  .  10/10 . i m an older gamer, which means to me most regular games are "been there done that". i suspect if you are younger and impatient you may find it boring. if you have any doubt though  , please go for it. about 6 or 7 hours of top notch arthouse level indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080166024', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1551382065}
review:
Comunica tanto, senza dire neanche una parola.
Non ci sono dialoghi, non ci sono combattimenti, non c'è una singola riga di testo a spiegarci cosa stia succedendo, ma mi ha commosso come pochi giochi hanno saputo fare.
È un'avventura da vivere, vedere e ascoltare.
La grafica è incantevole, mi è sembrato di essere protagonista di un lungo *film di Miyazaki, complice anche la colonna sonora orchestrale di gran valore.

Solitamente faccio recensioni elencando pro e contro, ma non ho davvero nulla di negativo da dire. Vi consiglio però di prenderlo in sconto, data la sua breve durata.

*sarete testimoni un po' passivi della storia, cosa che accade raramente nei videogiochi. Non c'è nulla di male, una volta tanto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037209138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1551733559}
review:
QUE JOGO INCRÍVEL!!!
Não tinha ideia que a história me proporcionaria uma experiência tão f0da assim. Me arrependo de ter subjugado o jogo por ser indie...os caras são muito bons no que fazem, e me surpreenderam MUITO!

Mesmo tendo alguns contras, se fosse pontuar o game de 0 a 10, minha nota seria 10. Pois fazia tempo que não me sentia assim com um game!!


PROS:
* História. A história é de longe o que tem de melhor nesse jogo...nossa, que história envolvente e dramática. Sem sequer uma fala durante o jogo todo, aos poucos vamos descobrindo e entendendo o que aconteceu. E o desfecho final...meu Deus, que coisa magnífica...um uso do simbolismo espetacular!! Simplesmente magnífica a história!

* Pra mim, a trilha sonora é meio caminho para uma obra ficar incrível, e a trilha desse game é algo digno de premio! Os caras fizeram um ótimo trabalho. Sempre temos um música agradável acompanhando o gameplay, que se encaixa perfeitamente com o estilo (game sem diálogos). Porém, nos momentos ápices da história, a trilha aumenta fazendo com que o drama ganhe força. Demais!!!

* Não tem como não falar dos gráficos desse jogo...que obra de arte!! o Jogo foi muito bem construído...cada detalhe faz parecer que foi pintado a mão de tão belo que é.

* A ambientação do jogo é ótima. Passamos por vários locais diferentes, com estilos e detalhamentos diferentes, praias, florestas, ruínas, porém, sempre da impressão de que estamos no mesmo lugar. Achei isso magnífico!

* O tempo de gameplay é curto, mesmo fazendo os 100%. Mas mesmo assim não acentuo o tempo de jogo como um contra, pois acho que é exatamente o tempo ideal para mostrar tudo o que falei acima. Já diz o ditado, "menos é mais"!




CONTRAS:
* As vezes os comandos são meio lentos pra responder, as vezes não respondem com exatidão;

* Puzzles são relativamente fáceis (apesar de que é bem complicado encontrar todos os colecionáveis);

.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033126384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1551730175}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983671955', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1551616107}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198035292713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1550924088}
review:
Beautiful game with a beautiful story. 

My only quibbles with it are [spoiler] that I hate chasing/keep away elements in games like this which I thought would be just pretty and mellow. The bird was bad enough, but the shadow things chasing you made me stop playing. It's not that it was difficult to get around them, I just didn't enjoy those elements at all. [/spoiler]

[spoiler] And while the ending was gorgeous, I'm also a little tired of games with such interesting worlds and which manage to build such an amazing story without any words end with an 'it was all a dream/hallucination/in world metaphor for loss' thing. I was looking forward to finding out more about the island and what happened to the civilization on it, not for it to end up all just being an elaborate way for the father to get over his grief.[/spoiler] 

That said, I thought it was amazing how they told the story without any words. Exploring the island was wonderful and I loved the soundtrack and visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126147324', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 530, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1551284757}
review:
Nieco nudnawa z banalnymi, niezbyt urozmaiconymi zagadkami gra action-adventure. Podobno wraz z premierą technicznie pozostawała wiele do życzenia, ale na szczęście grę połatali i śmiga na blaszaku elegancko. W grze przede wszystkim bardzo dużo biegamy po mapie odnajdując klucze i inne rzeczy, które otwierają nam dostęp do kolejnych miejsc. Czasami skaczemy sobie po platformach niczym Lara Croft, ale jednak przede wszystkim biegamy i biegamy... 

Ogólnie eksploracja jest nudna i w sumie uboga - mnie odechciało się szukać dodatkowych, nic nie wnoszących znajdziek i skupiłem się tylko na wątku głównym, który przeszedłem w 5 godzin. Na minus jeszcze jest kamera, która wg mnie jest miejscami źle ustawiona. Miałem dać 6, ale podwyższam o jeden punkt ze względu na zakończenie. Wizualnie jest bardzo estetyczna zaś muzyka jest bardzo przyjemna, ale jako całokształt szału jednak nie robi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387826123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1551319759}
review:
I fell in love with the experience, the journey, the essence of what this game entailed, what it showed me and in the end, gave me. 

I was astounded by the games beautiful imagery, music and the great wonder brought by exploration. What was unexpected was the emotional aspect. Making this game a rarity in its own right.

I got this game as part of a bundle and didn’t expect anything of it. But shortly after I started playing I became mesmerized. I loved the puzzles and adore this games essence. Superficially, RIME might seem like a game about simple exploration, but within its depths there is more. I found a story, a story without an uttered word. A silent movie if you will. It was a story fueled with wonder, discovery, love and loss. 

This game is a true experience. It’s creators should feel proud about giving it a soul, and in its silence, a voice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361821357', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1607487189}
review: to be honest it's hard to put into words how good this game is, but the bottom line is that it has an incredibly powerful and moving story without a single line of dialouge, it has beautiful music and environments, and while this won't be what you're looking for if you only care about gameplay, the ending left me speechless and I would reccomend this game to anyone who cares about the story in games even a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098920433', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1503422033}
review:
开始没有报太高期待，以为又是个仿journey的游戏。  
结果意外地还不错，流程不长，解密难度也还好，不算太高。 （应该说比较适合我这种智商的..哈哈） 
画面并没有很惊艳，但也算舒服。故事也是似懂非懂的那种。结局不知道是该喜还是该悲。
蛮合格的休闲游戏吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995962613', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1551122403}
review:
Je crois que je suis complètement passé à côté d'un jeu pourtant globalement bien noté et bien aimé à priori.

Mais moi je me suis vraiment emmerdé. Je l'ai trouvé vain. On fait des trucs. On va dans une direction parce que le renard qui aboie va par là. On passe son temps à escalader juste parce qu'on voit qu'il y a des zones dans lesquelles on peut, donc c'est sûrement que ça doit être utile.... Les énigmes sont là juste pour faire faire quelque chose au joueur.... Tout m'a semblé très artificiel d'un point de vue gameplay...

Au final c'est un grand couloir. Aucune liberté d'action, on suit un chemin tout tracé... Mais j'ai quand même dû regarder deux trois fois sur le net pour des énigmes dans lesquelles j'avais pas remarqué tel élément, ou parce que j'avais pas vu tel truc sur lequel je pouvais grimper. 

Alors au départ c'est plaisant, les décors sont enchanteurs, la direction artistique maîtrisée, la musique nous plonge aussi dedans.... Mais arrivé à l'avant dernier "monde" (les grottes avec des arbres), j'ai trouvé ça vraiment pénible.... Je ne comprenais pas la finalité de mes actions en fait.... J'ai insisté juste parce que je savais la fin proche et que je voulais savoir ce qu'il en était...

Et le final.... C'est censé être bim boum les émotions dans ta face, le bon gros "ah d'accord bon c'est donc ça!", pour moi ça a juste fait "ah bah ok, c'est cool".... C'est vraiment tout ça pour ça.... Le jeu se veut très narratif et profond dans sa signification, mais on a passé tout le jeu à pousser des cubes et à escalader des murs, je trouve ça vraiment contradictoire.....
Même la musique a fini par me saouler avec ses thèmes à la fois larmoyants et grandiloquents...

Et d'un point de vue technique le jeu est vraiment optimisé avec les pieds, se mettant à saccader régulièrement dans des zones où pourtant y'a pas tant de choses à afficher.

Brothers a tale of two sons, par exemple, m'a vraiment plus ému dans la catégorie "jeu avec une fin inattendue et pleine d'émotion" parce que tout le jeu est logique. On suit la quête de deux gamins qui veulent sauver leur pêre, donc toutes nos actions ont une signification....

C'est con parce que j'avais vraiment envie de l'aimer à la base, j'étais parti avec de très bons à priori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173800185', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1559395914}
review:
第二のThe Witnessを求めて買ったが、全く違うゲームだった。
このゲームは雰囲気7割クライミング2割パズル1割のゲームです。

追記
最後までプレイしたので感想。
このゲームは、難破して無人島に漂着した主人公が、父と別れてしまったショックから、何の罪もない鳥に何度も雷を打ち付けて虐殺し、部屋に閉じ込められた無抵抗の闇の国の住人を、ナチスのガス室の如く、光を照射することでまとめて惨殺し、ついには気が狂ってロボットのことを友達だと思い始め、最終的に✟闇落ち✟し、闇落ちパワーで時間を巻き戻す話でした(適当)

雰囲気ゲーで10時間近くかかるのは、かなり長いと言わざるを得ない。
映画なら一本見て2時間、短い小説なら一冊読んで4時間、アニメだって一クール見ても6時間しかかからない。それなのに、それらより明らかに内容が薄いゲームを10時間もプレイすれば、飽きないはずがない。
もっとテンポが良ければお勧めしてたと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141775948', 'num_games_owned': 1709, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1550835636}
review:
そこそこ広めなパズルアドベンチャーゲーム。
文字や会話などは一切なし。パズルは優しめで高所に登ったりジャンプして渡ったりする要素もあるがそれも簡単。
転落して死んでもすぐ近くからリトライできる安心設計。
収集要素が多めで分かりづらいのがいくつかある。クリア後にチャプターセレクトはできるが1章が長いのに章の最初からしか選択ができない点が惜しい。
最初は意味不明だが、進むにつれて明らかになっていくストーリー。ラストの展開は良かった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198325804575', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1639312660}

我属于手残 ，喜欢 美 视觉 或视听盛宴 这种，虽然半年过去了，有点记不清这个游戏了，但我还是认为属于我这类型的应该会喜欢这游戏。
