author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1550634278}
review:
[h1]Simply Beautiful[/h1]

Rime is an adventure game with puzzle elements from Tequila Softworks. I picked it up for $3 and went in with fairly low expectations due to the mix of positive and negative reviews on the store page. I actually ended up being pleasantly surprised! Rime is a beautiful game that tells a story in an interesting way, and it does it with relatively few frustrations. 

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
[list][*]Rime really is beautiful, I love the aesthetic here and it remains pretty consistent throughout the game. The first three chapters are particularly beautiful, with the fourth being quite haunting. There were a couple of textures that looked a bit rough to me, but really good overall. I also think that all of the creatures in the game are really well designed.

[*]One thing I was quite pleased with was that the puzzles were quite straightforward. There were definitely a couple of puzzles that had me stumped for a minute or two, but for the most part I found them easy to figure out. Now, not everyone will think that’s a good thing, but personally I think Rime is much more of an adventure game than it is a puzzle game. The puzzles are certainly fun, but the real meat is exploring the world Tequila created and piecing together the story. I don’t think Rime would work as well as it does if less-experienced puzzle players were constantly forced to check guides/walkthroughs to figure out how to carry on.

[*]One thing you might need a guide for though, is the collectibles. I think there are four types of collectibles in the game, but there may be others that I just never saw. Seemingly they’re tied to most of the game’s achievements, as beating the game only got me 8/31. I’m usually not interested in collectibles, but I am actually interested in going back through to try and get some/all of them, which is a rarity in games. I think it adds some good replayability, especially if you’re a die-hard achievement hunter.

[*]There are some dangers in Rime, I won’t go into detail about what the dangers are lest I spoil the game, but I was glad to see a little danger thrown in, just to add some tension to the game. Though even with the tension in some parts, Rime is still a pretty relaxing game and I really enjoyed just sitting back and playing through it, it’s a good experience.

[*]I think the story is quite good, there’s some mystery that kind of strings you along through the game, and then once you see the ending of the game the story of the whole game is revealed to you. I don’t want to say too much more than that, so I don’t spoil it, but I felt satisfied by the ending. I think a second playthrough is probably required to make sense of everything though, as there are a couple of things I’m left confused by.[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
[list][*]One thing that I noticed other reviews picking up on is the climbing mechanics in the game, with that being mentioned in some of the negative reviews. I don’t really understand why this was an issue for some people, because while it wasn’t quite as interesting as something like Grow Home, it felt like it worked similarly to an Assassins Creed or Tomb Raider game to me (just with a little less animation). This is an adventure game rather than a climbing-focused game after all, so I think what’s there is about as good as I would expect it to be.[/list]

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
[list][*]My biggest disappointment with Rime was that it doesn’t have a photo mode. This game is beautiful, and it’s exactly the kind of game that a photo mode would work really well for. I get that this probably isn’t a huge issue for everyone, but I was definitely disappointed by it.

[*]Performance wasn’t quite as good as I expected, I had to turn the settings down a fair bit more than I would have liked and even then, it wasn’t running great. The visuals are great, but the game is simplistic and it’s not like it’s photo-realistic, I expected it to be easier to run. Probably not an issue for people with beefy rigs, but if you’re on a mid-range gaming laptop or PC like I am, it might be worth keeping in mind.

[*]There was a little too much underwater stuff for my liking. Rime really doesn’t look anywhere near as nice or play as well during the underwater sections, and while I really enjoyed the rest of the game, I could not wait for the underwater sections to be over with.[/list]

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]

I ended up enjoying Rime a lot more than I expected. It's a relaxing journey through some beautiful places, but don't come here looking for a challenge. It's worth playing through at least once. However, I don’t think there’s anything here that makes this game worth $30, I’d wait for it to be $15 or less.

If you found this review helpful, please check out my other reviews over at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33633486/]Kemo's Corner.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198154854885', 'num_games_owned': 1132, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1550516177}
review:
[h1]RiME: más allá de las palabras[/h1]
[u]Reseña Spoiler-free[/u]

Si tuviera que describir este juego con una sola palabra sería [b]hermoso[/b]. Todos los detalles visuales están cuidadísimos, desde lo que ves hasta lo que oyes (con una maravillosa canción de Lindsey Sterling, no te digo más). El cielo, el agua de lluvia cayendo sobre la piedra, el día y la noche... No te vas a cansar de observar todo tu entorno; y es que de eso va precisamente el siguiente punto, de buscar coleccionables. Si de algo se ha preocupado Tequila Works es de que tengas que andar rebuscando en cada esquina y cada saliente en busca de un sinfín de coleccionables diferentes: conchas, cerraduras, trajes...

La historia es maravillosa y, en pos de no hacer ningún tipo de spoiler, me limitaré a decir que deberías jugarlo sin ver nada: ni gameplays, ni walktroughs, ni siquiera guías por escrito.

E hilando con el tema de las guías, he de decir que mi mayor pega para con este juego es que la dificultad es [i]nula[/i]: los "puzzles" son demasiado fáciles, el plataformeo es para niños pequeños (con los bordes CONVENIENTEMENTE cagados por palomas) y el mapa es muy lineal. La única dificultad real del juego son, como ya he mencionado antes, los coleccionables y los [b]logros[/b]. Cazadores de logros: estáis jodidos sin una guía.

[h1]En resúmen[/h1]
[list]
    [*]El juego es, visualmente una pasada, una historia profunda y cautivadora.
    [*]No necesitas tener el cerebro 100% conectado, con un par de neuronas te será suficiente para pasártelo.
    [*]Cuenta con una rejugabilidad artificial en forma de coleccionables y logros; de hecho, es imposible conseguir el 100% en una sola partida :)
[/list]
[b]¿Recomiendo el juego? ABSOLUTAMENTE.[/b]

Heyyy, gracias por leer toda la reseña. Si te ha parecido interesante, te animo a que le des a útil/gracioso para que más gente pueda leerla y decidirse por este juego tan chulo :3 ¡Gracias otra vez!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073852396', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1550245675}
review:
Миленько, сказочно, с твистом в конце (который я специально посмотрел на ютубе перед написанием обзора), красиво прям до невозможности, но... Невыносимо занудный геймплей, ну прям очень! Вообразите себе, будто шесть часов вы играете только в занудный кусок анчартеда, где надо лишь бегать по локации, решать простенькие задачки и то и дело "бэктречить" туда-сюда, периодически карабкаясь. Скорость передвижения слишком тягомотная для такого размера локаций, загадки в духе "найди фигню, чтобы на неё крикнуть и включить" уже в первые 10 минут на первой же локации наскучивают (возможно, дальше будет лучше, но я не вытерплю, извините!), плюс попутно ничего не происходит Ну, как ничего - вон, кабанчики, вон лиса лает, задолбала уже, но я именно про какое-то развитие истории. Она развивается, конечно, но лишь по чуть-чуть, поэтапно, а между переходами - ничего. 

Вообще эту игру принято сравнивать с Journey по своей сути - тут я согласен, но! В Journey была достаточно высокая скорость передвижения с интересными моментами скольжения, благодаря чему это самое движение не надоедало до самого конца. И о конце - Journey не в пример короче, у неё почти идеальная продолжительность для такого типа игр. Здесь же я не готов терпеть ради концовки шесть часов этого занудного скитания по локациям. Большинство хороших симуляторов ходьбы делают это менее занудно, ну и продолжительность у них, как правило, соответствующая.
Так что, пожалуй, нет.
Если у меня будет супер-особое настроение для такого типа игр - возможно, я и развалюсь с геймпадом на диване, неспешно бегая по этим симпатичным локациям под приятную музычку, но сейчас это скорее наскучивает, чем расслабляет, ну прямо до зевоты!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004845691', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1550001129}
review: Фантастическое приключение в компании любопытного мальчугана и непоседливой лисы - проводника сквозь странный мир, зыбкий как сон и в то же время затягивающий все глубже и глубже в свое чрево. С золотистого пляжа в подводный чертог, сквозь тающий в объятиях джунглей город в юдоль скорби и отчаяния. Будет много вопросов, загадок, стильных отсылок и цитирования классики (Shadow of the Colossus, Last Guardian). Будет медитативный геймлпей и ожидание "ага, а теперь точно будет вот так!", будет виолончель и альт, будет осознание, переходящее в тоску понимания. Все будет...Если решитесь запустить RIME точно не пожалеете)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025247073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1550099218}
review:
Before getting to my review, I just want to mention that this is one of those games are generally run horribly no matter your hardware. Some people don't have issues, but maaaany do. Including me, my PC is more than powerful enough to max out Witcher 3 at max settings, but can barely run this game at 50fps on lowest. 1080p

Anyway, still giving this game a great review, mainly because this game pulls at the heart strings super hard for me. Great story, great gameplay (however the climbing can feel a bit sluggish at times) and the games not too long nor short. Depending on your puzzle solving skills. Might not be worth 40 CAD, but if you get this on a sale, definitely pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990455763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1550087662}
review:
Do you remember in 2005 when the rock climbing in Shadow of the Colossus felt awesome? Do you remember in 1998 when the puzzles in Ocarina of Time felt complex?

If you do, you'll only think of how much they can be watered down, when playing RiME.

Nice scenery to romp through the trivial puzzles and lackluster controls though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198368306652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1550158254}
review:
Rime es uno de esos juegos en los que lo importante es el viaje que haces junto al protagonista y que al menos a mí, me ha llegado, lagrimilla al final incluida.

Gráficamente me recuerda a algunos de los últimos Zeldas y como juego, no he podido dejar de pensar en otros ejemplos en los que también se realizaba un viaje maravilloso.... Quizás el más obvio sea ICO, pero también me acordé mucho de juegos como Journey, Abzú y sobre todo "Brothers, a tale of two sons" (Al que en lo emocional creo que es el más similar).

En el apartado técnico/artístico el juego me parece estupendo, con un diseño gráfico muy bueno y sobre todo con un apartado musical brutal, acompañando y contando parte de la historia con pequeñas pistas y matices muy sutiles pero excelentes.
La verdad es que para ser un juego desarrollado por un equipo pequeño (no lo aparenta) me parece más que sobresaliente. Ya me sorprendió en su día Tequila Works con su Deadlight y la verdad es que me intriga mucho su Sexy Brutale (que lo tengo en mi biblioteca).

En definitiva, recomendadísimo, es un viaje que guardaré durante mucho tiempo en mi recuerdo y espero que comercialmente resulte rentable para que la gente de Tequila pueda seguir haciendo juegos así.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071915150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1551118180}
review:
RiME - A tale to remember

TL/DR: I think this game is excellent [i] IF [/i] you are a story motivated player.

At first glance, RiME seems to be a fairly simple and cute puzzle game. But throughout the first region, the game starts to feed you small pieces of information, just enough to hint at something more. 
And boy was there more, and it was  a feel train.

Its hard to truly convey what made the story good without spoiling it. So just trust me, its good.

RiME is an artistic masterpiece. Each individual level has distinct moods. (That later have more important meaning)
These moods are represented through fantastic choices in colour, lighting, weather and the soundtrack. When you finish the game, and understand the story, the levels feel so much better designed now that you know what they are meant to be. 

The puzzles may have been simple, but I felt like the increase of complexity was smooth. It introduced the new concepts fast enough to keep the simple game play from stagnating. 
It is NOT like other puzzle games like "Portal" where you might spend ages in a single room. I feel it was purposely made the way it was so it did not subtract from the flow of the story.

[b] If you are after a difficult puzzle platformer, this game isn't for you. [/b]

[b] If you are after an unique approach to story telling, I honestly couldn't recommend this more. [/b]

I suggest sitting down and dedicating an entire session to knock this out in one sitting. Its on the short side so it shouldn't be to hard.

With that all said, I wouldn't spend $40USD on it. Wait for a sale to slam this artwork down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968804401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1549919875}
review:
Rime ist ganz klar eine besondere Perle und für mich eines der bewegensten Spiele. Es erzählt von einem Jungen, der am Strand einer misteriösen Insel erwacht und sich aufmacht, diese zu erkunden. Im Laufe des Spiels durchquert er verschiedene Gebiete, die alle für sich äußerst unterschiedlich und abwechslungreich sind. Die Grafik und das Design sind wunderschön anzusehen und laden zusammen mit einem grandiosen Soundtrack zum träumen ein. Langsam entfaltet sich dabei das wahre Schicksal des Jungen. Rime kommt beim Erzählen seiner Geschichte ganz ohne Worte aus. Und das ist wahrscheinlich dessen große Stärke. Wer sich auf das Spiel einlässt, den nimmt es mit auf eine fantastische Reise mit einem besonderem Ausgang, der mich emotional tief berührte. Auf dem Weg muss der Spieler verschiedene Rätsel lösen, die jedoch nicht allzu komplex daherkommen. Aber Rime ist kein klassisches Puzzle-Abenteuer, sondern Punktet vor allem durch seine Erzählweise. Die Rätsel sind darum eher als Teil der Erzählung zu sehen, statt als Herausforderung.

Negativ aufgefallen war mir einzig die schlechte Performance. Oft litt das Spiel unter starken Framerate-Einbrüchen, welche die sonst sehr schöne Spielerfahrung beeinträchtigten. Hier hätten die Entwickler etwas mehr Zeit in eine bessere PC-Otpimierung investieren sollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317566360', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1550583625}
review:
比预期要好的游戏。
解密难度不大，基本一路下来都很顺畅，流程大概是5个小时。一直很喜欢这种画风/风格的游戏，完成度挺高，整个游戏下来也就遇到一个bug，某一次从高处跳下来卡到地图外面了。
优化感觉不是很好，某些场景总是卡卡的。
配乐给满分，每次都能恰到好处的烘托情感。
有些长镜头的转换真的很厉害。
比起游戏，感觉更像是一部电影。
最后，建议玩的时候，去游戏设置里把伽马值或者亮度调高一点，不然一些比较暗的场景根本走不出去。

author: {'steamid': '76561198351519653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1547461673}
review:
本评测首发于[url=https://steamcn.com/t462213-1-1]steamcn[/url]


[h1] 序言	[/h1]
   《霜华》首次亮相于2013年的科隆游戏展览会，在展览会上，一则两分钟的预告片便让它带动了在场大部分人的心。如梦中仙境一般美妙的景色，悠扬又牵动人心的音乐，很难不让人想到《ICO》《风之旅人》等游戏。那时的《霜华》顶着PS4独占的名号，且PS4正是风头正劲的时刻，每个人都想早点玩到这款游戏。

https://www.bilibili.com/video/av746525


   不得不说事物总是充满戏剧性，你越想它，它反而离你越远。

   2016年，已经沉寂了一年半载的开发商Tequila Works宣布，他们将从索尼那边取回游戏的所有权，取消PS4独占，独立完成剩余的开发工作。这一系列操作着实让人感到迷惑，在此之间传出的一些有关开发进度的传言更是让人由粉转黑，质疑跟责难接踵而至，而开发完成的日期更是遥遥无期。

  直到2017年5月，该游戏才正式上架。游戏一经上架，便引起了广泛关注，各方媒体纷纷打出评价，其具体评价就不在此多言，等到总结再说。




[h1] 平平无奇的故事[/h1]



此平平无奇非彼“平平无奇”， 该游戏是一款解密探索类游戏，玩家扮演一位在大海上因为风暴而流落岛上的少年。在一只红色小狐狸的引导下在岛上解密探索的游戏，但随着探索步步前进，事实似乎并非所想象的那样。


游戏全篇从头到尾没有任何有关于剧情的文字提示，游戏玩家想要了解剧情，除了从过场动画能够了解一部分以外，剩下的只能从游戏中的壁画，或者收集物品等方式来了解。这是一种较为隐晦的叙事方法，这种叙事方法的好处在于，只要你把东西收集齐全，把壁画和解谜了解透彻，那么，你的感情会随着其中不断升华，直到结局得到释放。坏处在于，你只要没有把收集物品收集齐全，或者在游玩途中并不是很认真，你就会觉得，整个剧情毫无波澜，平平淡淡，甚至会让你感到有些无聊。

这并不是说玩家有错，而是这种叙事方法本身带来的效果。如果其采用完善的文字说明辅以过场剧情，即使玩家对此本无兴趣，也会了解一二，特别是这种本身不是以玩法为主要
目的的游戏，故事剧情就显得弥足珍贵。而采用这种方法来让玩家了解剧情，如果制作者功力不足，就会让玩家陷入两难境界，玩家知道玩到最后也许会出现反转，剧情或许会得到升华，但与此同时，玩家必须忍受其中平淡的过程，甚至在玩法上也没有什么特别的新奇之处，这就会劝退一大波玩家。


如果想要具体了解剧情，可观看以下部分，以下部分涉及剧透：

游戏的章节一共分为五个部分，而游戏的剧情也可以以此划分，分别是：Denial(否认) ,Anger(愤怒),Bargaining(顽抗)，Depression(沮丧),Acceptance(接受)。

游戏在最开始就可以看到小男孩在孤岛的沙滩上苏醒，苏醒的地方仿佛世外桃源，高大的白塔，清澈的溪流，憨态可掬的小动物，这里的一切都让人让人乐不思蜀，不想离去。这代表着Denial(否认)，表示想要否认某些东西，想要把某些不愉快的事情完全忘怀，沉浸于这个世外桃园之中。

即使再美好的景色也会看腻，随着游戏进度的推进，小男孩将会遇见一只巨大的怪鸟，这只怪鸟仿佛跟小男孩有着什么杀父之仇，夺妻之恨一般（不就偷拿了一个球嘛，至于吗，又不是真的蛋）只要小男孩暴露于阳光之下，不到十秒，这只怪鸟就会从天边飞来叼走小男孩，随出随到。想要通过地表，就必须通过游戏中的一些场景制造遮阴处，躲避怪鸟。这只怪鸟代表了Anger(愤怒)，无处不在的怪鸟代表了无法抑制的愤怒。

到了第三章，游戏已经来到中期，小男孩会不断遇到一些无限循环的场景，除非通过特定的方法找到出路，否则将会迷失于其中，无法自拔。在这寻找出路的同时，小男孩也会发现一些机器人残骸，并通过一些能量球复活了其中之一，并通过其开路。但好景不长，这个机器人最终还是因为能量不足而倒下，倒下同时也投映出部分曾经与小男孩共度过的时光。之后小男孩用另外一个在大树中的能量核心真正复活了另外一个机器人，并唤醒了一大堆的机器人，剧情由此走向第四章。这一章节的主题是Bargaining(顽抗)，表示仍然不相信现实，想要与现实作斗争。

紧接着下来的这一章节，可以看得出来，氛围跟前几章节完全不同，天空中被乌云笼罩，天上下着磅礴大雨，四周被黑暗笼罩，就连小男孩别具特色的哼唱也变成了啜泣。空气中的一切都透露着阴暗，让人感到绝望，沮丧。在这一章节，小男孩的机器人朋友先是成为了开门的钥匙，为小男孩打开最后的大门，紧接着，一路陪伴着小男孩的小狐狸也为了点亮雕像耗尽了最后一丝力量，化为花瓣，随暴风暴雨飘逝。这一切的一切都让小男孩感到无比悲伤，但他还是继续前进，结果在一股神秘力量的侵蚀下变成了雕像。Depression(沮丧)正是这一章节的主题，也是时候面对现实了。

最后一章节画面一转，详细讲述了那个暴风暴雨的夜晚，海上到底发生了些什么。原来最开始被冲进海里的并不是小男孩最开始所想的神秘人，而是他自己。小男孩早已逝去，而这一切的一切，仅仅只是一名痛失爱子的父亲，在绝望中不想面对现实，对现实感到愤懑，想要对抗儿子已逝的现实，但又沮丧地发现，事情早已不可挽回，只能无奈接受这个现实。游戏中的重要物品以钥匙的形式呈现，收集钥匙，解开谜题，也是解开父亲的心结，让这位沉浸于悲伤无法自拔的老父亲，重新面对现实，打开儿子曾经生活过的房间，与之告别。









[h1] 毁誉参半的景色	[/h1]

当我打开这个游戏，见到这个游戏的第一眼，我就被这个游戏所描述的画面吸引住了。清可见底的海水带着点波纹，拍打在沙滩上，沙滩中央出现了游戏Logo，这一高大上的画面顿时将我的注意力完全集中在了这个尚未怎么接触过的游戏上，让我产生了一种期待，游戏的Logo这么美，那游戏里面的风景呢？

最开始，游戏的景色完全没有带来一点失望，甚至可以说，超乎我的预料，毕竟游戏并不是什么3A大作，但它的表现很出色。大海中的孤岛，晶莹透亮的溪流，憨态可掬的小动物，高大的白色建筑，远处的白塔，海中的水母，给我留下了近乎完美的映象。在游戏的最开始，仅仅只是浏览观光风景，跟周围动物互动，探索地图等，就花了我一个多小时的时间。刚刚进入这个奇妙世界的我，差点就被晃花了眼。

剧透：[spoiler] 
在第一章的游戏中有一幕场景非常令人难以忘怀，正是这幕让我坚定了要玩到结局的想法。在那个场景中，触动机关之后，三个蓝色巨型水晶球之间相互呼应，由上至下的视角可以完整地观赏到整个场景，其中的美色难以用言语表达。但在这个美丽场景的背后，却是无尽的悲伤，由下面这个图可以看出，小男孩一家有一名重要成员永远地离开了他们（猜测应该就是小男孩的母亲）。而在水池下方有个隐藏场景（我也是无意中跳进去发现的），到达此处可以解锁一个隐藏成就，由成就Funeral flowers的解释find a nice resting place也可以得知这应该就是小男孩母亲的安息之地。

然而（没错，只要是这种开头肯定有然而），到了第二章画面的表现能力直线下降，画面由原来的鲜艳明亮，色彩鲜明变得颜色单一，灰暗，乌漆嘛黑的场景越来越多。虽然是由地上转到地下，难免变黑，但这种程度的画面实在说不上有多好看，看多了眼睛都不好受。这前后差别之大，不得不让人想到它的经费问题，看来从索尼脱离，自主开发的确对他们有着不小的影响。好在在后面几章，画面的表现能力重新上线，无论是第四章的大雨磅礴给人带来的沉重压抑，还是第五章释然后的平淡，画面都张弛有度，给人一种恰到好处的感觉。	[/spoiler]

说到画面，本作另一个要点就不得不提，那就是掉帧问题。游戏在发售之初就有着掉帧问题，该问题似乎主要是由于D加密导致的,在后来似乎已经解除了。不过在我玩这个游戏的时候，仍然能感受到时不时的卡顿或掉帧，在各种画面设置中，以抗锯齿最能影响掉帧。最为奇特的是，我把画面特效调到最高，流畅程度反而比中低特效好上不少。我的电脑配置是2600x+rx588，似乎游戏对A卡的优化较差，导致我仍然不能流畅玩耍。我玩这个游戏经常就是玩一个小时左右，就得停下来，不然掉帧带来的晕3D导致的强烈眩晕会让我毫无游戏体验，这也是我为啥玩了二十多个小时的原因之一。



[h1] 恰到好处的背景音乐[/h1]
    
    
好的背景音乐在我看来，不一定需要时时刻刻在玩家耳边刷存在感，而是在恰到好处的地方，给人带来惊喜，这样给人带来的震撼感才会更强。如果只是一直在玩家耳边循环播放，那再好听的音乐也只会泯然众人，甚至因为玩家通关不顺导致心情不好等原因，觉得该背景音乐刺耳难听，就跟苍蝇嗡嗡嗡一般（本人因手残深有体会）。而《霜华》并没有这种缺憾，相较游戏的其他方面来说，背景音乐可以说是《霜华》做得最好的一方面了。


游戏的背景音乐可以说是非常贴近背景，林间的静谧，瀑布的喧哗，地下的幽静，都表现得淋漓尽致。特别是谜题解开过后，恢弘壮阔的景色配合恰到好处的背景音乐，让玩家体验更上一层楼。



[h1]并无新意的玩法[/h1]


游戏主要玩法是以在不同的障碍之间跳跃，收集钥匙解开钥匙孔，以及推动方块或移动柱子的视角等方法解谜。大部分游戏中的谜题都很简单，只要找到具体的物品，很容易就能解开，问题在于找到具体的物品。有时候找了半天可能都找不出东西在哪里，这时候你可以放下游戏，去做别的事情，过了一会之后，再回来寻找，可能一下子就能找出物品的所在之地（个人经验），因为东西所在位置并不难找，找不到原因大都是因为陷入思维误区，一直较真只会徒增烦恼。

由于谜题大都比较简单，而有难度的地方就放在了收集物品方面，游戏的收集物品非常之多，而且往往都在一些较为偏僻的角落，所以想要在第一周目就完全收集基本没什么可能，除非看攻略。不过在第一周目并不推荐直接查看攻略，本身游戏剧情存在感就较为薄弱，如果再加上剧透buff，那基本就可以跟游戏剧情说再见了。而且，当你通关一次剧情之后，再回头收集这些物品，你会发现，很多原来较为隐晦的东西都会完整地展现在你眼前。 








  [h1] 总结	[/h1]

    I didn’t hate Rime. I didn’t love Rime. I played Rime for a while, then later, it ended.


游戏在媒体上的评价两极分化严重，部分媒体打出的分数达到了佳作水平，而Gamespot和IGN分别只打出了6分和6.5分，仅仅在及格边缘。


这种现象产生的原因跟游戏的表现手法与优化密切相关，喜欢这种表现手法的游戏玩家爱它爱的要死，而对这种表现手法不感冒的玩家则完全无感，这说不上好与坏，只能说明这款游戏的受众较小。

在我看来，这款游戏可以在7分左右，如果喜欢风景宜人，有着足够耐心并且能够适应隐晦的表现手法的玩家可以推荐一玩，这绝对是你不容错过的游戏！游戏多次进包，大概10块左右就能收到，算是性价比非常高了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100039957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1549851570}
review: Others have complained about the controls and the slow movement speed and that is true however I feel it was done on purpose. A forced slowing and in-expertise in movement. Especially look when the boy is running in water and he lifts his feet high then stomps down with more emphasis on splashing than moving forward (like every 7 year old). This is meant to be an emotional experience where you aren't told the destination but slowly you sense where you are being led.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158429750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1549813000}
review:
웰메이드 감성,어드벤처 게임.

툼레이더의 액션보다는 유적탐사에 재미가 있었던분들, 분위기있는 판타지게임을 좋아하셨던 분들에게 추천합니다.
엄밀히 따지면 힐링게임도 아니고 퍼즐게임이라고 하기에도 애매합니다.

딱 퍼즐수준이 툼레이더 유적길찾기 수준.. 길찾기는 게임을 많이 해보셨던 유저라면 꽤 잘 찾아갈수있을거라 생각합니다.
여우가 길유도를 한다거나 어떤 오브젝트로 힌트를 준다거나 하는 식입니다. 요즘 친절한 내비게임에 익숙해졌다면.. 살짝 불편한정도?

스토리보다는 분위기, 특히 사운드가 죽여줍니다. 이 게임에 절반은 사운드가 먹고들어가는정도.. 살짝 루즈해질려하면 오리엔탈풍의 아름답거나 환상적인 음악으로 게임에 몰입하게끔 만듭니다.

스팀평가보면 최적화 문제 이야기가 많은데, 초창기 데누보가 있었을때의 문제고 지금은 깨끗하게 작동합니다.
이 게임 사기만 하고 플레이 안하신 스팀친구분들 많으신데 한번씩 플레이하셔서 눈호강과 귀호강, 끝에가서는 차오르는 감성도 느껴보셨으면 좋겠습니다.

플레이타임은 6시간정도. 챕터를 하나씩 깰때마다 메인메뉴 아트가 변한다는건 팁아닌팁

author: {'steamid': '76561198027982199', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1549738657}
review:
While I really liked the story that unfolded before me, the mechanical downsides leave much to be desired.

RiME is a puzzle/platformer where you travel a mysterious island, learning more about your character as you progress.  Unfortunately, the game is extremely short and I completed it in about 5 hours.  Sure there are collectibles to gather, but considering your character's movement speed, it does not seem like a fun thing to do, even if the lore interests me.  I feel that if my character was able to move even a little faster I would have shaved off a lot of my playtime, but of course, that would break some of the puzzles.  Granted, there are positives about the gameplay, I never had to worry about falling off of ledges or about my jumps being too small, the game will appropriately snap you in place to where you need to jump everytime.

As for the graphics, I really like the art style, however, I feel like there were some optimization issues as I would get consistent framerate drops and some of the shadows would glitch in and out.  There's only one area in the game where I hit a solid, consistent 60fps and it was in one of the prettiest areas near the end of the game, but unfortunately it did not last long.  

This game is more like an interactive story, so if that's your thing, go ahead and get it, but I strongly stress that this is not worth the $30 price tag for only 5 hours of core gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190537711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1549685051}
review:
아름다운 음악과 훌륭한 그래픽이 매력적인 게임입니다. 하지만 지루하다고 느낄분도 있으실것 같네요. 누군가에게 추천하라고 하면 망설일 것이 분명하지만 그래도 저에게는 꽤나 인상깊은 게임이었습니다. 

평가에 게임이 끝난 후 스테이지 선택화면에 들어가보라는 말이 있어 스테이지 선택화면에 들어가보고 나서야 이 게임의 진정한 의미를 깨달았네요. 이 게임이 하고싶은 말은 바로 스테이지 제목 순서와 일치합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091075885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2739, 'last_played': 1549505649}
review:
A lot of running/jumping/climbing just for the sake of it.. the game would take you through room after room after room where you literally just have to jump and climb a little to get through (these rooms probably had collectibles in, I don't know since it was such a chore to get around that I didn't feel like exploring). Easy puzzles. Can't go wrong, just follow the path - never felt the need to save the game. Controls slow, unintuitive and sometimes a guessing game - frustrating!

I'm an explorer. I will explore for days. I will make spreadsheets, maps, lists and notes. Absolutely love exploring. After an hour into Rime I just wanted to solve the puzzles, after 3 I wanted to quit, after 4 I got some wine and doggedly pressed on until the end (which was sad, but had very little to do with the rest of the game).

I would call this is a charming walking simulator. Great soundtrack.

review:
Ein wunderschönes Spiel um einfach mal vom Alltagsstress zu entkommen. 
Da keine Dialoge gehalten werden, ist der Spielraum für eingene Interpretation der Story sehr gross. Dies habe ich sehr geschätzt. Umso wichtiger war die Musik, diese hat das alles wunderbar umhüllt. 
Das Spiel verleidet auch nicht bei mehrmaligem zocken. Jedoch werde ich das nächste Mal zum Kontroller greifen, da an manchen Stellen die Steuerung mit Maus und Tastatur nicht ganz ausgereift ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997159902', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1549293051}
review:
I tried very hard to like this game, but it felt as if it fought back against me every step of the way. On its surface, this game is extremely charming, the environments are stunning, and the soundtrack is truly exquisite. But the game itself -- the interaction between player and system is fundamentally unsatisfying -- from the way the character controls down to the puzzles or challenges the game presents to you. 

Your character's movement and animations feel so slow and labored that getting from one point to another in the game genuinely just got bothersome. Even the camera moves at an painfully sluggish pace -- when you're in control, that is. Because Rime loves to fix the camera to a certain point, and then it becomes a guessing game of which direction your character will move in in response to your inputs. While I started out wanting to explore the fantastic-looking world of Rime, by my second or third hour I just wanted to mainline it. By my fourth hour I just wanted to quit. 

There is barely anything to the puzzles you're asked to solve. Zero thinking required. You see something, it clicks immediately, because you've either done this in another game already or it's just that dead obvious, and then you just execute. Next. Where is the payoff, I wonder?

I think that that's the biggest problem with Rime. It fails to stimulate the player at any possible level -- not emotionally, not intellectually, and not kinesthetically (through controlling the character). Even the world loses its shine when you dread simply getting around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007029683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1676143354}

author: {'steamid': '76561198200396482', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1577816012}
review:
Resumen: una obra de arte con todas las letras.

RiME es una historia que si no te atrapa con el primer frame de sus gráficos, sin duda lo hará con la primera nota de su banda sonora. Con una calidad espectacular y cuidado hasta el más mínimo detalle, RiME es un título que no te dejará indiferente. Dedicáte a explorarlo con calma, porque no hay ni una piedra colocada ahí por casualidad, cada paso que des tiene su objetivo (ya sea encontrar algún coleccionable, que los tiene a patadas) y cuando llegas al final todo cobra sentido.

Hay gente que se queja de que es corto, y es cierto que 35€ es algo caro, pero si lo compras en rebajas sí que compensa, sobre todo si te das el tiempo suficiente para saborearlo, en lugar de avanzar y avanzar lo más rápido posible.

Es cierto que en cuanto a optimización no es lo mejor del mundo, tiene zonas en las que hay tantísimos detalles que los fps tienen que luchar por mantenerse estables, pero si tienes un ordenador decente podrás jugarlo sin problema la mayor parte del tiempo.

Historia: 9/10
Gráficos: 10/10
Banda sonora: 10/10
Jugabilidad: 8/10
Duración: 8/10

Global: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1548857903}
review:
I bought Rime thinking it was a puzzle-platformer, which is superficially true, but boy was I in for a (pleasant) surprise. Yes, Rime does all the stuff that puzzle-platformers do: you explore various worlds, scale walls, navigate mazes, all the while solving puzzles to unlock areas. The puzzles were mostly fun to solve, although most of them were not difficult, actually some were even very straightforward. However, the main purpose of Rime is to tell you a story, the puzzle solving business is totally secondary. And that story is very intriguing. I completed the game in just two long nightly sessions, so curious was I to see the story unfold. The backstory is unclear when you start to play the game. The game consists of 5 chapters with very different moods and atmospheres. As the names of the 5 chapters indicate, the game is about dealing with loss. But only in the final chapter the backstory of the boy is finally revealed.

Apart from the story, there is much to like about Rime. To me one of the main attractions of the game is the art and visual style of the game. Each world is very beautiful and well designed, with the exception of the various extensive underwater scenes (with the air bubbles) which appear to be a tribute to Super Mario Galaxy. The character controls pretty well and runs reasonable fast, which is very important in this game as you do not want the platforming to get in the way of the story telling. In some parts of the game you are climbing massive walls and structures, which was actually fun to do because the character handles so well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034840259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1661551914}
review:
Masterpiece. I'm not easly impressed nor generous with compliments, but I'm convinced that this game deserve all the love and admiration it receives. It's incredible how a videogame like RiME can tell a story, make you experience a great variety of feelings and emotions and even bring you to tears without using a single word.

If you are going to give this game a try, I recommend to not go for an achievement or treasures hunt. All that matter, at least for the first time, is the story.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995566759', 'num_games_owned': 2023, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1548884035}
review:
Vous jouez un enfant qui se réveille sur une plage sur une île. Au centre de cette île il y a une tour gigantesque que vous devez gravir. Vous allez devoir explorer cette île pour comprendre son histoire et avancer. 

Le jeu est vraiment beau avec une OST vraiment féerique (d'ailleurs je vous la conseille le soir dans le noir pour s'endormir tranquillement). Il n'y a par contre aucune ligne de texte, aucun dialogue, ce qui renforce l'immersion dans le jeu et surtout, le fait que l'on soit seul. 

Pour ceux qui aiment 100% les jeux il y a de bons guides pour le faire, préférez les guides images car il n'y a pas les solutions pour les puzzles, mais il peut être parfois compliqué de se situer pour tel ou tel item à collecter. 
Les succès sont vraiment facile d'accès, aucun n'est difficile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993173160', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1552771556}
review:
un juego PRECIOSO,una obra de arte tanto en la historia, como en la imagen del juego todos los paisajes,colores, son increibles, la musica tambien , es muy relajante y todo en conjunto envuelve y hace que sigas jugando.
la verdad que dificultad no tiene apenas .. es un fallo pero bueno aun asi lo recomiendo a mi me ha encantado.

a mi parecer no se si me equivoco o no yo creo que la historia va del niño que murio pero desde un princio el no sabe que ha pasado y es lo que tiene que ir descubriendo por eso pasa las 5 fases de duelo mientras va escalando peldaños por la torre gigantesca que a mi parecer es como las ascension al cielo por llamarlo de alguna manera y cuando llega arriba ya esta en la fase de superacion y acepta su muerte.

una historia que te engancha y con un final y mensaje que no se olvidan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082721306', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1496000513}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078288325', 'num_games_owned': 2748, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1548633642}
review:
RiMe fait partie de ces chefs d'oeuvre vidéo-ludiques comme l'on en voit trop peu.

Je m'y suis pris à plusieurs sessions pour arriver au bout, l'aventure étant longue (pour ma part 12h pour arriver au bout), et l'on se pose beaucoup de questions tout du long sans avoir de réponse (aucun dialogue). Le jeu se termine sur un grand final grandiose tout à fait satisfaisant.

Techniquement superbe, tournant sous Unreal Engine 4, on a en permanence l'impression d'être dans un film d'animation AAA non stop, avec les musiques qui vont bien et des plans à couper le souffle de beauté.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1557170126

En plus d'une grande rejouabilité (je n'ai même pas débloqué les deux tiers des objets cachés en arrivant au bout), le gameplay est un vrai régal, facile à prendre en main et jamais punitif (bien au contraire), les puzzles étant tous très faciles ce qui peut éventuellement déplaire à certains, on appreciera la multitude des environnements et le côté "monde ouvert" des niveaux, avec la possibilité de rejouer les chapitres une fois le jeu fini.

RiMe est en must-have dans ce genre, avec son lot d'émotions et de découvertes. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000178345', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1548616424}
review:
Beautiful graphics.
Wonderful music that guides you and let's you know you're going in the right direction at times.
Puzzles aren't extremely hard, but help with the story telling.
If you like games like Journey on Playstation, you'll love this. 
Game has all the feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977821655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1548543596}
review:
A neat casual game with strong audio, story and visuals. 

+ Very well written orchestrated music.
+ Minimalistic but strong story.
+ Polished and nice art style and graphics.
+ Overall polished, well working controls (played with a gamepad).

- It's never super fun or challening to play. Sometimes it's a bit on rails and too easy even if there are optional stuff to collect. In some parts of the game it opens up a bit, but not enough in my opinion.
- The goal of the puzzles are easy to understand. WHICH IS GOOD! But the solution is too easy and sometimes "free". 
There are some good puzzle mechanics that starts to sniff in the realm of Zelda, but it never gets there, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075560486', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1548103840}
review: Este juego lo he jugado en casa de otra persona como invitada de mi cuenta y me ha gustado tan poco que me lo he descargado en mi ordenador para poder jugar 1 minuto y así poder hacer una reseña. Simplemente es malo, ¿a quién le pareció buena idea estar 2 horas huyendo de un pájaro? El hecho de que no haya una sola palabra en el el juego, que tengas que entender toda la historia solo con las imágenes, no creo que esté bien llevado y hay una subtrama de reyes que parecía querer ser otra cosa. Eso sí es jodidamente bonito. Pero la jugabilidad está tremendamente mal llevada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116193767', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1548073633}
review:
[h1]Rime - o jogo sobre a maior jornada conhecida[/h1]

Mais um daqueles jogos que a princípio despertou interesse quase imediato e acabou sendo esquecido na prateleira por qualquer razão boba.
Eu tinha uma ideia do que seria o jogo, mas na verdade errei. Eu realmente esperava um jogo de puzzle e alguma historinha e o que eu vi foi sim um jogo com alguns puzzles, mas a "historinha" foi bem mais interessante e emocionante. Ele não é, dentre os jogos nesse estilo, meu favorito, mas ele ganhou um espaço na minha memória afetiva com certeza.
Um menino vagando entre cenários fantasiosos e incríveis, 3 locais bem distintos e uns mistérios a desvendar.
Aos altos e baixos então...
[h1]Bom:[/h1]
[list]
[*] A história. Comecei pela história porque pra mim é a melhor parte do jogo, mas calma... Não espere A história. O jogo não é focado numa narrativa como aventuras gráficas digamos assim, mas os mistérios envolvendo a figura da capa vermelha e a velejada serão os pontos altos sem dúvida.
Quem é a figura?
Do que se trata a velejada?
Quem é o animalzinho?
O que são esses lugares?

[*]A trilha sonora. Não é sempre que as trilhas se destacam ou que eu destaco as trilhas, mas aqui ela merece o elogio. É uma trilha bem específica, delicada e que funciona no jogo - depois você a esquece.

[*]O visual. Tem um estilo bem fantasioso e me remeteu a alguns animes antigos. Sem sombra de dúvidas, vai te segurar até o fim. Gosto dos momentos de grande contraste entre o preto / branco e uma cor destacada (lembrei de alguns filmes - exemplo Rumble Fish)

[*]Cenários. Cada local mais interessante que o outro e muito bem construídos. Quando você se perde, o próprio cenário e personagens te ajudam a reencontrar o caminho. São 3 principais e são bem criativas:
[h1]As ruínas da Raposa[/h1]
[h1]As ruínas do Pássaro[/h1]
[h1]As ruínas do Robô[/h1]

[*]A orientação. O jogo não te faz perder tempo tentando descobrir o que fazer. O foco é te mostrar pra onde ir e o que precisa ser feito, como você o fará é outra história - mas o cenário e personagens vão te orientar nesse sentido do "caminho". Não fosse isso tenho quase certeza de que o jogo teria o dobro do tempo, uma vez que em diversos momentos a iluminação é escura demais ou a câmera te zoa (explico nos pontos ruins). Toda ajuda será necessária.

[*]A raposa. Sem spoilers ou detalhes em excesso, eu "gosti" dela e foi a companheira perfeita.

[*]O desfecho. O final do jogo me encheu os olhos ------------- de água. Droga de indies que me fazem isso constantemente.
[/list]
[h1]Ruim:[/h1]
[list]
[*]A câmera. Avaliando o game no geral, ela não compromete. Entretanto a câmera é meio zoada em diversos momentos, inclusive te atrapalhando a entender o caminho em outros tantos.

[*]Partículas. 
Seu PC sangra?
VAI SANGRAR!

Cara... Talvez tenha sido porque escolhi a opção gráfico no ultra, mas ainda assim não justifica. Eu jogo o A.C. Odyssey no ultra e meu PC tem "ram" sobrando e posso, inclusive, deixar abas do chrome abertas de fundo. Aqui, o FPS cravado em 60 caía para ridículos UM......................... UM desgramado frame por segundo na sessão submersa do jogo. 
Quando você for pra sessão "debaixo dágua" dê um pulo no menu e ponha no médio ou low. 
Que?!?!
Tudo bem que eram poucos segundos, mas deixei um rolo de atadura e band-aids aqui do lado, minha placa uivou...

[*]O controle. A mecânica de movimentação não é muito boa. Não chega a ser uma aberração e talvez quando vocês jogarem nem entendam o porquê desta "reclamação", mas ela é apenas pontual - o jogo fica meio "travado" em alguns momentos e "lento" em outros. Talvez seja apenas eu ou minha preferência, mas não curti muito a movimentação.
[/list]

Rime é aquele jogo que fica ali na sua prateleira e você não leva muita fé. É aquele livro julgado pela capa, aquele filme que por não ser lançamento ou ter mais de 10 anos você sequer dá uma chance. Em números o [b][u]Rime[/u][/b] é um ótimo casual, com puzzles ok e de valor [h1] 8 [/h1]
Ele é muito bom, mas não chega a ser excelente. Acredito que pro meu gosto pessoal, uma orientação mais bem lapidada ou pelo menos mais intuitiva sem a necessidade das "muletas" que o  jogo oferece (talvez já pensando na sua desorientação?) faria a experiência melhorar.
Puzzles poderiam ser mais desafiadores inclusive, mas mesmo assim o jogo vale sem a menor sombra de desconfiança a sua atenção. Ele não é curto demais nem longo a ponto de te arrastar numa jornada cansativa (embora em alguns momentos, devido a "velocidade" da mecânica eu tenha me pegado pensando - por que não chego logo no fim?)

E aí? Compro no full ou na sale?
Compre no full se você quiser uma boa experiência com um indie incluindo cenários, puzzles e história e não tiver algo do gênero disponível.
Compre na sale se você possuir outros indies dentro da mesma proposta.
Seja como for, não se prive desta experiência - RIME é um jogo legal, cativante e bem curioso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331247232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1610440572}
review: [h1]Сюжет – есть. Геймплей – увлекает. Визуал – восхитителен. Тогда почему же [i]RiME[/i] оставила после себя настолько плохое послевкусие? Спешу разобраться.[/h1] Я обожаю внимательно подходить к знакомству с историями, которыми нас «кормит» современная массовая культура, и очень люблю прослеживать все незначительные детали, которые незримыми ниточками переплетаются с сюжетом и (обычно) дают нам ответ-подсказку на Главный Вопрос. [i]«А чем же всё закончится?».[/i][h1] [/h1][i]RiME[/i], в данном случае, не должна была стать исключением. Я с огромным предвкушением и удовольствием с головой погрузилась в её сказочный мир, наполненный тайнами и головоломками. И весь его (мира) образ, его история, которые сформировались у меня в голове по ходу прохождения, синхронно скандировали мне о том, что [i]RiME[/i] – это про становление. Притча о том, как маленькому мальчику (нашему главному герою, волею судьбы закинутому на загадочный островок) путём прохождения разного рода испытаний на ум, ловкость да смелость наконец предстоит стать мужчиной / принцем / королём-островитян (нужное подчеркнуть) и «закалить» себя перед битвой с великим Злом.[h1] [/h1]Но довольно неожиданно пришлось спуститься с небес на землю. А точнее, [i]под[/i] землю.[spoiler]Наш протагонист с самого начала игры был мертвецом, а всё наше с ним путешествие – ничем иным, как похоронной процессией с пятью стадиями принятия горя и финальным упокоением...[/spoiler]Думаю, именно в этом и кроется основная причина моего возмущения: я впервые столкнулась с историей, где мои внимательность, желание анализировать и собирать по кусочкам картину виртуального мира не получили должной обратной связи. А именно, мир [i]RiME[/i] – с его сочными красками, необычными обитателями и загадками – с самого начала, как оказалось, не имеет развязки и является пустышкой. Большинство обзорщиков «обозвало» это особым философским смыслом. Ну здесь не могу с ними не согласиться: философский смысл во всём этом есть, определённо, да. [i]«Чем же всё заканчивается?».[/i] Очевидно –[spoiler]смертью.[/spoiler][h1] [/h1][i]3 античных табуретки из 10[/i]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1630148028 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1636828421 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1638018091

review:
Ce jeu est vraiment magnifique visuellement, tout en restant minimaliste.
Accompagné d'une très bonne ambiance sonore, ainsi qu'un OST absolument sublime!
Possédant aussi un gameplay intuitif, et un bon level design.

Que demander de plus? (Éventuellement un poil plus long, mais ce n'est pas vraiment un problème en soit.)

Fortement recommandé pour les fans du genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198145945338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1547797977}
review:
The first I played this game... let's just say I didn't get it a very ligitamate way...

BUT the game was so good I decided to go buy it again to replay it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068018061', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1547610616}
review: This game is simply beautiful. You get dropped in with almost no context and that's all you need to enjoy where it takes you. Exploring is very rewarding. I played through it twice, the second for achievements, and it was great both times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307248836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1547508707}
review:
OK game, worth a playthrough

Pros: chill and very peaceful gameplay / decent story and graphics / semi-open world / good audio / ending has feels

Cons: game does not add anything new to the formula, gameplay-wise. What I have seen in this game I saw it all in other games. / Also nothing new or inovative in level design / Collectibles were placed in the game just for the sake of collecting. They does not alter the gameplay in any way. / Sometimes the game felt like a walking simulator / For the first three quarters of the game you just dont know whats up with the story. It only starts to make sense near the end (which is a shame, because it is actually good) / WAAY TOO EXPENSIVE for only 4-6 hours of gameplay (and for the quality of the game as well tbh). Only buy it during a sale!

Conclusion: RiME is building on the existing, good ol' formula, adding little-to-none new stuff. Decent game, and decent story but honestly nothing new. The big pro here is how peaceful the gameplay feels. 6.5/10

(sadly a few hours and achievements didnt sync at all)

author: {'steamid': '76561198186037221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1544701196}
review: Un sogno. Unico consiglio: godetevelo ed esploratelo. Io spesso con i giochi ho la smania di finirli subito, questo va assaporato con calma. Non abbiate fretta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057871277', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1546957918}
review:
J'ai toujours été attiré par les prods de la Team Ico (Shadow of the Colossus, Ico, The Last Guardian) mais n'ayant pas de console je n'ai jamais pu y joué. L'esthétique de Rime ressemblant beaucoup à ces jeux, naturellement ça m'a tapé dans l'oeil et j'ai voulu l'essayer.
Rime est un jeu de plateforme / énigme qui se veut poétique voire onirique. Le jeu coche toutes les cases attendues: un terrain de jeu vaste et élégant, des musiques avec beaucoup de violons, un compagnon animal / guide mystérieux, des ruines, une ancienne civilisation, une ambiance qui va crescendo... Tout cela est plutôt bien fichu (à 2-3 approximations techniques près ) mais au final on s'amuse peu. Tout est bien trop scolaire et convenu, et même si le thème principal abordé par le jeu me touche particulièrement, le jeu n'a pas su m'émouvoir tant que ça. Dommage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169816025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1547492533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198418917734', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1547401857}
review: Considero a Rime como una pequeña decepción, y a pesar de que el juego sea un espectaculo tanto visual como sonoro, se esfuerza demasiado y falla al mostrar unos sentimientos que no consigue transmitir. A pesar de este error no lo considero un mal juego, pero ensucia un poco el resto de los apartados.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994824233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1547424181}
review:
Bugüne kadar RIME hakkında bir sürü olumsuz yorum duydum. Oyunun ne kadar sıkıcı olduğundan, haritasının boşluğundan, keşfedilecek hiçbir şey olmadığından bahsedip duruyordu çoğu kişi. Meğer hepsi palavraymış…

İddia edilenin aksine oyunda toplanılabilecek beş farklı eşya türü var ve hepsini bulabilmek için bayağı çaba sarf etmeli, haritayı iyice keşfedip her deliğe girip çıkmalısınız. Açıkçası benim gibi keşfetmeyi çok seven bir oyuncu için çok güzel bir şey bu. Ek olarak oyunun bulmacaları ve hikâyesi de gerçekten ama gerçekten çok iyi. Özellikle sonu, neyin ne olduğunu anladığınız ve işin iç yüzünü kavradığınız an cidden başarılıydı. Öyle ki oyunu bitirdiğiniz zaman boynunuzdaki kırmızı fulardan tutun da takip ettiğiniz tilkiye kadar her şey anlam kazanıyor.

Oyunda hiç savaş olmamasından şikayet edenler de olmuş ama bu da tam olarak doğru sayılmaz. Evet, kılıç kalkan kuşanıp sağa sola saldıramıyoruz fakat ilerleyen bölümlerde yolumuzu tıkayan, hatta çok yakınlarından geçtiğimiz takdirde üzerimize saldıran gölge yaratıklarla karşılaşıyoruz. Onları yenebilmek için de çeşitli atraksiyonlara giriyoruz. Bir de kafayı bize takan koskocaman, yırtıcı bir kuş var tabii. Onunla da bir bölüm boyunca kovalamaca oynamak ve aklımızı kullanarak savaşmak zorundayız.

Oyunun başarımları da keyifli. Sırf bölümü geçtiniz diye değil, sahiden de bir şeyleri yapıp keşfettiğiniz için verilenler de var aralarında. Ki başarım dediğin de böyle olmalı zaten.

Tek şikayetim arada bir sapıtan ve duvarların, eşyaların içinden geçen kamera… Onun haricinde grafikleri ve sesleriyle (kayalara vuran dalgaların sesi beni benden aldı) iyi bir oyun RIME. Keşif ve bulmaca unsurlarını seviyorsanız, oyunlarda iyi hikâye anlatımına önem veriyorsanız harcadığınız vakte değen oyunlardan. 8/10

[quote]Daha fazla incelememe göz atmak isterseniz Steam Küratör sayfamı ziyaret edebilirsiniz: [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39265984/]Pikselatör[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198345508911', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1664610122}
review:
소리를 지르는 주인공이 퍼즐을 해결하면서 뛰어다니는 인상적인 게임입니다. 고사양의 컴퓨터가 있으면 한 편의 영화를 보는 듯한 느낌을 주는 게임으로 상당한 난이도를 자랑합니다. 
 스토리는 아들과 바다로 나간 아버지가 폭풍우와 매서운 파도의 습격으로 아들을 잃고 난 후에 스스로의 꿈 속에서 아들의 시점으로 퍼즐을 해결해 나가는 것으로 아들을 잃은 아버지의 분노, 슬픔, 허탈등의 심정을 각 스테이지로 표현하였습니다. 게임상의 빨간 목도리는 아들이 바다에 나갈 당시 입은 목도리로 마지막에 아버지가 이 목도리를 창문 밖 바다로 던지며 아들이 죽은 것을 인정합니다. 이 게임의 열쇠구멍 건물은 아들 방의 열쇠구멍을 뜻하며 이 열쇠구멍 건물로 향하는 모험은 아버지가 아들 방문을 열기를 선택하는 과정을 표현한 것입니다. 
  독특한 스토리와 말 없는 게임 전개, 훌륭한 그래픽과 두뇌회전을 도와주는 퍼즐요소까지 이 게임을 구매하기 위한 요소들은 충분합니다. 아직 아쉬운 최적화 문제는 업뎃을 통해 해결할 것이라고 믿으며 32000원이라는 가격은 이 게임을 플레이하기 위해서 꼭 써야 한다고 생각합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999920602', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 624, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1547310259}
review:
RiME is a story about a boy who can make statues light up by shouting at them and has an imaginary pet fox (that’s the spoiler-free version). It’s undeniably pretty but has so many flaws. Although it looks similar to fantastic experiences such as AER and ABZU, the similarities stop at the graphics. I don’t think I had to use my brain for the entire thing. The puzzles didn’t pose any challenge at all, and you’re literally led from one to the next, so it’s very linear. It’s short, so I finished it - but man was I bored for the entire game. It’s a good example of why you can’t just get artists and musicians to make a game without putting any thought in to the actual game design.

[b]Additional[/b]
Without spoilers, it’s a very pretentious game that takes you through 5 different stages, representing the after effects of an event that is slowly revealed at the end of each level. In that way, you might call it an example of games as an art form. I’d agree if it wasn’t so dull to play - I felt like the whole game was there to show off the artwork. It looks fantastic, but it just lacks and kind of depth or emotional engagement. I think that’s partly because it reveals so little of the story, but even after the first level I’d guessed what the game was about.

Luckily I got it in a Humble Bundle; I’d be really pissed off if I’d paid 36 euros for 4 hours of gameplay.

[b]Completed in 4.5 hours[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198069136076', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1547297198}
review:
In my opinion this game is perfect.

the story is nice, the gameplay feels smooth and polished, the mechanics are easy to understand but don't get boring, the stages are visually pleasing. This is the perfect way of presenting a exploration driven adventure game!

The difficlulty curve for the collecteables is also great. At first I stumbled upon them by just playing the game, so that I knew what I was looking for. But in the later stages I wasn't even able top find a single thing, you really have to be thorough to find them all. There are also some more hidden ones in the first level, so a second playthrough is also encouraged!

It feels like a toy when you play the game, everything just works (except a weird camera transition bug when you're on 21:9, that happens when switching from third person to third person for a cutscene). 
I got very immersed in the game, an experience I hardly ever get. I mean I even watched the credits all the way to the end, which is mostly due to Silvia's amazing voice though, but still, I just didn't want it to end!

It's a very steep price for such a short game, but the experience is definetly worth it. So when it's on sale, don't even think twice, just buy it and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997050632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1547285983}
review: The visual style is good. However dark places (there a lot of them) make my eyes hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025439235', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1547685325}
review:
The easiest way for me to tell you what Rime is, and what to expect from it, is to tell you wat Rime is NOT:

- It's not a fun, cute Zelda-like adventure filled with intelligent puzzles. 
- It's not a game with easy story telling, dialogue, or text. The story is very symbolic, doesn't really drive the gameplay, and is confusing even after ending the game.


So what do we have left? 

■■■ Gameplay ■■■
A very easy, third-person exploration game. Calling it a walking simulator would be too harsh, but the puzzles are really light, and there is not a whole lot to do other than that.
The controls are good enough. This game is more about the experience and story than pure gameplay fun. There is some stuff to collect and complete,
but i must be very honest about that it is not a lot of fun to do so. The game is level based, so you will have to replay a complete level again to collect missed stuff, which can take up to an hour. The total game is very short, around 5 hours, maybe 10 to 100% complete it.

■■■ Visual style & Graphics ■■■
This game has some VERY nice graphics and artwork, very bright and colorful. This was what initially got me interested in the game, it's just so vibrant and well-made. The world design also is awesome, the buildings and area's all are designed very well visually, this game just really has its own little style, and i really like it.

■■■ Music ■■■
This game has a beautifully orchestrated soundtrack, which adds a lot of atmosphere, but above all emotion to the game. Sometimes the music is very subtle to focus more on environmental sounds.

■■■ Story ■■■
Very hard to write about without spoiling. You will wake up, washed ashore on a mysterious island with a huge white tower. You will have to find things out yourself, and learn about the situation. The story is completely told through cutscenes, and some wall paintings, there is no dialogue or text to read. 

■■■ Technical & Bugs ■■■
No problems. Game ran fine on my GTX1060 3GB and i7. Enough graphics options.

Don't buy it for full price, it's not worth it for only 5 hours of gameplay. Though this game is a bit more than a walking simulator with a story, i do recommend it to peeps who like experiences like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012009396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1547310301}
review:
Atualmente não posso recomendar esse jogo. Os FPS vão de 30 a 60 sem parar, sendo que algumas vezes chegam a 15, isso jogando em uma gtx 1070, com 8 gb de ram. Nas settings mais baixas ele roda melhor, mas ainda não estável, e acaba comprometendo muito em um jogo "atmosférico" onde você deveria ser capaz de ser capturado pela ambientação.

Fiquei tonto :S

author: {'steamid': '76561197972540747', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1668283869}
review:
Lo recomiendo 100%
Es el juego con el que mejor me he sentido jugando desde hace años. el artist, la musica... Cada detalle. Una obra maestra. 
Es un juego de resolucion de puzzles con un sistema de plataformas como genero secundario. Algunos puzzles son mas complejos que otros, pero el interes por este juego no se basa en la superacion de retos dificiles, Son puzzles con una dificultad media que te piden pensar un poco, pero que no bloquean ni frustran y permiten disfrutar de cada uno de los maravillosos detalles. Se nota que este juego esta hecho con mucho amor.
Sin duda voy a seguir muy de cerca a Tequila Works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015183469', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1547248419}
review:
I can't believe this game isn't more popular. From the graphics, to the incredible soundtrack, entertaining puzzles and a beautiful story this game is a work of art. 

Easily an 8/10. Maybe even a 9/10. 

Tequila Works, I know you went through a lot to release this game and honestly I'm very pleased that it came out. Keep at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050268040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1547248597}
review: Beautiful game! Top Graphics, Leveldesign, Story and Sound!

author: {'steamid': '76561198296233086', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1547182262}
review:
RiME is a complicated review for me. I reccomend it, but not without reservations.

The Good:
It's an absolutely beautiful game. The art style is fantastic, and is executed perfectly across all aspects of RiME. Even more than the look of it, the music is incredible. It ranges from melodic and hopeful, to haunting and melancholy. The final two chapers are the ultimate showcase of this, as a combination of environmental choices along with music that makes you feel the anguish of the boy, are pulled off to perfection. The game shines with it's style, music, and subtle storytelling, and it's entirely why I recommend you play it.

The Not So Good:
The puzzles are fine, but they're not really anything special. That said, I knew I was coming in to this for the look and sound of it, and less so for the actual video game parts, so it's really not that big of a knock against it.

The only other thing that actually truly bothered me while playing, was some of the camera work. I don't usually feel motion sick playing games- I've got a Rift, and I can stay in that thing for hours- but for some reason, I found myself feeling kind of ill after certain sections of RiME. It's by no means a dealbreaker on an otherwise enjoyable experience, but it was an annoying problem that I've rarely experienced in any other game

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197984822255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1547169364}
review:
In two words: HORRIBLE GAMEPLAY.

Do not compare this game to The Witness, they have nothing to do with each other, otherwise, be prepared to:

Solve problems (can't be called puzzles, really) by trial and error, follow the damned fox and run like an idiot in a very expansive and pretty environment. The graphics are great, but level design is atrocious. Just did something important, where to now? No idea! Try to find the fox and follow it, since the devs didn't bother to make the levels intuitive at all!

This game is a mess and very boring. I really tried to finish it, but wasn't able to.

Want to play some beatiful game? Go play Abzû and don't spend your money with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011933591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1573305144}
review:
Eine sehr emotionale Geschichte, die am Anfang nicht zu erkennen ist. Jedes Kapitel hat sein eigenes Thema und gehört aber zum wundervollen ganzen Werk. Da ich Füchse sehr mag, hatte mich das Spiel schnell gewonnen, aber auch die zauberhafte Welt in seinem schlichten Comicstil, empfand ich sehr stimmig.

Keine Kämpfe (muss auch nicht immer so sein), aber dafür ausgewogene Rätsel die einen nicht verzweifeln lassen. Auch die Collectibles sind relativ gut zu finden. Da man jedes der 5 Kapitel nach dem Durchspielen frei ansteuern darf, ist auch das jagen und sammeln leicht gemacht für die Achievements (bei der Kapitelauswahl werden auch fehlende Elemente angezeigt, damit man weiß wo es noc hwas zu holen gibt).

Hat mich sehr gut unterhalten, und ein kurzweiliger Zeitvertreib. Gamecontrolelr empfohlen, jedoch kein Muss, da die tastaur + Maus Umsetzung auch gut funktioniert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361063440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1582793247}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993298574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1547054558}
review: Wonderful game that reminds me of Zelda BoTW mixed with ICO and a little Kojima mixed in.  Great game for kids, very little violence, but an element of death (learn about at end).  An adult story told through a child's perspective.  Great design and imaginative ending.  Look forward to what else this group can make.  Total play time less than a day if not spending time to collect unnecessary collectables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152482310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1606676346}
review:
Un coup de cœur pour cet indépendant !
BO riche et intense, graphismes léchés, histoire(s) prenante(s) et une facilité de prise en main, sans oublier des bonus toujours bienvenus. Une réussite qui rappellera quelques titres fameux (The Last Guardian, Journey, Aer etc.)
Évaluation : 17/20

Univers sonore : 5/5
> Il est effectivement possible de parler d'un univers sonore à part entière dans Rime : la bande sonore composée et interprétée par David García Díaz (https://music.greybox.com/releases) est fondamentale dans l'expérience vécue en jeu, soulignant les moments d'intensité lors de la partie tout en enveloppant à chaque instant les aventures vécues par le héros.
Digne d'OST cultes de films tels que Braveheart (composée par James Horner et interprétée par l'orchestre philharmonique de Londres) ou d'animés des Studio Ghibli (tels que Princesse Mononoké dont la musique a - comme souvent - été composée par Joe Hisaishi).

Graphisme : 4.5/5
> Un univers graphique chatoyant, très fourni, loin de l'hyper-réalisme et proche de la candeur d'un Zelda The Wind Waker et parfois des ambiances crépusculaires de Twilight Princess. Une belle expérience visuelle pleine d'évasion (non sans rappeler l'indépendant Aer : Memories of old), en accord avec le jeune âge du personnage mais aussi avec le mystère de la situation qui nous est ici dépeinte. Seuls quelques parasites, la frustration d'avoir l'impression de ne pas assez profiter du paysage et le contraste entre le premier et le dernier chapitre (très sombre, logique pour l'histoire, mais quelque peu décevant pour le plaisir de yeux) me semblent à regretter.

Histoire : 4/5
> Rime réussit la prouesse de nous conter une histoire à la fois belle, émouvante et complexe, et ce sans un mot ; quant aux sujets de l'attachement et du deuil, certes loin d'être abordés pour la première fois dans de ce type de productions vidéo-ludiques contemplatives (Journey, The Last Guardian etc.), ils sont traités avec poésie et finesse, et apparaissent sous un jour universel, prompt à toucher chacun par son propre vécu.
Les différentes interprétations possibles pourront toutefois parfois rendre perplexe le joueur, tout en sachant le garder en haleine jusqu'à la fin.

Gameplay : 3/5
> Très simple à prendre en main, peu de commandes, beaucoup d'aide du jeu : le gameplay de Rime est à la fois son atout pour le grand public et sa faiblesse par la facilité de ses énigmes et sa moyenne à faible durée de vie (compter 4 heures pour parvenir à la fin de l'histoire sans se précipiter, une dizaine pour débloquer l'ensemble des items et succès).
Par ailleurs, la redondance de tâches à accomplir rendent systématique la présence des composantes de l'architecture graphique du jeu (couloirs, portes, passerelles... Rien n'est jamais gratuit ni "inutile") et prive notre esprit de divaguer dans le paysage, dommage.

Bonus : +0.5
> La présence d'items dans le jeu en lien (je précise bien) avec l'histoire développée et sa compréhension permettent d'augmenter moins artificiellement sa durée de vie, et quelques clins d'yeux autour de l'artwork de la part des devs font plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038368866', 'num_games_owned': 4148, 'num_reviews': 745, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1546900873}
review:
Un juego donde te quedás mirando los paisajes.
Le tenía ganas desde que salió y hoy lo terminé.
Linda historia que no necesita ni siquiera de texto.
Gráficos muy lindos.
Puzzles sencillos aunque alguno puede trabarte pero no por difícil, sino porque no te das cuenta de lo que hay que hacer.
El personaje en algunos momentos (sobre todo cuando trepa) se mueve para donde se le antoja y es medio exasperante.
La optimización es bastante mala, siendo que vi gente que teniendo excelentes PC Master Race, les andaba medio trabado.
Resumiendo..:
Una joyita Indie que tenés que Jugar pero con algunos problemas de rendimiento y jugabilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193631221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1685936364}
review: I played through the game with my son.  Not only did we both really enjoy the game's awesome open-world atmosphere, attention to detail that makes you want to explore, and nonviolent gameplay, but I was really struck by the game's story.  While some may think the story a little "too real," I think it gave the game an added layer of meaning, and I appreciated that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960371060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1546893573}
review:
Un petit jeu de puzzle/plateforme à la troisième personne avec des dessins très agréables. La difficulté est assez faible, l'histoire est plutôt basique mais le jeu en lui même est une pépite. On se plonge dedans et on n'en ressort qu'à la fin, très ému. Enfin la bande son est géniale !
Un vrai coup de coeur <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197995543380', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1546738755}
review:
Graphics: 10/10
Beautiful anime art style, I with more games were like this, realism is overstated.

Optimisation: 4/10
Lots of fps drops between 60 to 30 with gtx 1060, but it’s not so bad

Music: 10/10
Lots of piano and violin, really beautiful soundtrack 

Gameplay: 8/10
Running, Jumping, Climbing, swimming, diving, pushing, pulling, rolling.
But no weapon and combat whatsoever.
Ropes and swing could have been fun to add.

Story: 2/10
I finished the game and to me the story still makes no sense.

Longevity: 5/10 hours
I little to short, but at leat it doesn’t have the time to get boring.

Verdict: 6/10
Beautiful puzzle game to relax, the gameplay is good, music is awesome.
Story isn’t and it’s short.
Buy it under 10$

author: {'steamid': '76561198058759429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1546660086}
review:
This is a game that could've told a beautiful story in a stunning medium. 
And the story is great, don't get me wrong.
But you know what ruins the experience for me?
The atrocious gameplay following Act 2. 

FOLLOWING THIS POINT, THE REST OF THE REVIEW IS SPOILERS. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

So Act 1 starts off at a slow pace, easing you into the basic elements of gameplay. You don't feel any sort of rush to complete the main objective right away so you're more likely to explore (which is good as you will ABSOLUTELY need to do that in later levels just to finish the main objective). One element never gets used again (feeding the boars fruit) which is seriously dissapointing to me.

Act 2 was INTENSE and I LOVED IT. I had all these good vibes going in and then the tone shift comes when a real enemy was introduced being the Bird(?) and the Phantoms. Now the thing with the bird is that I was expecting it to be the main antagonist for the whole game - not just one act. What I was expecting was finding out that this boy's tribe was responsible for destroying its home and the bird, in a continuous fit of anger, would attack their village. In order to appease it, they would offer a sacrifice - the boy - but something goes wrong. The boy survives and the bird is FURIOUS. He's now actively seeking out his meal and you must help this boy kill the bird and get to safety.
This is what I THOUGHT. But what I GOT was... well, like I said, it would've been good had the gameplay not ruined it.
The only other comment I have for Act 2 is the realization that the Phantoms were afraid of me. I thought that was an amazing discovery. This entire time, I had been going out of my way to avoid them, scared of them myself, and these things are just as afraid of me? That was AWESOME. You're meant to be playing from the perspective of a boy adrift in a strange land, you have no idea what's going on and you're just trying your best to survive. Then these bizarre creatures show up on what you can only presume is their territory and THEY are afraid of YOU? 

Act 3: 
Well, I wish the last point would've standed because even after you managed to kill the largest creature in the immediate area, those phantoms make a complete 180 and COME for you. Personally, I think this should've been switched. They should've started off aggressive and THEN gone to fear. Part of my frustration with this act is having to take a guess at whether or not this phantom is only acting as a barrier or if they're actually aggressive. The other part is not having a god damn clue what I was doing. Apparently I'm not the only one because one of the most watched Walkthroughs spends a good 5-10 min on puzzle just walking around, trying to figure out what the hell is going on. Half of my time was spent going " WELL HOW WAS I SUPPOSED TO KNOW THAT " and grinding my teeth in anger. This is BAD for many reasons but the largest one is that it takes you out of the running story that's going on. Like when you see these giant Cores which look like the Steam Punk version of cores found in Portal just lying there dead, I get the impression I'm SUPPOSED to care. I'm SUPPOSED to care when the 1st one you revive suddenly collapses. I'm SUPPOSED to care when the 2nd one sees its fallen brother and wails. 
But did I?
No. 
Because by the time I got to the end of the level, I was too pissed off to care. This same problem dominates through the rest of the game which is awful when you're trying to tell an emotional story like this. There was also this one part where there was this wall that looked like it had a golden ladder.
Couldn't climb it.
Massively infuriating.
You can climb vines, pillars with golden rungs, and rock walls with a small jut but you can't climb something that looks like a ladder?

Act 4:
Idk if this is meant to split up into 2 acts after the boy turns into a ghost but I'm counting it as one so you're gonna have to deal with it.
I was still pretty raw from anger coming into this and thought that this might be the Act I settle down but I was INSTANTLY enraged when I saw the robots were carrying the kid.
Why?
BECAUSE THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN SO USEFUL IN THE LAST DAMN CHAPTER, THAT'S WHY.
You gotta think before you do shit like this because I spent the majority of Act 3 glaring at this robot thinking " Why can't I just hold onto your leg or something and pilot you? "
Anyhow, the rest of the level was fine until midway through. One of the totems I needed to activate had the most infuriating platform sequences since the cliff I needed to grab was at a weird angle. The character is easy enough to control with just about any situation EXCEPT diagonal jumping. I had to make 5 attempts before making what should have been a relatively easy jump.
The final thing that ticked me right off was when the kid becomes a ghost.
DO. NOT. MAKE. YOUR. CHARACTER. THE. SAME. COLOR. AS. THE. PLATFORMS. OH. MY. GOD.
That was an AWFUL design choice. It's not pleasing to look at and it makes controller the character harder. 

4/10. This game could be so much better if it didn't try too much at once and cleaned things up a bit. I would rate this lower but it's still really beautiful and the music is composed+implemented very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1545259180}
review:
Was für ein wunderbares Spiel. Der wunderbare Stil und die Musik schaffen eine tolle Atmosphäre. Dazu kommt das gute Rätseldesign und die Neugierde, um was es eigentlich geht. Das alles wird dann tatsächlich auch am Ende auf eine erzählerisch sehr starke und ergreifende Art und Weise aufgelöst.
RiME hat einige technische Macken und ist nicht an jeder Ecke ganz rund. Das verzeiht man dem Spiel aber insgesamt doch gerne. Mit rund 6 bis 10 Stunden Spielzeit (je nachdem wie viel man in die Entdeckung der Welt investiert) hat es auch eine sehr angenehme Länge und kann gut an zwei bsi drei Abenden durchgespielt werden.

Fazit: Wer gerne ruhigere Spiele mit toller Atmosphäre und nicht übermässig schwierigen Puzzles mag, für den ist RiME ein absolutes muss.

review:
I enjoyed it right up until the last 10 minutes of gameplay.

It seemed like a left turn at the end for the sole reason of making it "deep"  By the time I got to the last level I figured I was working through the stages of grief, but the flip in perspective was jarring.[/spoiler]

review: RiME is more a walking simulator than a puzzle game. There are puzzles but they are all very easy to solve. Most of the time you will walking around the beautiful designed world and explore the story. Because of the great art style / graphics and especially the outstanding sound and music it is worth a trip if you like games of this kind. I took my time and completed the game in about 8 hours but you can also finish the game much faster in under 6 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174126415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1546213217}
review: Superbe jeu, tant par ses graphismes, son ambiance que sa bande son. Mais un énorme défaut : c'est LENT ! Malgré une config largement suffisante par rapport aux exigences du jeu, j'ai parfois eu droit à 22 mn de temps de chargement, pour un jeu où mon perso s'encastre dans les murs, les marches d'escaliers, et où la caméra est à peu près aussi optimisée que dans les mauvais jeux disney sur pc... J'ai du me battre avec moi même pour le finir, car je devais forcer l'arrêt de l'ordi une fois sur 3 à cause d'un bug durant le temps de chargement... Le jeu est cartes superbe, mais à quoi sert de rendre dynamique les brins d'herbe si la caméra est aux fraises... Bref, 35 € est un tarif très surestimé pour ce jeu, et je suis surprise qu'il soit si acclamé quand de si gros problèmes sont présents... C'est dommage !
