review: Un juego sobresaliente teniendo en cuenta que es indie y que la ambientación es espectacular. La música te mantiene sumergido en la historia y el desenlace es muy inesperado. Un 10 a esta compañía y a su obra maestra! A seguir mejorando!

author: {'steamid': '76561198357287052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1546170501}
review:
Rime é um jogo muito imersivo, onde você controla um garoto que naufragou e parou em uma ilha, e agora você tenta descobrir oq está acontecendo ali. Além de ter um grafíco lindissimo, o jogo ainda conta com uma trilha sonora que combina muito com os lugares que você vai, com uma história fragmentada pelo mundo que pode ser decifrada achando os brinquedos, fechaduras, emblemas e outros itens. Definitivamente um jogo que todos precisam jogar, ainda mais se gostarem de plataformas e de raposas.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062197146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1546165475}
review: Very special game that l finished on the Switch. I got the PC version because l enjoyed it so much. I thought that the PC version would be really good but to be honest the Switch version is just as good if not better because you can play it anywhere. No matter what version you get it is not about graphics, more about the music and imagination and the journey. These games are great when you got to figure it all out on your own. But the story and the what you need to do is cleverly designed so even if you have no brain you can work it out. Highly recommended if you need to have a break from all FPS and action games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1546147697}
review:
If you play this game without worrying about secrets or collectibles, it's probably fine. But god did they completely screw up secret/achievement hunting here. You can only select the start of each chapter, and there's points of no return all throughout chapters, meaning that secrets are easy to miss and then take a looong time to get back to if you do miss them. Which is bad. And they all do... nothing, really. Emblems mean nothing. Lullabies mean nothing. Toys and Keyholes have tiiiiny rewards but nooot really. Outfits are the only tangible reward and they're only aesthetic at best. And the way some stuff is hidden is... questionable. Go through a specific set of doors? Uhh. Climb a tower you already climbed but with no indication you need to climb it again? Why. 

The problem you face whether or not you go for completion is that this game is self-indulgent to the point of arrogance and thus looooves wasting your time. Be prepared for: 1. Slooow cutscenes. 2. Slow movement. 3. Lots of samey, uninteresting parkour platforming. 4. A general super slow feel. It's just... paced really badly and on replay (which is almost a necessity if you want to go for completion considering how easy it is to miss stuff) it reeeally shows how much this game revels in its own "atmosphere" and "beauty". Yeah, the game does look good. But not -that- good. Not so good you need to constantly shove it in my face. The music's also a tad generic but constantly seems to believe it's meaningful and deep. Bleh.

I will say, the story is solid, and it's revealed at a decent enough pace, though really they could've told the same story more succinctly and cut out a lot of the tedious puzzling. But ehh. In the end... yeah, especially for $30, with how little content is actually here, absolutely no recommendation, you can do much better in this style of atmospheric puzzly/explory game than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969047038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1546053019}
review:
It's a shame this game is known more for framerate problems (especially on console) than anything else, but luckily I didn't have issues.  On my GTX 1070 / i5-8600 at 1440p and full settings it ran mostly over 90 fps, with some brief drops under 60 fps in a few places.

The game is absolutely beatiful, fun to play, and has an intriguing story and some fantastic environments.  My only complaint is the puzzles could have been a little more challenging, but maybe that wasn't the point.  At 6 hours I think it's about the right length.

Totally recommended if you have a decent PC and enjoy games like Journey or Limbo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041711291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1546035196}
review:
[H1]I am writing a review for RIME.[/H1]

[H1]When I first saw this game the thought was, "I will Probably get this when they iron the bugs out."
The bugs are ironed out.
This game surprised me for several reasons, and I'll break it down for you.[/H1]

[H1]Gameplay:[/H1]
[H1]As simple as this game appeared when I first finally got my hands on it, It Quickly let me know this is a game of Skill and thought. You are in character like Tomb Raider. You jump from ledges and hurdle across casms and climb VERY high. I say this because I have a fear of heights. My games that terrifed me; were like Dying Lights First encounter with the Crane off the roof. I nearly hurled. After you get used to it its alright, and this game delivers that sense of height and risk.

The controls are very tight.
 
I am a WASD player, casual gamer. The controls having sensitivity is crucial because the game will kill you for jumping. Falling works in the game, and there IS gravity.

I found the situations and scenery made the game play all the more fun. As you go, youre able to collect things, There are shells, pieces of images, pictures keyholes, and some other things I cant remember. This game was LUSHLY populated with Lovely, and harsh landscapes.[/H1]

[H1]Look and feel:[/H1]
[H1]I loved the simple beauty of the character, there was a childlike innnocence you saw. The enviroments were Lush. I loved how things interact with you. In a sandbox Open-world, I can go anywhere,  this game was fairly forgiving and allowed me to get out of jams, unlike some games do. The walls and rocks arent Traps like Other games, in other words.

I played this game for 3 days on a off. I tried to play to a stopping place and save. The game saves but its Usually where you started from, the last time you played. That Isnt a big deal because I saw how I needed to go sometimes when I was lost. Starting again helped me get my bearings.

The Puzzles are Great and varied. There are so many I couldnt count, but you were always involved. It was my Favorite part of this game.

Parker moves and jumping happens also.[/H1]

[H1]Likes:[/H1] 

[H1]The look wasnt so polished you were awestruck at every scene, but the graphics were (in Ultra) Beautiful. Physics are real and consisistent, as are response from controls.
The cut-scenes are a treat, and happen so infrequently its a great break in the action. It slows the play down too. Thats a deal because I found myself wanting to run through the game. I sort of Did, but in a thoughtful manner, trying to find stuff and get achievments.[/H1]

[H1]Dislikes:[/H1]

[H1]This game is Stingy with achievments if youre a collector of stuff. The artifacts to find, go from difficullt, to stupidly simple.
Not the strongest part of the game IMHO to complete. This requires a guide to find everthing.

At times I found my self having issues with what was being asked of me or where I was going (because I have a tendancy to wander in open world games like this, and I was lost a few times. Luckily the Devs had a Clue, and made it so if you save; it will allow you to return to the start of your mission. 

You have a traveling companion, a Fox. It willl lead you where you need to go. I had to pay attention to that, because its Really handy Not to get lost.
Im not a completionist.[/H1]

[H1]Final thoughts:[/H1]

[H1]I like to start at a place where everyone can agree, 'would you play this game again?'
I have to say, 'Yes'.
Im a sucker for games that allow me to run around everywhere and do mostly anything.
I liked the Puzzles in this game!! I like puzzles, but this game had great Logical puzzles, and it made sense when you finished them. Plus: You feel smarter.[/H1]

[H1]8/10 Beauty, because the graphics werent SO polished, but still lovely.
      9/10 Game play: It Was fun!
      10/10 Immersion, because at the end[spoiler]I cried[/spoiler][/H1]

[H1]The price is Right to get this, during a sale, so Please do. I enjoyed this game Immensely. [/H1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198240385568', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1545851633}
review:
¿Recomendaría este juego? SI. 

Desde que lo inicias ya te atrapa, no te suelta en ningún segundo, avanzas por esos escenarios acompañada de la banda sonora en todo momento, que va haciéndose eco en un juego donde no hay diálogos, pero que sin ellos logra transmitirte lo suficiente para que sepas apreciar cada escena, cada momento, como si lo vivieras tú. Según vas descubriendo escenarios te puedes ir haciendo una idea de su historia con esos flashbacks que te van mostrando, pero aún con esas, cuando llegas a ese final que puedes intuir pero no puedes saber cómo lo vas a sentir hasta que lo vives, lo sientes y te inunda con su belleza. 

A mi personalmente este juego me ha "roto" pero se ha hecho un hueco en mi corazón.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041724761', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1545817064}
review:
[b]Beeindruckend![/b]

Rime hat mich vom ersten Augenblick an emotional berührt, in seinen Bann gezogen und in seine verzaubernde Welt mitgenommen, ohne dass ich vorher wusste, was mich da denn jetzt nun wirklich ganz genau erwarten wird. Das schaffen nicht alle Spiele und Rime hat es dazu auch noch auf eine Art und Weise geschafft, die ich so bis jetzt noch nicht kannte. 
Ohne dass im gesamten Spiel auch nur ein einziger Satz gesprochen wird, fühle ich mit, leide ich mit und fühle mich im Geiste mit dem Hauptcharakter verbunden. 
Tequila Works hat hier einen absoluten Knüller abgeliefert der einen ans Herz geht und mit seiner erstklassigen musikalischen Untermalung das Spiel wunderbar abrundet und die Stimmungen mehr als gefühlvoll trifft. Auch das schafft längst nicht jedes Spiel aber Rime hat es geschafft.

Das einzige was ich persönlich zu kritisieren habe ist, dass die Kameraführung an manchen Stellen nicht optimal war. Ansonsten habe ich jede Minute dieses Spiels genossen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004006208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1545812998}
review:
Good Idea Bad Devs

The first hour of this game is like dating a hot psycho sure shes great to you in the begining but slowly but surely her insanity starts to show. Rimes concept of an exploration game with epic puzzles is a great idea and you will feel like thats what your getting in the begining which sadly is as far as most people get with there games as seen with low achivement rates.

But sadly this game is full of frustrating flaws and outright incompetance at the hands of the designer and even the artists which is very poor by todays standards. This game is overall a simple design for the unreal engine which was speically built to make these kind of single player games great unlike PUBG etc but boy does it have problems. 

Firstly this game has one of the worst camera clipping issues I have seen that causes the camera to jarringly go through walls often stunning the player with black or worse whatever randomness is behind the games walls. Its like being blinded everytime as if a deer just dove out in front of your car, truly awful programing. Plently of unreal engine games dont have any issue with the camera like this its something you dont even think about in Tomb Raider for example. 

Tomb raider is a good thing to compare alot of things in this game as despite its faults its fundemntals are solid when compared to Rimes poor effort. Alot of the climbing in this game is based on bird shit on ledges signalling you can climb it but due to the artistic lighting you often can not see it. Now i don't wear glasses but if you do dont even finish the review just dont bother with the game youre going to rage often trying to figure out what youre missing when you can see the slight change in color that was vital to you progressing forward. The lighting in general makes the game such an awful experince espically the areas that are dark and due to the high washed out light in the day you cant fix it with brightness changes unless you plan to turn it up and down everytime you in an area which somethings if your moving like underwater for example its too risky to do so.

The parkour in general in this game is often terrible when compared to Tomb raider or Assasins creed and thers a distinct lack of smoothness to the animations and controls which make navigating the world a chore. The little boys animations are so janky and stilted as if he has brittle bones, it feels like every button press has animation delay which makes timing what you want to do bad. I died a few times jumping off a cliff when I wasnt intending to do what the game produced. The game is also very inconsistent with what is possible, yes I know you could make that jump back then but you can't here ... or can you its never clear whats possible or if your doing it wrong. I really wish they had implemtned the fox guide more to aliveate this.

The boy chacters design starts to anoy after you spend enough time with him as hes just so odd looking imagine a white kid with black face thats strangely what he looks like. The dumb thing to me is why there wasnt a character creation tool in this game as the story is so loose that being a girl or a boy of whatever race would have not effected the plot. Being able to create you as a child would have added a lot of depth to the game and made it more meaningful because after a while youll be flinging him off cliffs just to see whats possible without a care in the world, meaning you dont care for his saftey and therefore his journey. 

The puzzles arent really that speical, there often beautiful in there architetureal design and art which is one of the games big draws but there's nothing hear thats better than the Breath of the Wild mini puzzles. Im not the biggest fan of Tomb raider or Uncharted but I can promise you they both have far better puzzles. One that particular pissed me off was one of the gold door ones that asks the player to know how to do something thats impossible within the games logic until you learn of it. Soon as you know its possible the puzzle is easy if you don't you'll feel like you dont even have a clue as to not only what to do but if your even in the right place, its that fucking awful. 1 of the worse puzzles I've seen made, thats similar to telling the player I know you have 2 hands but you should have used the invisble 3rd hand we gave you but didnt tell you.

Another thing mentioned by reviewer Jim Sterling really hit home the more i played the game and thats the problem of having collectables which are an issue for several reasons in this specific game. Firstly they are mostly apart from the story ones worthless and unrewarding items that make you feel like that was pointless for my time investment. Theyre kind of a nod towards those that explore a little more than others whilst doing the main ones but it just makes you feel like checking every nook for the sake of it not because you want to. Thats bad because exploration is what makes this game feel unique and special yet often youre exploration is not rewarded because instead of something like a beautiful hidden waterfall with unique life, you find a worthless charm thats more like an emoticon than anything else. The game really needed more animal life and a way for the boy to interact with it in an enjoyable way like petting it for example. 

The music is nice but kind of forgettable you want really be hearing it in your head later on but its not anoying unlike many of the sound effects from the shouting boy to the segul to the hellish bird boss scream. I turned the sound down more and more that I pushed through the game, shame.

The game runs very poorly on my powerful computer for a game this simple and it feels very poorly optomised. This is really bad given you kinda need the graphics on high to see things clearly due to the previously mentioned problems with the game. Even though the game looks simple enough if you have a low end system really do not bother with this game its going to be troublesome for you. I also hate the lack of being able to save when you want its really jarring when you have to come back to the game as your not where youd like to pause your journey. The options menu is very poor by Total Biscuits standards and pc buffs are not going to be impressed by whats here.

Overall this game is not worth the high price for a short indie game and even at sale due to its painfully frustrating elements I can not recomend you spend your time with this game. The sad part about this game is that if they had a team of testers or went early access that would have spotted all these obvious issues with the game and lead to them being fixed. A lot of what this game does has been done before but better and its a real shame the game designers didnt study hard enough to learn about the importance of customer feedback in design. Their lack of expertise has turned what could have been a great title into a bad one and how sad it is that all the hard work they put into this game is wasted.  

The main lesson here is Hire Quality Assurance Testers no matter what your games budget is, pls Devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031670464', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1495973893}
review:
Στα [+] καί [-]
•  Μιά άψογη συρραφή ελαφρά διασκευασμένων αντιγραφών από σουξεδιάρικα παιχνίδια (Tomb Raider, Portal), μέ πρωτεύοντα στόχο τό παιδικό κι εφηβικό κοινό τής κονσόλας...

Στα [+]
•  Τά arcade χαρακτηριστικά του είναι αρκετά εύκολα καί τό ίδιο τό πρόγραμμα σέ καθοδηγεί πολλές φορές γιά τό τί πρέπει νά κάνεις. 

Στα [-]
•  Τά πηδηματάκια από βράχο σέ βράχο, οι αναρριχήσεις σέ πανύψηλα κτίρια, τά μακροβούτια σέ θαλάσσιες σήραγγες καί τά τοποθετημένα σέ απομακρυσμένα σημεία "secrets", αποτελούν τό κυρίως πιάτο τού παιχνιδιού. Τό μενού συμπληρώνεται μέ μετακινήσεις κιβωτίων καί τή χρήση τής πασίγνωστης πλέον σφαίρας πού μετά τό Portal έχει γίνει τό φετίχ τών παρεμφερών παιχνιδιών! 
•  Ενα τουλάχιστον Dead End πού προέρχεται από λάθος τού προγράμματος καί δέν εμφανίζεται πάντα, αλλά έτσι κι εμφανιστεί απαιτείται η εκκίνηση τού παιχνιδιού από τήν αρχή! (Στήν περιοχή όπου σέ κυνηγάει τό μεγάλο πουλί, μπορεί νά σού εμφανιστεί όταν ετοιμάζεσαι ν' ανοίξεις τήν πόρτα τού φάρου κάτω από τή θάλασσα! Σ' αυτή τήν περίπτωση δέν μπορείς νά τού ξεφύγεις όσες φορές κι άν δοκιμάσεις, καί τό μεγαλύτερο κακό είναι ότι τό πρόγραμμα σώζει από μόνο του σ' αυτό ακριβώς τό σημείο...). 

Συνοψίζοντας
•  Η Lara τής δεκαετίας τού '90 είναι εδώ! Μεταμορφωμένη σέ μικρό αγόρι καί μέ πιό εύκολο ρεπερτόριο, αλλά καί μέ όλα εκείνα τά χαρακτηριστικά πού τήν κάνανε τόσο αγαπητή! Οποιος τήν πεθύμησε, μπορεί νά πάει νά τήν συναντήσει στό Rime. 

Βαθμολογία: 2/5

Παρεμφερείς Τίτλοι
TOREN

http://adventures-index10.blogspot.com/2017/01/rime.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198076099664', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1545707797}
review:
Dude varias veces de comprar este juego, pensando que seria un juego sin audio el cual te aburriría, pero me equivoque, desde el inicio me encanto esos colores, los rompecabezas la jugabilidad estilo tomb raider, poco a poco te va sumergiendo en historia y literalmente también XD, lo Recomiendo, Excelente juego.

Voces: Ninguno
Texto: Español

****Análisis*****
*Jugabilidad: Excelente
*Un Jugador : Excelente
*Campaña Horas: Bueno
*Rompecabezas : Muy Bueno
*Graficas: Excelente

Calificacion: 8.4

Nota+Definicion: 10=Obra Maestra, 9=Excelente,8=Muy Bueno, 7=Bueno, 6=Medio Bueno, 5=Mejorable, 4= Mediocre, 3=Malo, 2=Muy Malo, 1=Inservible

author: {'steamid': '76561197989693118', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1546986409}
review:
Yo no sé las películas que se han montado con el juego este y sus significados ocultos, si no hay misterio. Claramente narra la vida de un niño gaditano que se despierta en la playa después de 16 horas de siesta al sol y se pega un fin de semana de paseo por los pueblos del interior de la costa andaluza. ¿Qué de donde me saco esto? Pues pongo algunos ejemplos:

En un inicio llegamos a Mojacar, donde encontramos todas esas calles y casas blancas revestidas de cal (ya sabéis, para estar fresquitos en verano), visitamos también la playa de Punta Paloma, con sus aguas cristalinas y su maravillosa orilla en la que buscar fardos y, más tarde, nos adentramos en terrenos montañosos, concretamente en Málaga, donde casi al final del juego puedes encontrar el caminito del rey.

Es cierto eso de que es muy importante la voz del protagonista. Y es que en tu viaje deberás aprender a cantar soleás, tímidamente empezarás con suaves “mmmh” que avanzarán directamente a gritos porque no terminas bien de pillar el compás, y claro, eso te descarta automáticamente como cantante pero te vale para el jaleo.

Otra referencia clara es cuando, en un momento del juego en el que todo está oscuro, se te aparece la virgen de la macarena para darte fuerza cristiana, pero al verte se raya y desaparece porque sabe que no estás bautizao.

El zorro ese que no hace más que ronearte es en realidad el chivato del dealer del barrio. Uno que va con un poncho rojo y que está en todos los rincones del juego porque cambia continuamente de lugar no vaya a ser que los verdes le desmonten el tinglao.

Y bueno aún me queda juego por delante así que si veo más referencias iré actualizando esto. Gracias Tequila Works por llevar el folclore mediterráneo allende de nuestras fronteras. Moláis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072456655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1545653249}
review: Jeu sans combat, sans barre de vie, sans narration, sans dialogue, sans explication. Tout est terriblement intuitif, l'histoire est bien ficelée et les objectifs se dessinent très facilement. Un jeu qui dure 6h environ, que je conseillerai à tout le monde à partir de maintenant. MERCI A VOUS, enfin un jeu que j'aime du début à la fin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241251076', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1545602921}
review: “什么都好就是不好玩”的典型，玩法类似于极简化后的《神秘海域》或《古墓丽影》，以无趣的解谜与攀爬为主。音乐与画风俱佳，为低成本游戏的美术设计提供了一个优秀范本。尽管如此，其实优化糟糕，比玩 3A 级大作还卡。

author: {'steamid': '76561198013036887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1545573376}
review:
Rime- это преключение от третьего лица за пацана, которого выбросила на берег острова с гиганской башней, на топ которой ему помогает добраться дружелюбный лис. Игра очень похоже по Journey и ABZU. Разве что продолжительность и геймплей более разнообразный. Вся игра строится вокруг решения лёгких загадок, ползания по стенам и созерцания прекрасного окружения. Сюжет в игре, как в Jorney и ABZU, подаётся визуально и игрок сам должен выстроить его у себя в голове. Погружению способствует красивая музыка, которая очень тонко подчёркивает дух преключения. Долгое время не понятно о чём же игра, но уже на середине начинаешь понимать, что всё не так просто и кто такой парень за которого, мы играем. Финал лично меня не оставил равнодушным. Это то, за что люблю одиночные видеоигры- они дарят глубокие эмоции.

Что можно пожурить, так это оптимизацию. Графика в игре хоть и приятная, но всё же простая, поэтому не понятны заметные просадки кадров во многих местах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425674729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1545565166}
review:
美しい音楽、美しい世界
思わず息をのみ、涙し、胸が痛む。
心が動く美しい作品でした。

美しい自然と美しい石造りの廃墟と水の流れ、
すべてに目を奪われます。

ICOや大鷲のトリコ、ゼルダの伝説などの作品の影響うけ、
それをとてもよい形で混ぜ合わせ、新たなものを生み出したように感じます。
特にICOやトリコがお好きな方にはおすすめします。

価格もお安く、短編なのかな？と思っておりましたが
思っていたよりもボリュームがあり、驚きました。
私はゆっくりと進めていたので5～6時間でクリアとなりましたが
まだ実績が山ほどあったのですべてをクリアしようとするともう少しかかったかなと思います。

一カ所敵がこない筈の場所で敵に襲われる、というバグがありましたが
再起動しましたらまったく問題なく進めました。ただその一カ所意外に不具合はありませんでした。
何か不具合かな？と感じましたら再起動をお勧めします。
（こういった複雑で手が込んだゲームには意図せずバグが起こることもまぁあります。
こちらのバグは開発者に報告しておこうと思いますので今後はさらに遊びやすくなるかもしれないですね）

review: Lindo Game, como é bom ter mais jogos INDIE no mercado para nos tira da mesmisse, o jogo tem um final emocionante. Os gráficos são lindos, os mapas tbm, ele te instiga a explorar cada cantinho para ver se num perdeu nada. os Puzzles não são tão dificeis. mas acho que essa nem era a ideia, a ideia aqui é te conduzir atraves do mapa de maneira que vc entenda sua jornada, que no final faz todo sentido. minha única ressalva fica por conta da fluidez da jogabilidade as vezes é pouco lenta, por vezes vc acaba apertando o mesmo botão por conta de sua falta de fluidez. No mais é um otimo game. Recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052042822', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1578243103}
review:
Premiado plataformas en el que la voz de nuestro personaje es la clave, lleno de puzzles basados en observar bien el entorno y algunos momentos de huída/supervivencia; algo pausado pero hermoso. Merece mucho la pena, pero advierto que cuando te empieces a dar cuenta de lo que realmente representa su historia... acabarás con una incómoda sensación en el pecho.

Lo mejor: los entornos y todo el detalle que se le ha puesto, así como la música y las metáforas de la historia.
Lo peor: ¿Repetitivo? Un poco. Es de esas “pelis” que no gustan a todos porque no acaban como uno espera.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970711898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1545070274}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021722575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1546714763}
review: Très joli jeu d'exploration à l'ambiance onirique et mystérieuse, avec des énigmes accessibles, et très peu de violence  (mais je déconseille ce jeu pour les plus petits, ce n'est pas toujours très joyeux, surtout vers la fin). On a l'impression d'être dans un film de Miyazaki, avec des environnements surprenants, et une belle maitrise de l'ombre et de la lumière. Un voyage étonnant et initiatique, un univers à parcourir avec un vrai plaisir. C'est de plus en plus rare, ce type de jeu; alors profitez-en !

author: {'steamid': '76561198074777314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1545133638}
review:
I'm really confused.
The game is beautifull, and I mean it. One of the best looking, atmospheric, games out there. It's just astonishing. The story is also great, and well told. Music score kicks ass and so on. 10/10 if it comes to the tech / goodies.

Now, the game itself... It's not a puzzle game. There are like 5 puzzles where you have to think (a bit), and the rest is just tedious moving things around. No thinking involved at all. 

It's more WALKING SIMULATOR, rather than puzzle game. 
Quite wonderful walking simulator, but still - not a puzzle game. 
You walk, you jump, you walk and jump. No gameplay at all. Just tedious moving around the levels.

But then, once you turn the blind eye on the fact it's gameplay kind of sucks, and just realise it's a walking simulator, you'll spend couple of great hours discovering all the beauty  and heart, developers put into this title.

Not sure if I'd recommend this game to everyone, but if you're willing to forgive a lot of tedious walking, to get something quite special on different fronts (design, graphics, story) - it's a treat!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1545081262}
review:
Rating: 7.5/10
Genre: 3D platforming 

The Good:
+ An incredibly well-crafted game, exploring the environments with some light platforming and puzzle solving in the mix.  Exploring the environment carefully usually rewards you with some sort of collectable.

+ Variety of environments between the 5 chapters

+ There is a ‘silent’ story, no dialogue, and things start to make more sense as you play the game. Again, it fits nicely with the narrative of the game and doesn’t get in the way, allowing you to explore and enjoy the game. 

+ Fantastic soundtrack 
 
The Average:
+/- The puzzle fit nicely with the overall theme of the game but felt a bit too easy especially in the later half of the game since the puzzles don’t evolve very much. 

+/- The game will take around 5-10 hours depending on how thorough you explore each area.

The Bad:
- Framerates were not stable at all, fluctuating between 30-60fps. 

Conclusion:
The closest thing we will get to ICO on steam. Although I wouldn’t call this game a masterpiece, it does do a good job of filling that void though and those looking for a more relaxing, casual experience will definitely appreciate what this game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998530793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1545254843}
review:
This game is quite an intersting one, the story appears to be like your usual platform game. Solve puzzles, move on, etc.. but the further you go, you start to really think about it until it reveals itself by the end and all makes sense. The performance on surround is pretty good as long as you reduce anistropic filtering and switch to FXAA. The graphics are really good, along the line of Zelda the Windwaker. The rain effect is pretty amazing. I will say the achievements are not really hard to get and you should be able to get 100%. However, there is again one drawback, the game is short. Without looking for everything, it took me about 5 hours to finish, add maybe another 2 hours to find everything, that would be a bit short for $29.99. Again, if you find it on sale, absolutely go for it, and one more thing, the soundtrack is unbelievable.

Completely forgot to add one detail, there are no boss fight or monsters to take out. This is definitely not an action adventure, more like puzzle platform adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117107627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1576027326}
review: I got Rime on sale for 10 bucks, and that was an awesome deal. I absolutely loved this game. Beat it in about 13 hours, but will be going back to try and get the collectibles i missed. After playing it, it makes me mad to know how much criticism this game got. It looks and plays and sounds so amazing. It was beautiful in every way. It fluctuated between 60 and 30 fps on my 6 year old pc, but it was never very noticeable at all. I have ZERO complaints about framerate, or anything else really. It probably takes a specific kind of person to truly appreciate this game, but i am definitely one of them, and recommend it 1,000%

author: {'steamid': '76561198821387821', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1543266322}
review:
Juego con una estética preciosa y una gran ambientación donde lo importante es recorrer sus escenarios y disfrutar tanto de sus gráficos como de su música. En cuanto a mecánicas de juego es básicamente sencillo, algo de exploración y puzless sencillos para  ir avanzando.
El juego se basa en lo estético, en presentarte una obra de arte audiovisual, con una historia que va tornándose más oscura a medida que avanzas y que el juego es capaz de transmitir sin ningún tipo de diálogo, sólo con música e imágenes.
Es uno de esos juegos que hay que jugarlos por lo que es capaz de transmitir, por como te sumerge en su mundo y como te hace aflorar sentimientos. Más cercano a juegos como Abzû o Journey aunque más largo y algo más de complejidad en los puzless.
Si lo que buscas es un juego que te rete, que sus mecánicas te pongan en apuros, este no es tu juego. Es un juego concevido como un paseo audiovisual, con una duración bastante aceptable para lo que suelen tener este tipo de juegos.
En resumen un juego que no te puedes perder si te van los juegos contemplativos con una gran atmósfera y que transmiten belleza en cada pixel y nota de sonido que emiten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201824980', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1544930922}
review: Okay so this game is a masterpiece. I don't normally care for artsy games but this game is legit. Play all the way through you won't regret it.  The game starts off so simple and whimsical and becomes so deep and interesting. There is a lot more to this game than meets the eye, you will be coming up with theories the whole time about what is taking place. The gameplay is pretty good as well, these developers really proved they know game design with this one. Big world to explore but rarely feel lost due to good atmospheric hints and slowly building up in challange level. I don't know if the developers read this but your level design, art direction, and musical score are amazing and work together to keep the whole game flowing you should seriously be so proud of this.  Bottom line, get this game if you like puzzles, story, art, music, light platforming, or good video games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986573118', 'num_games_owned': 4065, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1544924339}
review: Un juego con un gran apartado artístico, un gran diseño, gran banda sonora y que nos llega al corazón. Se nota que el cuidado puesto en él. Como aspecto negativo podemos poner su duración. Pero merece la pena jugarlo para conocer su historia y vivir esos momentos, recomendable su compra en ofertas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074951267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1544976076}
review:
Сюжет игры уместится в одно предложение, очень шаблонный. Механики в игре унылые и раздражающие. Графика и саундтрек достаточно приятные, но игра света тени просто убивает зрение. Стоит игра не дорого, поэтому скорее рекомендую.

И да, я перед этим написал еще один обзор, я его оставлю. Уж больно помню эмоции, при которых я его писал.
[spoiler]Игра не стоит своих денег, даже со скидкой. Ужасное освещение в игре, глаза просто умирают. За тупорылый уровень в темноте, с этими камнями светящимися ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥и, хотелось бы лично уебать разработчика по лицу, чувствую еще немного и я бы потерял зрение. 
У этой игры есть только милый внешний вид, слизанный с зельды, который приедается на 5 минуте игры. УБОЖЕСТВО. ПРОСТО ДЕРЬМО.[/spoiler]

ГООСПОДИ, Я ПОТРАТИЛ НА ЭТО 7 ЧАСОВ. Не, не рекомендую.
[spoiler]7 часов унылой беготни, чтоб узнать о том, что у какого-то мужика во время шторма сын утонул.[/spoiler] Но в то же время, там виды красивые и одноглазики забавные. Ой, ладно. Рекомендую. Но по скидке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237673034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1544861274}
review:
声を使って謎を解いていく良雰囲気のパズルゲーム。
謎は易しめで特に悩んでつまるところはなし。
風景もBGMも良く、リラックスして遊ぶことができた。
すべてのストーリーの謎が明かされる最後のチャプターでジーンときた。
死亡した場合すぐに復帰するので気軽にチャレンジすることができる。

所々視点が固定されるのが不便。
ダッシュしているときに障害物にぶつかると転ぶ動作に少しイライラ。
チャプターセレクトですぐ解除できるが、一周では全実績解除できない。
重大ではないが、何もないところに掴まったり、壁にめり込んだりと多少バグがあった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053306836', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1544793382}
review:
Simply can't recommend a game where graphics takes center stage while gameplay - in this case puzzles - takes a backseat. Puzzles are just .. bad.. They don't have any real cleverness to any of them, at least for the player. It's all trial and error. The game just wants to show off its artistry at every point, which I admit is top notch and the game is absolutely beautiful. But with some clunky controls and poor puzzles, this is definitely a thumb down for me. Also has optimization issues. Stutters sometimes in some areas even on a Vega 64.

The game clearly takes inspiration from third person action adventure games like the classic Prince of Persia / Tomb Raider /God of War / Darksiders. Except, they have meaning to exploration, have great puzzles, much better level design, and good combat as well. Granted this is a chill-out and relax game,  but it fails even in that department because some of the puzzles are just annoying -they don't really require much use of your brain, but just trial and error.. If the puzzles were actually clever, like what you see in Talos Principle or Portal, I would've absolutely recommended this game. But, they're just mind numbingly boring to solve.. If you've played Hellblade Senua's Sacrifice, you'd know what I'm talking about. In Rime, puzzles are basically align an object with another,  rotate a ball till you hit the right spot, adjust an object so the shadows fall in the right places, so on and so forth. Sure, these puzzles show off a great lighting system and the developer's artistry skills, but as puzzles, they are barebones, yet frustrating at times, and it simply ruins it from being a good walking simulator as well.

This game has you pushing the Left analog stick on your controller forward (or pressing and holding W) for 80% of the game. It is a small open world, but your hand is still held by your pet which guides you to your objective. 

There is immense beauty on first look, but without any real content or meaning to it, it's nothing but a pretty empty shell that fails to keep me hooked.. There is no real story until the epilogue of the game, but by that time, I was already frustrated with the game that I truly didn't care.. If you think graphics/ visual art triumphs all, then boy oh boy are you in for a treat. Especially if you have an ultrawide monitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134313414', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1544629262}
review:
いわゆる雰囲気ゲーと表現されるタイプのゲーム。
もうしわけ程度の謎解きで少しのアクション要素はあるけど、低難易度でストーリーに没入しやすくなっている。
といっても明確に言葉を発する場面は無いので想像力で補って考察していくタイプだろうか。

計10時間あれば誰でもクリアできるくらいの難易度で、うまい人なら５から６時間くらいで可能だと思う。

とにかくグラフィックの質が高く、そこらへんを散策してるだけでも楽しい。
特に水の表現力の美麗さは必見。

ゲーム性やボリュームの少なさは褒められたものじゃないが
音楽やアートワーク等の他要素で補ってる良作。
Never AloneやBeyond Eyes等のゲームが好きだった人はもろ好みだと思う。

個人的にはこれ買って良かったなと素直に言えるゲーム。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001914736', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1544586214}
review:
If you like Journey or ABZU, you'll like this. I loved the art style, environments, music, and story - well done!! 

Puzzles are there to give you something to do - don't expect any brain busters. I also think most of the bugs have been ironed out. A couple of hiccups and slightly dodgy climbing controls did little to mar the experience for me. Ignore the the haters, it's  all fine. It's not an action game!

This game deserves an audience

author: {'steamid': '76561198303235862', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1544559242}
review:
Ce jeu est tellement fort et énormément émouvant, touchant on y traverse pleins d'énigmes et à la fois des secrets a découvrir et ce qu'ils signifient. 
Cette survie qu'il faut garder et traverser sur plusieurs étapes du jeu qui à chaque fois pour moi m'ont éblouie.
Mais j'avoue qu'il ma fait pleurer.
Je ne peux en dire plus , juste que je le recommande vraiment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112288397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1544458157}
review:
RiME is a beautiful platforming, puzzle and somewhat explorational game. The game is emersive and tells an interesting story without the need for narration. Although RiME has some issues, it is certianly a game that I enjoyed and would recommend to people who love going on a story-telling journey.

[h1] Puzzles [/h1] 
This game is more of an art piece. The puzzles aren't meant to be challenging, but are meant to take you through the environment you're in. There are different puzzle mechanics that get introduced throughout the game that keeps the game interesting without making the introduction of he new mechanics abrupt.

[h1] Exploration [/h1]
Although RiME may seem linear, the player still has the option to explore their surroundings, often finding secrets or collectables; which can provide some lore (but it's totally optional and you don't need to collect them). The game isn't fully open world as you cannot explore places that are in different chapters from the one the player is in.

[h1] Music and Visuals [/h1]
The music in this game was breathtaking and the visuals were superb. The music for each setting really added to the atmosphere of the game; making you feel wonder at some times and fear at others. The art style is fitting for the story the game is telling and the visuals look really good in game. Giant structures would be imposing and the creatures within the game looked rather cute.

[h1] Story [/h1]
You uncover the story about the boy and the island as you progress through the game. Telling the story through the environment and symbolism rather than narration is, although not a new concept, very effective in RiME. The story is left up to interpretation by the player which makes it all the more interesting. As I was playing, I felt as though the story was pulling me in; I wanted to know more about where it was going which lead me to progressing throughout the entire game.
*In my opinion, the first 30 minutes of the game was to get the player used to the types of puzzles and mechanics that would be seen throughout the game. The story in this part of the game is not very apparent. However, RiME becomes much more interesting past this part and has good pace throughout the rest of the game*

[h1] Controls and Mechanics [/h1]
The controls are reletively simple, and the game would often prompt you as to what button you need to press to do something (e.g interact, throw, s c r e a m).  The player mechanics are just your average jump, drop, climb and scream. These mechanics can be a little janky though, at times I would be jumping to a climbable plank above me and I would fall instead of grabbing on. Climbable wouldn't be climbable past a certian point, which required me to get off and get back on again. The animation when jumping up a small ledge was a little awkward too, the boy would just look like he was sliding towards the ledge. You would also have to wait for a previous animation to end before screaming at something as well. Overall, platforming wasn't too difficult, it's just sometimes these awkward mishaps can be a litle annoying. 

[h1] Performance [/h1]
I would often drop frames in some areas for no particular reason and the game crashed twice in the 4.5 hours of playing even with the recommended specs.

[h1] Pricing [/h1]
I do understand that this is an indie game however $40 is pretty expensive for what you get out of the 5 hour game. I recommend buying RiME while on it's on sale (I got it for $20)

[h1] Conclusion and Recommendation [/h1]
In conclusion, RiME does have a couple of issues but overall it is an amazing experience and remains emersive throughout. The visuals and music help create the environment and atmosphere the player is in and it tells an interesting story. I don't think RiME is for everyone though, I recommend it to people who appreciate games that are there to take you on a journey and allow you to experience a story (or people who have free time and money to spend).

author: {'steamid': '76561198015965166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1544709020}
review:
Una vez que he acabado con el juego solo puedo decir cosas buenas sobre el. 

Un juego de plataformas bastante currado y entretenido, con una jugabilidad increíble que te hará que disfrutes de cada minuto que pases con el. El juego tiene una gran historia que va acompañada de una excelente banda sonora y una puesta en escena con unos decorados que te van a enamorar. Todo esto en su conjunto hace que Rime te toque la fibra como si de una gran pélicula se tratara. Si bien es verdad, que el juego es bastante sencillo (no hay posibilidad de morir o fallar) y que los puzzles que lo acompañan son facilones, pienso que lo primero compensa esto último. 

Para terminar, quizás pagar el precio completo por el juego es un tanto excesivo dado que no es muy largo, pero si tienes la oportunidad de obtenerlo con una buena oferta no lo dudes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269082534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1544369568}
review:
Nothing makes me happier as both a player and aspiring developer than seeing this genre of Journey-esque games grow with every beautiful contribution. I mention Journey because it was the first game like this that I got to experience first-hand. It is still one of my favorites, but I gotta say Rime grabbed my heart and squeezed more than Journey ever managed to do. 

I expected a quiet, beautiful puzzle game, which it ultimately was. But the emotional journey I went on was neither quiet nor beautiful considering I sat through the last minutes of the game as well as the end credits bawling my eyes out and slobbering all over my keyboard. I cry all the time, but you know something messed you up real bad when your nose clogs up and the tears mix with your snot (TMI I know). 

The level design was fantastic, both in the way the world was built and the puzzles. The game used subtle visual, auricular and narrative queues to guide you and every feature immersed you in the experience. It used a lot of classic concepts that, as a gamer, you are very familiar with, but in a way that made them feel unique and interesting. I loved all the shaders and VFX. The feature that allowed you to sing and hum and cower and cry depending on your surroundings was absolutely fantastic. When I got to the dark room where you lit a path by singing, the subtle melody of the boy's voice instantly brought tears to my eyes and it continued to do so throughout the game. The music and soundeffects took the game to a completely different level.

I was constantly amazed by the beauty of each area, my favorite being the [spoiler] beginning of Bargaining, the swampy area. I especially enjoyed the part where you walk through one door and without walking up any stairs arrive at another floor, and when you take the same route again end up somewhere completely different. And the part where you walk and walk but never get anywhere (although it was a little buggy). It felt like the game was playing with you. 

The whole five stages of grief thing was fantastic and you could see signs of each stage in everything about each level. The mood, the progression, the way you interacted with the world, the way the boy acted etc etc. The symbolism was brilliant in both the holistic experience and in the little details. And in the end when you finally realized the truth it hit you like a bag of bricks. /[/spoiler]

I bought this game during Black friday which means it was heavily discounted, but for everyone that missed that I would 100% buy this game for the full price. I didn't go out of my way to get any of the collectibles but it still took me 12+ hours to get to the end. This game will touch you in a way that feels personal and intimate, and that is a very rare and precious thing. I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037205959', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1544354694}
review:
[i]RiME[/i] is the emotional journey of a fragile boy in some mysterious world. He has to fight himself through puzzles and hostile encounters, sometimes with the help of friends he makes along the way, othertimes alone.
One of the first things I asked myself while playing was how this game hadn't even been nominated for best score during the 2017 game awards. The orchestral accompaniment carried the mood of the scene throughout the game, and, together with the character design of the wondrous protagonist, created a Ghibliesque experience.
There are many positive things to touch on, from the adaptive use of the action button ([spoiler]either shouting to activate something, or expressing the protagonist's mood when no objects are in range[/spoiler]), to the complex relationships with NPCs ([spoiler]e.g. the shades fearing the boy, then attacking, and later accepting him[/spoiler]), but the dev's biggest accomplishment is the story.
I'd recommend a playthrough to anyone who has a heart. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995123777', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1544316658}

review: A game in the style of Journey and Ico, but more like the former than the latter. The music is great; atmospheric and gentle. Controls so simple your mom could play it. No dying stress; the game checkpoints against fall death every few seconds it seems. And game save checkpoints are pretty plentiful too. Highly recommended if you enjoy games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845894249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1543938968}
review:
RiME is not just a regular platform/puzzle story game....no....it is so much more.I wasn't expecting anything other than thinking it was an adventure story game of finding a way home.

As I went through the game,the whole story starts to unfold.The story will hit you in the heart unprepared for what is to happen.It is an emotional and beautiful story that has left me more enlightened and grateful about certain things in my point of view.You will fall in love with the characters that you meet on your journey as you slowly uncover the real truth.

The Puzzles in the game doesn't take extreme thinking but leaves you at a medium level of difficulty.The only flaw that I found was the frame stuttering even with high end gear.(You can easily fix it just by tweaking the graphic settings lower, don't worry because the scenery of the game won't be hugely affected and you won't even notice a difference).

RiME is a masterpiece of a story driven game that will rock you at your core upon uncovering the secrets.This game has left me with an emotional state but learned lessons as well from it.


I recommend fully you try this game.Do prepare for what RiME has instore for you 😉

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198282335679', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 878, 'playtime_forever': 2100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1543933627}
review:
一個很好的解謎遊戲, 沒有高難度動作或戰鬥的要求, 人物生動自然, 早段的故事架構不錯, 有很多令人意想不到的好點子。
雖然標籤著開放世界, 但其實整個遊戲只是分成幾關, 每關都是獨立的很大的地圖, 經常會無法回去曾經走過的地方。
謎題的設計非常優秀, 不知道是否我想太多了, 初期我被誤導了好幾次, 明明很簡單的, 卻老是做著傻事。
喜歡尋寶的人也很適合玩, 大多數物品藏得很易察覺, 但也有幾個可能要靠攻略才能發現的寶物。
破關後可以直接選擇章節補完各收集項目。

關於全成就, 難的只有一個潛水的項目, 條件苛刻, 失敗後必須讀檔(很久), 否則不計數。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973430702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1543927001}
review: This game is a masterpiece. I cried at the end as it all came together. The puzzles are not the main point, and anybody going into this expecting to be taxed will leave disapointed, as they are more a way of tying the narrative together. Music, art design and emotional impact go together to create a game will bags of soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1543902995}
review:
A lovely game full of calm, almost dreamy exploration, as well as delightful and sad surprises. I strongly recommend it for [I]people like me[/I], realizing fully that others might find it boring and confusing.

The gameplay is generally linear but gives you as much time as you'd like to explore each level. There are environmental puzzles: not too challenging and yet still satisfyingly composed. And yet the puzzles are more like focal points for your attention, small moments along a grand path. The true core of the gameplay is exploration.

Exploration is rewarding. The levels are beautifully designed, and there are nooks and crannies from which you can peek at familiar vistas from new angles. Many people who dislike the gameplay still admit that it's visually breathtaking. And there are small secrets (collectibles) to be found for meaningful achievements. (You can return and collect all of them after you've finished the game, so don't fret.)

The unspoken narrative is more of a loose poem than tight prose, even though it does coalesce in the end. You can assemble meanings and feelings yourself or read that interview with Raúl Rubio Munárriz in which he explains the basic intent. But he was just one person on the dev team, and there are many layers. Good art can evoke many perspectives.

Some have reviewed this game as being boring and tritely sentimental. I can't argue against taste, but it seems that I value the things they find unimportant. Some say  a pale imitation of [I]Ico[/I], a game that likely inspired it. Well, I recently played [I]Ico[/I] on the PlayStation 2, and RiME is a vast improvement. It has more imaginative and diverse levels, more satisfying puzzles, and a more creative story. It's funny how nostalgia makes old games seem better than they are.

Finally, some criticism. What I can say is that [I]Ico[/I] achieved a lot with very little, and sometimes [I]RiME[/I] can seem too lush and crammed with ideas. It's a nice long game, but perhaps it would have been more poignant if it were more compact, the themes drawn together a bit more starkly.

And as many have pointed out, the game has technical difficulties. Frame rates are not great even on high-end hardware. You can overcome stuttering by reducing the graphics quality and even the resolution. The game will still be beautiful, trust me. I was specifically annoyed that I couldn't get my Xbox controller to work with it, even though it works fine in other Steam games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016800878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1543894740}
review: Well this was the first video game to make me cry. A lot. Sure the story isn't slapping you in the face like it is in so many other games, but that's what makes it so beautiful. To really understand and appreciate the story, you MUST take your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152514993', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1543847109}
review:
[h1]类型[/h1]
步行模拟
[h1]内容[/h1]
操纵小男孩收集物品或通过简单的机关开门，不断前进。主要包括四个章节场景。
主要剧情：[spoiler]讲述小男孩海难发生至他死去化作星辰前经历的幻象。[/spoiler]
游戏里小男孩说话基本靠吼“啊”，不会语言，所以你只要看得懂菜单上的英文就够了。
[h1]优点[/h1]
+画面美丽清新，画风柔和，音乐抒情。
[h1]缺点[/h1]
-移动缓慢。
-比较幼稚。
[h1]个人感想[/h1]
“幼儿版古墓丽影”。
如果是冲解谜来的，可以洗洗睡了，最大用处是看看风景。适合儿童和童心未泯的人玩。
小男孩的肤色有个非到深处自然欧的有趣变化，这是全篇最励志的地方。

author: {'steamid': '76561197987527101', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1543746938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1543796733}
review:
The game is very visually pretty but the puzzles are rather simple. 
Some of the items you get by exploring is probably where you would sink many hours of your first run. 
Some of those items are hidden extremely well. 
Took me 6+ hours to beat it and another 6 or so to get every item.
Soundtrack and effects are fantastic.
After your first playthrough, you can aim to get all the achiements cause they are easy to get which is sadly the only replayability of this game.

I would recommend but not sure on full price honestly, sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119622506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1674313478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098431658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1543722195}
review:
No narrative draw. No amazing moments like you would expect in this type of game (like Shadow of the Colossus). Most of the "gameplay" is doing tedious puzzles. I didn't finish it because I got bored, but I watched the walkthrough on 3x speed to skip the tedium and see if the game got any better. It didn't.

On reflection, if this were just a walking simulator (taking out the tedious "puzzles") then it would be more enjoyable. The atmosphere is great, but the pacing is very poor to the point that it frustrated me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215558185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1543727109}
review:
I wasn't very entertained with Rime and don't think there are many people I would recommend it to. Most of the gameplay is simple puzzle solving and an excessive amount of jogging/climbing, all of which I got tired of quickly. Also, towards the end of the game and the ending itself the story wasn't very well done, I get the feeling it was trying to make you feel sad but honestly when the "sad" things start happening I didn't really care, *spoilers* maybe if the main character and the creatures you meet along the way had a bit more development of some kind it would have been a bit more emotional but since there wasn't any of note it all felt pointless in the end.

Overall, I felt it was boring, and not very well-done story-wise. If you absolutely must get it wait for a sale because $36 (NZD) is not worth the below average experience.

(There's no rime or reason to play this game)
(Special needs child shouts at inanimate objects simulator)

author: {'steamid': '76561198083647219', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1543817525}
review:
“Just that,” said the fox. “To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you, I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world...”
                                                                                                                                                                        ---- Little Prince

author: {'steamid': '76561198197797211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1544206739}
review: Absolutely beautiful and meaningful. Recommended to those who seek atmosphere and adventure without complex or difficult gameplay, Non-violent, puzzles are easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815543992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1543681376}
review:
一开始有点3D晕眩加上没有常规的新手指引，差点退出，但被画面吸引坚持下来了，通关后庆幸没有弃游。总体来说瑕不掩瑜，是一款有遗憾但不失震撼的好游戏。
解谜方面：对新手相当友好。RIME可以算我正经的第一款解谜类游戏，在无新手指引的情况下也不需看攻略即可达成通关。
画风方面：清新朴素的画风，每一帧都可以截图当屏保，很美！
剧情方面：通关后看了一些评测，剧情方面褒贬不一。个人认为，RIME的剧情优秀而内敛，蕴含着制作者对“生与死”的思考，是整款游戏最大的亮点。虽然前期提示较少导致结局稍有突兀且反转猝不及防，但瑕不掩瑜！
成就方面：首次无攻略通关成就达成9/31，游戏内收集进度约四分之一。部分内容还是需要多次探索+运气才能达成。不过画集和音轨实在太美好了，另外做成就时也可以再回顾剧情，获得和首次玩不一样的感受。

PS：一个小小的提示！首通后章节选择界面的标题起的很好，有助于加深对剧情的理解。

author: {'steamid': '76561198315741159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1543693073}
review: Очень трогательная история, рассказанная без единого слова.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153176634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1543645338}
review:
Rime is an odd title but can it be a good game? I will be reviewing the game in a pro/ con style and end with my conclusion.

Pro:
     The graphics are beautiful. The game has a simplistic style that looks similar to journey, a cartoon like fantasy design for both worlds and characters. It kinda looks like zelda in a way.

     Gameplay is very nice. It is a platformer just like journey on PSN. There are a few puzzles that are not too hard but does compliment platforming parts quite often.

     Music is magic. Again you can not expect anything but the best emotional music from a game that is similar to journey. The music is used to protray mood of the characters or to add a layer of depth in the world with the ambient audio. The sound effects are pretty one point too.

     Story is super. The story is told through both cutscene and music. The game goes the path of show not tell which leads to quite a theatrical experience where your not being told how to feel or whats going on. The story is told with 0 dialogue and like ive been saying a thousand times, just like journey. There is more emotional impact that a player feels with the show not tell tactic in games.

Conclusion:
     Fime is a super game, you can see a good emotional story experience. Just like journey on PSN the game is an emotional rollercoaster and is worth playing from start to finish. Each stage in the game is unique and the music compliments both the world and the emotional impact of the game. I can reccomend this game because it has so much going for it and the feels are real.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002285053', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1543038681}
review: If you like Journey or Abzu, you'd probably like this game.  Unfortunately, I wasn't a fan of those games, so RiME wasn't for me, as it's more or less a walking simulator.  Yes, RiME has puzzles, but they're very simple and easy.  That said, I will say that some of them are interesting mechanically and could be made into fun puzzles if they had more of a challenge.  I think the story in RiME could have been pushed a little more, as I basically didn't pick up on any of it until I talked the game over with a friend, and he didn't even get it until he looked stuff up online.  I will say that the game does do a good job of leading and teaching the player though.  Oh, and the art is very pretty, especially their skyboxes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012104962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1562526198}
review:
Beware before playing this game: RiME is less a game than it is a story.  Those who, like me, play games for the story will find much to like about RiME.  Those who play games as games might be less enthusiastic in their comments.  In particular, I've read several reviews which complain that the puzzles in RiME are too straightforward, and they are.  This did not bother me so much because I was more interested in the story unfolding as I progressed through the game.  The puzzles are there, not to make you think, but to suggest things about the plot unfolding before you.  The visuals and the settings are superb in conveying a particular mood, and the mood changes as you progress.  Like a good book, you find you want to keep going further into the narrative; and it isn't until you come up for air at the end that you realize just how invested you became.

My recommendation? Play RiME as an experience, not as a game.  Play as it a story rather than something to beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028441242', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1543609349}
review:
RiME is an adventure-platformer videogame developed by Spanish indie developing team Tequila Works. The whole premise is really simple: your playable character is a kid who find himself cast away on a seemingly deserted island filled with the ruins of a civilization long gone. He must proceed to navigate the (at times) dangerous new environment with the help of a magical fox companion in order to find a way to escape.

It's pretty clear that the developers took a lot of gameplay and atmosphere clues from the Team ICO games. Putting aside the premise itself and the design of pretty much everyone and everything, the gameplay is all about leading your young protagonist throught the various, breath-taking areas and solve some puzzles or otherwise manipulate the environment in order to escape danger or to advance.

While RiME doesn't reach the unforgettable status of its inspiration, the result is still a really enjoyable experience. The gameplay is simple yet enjoyable and the controls, especially during the purest platforming sequences, are comfortable, at the very least most of the time. The puzzles you are presented along the journey aren't especially hard, but they are varied and entertaining enough in their own right. The atmosphere, the characters and the minimalist, cartoony art style are most definitely endearing and make go throught the game a very enjoyable and relaxing experience. It also helps that the areas after the first one, the Island proper, are varied enough and each feature its own theme and elements. The soundtrack also enhances the mood perfectly.

RiME's major drawback is most definitely its kinda short lenght: an average player will be able to complete it in under five hours or so. That said, the game's world is filled with hidden collectables and hard-to-reach secrets that may increase the overall longevity a great deal, should you have the will and patience to find them all

author: {'steamid': '76561198068928905', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1543691011}
review: This game is so amazing! The controlls (on keyboard) are a bit odd sometimes, but the story and design og the game is really good.  The puzzle-solving is really clever. This "universe" in the game is very magical in a peacefull way. This game i worth you time and money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198322959231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1543548174}
review:
猝、猝不及防的反转结局。。前期清爽色调海岛风景太醉人，后期深海恐惧黝黑洞穴鬼影重重甚至追逐战本游戏瓜农胆战心惊。解密比较简单，基本上车到山前必有路。找收集品探索小路蛮有趣的但是对于游戏剧情和结局没有影响，到后期我已经慌的一批，凡是到了黑黢黢的狭窄的幽深的地方我都尽快过，所以基本一个物件都没收集。。。哦对了，我最慌的还是深海，每次在洞穴里看到一汪绿油油的潭水上面还浮着水藻，然后跳下去一路往下钻我都会头皮发麻好一会。
虽然整体下来我觉得还是蛮开心的，但是以后知道有这样的紧张过程就不会玩了。还好游戏难度不大，要是在那些地方卡关我就疯了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024947353', 'num_games_owned': 1731, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1543533061}
review: Gameplay is mostly linear and there's no combat or health mechanics, just puzzles/platforming/exploration. The story is darker than I expected, and the game does a great job of capturing more serious as well as light hearted moods. The music and visual design are beautiful and I love the quality and variety of atmospheres. I'd definitely recommend this to adventure genre fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148801901', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1543507795}

喜欢这个画面和音乐，解迷也挺轻松的，每一个章节的故事也挺治愈的，但总体来说比较伤感...

author: {'steamid': '76561198348851757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1549233852}
review: Muy buena ambientación, jugabilidad y banda sonora. La estética mediterranea tipo Sorolla está muy bien lograda. El personaje emociona sin una sola palabra. Este tipo de juegos me encantan y más si son españoles. FELICIDADES

author: {'steamid': '76561197972234665', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1543358496}
review:
I so wish I could leave a neutral rating. I thought about dropping a bad review, but that would not be fair. I finished RiME in round about 8 hours. And I loved it for seven of those. 

It all starts with a young boy waking up at the beach of a mysterious, foreign land. There are no other people, but old, ancient ruins. So we have our lad run about Tomb Raider style, jumping, climbing, swimming, diving, solving puzzles and riddles, trying to find out where we are.

This journey is a most beautiful one. The graphic style is simple, but colorful and very well made. It reminds of The Witness and Firewatch. Not one word is spoken throughout the game, the whole story is being told through pictures. Lovely nature sounds and an orchestral sound track wonderfully add to the atmosphere.

What seriously spoiled the game for me was the ending. I can not go too deep into detail, but I believe it's safe to say that at the end, nothing of the bright happiness is left. Watch the trailers on Steam. They show how the game begins. The ending will be the total opposite. The trailers make RiME appear as the perfect puzzle game for the entire family, your kids included, and YES for the very most part it actually is! The puzzles are not really challenging, the world, the young boy, the little fox, everything is super cute and there will be a lot of bright smiles while you play. Just if you let your kids play RiME, pray that they never make it to the end.  Or have paper tissues ready. 

This is not what I expected from reading the game description or watching the trailers and I feel a bit betrayed. I believe finishing a game should leave you satisfied. Yes, some games have sad endings, some games have a dark theme too so that you are prepared for what there is to come. And even sad endings can be positive in a way.  But RiME just left me sad and empty. I hoped that after the credits there would be something, a hint, a picture, anything that would make me feel better, but there was nothing. Yes. yes. I do understand the message behind the story. But I believe RiME was not the right game for such messages.

So I still recommend playing RiME for all the beauty that is has...but if you hate sad endings, skip this one.

review: 没有一句对白，但小男孩与狐狸的互动却胜过千言万语。没有一处旁白，但却能把故事讲得如此凄美动人。这款游戏的美就如他的风格一样，无法用言语完美表达。我愿意用脚走遍游戏里每一个角落，即便我知道哪里没有道具；我愿意双手离开键盘就这样盯着屏幕，听上一小会BGM。这款游戏不论是美术风格还是配乐的处理都堪称完美，如果你想暂时逃离压力重重的工作和生活，想寻求一处宁静的港湾，这款游戏说不定适合你。

review: RiME is an exploration game with puzzle elements layered on top. It is a game about the exploration of its visually vibrant and beautifully mysterious world. author: {'steamid': '76561198069420601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1581295888}
review:
Update:

I've finished the game, and I still recommend it! Very replayable to explore more, as there are many secrets on the island. The storyline is great - I'm glad I avoided spoilers. 

My playtime is really more like 11 hours because I tried a lot to go for the achievements at the beginning (there are so many collectibles and hidden areas), then lost steam in the end to just beat the game and finish the story. The rest 5 hours were AFK by accident.

=== === ===

(Review in progress)

Didn't really expect much going in - had seen a little bit of @Monukai streaming this game and that's it.

Environmental exploration with lots of secrets. I kept noticing areas that seem like you could get to, but weren't linear for the story progression. Sometimes there's achievements for figuring it out!

Wasn't sure about the art style at first, but it really grew on me.

Cute collectibles that are in theme.

The main chapters are getting more and more serious, in the sense that it feels like I will discover some sort of lost civilization. The level designers made it a joy to explore.

Overall I'm looking forward to finishing it, Still have some more chapters to go!

review:
It's a fantastic game in visuals, a story that is told without actual words and the music is on point. Besides that, its a relaxing game which draws you into its world.
