author: {'steamid': '76561197970792772', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1541299695}
review:
If you liked Ico, you should buy this.  While it's not quite as good as Ico itself is, it shares many characteristics of it (a puzzle platformer with no spoken dialogue in a beautiful setting laden with the feels).

Puzzles are well designed, with a few core mechanics used consistently but with slightly different twists each time, so they are familiar enough to solve without getting boring.

Platforming is straightforward and forgiving; there's a few times you can get lost or miss the cues about where to go next, but the controls handle well and if you do miss a jump you're usually landed right back ready for another go without losing any progress.  (The jumps themselves tend to err on the forgiving side; on occasion your character will visibly not quite make the jump but the game will let you latch on and continue anyway rather than dropping you into the void.  I consider this a good thing.)  There are a few spots where it probably would have been better to use a controller (due to camera angles and needing to do the two-key running shuffle), but I played through using keyboard and mouse just fine.

The environments are beautiful (especially at the beginning, although later chapters are still beautiful in a different way).  The only downer here is that on my system (which is not the best, but is reasonably decent) there are quite a few spots where it's unable to maintain a stable 60 FPS, so wide angle camera motion in particular can sometimes suffer a bit.  As this only really happened during cinematic transitions it never particularly affected gameplay.

There is a definite story in the game, although it's one that's best experienced for yourself, and since it is of the "silent but evocative" type, in some cases each person might come away with a slightly different idea of what story it was actually telling, somewhat informed by their own experiences.  But this is fine, and as long as you see it through to the end (and avoid spoiling yourself beforehand) you should get something good out of it.  Several articles have been written based on interviews with the game's creators as well as other people's experiences of the story, but you really should try to avoid reading these until you've played it through at least once on your own.

For the explorers and completionists, it comes with a healthy number of hidden secrets, collectibles, and achievements, which you can either spend time hunting down on your first playthrough or use the Chapter Select feature to jump back later on to collect things you missed.  (There are only one or two things that are actually impossible to find on your first playthrough, although unless you're very thorough you're likely to miss quite a bit more than that.)

Overall, again: if you like this sort of thing, you should play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092126420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1541293621}
review:
10/10
The mix of story telling, puzzles, gameplay and strategy are on point. You really connect to the story, I don't think I have ever been so sad but also happy to finish a game. Left me in tears. 

Graphics are a fantastic parallel to what is mentioned above.

Highly recomend getting a controller and sitting on the couch to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965811013', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1541291219}
review: I connected on an emotional level with this game more than nearly all games. The Houser Brothers wish they could invoke these kind of feelings, let along being able to do it without any dialogue. I'm not crying. You're crying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005738166', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1541271154}
review:
Красиво, однообразно, скучно.
Очень красивая и атмосферная игра. Попадая в первую локацию, хочется заглянуть в каждый уголок, исследовать всё что можно, головоломки почти незаметны и наслаждению процессом отдаёшься полностью. А дальше начинается скука и однообразие. Головоломки никак не меняются, сбивается темп игры и беготня становится рутиной. До последних минут игры подаваемая история не очень ясна, поэтому геймплейные пробелы очень сильно выделяются. Но стоит заметить, что заблудиться в игре очень сложно, тебе всегда намекнут в каком направлении двигаться и что нужно сделать.
После прохожедния негативных эмоций осталось больше чем позитивных.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1541275651}
review:
Ever since Ico became popular I've seen a lot of games attempt doing something similar - a puzzle and platforming 3D game with no spoken narration, simple but beautiful artstyle, moving music and some central concept/idea to it all. And as more and more indie developers became enabled to use powerful engines that allow creating something mechanically simple, but beautiful and, hopefully, evocative, the amount of games of this type went up dramatically. RiME is just another example of this type of game. Made with lots of care, genuinely good looking, with a good story concept behind it and yet all too familiar, not particularly fun and ultimately forgettable.

The big issue RiME has lies in the fact that the game never really gets anything to truly hook you with. You run, jump, climb and scream at things to solve problems as you start the game, and that's all you do until the end, with all of these basic mechanics being rather bland. There's never any clever challenge or strategy involved with the platforming bits as they just use the modern approach to 3D platforming where you go along the only (and usually obvious) path, clearly outlined and never need to think where you are in space. Puzzles suffer from a bizarre decision to make action button work only after a short pause after a full stop and scream not working at times if another animation is playing, meaning you always come to a full stop, wait a bit and then hope that you can perform the action necessary, which isn't helping already mundane puzzle design.

And the game never properly knows if it wants to be about exploration or not, as it would give you a bunch of things to collect throughout the game world, and give you an open space, but then can just push you into a linear path when you least expect it with no way to backtrack and see if you've missed anything. In addition right from the start it gives you one of the most obnoxious "guide" I've encountered in games - a magic fox that barks (more like yaps) to "help" you find the way. With the issue being that it always does it either when there's only one way you can take, or when it's somewhere offscreen and you can't possibly know how to get to it, making it useless and annoying in both cases. And not helping if you're trying to explore.

There's no good story or even mood hook either. There's an attempt at one, but when the revelation of what this game is all about comes, it feels unexpected because the game never actually delivers on that mood at any point prior to that. Like if I'd start showing you my ninth grade pictures while punk rock plays and then at the end tell that this experience was meant to help you understand how to make better pasta. It's not completely unrelated because I like pasta, but... It still doesn't feel like that's what the experience was supposed to be about.

Not that the game doesn't try to be interesting and evocative. It does look good, it does sound good (sans that annoying fox), there are a few puzzles that aren't boring and there are moments that are genuinely interesting. And there is a certain desire to make the game feel as varied as it could. It's just that this isn't enough and it's one of those instances where after finishing the game in 5 hours you feel drained as if you spent the entire day and all your energy on it without really getting anything in return.

RiME seems to have its heart in the right place and it does feel like it tried to be an interesting moving and beautiful journey. But it's not what it turned out to be. It's not a game you should be specifically avoiding and maybe you would have some good times with it, just wondering around and enjoying the look and the mood of the areas. But I can't recommend specifically purchasing the game unless you get it as part of some bundle as your time and money would be better spent elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979860899', 'num_games_owned': 1192, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1541255837}
review:
Даже после второго прохождения остается целая буря эмоций.
Очень красивое и невероятно грустное приключение с довольно простыми загадками.
Собирательство вещей и достижений заводит в самые дальние уголки этого мира.
Каждый этап - олицетворение своего названия, которое можно увидеть после прохождения игры.

Единственный минус- ужасная оптимизация, с которой до сих пор ничего не сделано.
Игра однозначно стоит своих денег, тем более на момент написания этого отзыва ее можно купить в бандлах
на Fanatical и Humble Bundle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088547612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1541799812}
review:
Bello da giocare per gli amanti dei puzzle ambietali e arrampicate come il sottoscritto, ma non mi ha emozionato e affascinato come Submerged o Papo YO.

Ottimo Level Design e Comparto Tecnico, 6 ore sono passate come il vento.

Però ho odiato i livelli sott'acqua se non siete amanti delle nuotate ansiogene, preparati a bestemmiare nella sezione centrale del gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070556418', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1541251248}
review:
慈善包里面的惊喜，唯美的画面，几乎满分的BGM，不算太难的解密（也许是缺点？）

缺点：部分时候光线太暗，听说优化较差（不过我没遇到掉帧的现象），流程中有些跑路的部分比较枯燥费时间

综合7分（建议进包时购入）

author: {'steamid': '76561198327335751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1541240934}
review:
Never before I've written a review, but this gem certainly deserves it - so here it is :)
I really enjoyed the graphics, it looks beautiful! In the beginning, it was not entirely clear (at least to me), to what purpose this adventure would take you - you only get a glimpse at the real purpose bit by bit as you go further. And without spoiling too much - I was really crying at some times during the game, because the story is more than moving and intensely emotional. 
That's what great storytelling is for me - even without complex fights or gaming mechanics, which I found very nice and relaxing for a change. As some pre-writers said before, the puzzles you encounter don't need a genius to solve, but are nevertheless beautifully made and very enjoyable.
If you like games like Abzu or The Journey , you'll probably like this great game here as well! :) 
Definetly worth every cent :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049156087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1541260595}
review:
3人称視点探索アクション
クリアまで6時間程度遊べた
テレビゲームにとってフレームレートがいかに重要か教えてくれるゲーム
完全に最適化不足、屋内でも遠景オブジェクトを全描画してるんじゃないかってくらい重い
主人公は走り方がやたらフェミニンな少年
ゲーム性はABZUやAERみたいなほぼ敵が出ないタイプの遺跡探索ゲーム
オープンワールドっぽいけど進むと後ろを仕切られるタイプの伝統的アクション
青く光ってるオブジェクトの近くで叫んで玉が飛び出せば、それが進行ギミック
収集要素はやたら多い、おもちゃと石版の欠片と貝殻と鍵穴とコスチューム
女の霊に全部触るとエンディングの演出が少し変わるらしい
フィールドの広さの割に移動速度が遅いのと低fpsが相まってイライラが止まらない
画質の割にマシンスペックの要求が高過ぎ
日本語UI有り、箱丸コン対応

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1541190455}
review:
Here the list of what i don't like in Rime :

 [list]
    [*]This game is literally way darker than his advertisement screenshots. We explore a lot of underground area, maybe half of the game, so be warned, this is bloddy dark down here... The pretty island is just the front door.

    [*]The game do not drag me into his ... i wanted to say story, but this is precisely what he lacks the most, when the main thing you end up doing is shouting to crank up brazier... and break up amphora... this is not even a side quest, but this is  the kind of regular interaction you get with the world for all of the game...

    [*]This game give you so few elements to process, you can leave you mind go his on way while playing, this is really a strange felling. But at least you can work on your review. Maybe i didn't get this game right, and YOU have to build you own story...i did this game in autopilote.
[/list] 

Maybe I am too old for this, and i fell that the target audience is between  12 and 16.
Too bad steam does not give this kind of info.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042112617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1541257145}
review:
Don't buy this full priced, so glad I got it when it was on sale the other day.

If you liked Journey on Sony's consoles, you're probably going to like this one. Buyer beware though, this game is VERY BADLY optimized due to it's lighting gimmicks. Even if you have a decently high end rig you're still going to experience lag at certain places and will have to drop settings lower.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981685652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1541135879}
review:
Игра отстой. При достаточно простой графике тормозит. Пришлось играть при разрешении 720p, так извините, в таком разрешении в ведьмака 3 можно было играть на радеоне 6970 при настройках выше среднего, а тут фури х еле тянет.

История отстой. Сначала всю игру бегаешь такой загадочный в стиле "и что всё это значит", и потом тебе за пять последних минут рассказывают, и вдруг игра заканчивается.

Отсутствие контента и игрового процесса пытаются компенсировать, понукая собирать ненужные картиночки, а то типа я и так мало бегаю по десять раз туда-сюда.

Ленивые программисты + ленивые сценаристы = зря потраченное время и деньги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202173540', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1543163604}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017239697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1541270097}

author: {'steamid': '76561198332321244', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1541108706}
review:
RiME  ist ein weiteres wunderschönes Beispiel dafür, wie man eine absolut liebevoll gestaltete Welt auch ohne Worte entdecken kann und dabei trotzdem emotional an seine Umgebung und den Hauptcharakter gebunden wird. Der Soundtrack untermalt dabei das ganze Spiel wundervoll und passend. Die Story und Hintergründe des Spiels werden einem nicht, wie man es von anderen Spielen gewöhnt ist, ins Gesicht geworfen, sondern müssen vom aufmerksamen Auge des Spielers entdeckt werden. Das Spiel mutet recht linear an, doch entfaltet es seine wirkliche Größe, wenn man vom offensichtlichen Weg abweicht und den kleinen Hinweisen in der Welt nachgeht, die einem nach und nach vom Schicksal des kleinen Protatgonisten erzählen. Die Rätsel sind nicht wirklich schwer und man könnte auch ohne das Spiel zu kennen relativ leicht und schnell durchrennen, aber das braucht RiME gar nicht. RiME erzählt eine Geschichte und es erzählt sie nur dem, der bereit ist sie zu finden.

Der Preis von 35 Euro ist für 7-8 Stunden Spielzeit etwas teuer, aber im Sale lohnt es sich definitiv zuzuschlagen und sich mal einen Nachmittag freizunehmen um das Spiel durchzuspielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105445916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1541119041}
review:
RiME is a game with strong artistic design that lacks two of the most important elements in video games: a compelling story or fun gameplay. While its graphics are intriguing, the sound is mediocre with its focus on ambience rather than melody. There is practically no story for at least the first hour of gameplay, leaving you with little desire to aid this character on his quest. 

But its worst flaw is the fact that the gameplay lacks any dimension: between the simplistic "puzzles", generic platforming, and lack of any danger, RiME sacrifices fun for a sort of postmodern, minimalist, atmospheric art experiment. I HATE when games do this; this is not art, its laziness by the developers. Ultimately, RiME is a poor game not worth your time or money. Perhaps it would have been interesting as a short film, but here it just fails.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028866898', 'num_games_owned': 3672, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1541083052}
review: 震撼， 剧情优秀，玩到最后才知道是什么样的故事， 整体比较悲伤也比较励志。好游戏10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971135131', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1541070629}
review: De très beaux graphismes, une excellente bande son, un personnage très maniable, une ambiance réussie... RiME a malheureusement 2 gros défaut : son gameplay et sa durée de vie. Dans ce jeu, on passe beaucoup de temps a marcher, à résoudre quelques énigmes simples (en activant des objets au toucher ou par le cri, en alignant son point de vue, en poussant des blocs etc.) et il y a un peu de plateforme (mais ce n'est pas un platformer, ça ne demande pas d'adresse). Le jeu est divisé en chapitres et est linéaire. RiME n'est pas un jeu narratif, l'histoire est complètement en retrait et n'est dévoilée qu'à la fin. Le tout dure entre 4 et 6 heures. A 35 euros c'est trop cher au vu des faiblesses de gameplay, mais le jeu reste relativement plaisant. Prenez le en solde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272116660', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1447381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1711605398}
review:
当光芒快要吞噬我的那一瞬间。
我想起那些陪我一路走来却又离去的小狐狸和独眼怪。
还有那些我曾经一路走来的风景和一路克服的艰难险阻。
但最后依旧没有出现希望。
原来至始至终都只是我一个人的幻想和坚持。
我太累了，所以纵身从塔顶跃下。
让这一切结束吧。
……
当最后那块红布飘向远方的一刹那。
屏幕前那个面无表情的我突然哭得像个孩子。

author: {'steamid': '76561198196586855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1541038899}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050850033', 'num_games_owned': 1367, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1542832845}
review: A beautiful emotional experience, that stays with you long after you've finished playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014088079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1545092602}
review:
Visuals and overall atmosphere are heavily influenced by Shadow of the Colossus, Studio Ghibli films, and a little Jim Henson's Dark Crystal.  It's an amazing, amazing A/V experience.  However, the gameplay is good, too!   The controls are tight and responsive, there's a shockingly wide range of things to do, and you can tell that the devs polished the hell out of the experience to make it as natural and flowing as possible.  For example, the game regularly introduces new goals and gameplay types without ever providing explicit instructions or using words at all, yet you are given enough clues to quickly figure out what to do.  It's very elegantly designed.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082713718', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1543206392}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102968777', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1540987733}
review:

BGM也很好评，正太也好评，还有个狐狸也好评……正太和狐狸的故事。[spoiler] emmm，好像跑题了……	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1540979258}
review:
Story hits like a truck. Maybe because it's unexpected, dream kind of mythological story can be moving. First there is charm since it doesn't matter where we are looking this game is simply gorgeous. Soon enough there is much more... Good enough riddles and navigation everything is intuitive which is important considering exploration potential. There are many collectables so 6 hours is not equivalent to the possible time.

It's safe to say that "Rime" can be played and enjoyed by everyone. Without spoiling the story value, gameplay beside riddles is offering platforming sections and moving objects. It is fine sometimes I feel like movements are brutally restricted, only by the lighted edges. Bringing possibility to fail some jumps cause of clunky keyboard controls. Other than that I didn't find anything annoying.

Music is great and adding up shadows and occasional day and night cycles it's cool. Travelling through locations is real joy for the eye. Definitely they implemented some fresh gimmicks to the riddles, problem is that the game became mostly one way ticket. It's hard to feel into this more without words. Yes this game has no dialogues except shout interaction, yet it is incredibly well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970405203', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1693325294}
review:
Wonderful journey.
Graphics and musics are great.
Puzzles are not too hard and enjoyable.
Controls are OK and the camera works well.
The game runs well, but sometimes it strangely shows less than 30fps, even on my settings (6700k@4.6Ghz 1080ti 16Gb RAM) with AA desactivated.

Artists of Tequila Works made a incredible job : the world is beautiful, the under-the-rain level is incredible, you really feel the rain.

Play this game if you liked Ico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089323010', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1540908323}
review:
The game itself has some flaws, performance could have been better, and price is way to high for a game that you can finish around in 7 hours, more if you really take your time and explore while enjoying the graphics. 
The graphics are something I would call beautiful and artistic, while the game is simple and even an absolute moron could play it.
The story, unless you're so fortified in yourself and force yourself to not feel anything, will make you cry at the end.


If the game is on sale, it's definitely worth it. If it's not on sale, I would rather watch someone else play it on youtube and buy 10 good books for those 30 Euros.
Then again, I find it hard to justify shelling out 10+ Euros on any video game unless it comes with a gold bar.



Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995558172', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1540933700}
review:
Ani nevím co napsat, protože nehraji tento typ her, náhodně jsem zakoupil na Humble. Tak prostě vysypu myšlenky.

Klady:
+Konec mně vyrazil dech, příběh je super, nečekal jsem to.
+Atmosféra je skvělá, nevěděl jsem co si mám myslet, ale byl jsem celou dobu na špičkách.
+Grafika perfektně stylizovaná, neměl jsem sebemenší výtku, líbila se mi.
+Hudba perfektní, přesně pasuje, tak akorát.
+Ovládání responsivní bez problémů (gamepad X360).
+Délka přibližně 5 hodin, chtěl jsem jednohubku.. dostal jsem jednohubku.

Neutrální:
+/-Puzzly jsou fajn (občas excelentní), ale repetitivní, nejsem zrovna myslitel, ale vyřešil jsem valnou většinu sám, takže obtížnost je snadná.
+/-Level design je okey, občas to moc natahují, což mě nebavilo.

Zápory:
-Optimalizace špatná, na i5 skylake, GTX970 jsem se dostával až na 30 FPS, na High nastavení, což není dobrá vizitka.
-Zbytečné natahování herní doby.

Celkově hodnocení 7/10 a doporučení, pokud chcete zkusit něco jiného. Ten konec mě dostal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993196551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1541346359}

review:
So pretty. Great characters. Like controlling a beautiful Saturday morning cartoon. A bit too dark at times, but that usually means there is something hidden near by. Not really difficult but well thought out.

The main story though is obvious and nothing new or special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006357460', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1606074022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070405731', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1540907431}
review:
One of those games made with soul. You can tell a lot of passion was put into this.
Positive aspects: The visuals are great, sound effects and soundtrack are AMAZING, a few different areas that makes the gameplay very refreshing, some friends you will meet during the story, and a last part and ending that... are... just wow.
The game also has a lot of different collectables very relevant to the main story, which adds a bit of replayability.

Things that could have been better/improved: Puzzles (except a couple, they were simple and lacking originality). Duration (I completed the game finding half the collectables in 5 hours). Controls (a bit clunky time to time on some jumps/platforming). None of this negative aspects are really too relevant tho, the game is still enjoyable!

Grab it on sale!
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035322871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1540975618}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996622104', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1540919542}
review:
I usually like collectables and achievements, but this game shouldn't have them. They were fine for maybe the first hour in to the game. After that it felt wrong and kind of sad everytime I thought about where I could find collectibles for 100% completion, or checked the achievements so I wouldn't miss them, because those were second missed soaking in the atmosphere of the game. After completing the game, the feeling grew hundred times stronger. I want those seconds back.

If you play the game, play it alone, headphones on, cellphone off and forget about the extra crap in the game. You can collect and achieve on a second playthrough, just breath in the game on the first one, because the game will never be the same afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1540819235}
review:
Wonderful game! Great artistic achievement, beautiful visuals, perfect music, charming moments and touching story. Puzzles and platforming isn't that hard but if you miss something you can stuck for couple minutes but not for long, this game is more about story, mystery and bringing feelings than anything else, this is not dark souls :) 

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983948715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1540771291}
review:
Grafik und Soundtrack ist gut. Story wird durch Visuals erzählt.
Jedoch hatte ich mir tatsächliche Puzzles erhofft und wurde in dieser Hinsicht sehr entäuscht. Die "Rätsel" sind leider meiner Meinung nach nicht vorhanden. Stattdessen handelt es sich hier nur um ein Erkundungsspiel, in dem ab und zu eine Box auf einen Schalter geschoben wird...
Es gibt ein paar nette Momente, aber die genügen nicht um tatsächlich zu überzeugen.
Mit knappen 4 Stunden Spielzeit ist es recht kurz, da es jedoch nicht wirklich was zu tun gibt wäre eine längere Spielzeit eher negativ gewesen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031569409', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1540815283}
review:
Very good ambiance and immersion, interesting puzzles, touching story, the world is very beautiful in exterior (way less in interior), music and FX create a nice ambiance. 

You will need a good computer to play it in High graphic settings.

I get it on cheap via a current Humble Bundle, I finished it on GOG before. It take around 7h to finish it without looking for collectibles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006606663', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1540793940}
review:
Just a fantastic journey start to finish.

This is a game you can play in a long sitting.  I would say 7-8 hours, I did the whole thing on a Sunday.  You can tell it was made with a ton of heart.  Excellent 3D platformer, clever puzzles, story isn't over-bearing but it is very touching and impactful.  Movement was sharp and very connected.  

If I had to gripe, there was occationally some visual artifacts and glitches when the camera was moving to a specific device but they were only for a split second and had no effect on gameplay.

Complete recommendation, just a great effort and a fun game to play (even family friendly).

author: {'steamid': '76561198084389822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1542601794}
review:
This is one of the games or nonviolence driven adventures, where you are to explore wonderful enviroments and discover secrets along the way. The story as you piece it together is very charming, the style of the game really suits it atmosphere. 
Similar to games like Journey, Abzu, Ico, Papo y Yo, Tale of Two Brothers...
I had some issues with framerate and a rare instance where sound was cut off completely for a second or so. It was very minor but there might be more depending on your Rig, the changes in graphics quality doesn't seem to major so I wouldnt say playing in Ultra is necesary by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981476197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1540771756}
review: Was für ein Spiel. Wer Journey mag und ein entspanntes Wochenende in einer absolut schönen Spielwelt verbringen will, sollte zugreifen. Wer ein Zelda erwartet, kriegt was anderes. ;p Es gibt in dem Spiel kein Kampfmechaniken. Dafür aber diese Panoramen zum Erkunden. Die Story ist nicht aufdringlich, aber hat ihre Meta-Ebene die sie durchdacht und nicht zu verkopft umsetzt. Das Spiel startet mit kindlichen Entdeckerdrang und wird mit der Zeit etwas düsterer und melancholisch. Macht das Gesamtkonzept und die Story aber nur runder und beeindruckender. Kann aber auch sein, dass es nicht ganz das Kinderspiel ist, für das man es erst halten könnte. Durchgespielt hat man das Game in 6-8 Stunden. Was mir positiv auffiel, keine unnötigen Längen, einfach eine runde Spielerfahrung. Technisch ist das Spiel ressourcen-hungriger als gedacht. Wer ohne Action gelangweilt ist, darf weiter gehen, der Rest sollte RiME seine Chance geben, die hat es sich verdient, aber so was von!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980700456', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1540768256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044256109', 'num_games_owned': 1187, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1540702604}
review:
In this game you play the boy from Ico chasing the dude from Journey with the help of Okami's little fox cousin. Overall has great potential but falls a bit flat, missing a coat of polish. Things are a bit blocky and sometimes unresponsive and glitchy.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085642525', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1540674242}
review:
===[ Game overview ]===
RiME is a game about a boy who washed up on an island, after waking up he wanders off the shore and deeper into the island. He begins solving puzzles to progress further and ends up coming across a fox who helps him navigate the island and in doing so, he and the fox become friends. Through his puzzle solving and exploration, he uncovers a story. The further he goes the more he uncovers.

===[ Target Audience ]===
☐ Kids
☑ Everyone
☐ Casual players
☐ Good players
☐ Pro players
{Though some puzzles can be confusing, you'll surely get the hang of what to do and how to do it.}

===[ Graphics and Environment ]=== 
☐ Really bad
☐ Bad
☐ Ok
☐ Good 
☐ Beautiful 
☑ Masterpiece
{I found both the graphics and environment absolutely stunning. It gave me a Shadow of the Colossus/The Last Guardian feel. Even though the art style is simplistic, it doesn't at all take away from the overall feel of the game. The environment only adds to the overall immersion.}

===[ Requirments ]=== 
☐ 90' PC
☐ Minimum
☑ Medium 
☐ Fast
☐ High end 
☐ NASA computer
{Though you don't need a beast of a computer to play this game, it can be hard on your PC in certain areas. There were times where I would drop down to about 30FPS, with my average being 60FPS. But that's nothing lowering the graphics can't fix, and trust me when I say, lowering the graphics doesn't effect how the game looks, or at least it didn't for me.}

===[ Gameplay ]=== 
☐ Boring
☐ Ok
☐ Fun
☐ Very Fun
☑ Amazing
{I found the gameplay to be amazing. Though I did take breaks, that was only to rest my eyes. I didn't find myself getting bored with this game for a sinlge second.}

===[ Sound/Music ]===
☐ Poor
☐ Ok
☐ Good
☐ Great
☑ Masterpiece
{Along with the graphics and environment, the sound and music was breathtaking. The music added even more to the environment, it is as if they worked in tandem with one another.}

===[ Difficulty ]=== 
☐ You just need 2 arms 
☐ Easy
☑ Medium
☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master 
☐ Hard
☐ Dark Souls
{Though this game isn't hard by any means, it can still be difficult at some parts.}

===[ Game time/length ]=== 
☐ Really short ( 0 - 2 hours)
☑ Short ( 2 - 8 hours)
☐ Few hours ( 8 - 12 hours)
☐ Long ( 12+ hours)
☐ Endless
{I beat it in just under 5 hours. It may not be a long game, But what it lacks game length, it makes up for with good graphics, environment, music, and story.}

===[ Story ]=== 
☐ It doesn't have
☐ Average
☐ Good
☐ Very good
☑ Fantastic
{Instead of the story being told to you, it's rather shown to you through picture and visuals. This adds so much to the story as its relies less of your ears and more on your imagination.}

===[ Bugs ]=== 
☐ Game itself is one big BUG
☐ Bugs destroyed the game
☐ Lot of bugs
☐ Few Bugs
☐ Sometimes
☑ Nothing
{I didn't come across a single bug.}

===[ Final rating ]=== 
☑ 10/10

===[ Notes ]===
I would highly recommend this game to anyone who is interested in it. Its been a long time since a game has given me goosebumps or made me feel for a character, and this game did both.

===[ My PC Specs ]===
CPU: AMD - Ryzen 5 1600 3.2GHz 6-Core Processor
Motherboard: ASRock - AB350 Pro4 ATX AM4 Motherboard
Memory: G.Skill - Ripjaws V Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4-3000 Memory
Storage 1: SanDisk - SSD PLUS 240GB 2.5" Solid State Drive
Storage 2: Western Digital - Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive
Video Card: Zotac - GeForce GTX 1060 6GB 6GB Mini Video Card
Case: Deepcool - TESSERACT SW ATX Mid Tower Case
Power Supply: EVGA - BQ 600W 80+ Bronze Certified Semi-Modular ATX Power Supply

author: {'steamid': '76561198095879858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1540819038}
review:
Comme beaucoup, j'ai été attiré par la direction artistique du jeu qui est séduisante. Mais au final, j'ai trouvé ce jeu ennuyeux.

L'histoire est pas mal, mais même si c'est pas fou non plus, c'est le point fort du titre, surtout à la fin où l'on comprend le délire. Il faudra compter 6-7h pour terminer le jeu (en fouinant un peu à gauche et à droite). En ce qui concerne les énigmes, c'est toujours les mêmes, ça peine à se renouveler. En plus, l'exploration c'est surtout pour trouver les collectibles cachés. Collectibles qui ne sont pas totalement inutiles, même si ça relève du bonus. 
Dans le lot il y a quelques bonnes idées mais pas assez exploitées. 

Ajoutons à cela divers petits bugs qui m'ont poussé, à plusieurs reprises, à relancer la partie depuis le dernier checkpoint. En parlant checkpoint, ils sont assez hasardeux et le retour en partie peut être un peu perturbant quand on se retrouve 200m plus loin dans une salle que l'on avait pas encore exploré. Sans oublier des murs invisibles gênants. En plus, je trouve que le jeu est mal optimisé.

Ce que je trouve le plus aberrant c'est le prix auquel ce jeu est vendu, 35€ à l'heure où je tape ces mots. C'est beaucoup trop cher pour ce que c'est, ce prix ne RiME à rien.. Pour ma part je l'ai eu dans un bundle et même là... je trouve assez peu d'estime pour le titre. Attendez une baisse drastique du prix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072120618', 'num_games_owned': 2062, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1540669346}
review:
这是一段凄美的故事，玩到一半差不多就知道是个怎样的故事了，整个游戏过程伴随着哀伤温婉的音乐，整个情绪始终被压抑着，到结尾进行释放！
游戏解密难度不大，虽然没有中文但基本也不需要，没有战斗，没有引导，交互基本靠吼，但很快就能掌握游戏操作，小品级的游戏，进F包买的，原价买不值这个价，巫师3才63呢~~
虽然整体流程不长，但细节也并不马虎！说一个点，叫喊的声音到后面变身之后，声音也变得凄惨了，很符合情景！
游戏之所以能称之为第九艺术，正是有这些认真讲故事的游戏存在，总之感谢！

author: {'steamid': '76561198091558361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1540657158}
review:
RiME is one of the most beautiful games I think I have ever played. Both the visuals and audio are done with such perfection you are moved in ways most large budget titles cannot achieve, and while there is action in a common sense this doesn't hold back the title whatsoever. Not many games have actually brought me to tears but the ending of RiME did just that. However this game is purely an atmospheric title; almost an interactive story. The platforming is very slippery and there is no fighting aside from some puzzles which lead to action. That said the puzzles are quite interesting and deal with day and night, which as well correspond too the story itself.

In short RiME is easily worth your dollar. I most definitly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156896477', 'num_games_owned': 1789, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1540610050}
review:
之前买包给的，真的是赚到了
场景美得令人窒息，bgm满分，谜题也很有趣，就是通关了有点扎心

author: {'steamid': '76561197997839137', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1540602589}
review:
Ok, I have to be honest... I was close to abandoning this game as I was getting a little bored with the repition of some basic tasks, but I was close to the end, so I decided to stick it out.  I am REALLY glad I did.  The ending wraps everything together perfectly.

The graphics and soundtrack are wonderful too!

I do believe this game isn't for everyone, but if you've arrived on this page because it looked interesting, chances are you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972986072', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1655067554}
review:
La mayor virtud de esta producción del equipo español Tequila Works, es sobre todo la belleza, tanto visual como sonora, pese a que realmente se nota que el estilo artístico es una muy buena copia de Ghibli, en ambos aspectos.
Por un lado la banda sonora parece compuesta por el mismismo Joe Hisaishi, con temas que parecen sacados de La princesa Mononoke, y por otro lado el aspecto gráfico que parece que estemos viendo un hijo de toda la filmografía del estudio :D.
Respecto a la banda sonora, mención especial al tema creado por la violinista "youtuber" Lindey Stirling, y un tema vocal en español.
También se puede comparar bastante con Abzu, Journey e Ico. Es más, el juego ha pasado apenas sin hacer ruido, cuando no tiene absolutamente nada que envidiar a Journey por ejemplo.

No obstante donde para mi falla es en su exploración, el juego tiene unos escenarios increíbles, que daban para hacer mucho mas juego y una sensación de exploración mas profunda. Tenían que haber creado una suerte de mundo abierto y poder recorrerlo de principio a fin y volver cuando queramos o necesitemos, sin embargo han optado por un sistema por capítulos "inconexos" entre ellos que en mi opinión no le hace bien.
Los puzzles tampoco es que sean muy complejos, aunque hay alguna mecánica jugable algo original. 

La historia a diferencia de Abzu, o Journey, es bastante clara de entender, y no es la típica fumada mental de tantos juegos indie que salen hoy en día.

Para terminar decir que su rendimiento es bastante malo, pese a tener unos reflejos cojonudos que hacen chupar fps cosa mala.

Recomiendo el juego siempre y cuando nos gusten los juegos relajantes y te llame la estética tan cuidada que tiene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102352931', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1540216443}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970149845', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1540145201}
review:
A truly exceptional masterpiece in atmospheric exploration, storytelling and platforming with light puzzle elements.

The graphics, sound design and animation along with visual effects, level design and lighting all play hand in hand to establish atmosphere exceptionally well. Environment and puzzle variance is good, with good pacing. The story revelations are interesting and surprising. The established world is consistent and enjoyable. The level of detail to establish it is quite good. I really enjoyed these four hours.

If you can enjoy atmospheric third person platforming exploration with light puzzle elements, definitely play this masterpiece.

+ Exceptional atmosphere
+ Exceptional sound design
++ Great music
++ Great dynamic elements and adjustments
+ Exceptional animation
+ Exceptional visual effects
+ Exceptional presentation, exceptional direction (everything coming together great)
+ Great environment and world, great level of detail, great variance
+ Great platforming mechanics
+ Good, enjoyable puzzles, quite some variance
+ Interesting story/setting (explored through action, exploration and visuals)
+ Great guidance
* 4 hours for a playthrough
- No skippable cutscenes, even after playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561197967132117', 'num_games_owned': 4622, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1419, 'last_played': 1541979713}
review:
Fantastic game with great atmosphere, nice graphics and puzzles that are not too hard for the casual player of puzzle games... (so, myst-type players might find ths too easy as there is no hours of backtracking and so forth)

The game also has a fantastic story which unfolds between each level and in which you actively take part after level 5.

I don't want to spoil too much, but the end will have some people having wet eyes.

This game is one i really can recommend.  I really wanted to start playing it when i came back on my pc, but i tried to play a level at a sitting so i had to refrain myself when i had only like half an hour.  I probably used more time than the average player, but that's because i also went on looking for items and i have a fair amount of them (all toys, all emblems, 4/6 lullabies, etc etc). 
If you just want a game where you puzzle a bit and have really nice aestethics, then i can also recommend this game, it's got a really nice atmosphere.  For those that also go itemhunting; it gets reflected at the end of the game but i can't tell too much about it as it would spoil the story. Look at it as a little incentive you get ...

I got this game in a bundle (i believe it came with humble monthly, not sure anymore) and the quality of the game really makes the full price worth it, although if you don't search for items the playtime gets shorter and then i'd pay about 50% of it's regular price (which is €17.50 instead of 35€) I believe 20€ wouldve been a better price for the game, but the level of detail they've put into the game and thus work, makes the original price not really overpriced if you appreciate the gametype and play it to it's full extend (thus searching for the extra's).

If you can ever get this game in a bundle or very cheap promo (like 5€/5$) then buy it, you won't be disappointed!

本来是取材来的，结果玩到后面彻底忘了。
令我记忆犹新的几个场景：
1.王室底下的黑暗迷宫，点左键角色会唱歌，情不自禁的边走边唱，然后就被美到头皮发麻。
2.去高塔之前的长桥，内心完全被游戏氛围以及游戏音乐所震撼，情不自禁的探索未知的前方。
3.自己亲手造的机器人成为钥匙的时候。
4.最后老人将红围巾放飞的时候。
整个游戏的感情代入非常到位，能很大程度上的带动玩家的情绪，正如一些优秀电影一样。这个游戏我不推荐分开时间来玩。强烈推荐，找一天空闲的时间，一次玩完。这样等更大程度的体会到游戏交互的艺术于魅力。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990410670', 'num_games_owned': 1907, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1541790956}
review: Hra RiME je naprosto perfektní hra je jak veselá tak dost smutná sice hra má herní dobu něco kolem 5 hodina ale jde jí prodloužit tím že budete hledat speciální předměty , hru bych přirovnal k uměleckému dílu které vás od začátku až do konce bombarduje vjemy jak obrazovýma tak nádhernýma soundtracky + zde najdete opravdu velké množství překážek a dokonce zde můžete i plavat v nádherném moři plném ryb a korálů , hra je dost intuitivní a každý si musí sám domýšlet děj hry neboť hra je vyprávěná beze slov stejně jako kdysi hodně dávno ve hře Half-life vás dokonce sleduje i tajemný přízrak v červené kápi a spolu s vaším liščím průvodcem vás sleduje a doprovází hrou :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1540079903}
review:
Juego similar a Ico o Journey, de exploración, puzzles sencillos, fantástica música y un mundo de fantasía. Es un juego muy lineal, con algunas pinceladas muy originales aunque no es perfecto y tiene algunos problemas menores. Principalmente, bajadas de frames sin motivo (¿tiempos de carga disimulados?) y un control del personaje bastante mejorable.

El juego bebe mucho de ICO, con un mundo colorido que se va tornando oscuro según avanza el juego, para terminar con un final bastante tristón. Es uno de esos juegos que deja muchas cosas en el aire, para ser interpretadas, aunque el final intenta ser más concreto y no dejar la trama colgando (como en el Limbo o el Inside).

No es una obra maestra, pero merece la pena si lo compras rebajado ya que es una experiencia treméndamente distinta a los juegos superventas de hoy en día.

The game handles fine, frame rates are meh, finding all of the optional items is decently hard

author: {'steamid': '76561198000466618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1540511752}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008571452', 'num_games_owned': 1233, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1539841007}
review:
Went in expecting a simple puzzle/platformer (and the first couple of areas are like that). Wasn't ready for the feels that followed  (˚ ˃̣̣̥᷄⌓˂̣̣̥᷅ )


Graphical fidelity is good (runs on Unreal Engine 4) but the aesthetics are more important to lend to the perspective of the character. The theme is purposely inconsistent between the areas which is hard to elaborate on without ruining parts of the story. Puzzles are simple enough though they do better with creativity than difficulty, some puzzles use perspective, light/shadows and day/night cycle, you will never find yourself stuck though as they stay fairly simple push, pull, carry, climb type puzzles akin to Zelda (though a lot less demanding than Zelda's), pushing yourself past the first area or two is important as they feel over simplified. The controls are good and responsive (even on mouse and keyboard) but like the puzzles, the platforming stays simple to the point some mechanics (like rolling) feel unnecessary and under utilized. The more important point of the game is the aspect that is hard to talk about in a review, the story (that is told with no words) but it doesn't take long before you know something is wrong here...


Recommended but not at full price due to how short the game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185972270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1539870971}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980799910', 'num_games_owned': 1077, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1539783292}
review:
Игру однозначно брать. Играть так:

1. Избавиться от всего, что может отвлечь, к игре хорошо идет желание провести часик-другой за чем-нибудь красивым и расслабляющем
2. Взять геймпад и наслаждаться живописным миром, и лором, рассказываемым без единого слова
3. Немного огорчится что некоторые светильники не зажигаются в принципе, а геймплей к третьему миру немножко проседает
4. Пройти игру до конца и тщетно пытаться успокоить бурю эмоций внутри, глядя на экран титров. Окно с видом на вечерний горизонт тоже подойдет.
5. Пойти в отзывы и написать отзыв, в котором постараться передать ощущения от игры не заспойлерив её.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126690315', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1539644805}
review:
Безумно красивая и трогательная история! Головоломки не совсем детские, но и напрягаться особо не надо. Мир яркий, красивый, кладезь отличных скриншотов. Присутствует небанальный сюжет с несмазанной концовкой. Саундтрек так вообще выше всяких похвал, ооочень атмосферно!
Рекомендовал бы еще заморочиться ачивками, особенно собирательными, это заведет вас в крайне неожиданные и труднодоступные места в локациях :)
Из минусов только крайне низкий FPS, который в игре такого плана не ожидался..
10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060654075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5493, 'last_played': 1514319496}
review:
It took me quite some time to understand what this game was about. The first few hours, running about, collecting, solving, were just lighthearted. But as you move on, see things, watch things change, the realisation occurs, and you comprehend the nature of the story. I'm trying to write this without spoilers, so the language might be a little vague in places. 

Further in the feeling of the game changes radically and there is strife and difficulty, over and above the simple game mechanics. You begin to get a darker sensation of narrative and the solutions to puzzles don't satisfy in the same way, there's a sense of achievement but also one of sadness. 

As a gaming experience this is not the hardest thing you will ever do. As an emotional journey, if you are open to such things, it may well be very difficult indeed.

If exploration of feeling is of any interest to you then I whole-heartedly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072994974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1539564363}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112583014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1538920607}
review:
Magnifique et poétique!

Vous incarnez un jeune garcon qui se retrouve naufragé seul sur une ile. Vous devrez débloquer le passage pour arriver à la tour pour comprendre ses mystères.

Rime ne se résume pas que à ces 2 phrases, bien évidemment! 
Le jeu est beau, les paysages sont à couper le souffle et la bande son est magnifique!
Les énigmes se corsent au fur et à mesure, mais ne sont pas vraiment difficiles.
Le scénario est bien fait, et la cerise: une belle fin! (Oh oui, avoue que tu as été déçu par ces jeux aux fins moisies plus d'une fois!)

En bref: je recommande vivement Rime!    Mais pas au pris de 35€, le jeu m'a occupé environ 7h... ca fait cher du kilo. Kilo de qualité, certes, mais non. A prendre lors d'une promo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026099931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1538897239}
review:
아름다운 그래픽 - 아기자기한 텍스쳐에 생동감 넘치는 움직임을 넣어 플레이어들의 눈을 황홀하게 함.
아름다운 배경음악 - 플레이를 하면서 맵에 어우러지는 배경음악이 나와 플레이에 집중할 수 있도록 도와주는 역할을 톡톡히 함.

한글화가 없음에도 ABZU와 같이 게임 내 대사가 나오지 않는 게임이라서 플레이에 지장이 없다.
그러나, 스토리를 진행하면서 도대체 무슨 목적으로 게임을 진행 하는 지 알기가 힘들 수 있다. (물론 결말 부분에서 이 여정이 왜 시작되었는지, 왜 지속되었는지, 숨겨진 아이템들은 뭔지 다 알게 된다.) 

퍼즐요소들은 많지 않고 난이도도 어렵지 않다.  길 찾기가 중요한 게임이다.

위의 요소들에도 불구하고 불편한 시점과 불편한 조작감은 어쩔 수 없다. 그러나 충분히 참고 견딜만 하다고 생각한다.

개인적 기준으로 다시 정리하자면 

그래픽과 배경음악 - 충분히 만족스럽다.
스토리 - 나쁘지 않다.
시점과 조작감 - 상당히 거슬렸다.
 
결론 : 정가에 사기엔 상당히 아까운 게임이다. 

-----
Beautiful Graphics - Cuty characters, vibrant motions, make players satisfied.
Beautiful BGM - During playing, harmonized music makes you concentrate on game. 

Hard to understand stories during playing. (ex : There is no reason why stories going like this. <- You will know the reason of story at end parts but I felt awkward on here.)

A few & easy puzzle moments, mostly find the way to get destinations.

Although above things, inconvenient camera angle&controls devalue this game a little bit. But, it was bearable to me tho.

So, the point is (in my opinions)
Graphis & BGM - Satisfied enoughly.
Stories - not bad 
Angle & Controls - Uncomfortable

Conclusion : Buy this game at discount times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993709423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1579900495}
review:
RiME is a third-person non-violent adventure game, sometimes exploration, sometimes platformer, sometimes puzzle game.

The gameplay is not particularly original. It felt like I had already seen these kinds of puzzles, these kinds of adventure in many games before this one. If you already played Tomb Raider, or Zelda, for example, you'll get it. It's not much difficult either, except if you want to get all the achievements. It's also (mostly) linear: even if some places may be huge, there is always only one path. There are not many characters. You'll mostly follow a magic friendly fox, and a mysterious guy with a red cape who remains out of reach. There are some minor defaults, like a camera which sometimes takes dubious initatives, or some zones so dark that I had to switch off the light in my room. It also requires a decent computer.

But it's a utterly fantastic game, and for me one of the best games of 2017. Why? Because of the ambience.
If the vivid screenshots and the trailers didn't give you the compulsive desire to click "Buy" right now, wait, there is more:
[list]
 [*] First, like I said it's not difficult; but it's a good point, because you never feel stuck up very long, it's enjoyable.
 [*] Second, the environment is fantastic. It felt like I was visiting an abandoned crumbling civilisation and I wondered during most of the game what happened and what it was all about.
 [*] Third, the melancholic music, barely audible during the game and yet omnipresent, helps me put in this state of wonder.
 [*] Fourth, the story is great, even if it is sad, and is rarely present in the game. The game - all of it - fits the story, and not the contrary.
[/list]

In the end, the downside is that the game is not that long (9 hours for me without speeding up, including getting a good part of the achievements)... And when the end occurs, I wished I could continue exploring new green grasslands and beautiful ruins, and yet it's the end. But that, too, serves the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148242391', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1664130658}
review:
TL:DR - This game is AMAZING - Buy if your PC will run it.

Hi, I am aware that this game has no reviews currently and I heavily feel that it deserves some.

This game is excellent in every regard bar one thing, the graphics are so good that it struggles to run on my PC (however, it is playable!).

Pros:
- Excellent graphics and audio.
- Very easy to use controls.
- A very touching storyline.
- Is able to tell a story without words extremely well.

Cons:
- None that I can think of.

This game is pure gold dust, it is excellent, the graphics are beautiful as well as the audio. The music is extremely well done and the graphics are that of a triple A game. I won't spoil anything here, just please buy this game, it is well worth the money.

Thanks Tequila Works for an amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970520745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1538564615}
review:
I highly recommend this game, but not for the story (which is pretty buried in symbolism). With its combination of a beautiful sound track and a painting-like art style, this game put me in a different state of mind. The platforming was slightly frustrating at times, but the puzzles were mostly easy. 

Play this if you want to expaerience something artistic and be transported into another world, without facing too much of a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087203414', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1537823886}
review:
игра хорошая. особенно зацепила идея в основе сюжета. музыка и звук тоже на высоте. есть косяки с физикой: определение уступов, пригодных для спуска и подъёма; невидимые стены; проблемы с застреванием персонажа. движения камеры порой сбивают с толку - камера может решить повернуться на 90 градусов во время бега по узкому мосту. по графике можно сказать, что она средняя - иногда сцены выглядят впечатляюще, а иногда - примитивно и бедновато. я предпочёл бы увидеть такой мир в максимальном качестве - он этого заслуживает. вначале загадки казались сложноватыми - нужно было привыкнуть к их принципу и механике, к финалу загадки уже не вызывали проблем, хоть некий челенж и сохранился до конца.
можно рекомендовать любителям 3д инди головоломок с сюжетом.

плюсы:
+ идея и сюжет
+ красивый мир, который приятно исследовать
+ музыка и звук
+ загадки заставляют задуматься
минусы:
- бесячая камера
- косяки с физикой
- графика порой смотрится слишком тёмной и угловатой
- на ранних этапах не помешало бы больше подсказок

мне игра понравилась. более того, хотелось бы сказать искреннее спасибо авторам за такой проект. чувствуется, что разработчики вложили душу в творение.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999825207', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1537771038}
review: This was pretty good but I kinda felt like the story mildly fell apart due to relying on symbolism too much. [spoiler]I'm not very fond of the "it was all in the father's mind" ending twist at all.[/spoiler] Great art direction, gameplay was alright though sometimes the level design was a bit frustrating, but nothing too bad. I often felt like relatively small changes in design could have greatly enhanced what's already there. I would give this a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316537937', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1537684948}
review:
Казалось бы, сколько уже было игр про неизведанный таинственный древний мир и одинокого мальчика, которого в этот мир безжалостно бросили и не дали никаких объяснений ([i] сразу на ум приходят Journey, Abzu, The Last Guardian, Hob, даже Horizon Zero Dawn [/i]). 
Вместе с персонажем вы изучаете старинные фрески, статуи, разбитые эмблемы, развалины древних храмов, встречаете рисунки огромных роботов, которых в таком мире быть не должно. И сразу куча вопросов. Почему все такое пустынное? Что это за высокотехнологичные существа? Куда они исчезли? Что такого ужасного произошло? И вот глава за главой вы движетесь к ответу и [strike] в конце весь мир преображается и оживает [/strike]... все совсем не то, чем кажется.
Этот красивый и светлый мир на самом деле пронизан невероятной болью. Взаимоотношения персонажа с его немногочисленными спутниками, да и сам мальчик настолько трогательны, все это так сильно привязывает к героям, что от этого финал опустошает и потрясает намного сильнее. И невозможно сдержать слезы. 
На первый взгляд детская игра о совсем недетских, близких каждому вещах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030193439', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1535475160}
review:
I bought RIME on its description as a puzzle game with exploration. What I got instead felt like a walking simulator without sufficient payoff, narrative or otherwise.

The single factor that killed this game for me is the size of the environments, combined with the glacially slow pace. Movement speed in particular would have had to be twice or thrice as high for me not to constantly get bored to tears. It's rage-inducingly slow.

And once a game screws up like that way, you know it won't work in other ways, either. For instance, despite the description of "exploration", the game is almost entirely linear except for various hidden collectables. But trying to collect those is deeply unsatisfying. Partly due to the glacial movement speed, which discourages walking around. But also because stage select is chapter-based, so trying to collect missing doodads after the fact sounds like soul-crushing pain.

There's no way to save manually, and the autosave mechanic is pretty bad; I played through the game in a few sessions and typically had to replay a small section each time.

The game is rather pretty, I do admit. But it's also full of dark areas and zones, and those didn't work for me at all.

When it comes to the puzzles themselves, there aren't that many, and most of them are mediocre or trivially easy.

A concrete plot underlies the game, but it's told in a very vague, nonverbal way. The end seems neat-ish, but also disconnected from what came before. I had to read a story explanation to make any sense of it. Not my kind of storytelling.

I hated this game. It felt like it was designed entirely to waste the player's time. Like some business guy realized the game only had 2-3 hours of content, and promptly cut movement speed by 1/2 or 2/3 to pad the playtime numbers. Instead of this mediocre game that does neither puzzles nor exploration well, I recommend purer games instead: e.g. The Witness or Stephen's Sausage Roll for puzzles; and A Hat in Time, a Mario game, or Hollow Knight for platforming and exploration.

PS: My displayed Steam playtime is wrong; the actual playtime was more on the order of 6-7h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061080587', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1531364480}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090349927', 'num_games_owned': 1672, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1535798038}
review:
5小时通关，内心百感交集。
RIME也算得上是最让我有感触的游戏之一了，讲真没有玩过绝对会有遗憾。
玩家扮演小男孩，一路上寻找自己因海难逝去的父亲，穿越人间和阴曹、走过郁郁葱葱的森林和阴森昏暗的死亡之地，直到最后发现逝去的是自己的故事，最后的父亲LETTING GO的一瞬间，达到整个剧情的高潮，小男孩和众多亡灵一样最终成为了满天繁星重的一颗。

先评价下优点：
1、场景充满了设计感，处处都是构图过的镜头画面。
2、色彩饱和度高而不艳，线索物体（光线、门、球）设计非常精致。
3、剧情没有文字但绝对不晦涩，谜题恰到好处既不会让人烦躁也不会让人睡着。
4、游戏设计者具有极高的美学素养（这一点也体现在了音乐上）。
5、剧本虽然简单但游戏表现力强。

缺点：
刚通关想不出来

author: {'steamid': '76561198184760923', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1535579437}
review: 可以可以

author: {'steamid': '76561198391870713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1535441524}
review:
老人（看年纪其实只是大叔）在一次海上风浪中失去了儿子，只留下从儿子红色外套上扯下的一块布，这块布被在亡灵世界探索的儿子当做披肩贯穿旅程始终，游戏最后老人打开儿子的房间，睹物思人，回望窗口的夕阳，老人让这块布从窗口随风飞去，同时解锁成就Letting go
游戏风景和音乐非常赞，要是有美术书和原声带我现在就买；解谜难度不大，也不算鸡肋；优化不太好；搜集元素有点蛋疼，好像也没什么用，我这种随缘玩家一遍流程下来只搜集了十分之一；小伙伴狗子好评，暖心向导，什么？狐狸？狐狸是啥？会叫汪的就是狗子[spoiler]可惜最后死了[/spoiler]
ns平台这游戏一张卡200，steam打折20，唉

author: {'steamid': '76561198147899392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1535417163}
review:
[h1]这不是游戏，这是一件艺术品。[/h1]

故事从男孩在平静的海滩上苏醒开始
[spoiler]结束于波涛汹涌的海中[/spoiler]
[spoiler]梦里才有这样梦幻般的景色[/spoiler]

1.完美的画面与音乐，剧情与音乐衔接天衣无缝
2.剧情在一步步探索中逐渐揭露，环境与角色的象征与暗示值得思考
3.游戏性锦上添花，解谜需要一定观察与思考但又不复杂，剧情提示恰到好处

最开始的10分钟我曾好奇为什么游戏里不能快速奔跑，

[b]慢下来，才能体会到游戏的美。[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062623579', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1535336966}
review:
Rime manages to tell a captivating and emotional story without a single line of dialogue. It conveys it's emotions only through it's enviroments and soundtrack, and it does it beautifully.

$30 is still steep, but $15 is a perfect price imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119762555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1535287287}
review:
我们一直都明白面对现实的代价，哄哄自己，咬紧牙关，擦干泪，别怕。

全程没有一句对白，不需要中文化的游戏。
画质谈不上多好，但有一种简约到极致的美，有昼夜白天的设计，夜晚的色调更美。
BGM是烘托气氛的点睛之笔，时而凄美，时而让人感觉不到存在。
能看出制作非常用心，不同章节标题有不同的动态效果，整体是个解密游戏，但没有卡时机的动作和谜题。
随着经历的不同，不同人能看到不同作品的影子，像我想起了小王子、天空之城、风之旅人等。
但也不是没有缺点，如果你静不下心，你是玩不进去的，这不是一个有趣的游戏，更像是一个比较文艺的游戏，
再就是优化不太好，GPU占有很高，有时还丢帧，还有部分场景特别黑。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031440161', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1534972545}
review:
I've played too many artsy, allegorical games with mysterious protagonists. Once you've played Journey, ABZU, AER, Unfinished Swan or any of another dozen games of The Type, RiME just does not feel that remarkable, even though it predates or is contemperaneous with these works. I played it too late and struggled to feel engaged. Yet, I recommend it.

I recommend it, because RiME is a high-quality experience. It harkens back to the best moments from games by Team Ico and Nintendo's Zelda team. It doesn't do a whole lot new, but it does it with style and attention to detail. There's a fair bit of Disneyesque cheese here too, but it is probably necessary in a game about emotions that has no voice acting.

I didn't really feel the allegorical Deeper Themes it was trying to convey, because they were - and I rarely say this - too subtle and oblique. But that's a taste thing. You might feel differently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130049543', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1541092894}
review:
Premetto col dire che RiME è uno dei migliori titoli a cui abbia mai giocato.

Ogni anno esce un nuovo Battlefield, un nuovo COD, un nuovo FIFA, un nuovo F1; microtransazioni e meccaniche di gioco rotte e frustranti pullulano nel ricco paesaggio videoludico, ma ho troncato la lista per pietà.
Non è tuttavia per un pessimo film che la filmografia precipita dall'Olimpo artistico, diventando mero intrattenimento.
Nonostante tutto, i videogiochi si sono guadagnati e mantengono tutt'ora lo status di [b]forma d'arte[/b].
A quelle persone ottuse e retrograde che trattano [b]ancora[/b] (dopo 30 e più anni dalla nascita) il videogioco come svago fine a se stesso o peggio ancora come [i]arma di distruzione di massa[/i] o lavaggio del cervello, a quelle persone bisognerebbe far giocare giochi come RiME e chiedergli se non si sono emozionati per davvero.

Un videogioco, fosse soltanto che dura molto più di un film, richiede una propria partecipazione, indispensabile. Viene da sè che l'attaccamento emotivo ai personaggi, gli scenari, le musiche, (un po' meno spesso) le meccaniche, è... significativo.
Per questo quando si finisce un gioco su cui si sono passate ore e ore, a volte ai titoli di coda la lacrimuccia scende.
(Spoiler [spoiler]con RiME ho   [b]q u a s i[/b]   pianto[/spoiler])
Un'opera d'arte, sia un libro, un film, un brano musicale, una poesia, un dipinto, una fotografia, non fa altro (si fa per dire) che far provare emozioni. E un videogioco ci riesce benissimo.

Grazie quindi a Tequila Works e a chi di merito per essersi distinti dalla massa con un piccolo capolavoro dai paesaggi splendidi, musica affascinante e incalzante, tematiche di spessore notevole e gameplay (quasi) perfetto.
Unica pecca è che purtroppo non sono stato in grado di unire tutti i puntini da me, e alla fine ho dovuto guardare la trama su Internet (e non sono l'unico, ma d'altronde in un gioco senza narrazione è un rischio da correre).

Sul fatto che valga o meno il prezzo pieno, quello dipende molto, c'è da tenere conto che RiME non è un gioco lungo, nè tantomeno rigiocabile. Dovesse andare in sconto di sicuro è da valutare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140381191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1534556313}
review:
Al igual que me ocurrio con "Ico", "Shadow of the Colossus" y "The Last Guardian", hay una palabra que define a la perfeccion el juego: PRECIOSO.

Y si, hay muchas referencias a esos juegos mencionados (quiza el que menos "Shadow of the Colossus" ya que no hay combate). Controles muy basicos y nada complejos, al contrario que su historia, que hasta que consigues llegar al final no comprenderas todo, pero es fascinante como al acabar el juego vas atando cabos de todo lo que has visto, esa sensacion me encanto, y este juego lo consigue.

La mecanica es bastante simple, y la simplicidad lo hace tan bello, resolver puzzles e ir avanzando, muy chulos todos, no muy dificiles, bien adaptados para que no llegues a momentos frustrantes y no puedas avanzar (al menos desde mi perspectiva). Por supuesto, la exploracion es bastante importante, sobre todo si quereis conseguir los coleccionables, que explican aun mas de que va la historia, mi consejo es que vuestro primer recorrido vayais a vuestra bola, y el segundo si que consigais todo para que ya la historia sea reveladora al instante. Y ademas desbloquea un final alternativo.

En resumen, precioso, vale la pena, que gran viaje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054521091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1534090313}
review: Ein wunderschön gestaltetes Spiel, welches sich ruhig und entspannt vor sich hinspielen lässt. Kein Puzzel ist so schwer, dass es frustran wäre. Man plätschert Schritt für Schritt (und vor allem ohne nervige Tutorials) durch wunderschöne Landschaften und eine unglaublich berührende Geschichte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078666811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1534404798}
review:
I bought this game during the summer steam sell a month or so ago. And this game is beautiful. And then the mood changes from calm and serene to creepy and chilling.
 OmO The lighting and the monsters turns dark and the music itself gives you a feeling of dread. (The black shades suck your soul out literally) They are quite scary the first few times dealing with them....this game does a great job at creating moods.

I have to redo the game to get the achievements I missed,but its worth playing it I promise!! 


*Just a heads up though, look up an achievement guide BEFORE starting. To familiarize yourself with the environment first. If you wish to collect the achievements. As you can not go back to sections once finished.*

author: {'steamid': '76561198364032661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1534325918}
review:
I'M NOT CRYING, YOU ARE CRYING!! 

With all honesty, I can't recommend this game more. It is so.... Heart touching. I won't spoil the game, but this game is truly a master piece. I hope more games like this one come out more often. Overall, the game is amazing, the only issue I had was when the camera would just do whatever it wanted randomly during gameplay. And one weird glitch where I got stuck in a wall. Thankfully I could just load back to the last checkpoint, that just happened to be a few seconds ago.

review:
感动，虐心。还是不剧透了，玩下去，哪怕是原价都非常值了。

画质默认高，开启水粒子，全程除了几个场景掉帧外，都在70帧左右；唯美的风景配上凄美的音乐，上一次这种暖心的感觉还是8年前的《刺客信条2》，尤其雨景太唯美了。

玩法上“输出基本靠吼”这句话可以说是完美诠释了这游戏。攀爬动作、视角跟 艾吉奥三部曲 像的简直了。

主角的声音太可爱了，平时走路时按手柄Y键会哼唱。
。
。
。
。
。
。
不知道这样些会不会涉嫌剧透。
。
