author: {'steamid': '76561198039095301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1533811910}
review:
Le jeu est très joli, très beau design, jolies musiques, univers très enchanteur.
On ne comprend vraiment l'histoire qu'à la fin.

Par contre, les temps de chargements peuvent être assez longs, la caméra peut être chiante, et la maniabilité pas toujours au top... A cause de ça j'ai préféré aller à l'essentiel au lieu de chercher les petits objets annexes (j'ai mis ~6h pour le finir, chercher les objets peut rallonger de quelques heures mais pas des masses).

A prendre en solde, parce que 35€ pour quelques heures, ça fait cher :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198134383234', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1596737462}
review:
Wow - ich weiß noch gar nicht, wo ich anfangen soll. Dieses Spiel hat mich einfach total geflasht!

Für alle, die nicht gern viel lesen - vllt solltet ihr euch ein anderes Review suchen. Das hier könnte etwas länger werden.

Zu allererst: ich bin begeistert von diesem Graphikstil. Obwohl er so schlicht und einfach ist und auch irgendwo sehr kindlich wirkt, schafft er es, wundervolle Orte und Landschaften darzustellen. Auf eine Art und Weise, die bewirkt, dass ich an dem ein oder anderen Ort einfach für längere Zeit stehen geblieben bin und den Anblick habe auf mich wirken lassen oder an anderen Stellen länger herumgelaufen bin, als nötig war.
Jeder einzelne Ort und jede Landschaft hat ihren ganz eigenen Zauber, der einem zum Teil einfach nur den Atem verschlägt. Ich wäre gern länger dort geblieben ;)
Auch der Soundtrack ist von besonderer Schönheit. Ich kenn nur wenige Spiele, die es mit dem Soundtrack von Rime aufnehmen könnten. Er passt perfekt zu den einzelnen Situationen und besteht aus wunderschönen Meolodien, die trotz ihrer vergleichsweisen Komplexität nicht aufdringlich sind, sonder weiterhin im Hintergund das Spiel untermalen und die Intensität des Spielerlebnisses noch verstärken.

Zuletzt das Spiel selbst: Zu Beginn des Spiels strandet man am Strand einer unbekannten Insel, deren markantestes Merkmal ein riesiger weiser Turm ist. Im Folgenden stehen die Erkundung der Insel und das lösen diverser Rätsel im Mittelpunkt des Spiels.
Eine genaue Erkundung lohnt sich hierbei nicht nur, um die verschiedenen Punkte der einzelnen Landschaften zu entdecken - gleichzeitig können auch verschiedenste Dinge gefunden werden.
Die Rätsel waren relativ einfach (ich habe aber auch schon etwas Erfahrung mit Rätseln) - nichts, was man nicht schaffen kann (auch als Rätselanfänger). Manchmal ist ein wenig Geduld gefragt, zum Teil können Rätsel auch erst später gelöst werden (womit wir wieder bei der Erkundung der Gegenden wären) und bei anderen lohnt sich genaueres Hinsehen.
Im Verlauf der Erkundungen und des Lösens der Rätsel wird einem Stück für Stück in kurzen Episoden die Geschichte offenbart. Dazu möchte ich ungern mehr sagen - es ist eine Geschichte, die jeder für sich selbst entdecken und interpretieren muss. Nur so viel: Lange Zeit wusste ich nicht genau, worauf die Story hinauslaufen wird und war gespannt darauf, was der nächste Teil bringen würde. Es lohnt sich, dran zu bleiben!
Die Charaktere, die im Spiel auftauchen sind mit viel Liebe gestaltet und jeder wächst einem im Laufe des Spiels irgendwie ans Herz. Es gibt keine Dialoge - stattdessen wird alles über Mimiken und Gestiken ausgedrückt, was eine noch stärkere Bindung zu den Charakteren hervorruft.
Von der Steuerung her: Ich hab mit Maus und Tastatur gespielt - kann also nichts zur Steuerung mit einem Controller sagen (obwohl ich das vllt auch mal noch ausprobier). Die Steuerung ist einfach und jeder, der öfter mit Maus und Tastatur spielt, sollte sie im Grunde schon kennen :) Ich hatte nur wenige Stellen, an denen es mit der Steuerung oder der Kamera nicht ganz so war, wie ich es vllt gern gehabt hätte. Im Großen und Ganzen hat alles supergut funktioniert.

Ich persönlich bin auf jeden Fall total begeistert von diesem Spiel und werde es vermutlich noch das ein oder andere Mal neu anfangen und nochmals spielen.

Für alle, die sich überlegen das Spiel zu kaufen: Ich würde jederzeit wieder in dieses Spiel investieren.
Noch eine Bemerkung für alle, die es sich gekauft haben und es anfangen: Ihr werdet den Turm früher erreichen, als ihr vermuten würdet - aber keine Angst, das Spiel geht länger, als man denken würde. 7h Spielzeit sind auf jeden Fall drin :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995666469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1531938553}
review:
Have you ever been on a flight where they show these short, "artsy", pretentious and shallow student-made films to entertain the passengers? 

RiME is like that, but in a video game form. Very pretty art style and animation, but pretty much everything else is uninspired or derivative. RiME tries to imitate ICO and Journey, but the similarities are skin-deep. Those games manage to build suspense over the game and merge gameplay with story to great effect, but RiME does none of that. Instead, RiME copies the superficial qualities of those games, like the minimalism. "If there are no words used in our game, that MUST mean that the game is deep!", thinks RiME.

This game is a massive wasted opportunity, and that irritates me. I wish its developers the best of luck in their next game, I'm sure they can do better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119058186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1533571449}
review:
OBRA DE ARTE.
A ver por donde empiezo...
Es un juego que, en su mecánico es bastante básico, y donde se podría haber profundizado un poco más en cuanto a tipos de movimientos del personaje, fluidez y realismo en algunas físicas... Pero después de habérmelo pasado dos veces, creo que su encanto reside en esa sencillez. No es complicado de superar, por lo que es un título apto para todo tipo de público, pese que la profundidad de la historia no lo sea. Es una historia arrolladora y aplastante como la vida misma... Lo que empieza como una aventura de un niño que despierta en una isla desierta, sin saber por qué "que por cierto la isla es preciosa, con ese toque de isla griega", se convierte en un viaje cada vez mas oscuro, misterioso y lúgubre, para darte cuenta, y no hago spoilers, de que al final, todo era algo muy distinto a lo que el juego te estaba mostrando y darte un buen gancho de izquierdas al corazón... Vamos, que si eres un poco sensiblero como yo, acabas llorando a moco tendido con el final xDDD Y aquí reside la importancia de una buena historia señores, el hecho de que al tenerla, al juego se le perdonen otros fallos, como los que anteriormente he mencionado. Ya no me importa la sencillez de la mecánica, ni el irrealismo de algunos movimientos o físicas... este juego me ha llegado al alma y me ha hecho LLORAR señores... que hoy en día es muy difícil... Porque aunque no lo parezca, este juego trata de algo muy común de la vida cotidiana de las personas... Algo por lo que todo el mundo pasa.

Lo recomiendo encarecidamente en versión PC, ahora que no tiene DNUVO, luce genial a 60FPS.
La banda sonora es preciosa, y me encanta que el estudio de TEQUILA haya decidido poner una canción final para los créditos en español, si señor! Que quede la marca ESPAÑA en algo de tanta calidad...

Me hubiera encantado que el viaje durase mas, en unas 7-8 horas puedes pasártelo en una primera pasada, depende de la facilidad que tengas en resolver sus puzzles, pero habría estado genial que el mundo de RiME hubiera sido mas basto y grande, pero supongo que el presupuesto para este título era algo limitado... No hablamos de un Assassin's claro...
Ojalá les vaya bien a TEQUILA para poder hacer un RiME 2 u otro título diferente con la misma magia.

Felicidades chicos!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287777213', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1533286169}
review:
綺麗なグラフィックと、音楽で、とても良い雰囲気ゲーでした。
最初は謎だらけなのですが、ステージが進むにつれて理由などは分かってくるかと思います。
収集物も集めないと全貌は分からないのかな、これから2周目として順番に片付けていこうと思っています。

CPU:Core i7-6700、ビデオカード:RX470の組み合わせで表示解像度1080ならサクサク動きました。
ディスプレイが4Kだったので表示解像度も上げたり画像品質を上げたりしてみましたが、カクカクした動きになって良いそうなので、ビデオカードが貧弱なら設定は下げておいた方が良いです。
表示解像度1080でも色使いが上手いのか、とても綺麗でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198202092151', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1533127306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198184282673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1532966491}
review:
To be honest, this is one of such games that you should play yourself to understand, because it’s nearly impossible to describe it with words. I would actually describe Rime like that: developers took Journey mechanics, expanded it to big locations and flavored it with mystique and more or less reasonable ending. If you still do not sure whether you should buy it or not, here are the details:

Graphics – just perfect. Seriously, about 2 hours of my walkthrough I just walked and enjoyed sceneries. The picture is far from photo-realistic but it has its own soft, vivid, saturated style, which creates just wonderful beauties, the sky at night is just something indescribable.
After completion, I collected whole wallpaper pack for my desktop, where half of the pictures were my own screenshots. 

Atmosphere is also hard to characterize. I would just say that you dive into the game’s wonders and become astonished by the sceneries. 

Music is great. It perfectly fits the graphics and atmosphere, and the only drawback is inability to by soundtrack directly in Steam. 

Story. Well, I don’t wanna spoil it, so I’ll tell you shortly: itself it is not really unique, but with the local storytelling and narrative where you do not really understand what’s happening until the end of the game, it becomes just great and perfectly fits the game. 

Gameplay. Frankly, not much to say about it. It mostly resembles Journey, the only differences are bigger levels, more freedom and various goals or destinations throughout the game. The rest is quite similar: you walk through beautiful surroundings, solve easy puzzles and encounter only 1-2 aggressive creatures during the whole game. For some it may seem too meditative boring but it’s nice for such a game and complements it. 

So, all in all, RiME is great and in some part even original game, because, despite usual utilized elements, together they form something new and unique. I would recommend it for everyone, but if you are looking for some challenge or active gameplay, this game is not really for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126969887', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1583956902}
review: Es genial la verdad estoy orgulloso de la nueva compra :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998358012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1533029957}
review:
Recomendadíííííííísimo!!!
No es un juego, es una obra de arte. Ambientación maravillosa con una increíble paleta de colores mediterránea que va cambiando a lo largo del juego. Impresionante capacidad e transmitir sensaciones sin ni siquiera necesitar palabras. La música es maravillosa parte esencial del juego y catalizadora de las emociones que transmite (los de lágrima fácil llorarán al final seguro, y alguno que no lo sea, como yo, también).
Puzles muy acertados, no excesivamente complicados y muy bien integrados en el escenario juego. Tiene además una sección de plataformas, algo más floja, que recuerda (al menos vagamente) a los primeros Tomb Rider. La única pega que le pongo es que en opcasiones es demasiado guiado, perdiendo un poco la libertad de exploración que sí aparece en los primeros capítulos del juego. Pero a pesar de ello es maravilloso, una auténtica obra de arte...

author: {'steamid': '76561198115399415', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1550154769}
review: Such a great game! It's got a heart-throbbing storyline but i would highly recommend getting this game! The soundtrack perfeclty sets the mood throughout the entire game and the visual details are stunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054277538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1659148793}
review:
16 hours in, I have to write a review now. It's easily worth $30 (I got it on sale when it was $15?
(yes, I'm a Zelda fan)

Holy shit, this game is gorgeous. It's so hard to describe how great it is, yet simple.

I of course had my frustrations with a few puzzles, but I'd say I'm significantly lower than average when it comes to puzzle solving. I go to this game when I'm stressed out or frustrated with other games and it's so beautiful and puts me at ease.

Coming from a current Violist who plays in Orchestras, the music is phenominal. It's so relaxing and sets the exact perfect mood.

The characters, while there are few, are so unique and special. It's perfect

I just got through a section where the story REALLY got to kick in. All I can say is "wow". The fact that such a simple game says that, says a lot in itself

author: {'steamid': '76561198072997489', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1531169041}
review:
The game was incredibly nice and relaxing to play at first, it gets pretty spooky and sad though. Im scared of birds now. 
It had some parts that felt a bit slow but other than that, I really liked the story.
As for the environment, level and overall game mechanic design, the game is honestly outstanding. Theres so much love in every little detail of the islands, the puzzles constantly progress in difficulty while still being super fun and rewarding to solve. In fact, “Puzzles” doesnt really do them justice since youre forced to interact with the entire environment sometimes, i especially loved the inclusion of light and shadow through different times of the day and the whole perspective thing.
I think it’s one if those rare non-combat games that have actual good gameplay. 
I bought this for half the price on sale and I consider that a good price for the amount of content. The full price is a little much compared to the amount of raw content the game offers. Although its hard to put a price tag on great ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367524971', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1531869209}
review:
玩法和画面没什么好说的，但是优化真心难受，没有1080的显卡怕是玩不爽！解密元素适中，彩绘画风独特，玩法上别具匠心，故事颇有味道！画面恢宏却打磨细腻，细节刻画到位，给人一种自由度极高的沙盒游戏的错觉，奇幻的冒险已然开始！

不够优化力度真心蛋疼，帧率很难受！

author: {'steamid': '76561197998227720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1531755499}
review:
Juego que inicialmente parece incluso hasta infantil. Es cortito y las mecánicas son faciles, no tiene una gran dificultad. 
Pero es muy bonito, cuidado al detalle, tiene una banda sonora preciosa...
Y sobre todo, la historia. Al principio da la impresión que el juego no tiene una historia muy profunda... nada más lejos de la realidad. El final es sublime. Y mucho más maduro y adulto de lo que parece todo el juego. Te deja alucinado.

Altamente recomendable :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013586186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1523397729}
review:
It has its good points, but for me, there were too many bad points.

PROS:
-Original puzzle mechanic.
-Excellent design.
-Good Music.
CONS:
-Not challenging at all. You have to get how a puzzle work, once you get it that mechanic will repeat over and over and over.
-A tendency I've seen in other games and I hate, is the fact that it's easy to advance to some area or trigger a cutscene and loose all access to previous areas that you wanted to explore.
-Very linear.
-The story does not catch you, once you see that nothing you do will lead to any answer; until the end, which is extremly topic and overdone.
-Controls do not work properly. It is frustrating to die several times at a stupid jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318249224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1530688967}
review:
PVからも分かるように雰囲気ゲーです。プレイしていて雰囲気は最高でした。
ゲーム性としては大体が謎解き、そして申し訳程度にアクション要素もあります。

それなりにフィールドが大きく、謎解きのヒントが分かりづらいため
ゲーム中は大半の時間をウロウロするかと思います。
そこにイライラしない方なら楽しめるかと

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1531594288}
review:
アクションアドベンチャーゲーム。
とある島に漂着した少年がキツネの力を借りながら島の塔の上を目指すという内容だ。適度な難易度のアクションとパズル、作り込まれた雰囲気とマップのアクションアドベンチャーとなっている。
ゲーム開始時にいきなり広い場所に放り込まれるのでオープンワールドと思いがちだが、チャプターごとに分かれている広いマップだ。地形は入り組んでいるがパズルやカメラによる制限、キツネの動きで移動先を示してくれるので迷わないように工夫されている。基本的には一本道だがところどころにシークレットが隠されており探索も十分にできる。パズルは試しに仕掛けを動かして手探りで考える必要があるが難しすぎず簡単すぎない良いバランスだ。中には影を合わせるというような周囲の地形を利用したパズルがある。また、死んでも近くの場所から即リスタートできる親切設計だが任意セーブはできない。

アクションやパズル、ストーリーテリングの配分や難易度など全体的にバランスが非常に良いゲームだと思う。トゥーン調のグラフィックだがマップがきっちり作り込まれており非常に綺麗だ。波などの水の流れや風を感じさせる表現、色合いも美しい。明暗の表現も良いと思う。意外性のあるラストも良い。カメラ制限や暗さで見づらい場面はあるが短所と言うほどではないと思う。
良質のアクションアドベンチャーをプレイしたいのならオススメのゲームだ。

review:
First you think it is a short game of pure exploration and some puzzles.
A bit later you realize it is not that short. Some puzzles later you realize that it those are pretty clever. And all the way you stay amazed how beautiful this game is. And the story... you go through all the game with more and more questions, and no answers until the very end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150277730', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1517589075}
review:
Rime.

Sarà breve, impersonerete un ragazzo che si ritrova su di un'isola sperduta, dopo essere caduto dalla barca del padre.
In questa isola non incontrerete altri umani, ma una volpe che vi farà da guida, portandovi ad esplorare il paesaggio e e che vi condurrà a quello che spererete sia la vostrra salvezza.
Il punto di forza di Rime è sicuramente l'ambientazione, i paesaggi sono incantevoli, emozionanti, vi toglieranno il fiato e gli enigmi e i puzzle non troppo difficili non vi distoglieranno da questo vostro viaggio attraverso questa isola della meraviglie, mentre cercherete di risolvere i misteri che avvolgono l'isola e l'oscuro figuro che vdrete di tanto in tanto.
Solo verso la fine del gioco inizierete a capire quale sia la verità dietro tutto questo viaggio, le emozioni vi accompagneranno fino allo straziante finale che è proprio ciò che merita questa grande piccola perla di gioco.

Ve lo consiglio se vi piacciono i giochi tranquilli, in cui avete il tempo per esplorare e deliziarvi con la vista dei meravigliosi paesaggi.
Non fà per voi se cercate puzzle che vi mettano seriamente alla prova o giochi con quests che vi guidino attraverso tutto il gioco, in quanto non esiste un vero e proprio obiettivo.

Come sempre lascio il link al mio playthrough del gioco, se volete darci un'occhiata epr farvi un0idea sul gioco siete liberi di farlo.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h940FqJSLvQ&index=2&t=0s&list=PLI0MWZauwpgTGgawpW0IuobajgWaQ06Rp

author: {'steamid': '76561198223236784', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1531171426}
review: В первую очередь игра покорила графикой, собственно именно поэтому и купила эту игру. Но затем я поняла, что игре есть чем зацепить и кроме графики: исследование открытого и красивого мира, головоломки, может и не самые сложные, так как со временем сразу понятно, что и как делать. Сначала я не поняла сюжет игры, мне казалось, что происходит какой-то бред, но со временем настроение игры менялось и концовка все расставила по своим местам. По сути игра - это одна большая метафора. В общем для любителей головоломок, игр с глубоким сюжетом и великолепной необчной графики обязательно к прохождению!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068417827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1531091689}
review:
Je l'avais pris il y a longtemps maintenant, commencé puis un peu oublié dan un coin de ma ludothèque.
et puis plus d'un an après, je me suis dit "tiens je vais le continuer".
J'ai tellement bien fait.
prenez-le mais surtout allez jusqu'à la fin: l'histoire a un sens qu'on ne découvre qu'en finissant le jeu, et tout son contenu a un sens métaphorique.
C'est donc une très grosse recommandation, pour ceux qui aiment l'artistique du jeu vidéo, car ce jeu est une vraie oeuvre. 
[h1]SPOILERS, ne regardez pas si vous n'avez pas fini le jeu. j'insiste.[/h1]
[spoiler] Petit à petit, au fil de l'histoire, on découvre la métaphore du jeu, c'est à dire (du moins mon interprétation personnelle), on incarne un souvenir d'un enfant dans l'esprit de son père, après qu'il l'a perdu lors d'une tempête en mer. on passe donc de zone en zone, dans l'ordre chronologique, chacune représentant des phases du deuil dans l'esprit du père. à la fin de la presque dernière zone, celle de la dépression: l'enfant que l'on controle finit par se jeter lui-même dans le vide, signifiant le père qui devient finalement capable de lâcher prise et d'accepter les choses : c'est la dernière phase. bien sûr il n'oublie pas son fils, mais il accepte son absence inévitable, et décide que la vie continue. [/spoiler]
C'est beau, c'est joyeux, c'est très triste, et encore beau.
Bien sûr, tout cela sans aucun dialogue ni texte, uniquement des mises en scène, de la poésie et une direction artistique qui fait tout.

review:
tldr like shadow of the colossus without the colossi.

this is a pretty, somber, quiet experience that really nails the aesthetic and tone it was shooting for. it easily brings you through a gambit of emotions such as confusion, loneliness, joy and melancholy. its not so much that the story is complicated so much as it is very well told. there's no dialogue in this game so all the story telling has to be shown and not told. from a movie fans perspective i appreciate this.  its amazing how such a simple game can brig so much to the table with such a simple story. this is where the game shines. where the game could do a bit better is on the difficulty side. the puzzles and climbing sections make up the bulk of the experience and while they are clearly not phoned in they didn't really break the mold or challenge me. there's nothing inherently wrong with that of course but your not going to feel like your breaking new grounds. no completely unique mechanic that lights you up, nothing too hard. that's gonna turn some people off. there was maybe one or two puzzles that slowed me down for a sec but nothing too hard. there's a place for that in gaming in my opinion though. not everyone wants to be scratching there heads for hours on every single puzzle.for me this broke no deals.

still if your looking for a light single player puzzle and climbing game experience with a very moving tone this could tickle your fancy. would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045501637', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1530770350}
review: I bought this game thinking it'd just be a nice and simple adventure with a nice art style which I adore and search a lot in game, but it turned out to be much much more than just this. It starts as a sweet, joyful story full of magic and bright colours, becoming deeper and deeper as you play it, eventually unfolding the true meaning behind this game, which is the complete opposite of what the game conveys you for the first half (I made it last 6 hours, but depending on how you play it, it might last half of double that time. Of course I intend to complete it fully, 'cause it totally deserves it.) or so, which is bitter, but at the same time tries to teach you a lesson that is very very important in life. All this, with one of the best OST I've ever heard in my life. Impossible not to be carried by its charme. I advise you to play it in one go, so take a day for yourself, be sure no one is gonna disturb you in any way, and enjoy this masterpiece to the fullest. Definitely deserves the all the money it costs. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166043878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1529821652}
review: Never has any form of art provoked such a profound feeling in me such as RiME has. Truly a work of masterful art. The time you spend as this character and how all the subtleties within the game influence you is done is such a way that I had not realized it as a I played. I cannot explain how I felt after playign the game because that will completely rui nthe experience for someone reading this that hasn't already played the game. I will simpyl say that it is refreshing to once again feel so heavily for a work of art. Without a doubt, for the rest of my life, I wil lrecommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250078536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1530771628}
review: My partner bought me this game. I didnt want to play it. I normally play Lego video games . I decided to install the game and give it a quick try. I could not stop playing. Everything about this game is beautiful. I loved the world, the music, the story, and the ending. This was an easy game. I get fraustrated easily in games and tend to look up the walkthroughs, but I didnt need to in this game, and I didnt want to ruin the story for myself. I have told all my friends to play this game. I loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054973039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1530659393}
review:
A Beautiful Atmospheric Palate Cleanser. Ever played ICO or Shadow Of Colossus? It's sorta like that.
Your character is unarmed in a mysterious island filled with ruins of an ancient civilization, you are drawn to a colossal tower far off in the distance, and you want to get to the top. That's basically the plot, you'll uncover clues that will reveal more of the story as you go.  This game is a great break if you want to get away from all the stress of combat and shooters, this game has no direct fighting or combat, yet it doesn't need it. You'll explore the beautiful island and its ruins, figure out the working of puzzles in order to uncover your path and reach that tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965722299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1530543073}
review:
I enjoyed playing RIME, loved the world, music and story.

The only thing that slightly let it down for me was the camera control, but then this isn't the first game to suffer from erratic cameras that swing around just as you jump!

The puzzles themselves are fairly straight forward but enjoyable, and never felt frustrating.

The game itself reminded bit of Journey and ICO (for its' mood), but it does stand by itself as an enjoyable game to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198067361463', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1530541738}
review:
I was looking for a game like The Last Guardian, and discovered this game what impressed me already with its trailer and gameplay. I wanted to buy it in a sale, because the game is expensive for the average gameplay hours (~7 hours).

In the Steam Summer Sale 2018 I've finally bought it. I went play it very fast and while playing I discovered much extras in this game. I liked the graphics immediately and the game felt relaxing. After a few hours of playing, the game became exiting with some boss battles and fights against weird creatures. The puzzles were at a good level. In the final became the story very clear for me, and after all it was a sensitive game. The music is impressive, from the beginning to the final.

If you want to buy this game, please buy if for at least 17 euros because it's worth!

This game is 10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706844', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1530493926}
review:
RiME is a calm/relaxing puzzle/platformer with environmental storytelling. It features magnificent graphics, a great soundtrack, and some magic/moving moments.

On the downside, the puzzles and platforming are good but not great. In the end, RiME is a great experienceif you know what it is and it's right for you : if you're expecting complex platforming or brain-scratching puzzles or any kind of combat, RiME is not for you. If you just want to spend some quality relaxing time exploring magnificent worlds while learning more about the story, this game is perfect for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042069229', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1530482499}
review:
[b] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31067175/] If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page here [/url]. [/b]

RiME is a puzzle adventure game in the mold of ICO and The Last Guardian, while also evocative of other indies like Journey, Abzu and The Unfinished Swan. If you enjoyed any of those titles, then I’d say it’s safe to say that you will really enjoy RiME.

Originally debuting with 2012’s Deadlight, developer Tequila Works delivers a real gem with RiME. While I enjoyed Deadlight, a good-not-great post-apocalyptic sidescroller, I would have never guessed they had it in them to make a game like RiME. I compared the game to Sony exclusives ICO and The Last Guardian, which is funny because at one time RiME too was a Sony exclusive. I’d say the split worked out pretty well for Tequila Works and gamers as a whole since more people get to play it now. I also firmly believe that RiME is a better game, and experience, than either ICO or The Last Guardian.

Being as spoiler free as possible, you play as a young boy who wakes up on a mysterious island. On this island you solve various environmental puzzles that I found to be both fun and intuitive. The game strikes a good balance of being accessible to most people while not making its solutions obvious on first glance. The game also boasts a striking visual aesthetic than is strong throughout and wholly cohesive.

Gameplay wise, it’s most similar to The Last Guardian, albeit with much, much better controls. I actually couldn’t finish TLG because I found the controls to so offensively bad. RiME is much better with it and I rarely found myself missing a jump and falling off something. Luckily, if you do make a wrong jump the checkpoint system is quite generous, so you’ll never lose too much progress. Perhaps the thing that most impressed me gameplay wise was the camera system. So often in third person games the camera can get hung up on the environment or just plain get in your way. This is not the case with RiME at all. It’s very cinematic and truthfully I rarely had to touch the camera controls. It always seems to be in the right place at the right time and more importantly does not impede you at all.

I’m keeping this review somewhat intentionally vague because I think it’s best to go in blind. If you liked the games I mentioned at the top, then know that this is a game for you. It often bests what those games do and will definitely deliver on the emotional beats as well. Tequila Works really outdid themselves with this one and delivered one of the best indie experiences of the past couple of years in my eyes. This should be a game in everyone’s collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997194818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1530472817}
review:
[i]TIP: M&K Users! Take your fingers completely off the keyboard between movement changes during climbing puzzles. I'm guessing it doesn't handle key-holding well because the game was designed for controllers. Except for that and a few issues with climb-onto-box-directly-in-front-of-you, keyboard + mouse works just fine.

TIP2: Achievement Hunters! Don't even bother looking for the various collectibles if you want to avoid a walkthrough on your first playthrough. You absolutely will not find them, and some are pretty convoluted and will require multiple playthroughs. Do yourself a favor and play the game once for the story, and then again for the achievements. I HATE using guides/walkthroughs, but it's a must for this game. Use [url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/articles/view/video-games/walkthroughs/17776-Rime-Achievement-Trophies-Guide-100-Completion]this one[/url] for 100% as the Steam guides for RiME are trash.[/i]

Recommending this game because I bought it on sale and got at least a dozen hours of playtime out of it. Under any other circumstances this would be a negative review due to poor performance, lack of manual saving, poor controls, tedious achievements, and an embarrassingly bad-looking protagonist. Aesthetics aside, the reason for making a game in this style is an easy performance win, but too much unoptimized-for-PC polish added to that makes the game run sluggishly. I'm sure it runs great on consoles, but the cool water effects just aren't worth the frame loss on PC when you have a main character whose face looks like Mr. Potatohead. To estimate 6 hours of playtime (single playthrough) seems reasonable, but $30 for a game with no replayability outside of achievements seems steep to me. For $15 though, there's enough good going on that I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017190871', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1530374359}
review:
Bonjour, je vais faire un résumé de ce que j'ai pensé du jeu qui sera comme suit.
- Sentiment global
- Durée
- Sentiment pendant le jeu
- Gameplay
- Prix
- SPOIL (ne lisez-pas cette partie si vous ne voulez rien apprendre du jeu) Je mettrai un avertissement

Ce jeu est tout simplement une pure merveille. Un mélange d'onirisme et de poésie portée par une ambiance graphique et sonore irréprochable, le tout, offrant une narration impécable.

Pourtant, le jeu est court, très court en fait (pour l'histoire sans chercher tous les objet à trouver) vu que je l'ai fini en 7 heures. Cela dit, le fait que l'histoire ne soit pas plus longue fait sens et une fois le jeu terminé, je me suis dit que plus long, ça aurait pu être raté. Mais certains aspects du jeu sont pour moi un peu trop survolés (je ne peux rien dire de plus ici, cela spoilerait) et auraient mérité qu'on leur accorde plus de temps.

Pendant que j'ai joué à ce jeu, j'étais vraiment dedans, ce jeu est bien fait en tout point : On se laisse porté par l'histoire, on ne se prend pas la tête, les "morts" seront rares et nullement rageante, en fait, ce jeu vous fait passer un moment agréable. N'est-ce pas le but premier d'un jeu vidéo ? Vraiment, dans ce jeu, on se sens plus dans un film que dans un jeu.

Pour ce qui est du gameplay, rien à redire de mon côté :
- Prise en main facile : Z-Q-S-D + 3 touches dont une sur la souris.
- Plateformes simples, agréables et intuitives (90% du temps) et d'une manière générale, je déteste les jeux de plateforme.
- Enigmes simples et très intuitives, avec peu de variations sans pour autant tomber dans un jeu rébarbatif, les énigmes sont cools jusqu'à la fin du jeu.
- Un gameplay rapide et fluide (j'ai quelques lags en jouant mais mon PC ne supporte pas la moitié des jeux actuels sans avoir quelques lags).
- Ce jeu se finit tout seul, si vous n'aimez pas les jeux impossibles à finir, celui-là n'offre qu'une résistance minime.

Prix : Je l'ai acheté à 50% et je ne suis pas vraiment déçu d'avoir attendu car le jeu à beau être proche de la perfection dans presque tous ses aspects, 35€ les 7 heures, c'est pas excellent quand on considère qu'une fois l'histoire finie, il n'y a plus grand chose à faire. Par contre, je vous garantie que vous ne verrez vos heures de jeu pas passer.

!
!!
!!!
!!!!
!!!!!
SPOIL  // ATTENTION //  SPOIL :
!!!!!
!!!!
!!!
!!
!
- Jouissif au départ, onirique et poétique, on suit précisément les émotions que les créateurs veulent transmettre et cela fait du bien.
- Vos sentiments changent avec l'avancement dans le jeu au même titre que le récit du jeu et si, comme moi, vous rentrez entièrement dans le personnage, vous suivrez naturellement ses émotions.
- La fin du jeu est triste, vraiment triste. Tellement juste et poignante, elle retrace les différentes étapes du deuil et c'est narré de façon spectaculaire.
- Par contre, certains aspects du deuil sont largement mieux représenté que d'autres (je parle d'un point de vue psychologique, pas de gameplay ou de longueur "d'actes")
----- Déni : Impécable
----- Colère : Impécable
----- Marchandage : En deux parties, la prmière est surprenante de justesse là où, pour la seconde, le lien avec le deuil est beaucoup plus subtil et même en ayant fini le jeu, il est compliqué de voir le lien entre le temple et le marchandage pour qui n'est pas coutumier des étapes du deuil et de leurs aspirations.
----- Désespoir : Proche de la perfection
----- Acceptation : Trop court, trop rapide, j'aurais aimé en avoir davantage sur la dernière étape de la dépression car c'est tout de même celle où la personne s'en sort et il aurait été agréable que cela dure plus de cinq minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107258071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1576378730}
review:
Maybe it's because I'm in an emotional mood, but Rime hit me in ways I did not expect to get hit.  I started out going "Okay, this game is so saturated with Ico and Shadow of the Colossus that it's an irrefutable fact that it will be sad or uplifting (or sadlifting).  I'm prepared so I'll be fine."

And somewhere along the line this went to "Ok that's pretty sad" to "Ok that's utterly heartbreaking actually" to "WAIT NO NOT THIS, STOP, RIME PLEASE NO I HAVE A FAMILY."  So, fair warning, if you possess empathy, Rime will get tears out of you.

A lot of people complain that the story was vague, but it in fact seems extremely straightforward to me.  If you're confused about something then you're probably taking it too literally.  Also, just look at the names of the levels (either at the end or on a walkthrough like I did) and the nature of the game itself should be made extremely clear to you literally at first glance.  (So on that note, fair warning that looking at a walkthrough is a kind of spoiler, but this one probably enhanced more than hurt my playthrough tbh.)

On that note, yeah, I had to use a walkthrough once or twice.  There are some little finicky points in the game where things just aren't that clear (e.g.; I got stuck in an area where an enemy kept blasting me off a ledge, which no one else seemed to experience, until I figured out that I had to pass by from MUCH closer to the enemy than the game had taught me was wise, but to be fair it had also taught that moving around just under this enemy was okay, so--YMMV).  I also struggled when the game got dark, because Enu (the kid) will usually stop and hang from a ledge but sometimes he apparently just says "screw it" and jumps.  This was only a mechanic in one or two areas though.

Otherwise, the graphics are beautiful, and I didn't struggle too much with the controls.  The keyboard support is definitely nice for people like me who're short on controllers, but there are a lot of areas where it's super clear it would be more fun with an analog stick, and camera control through the mouse is very much an acquired taste on this kind of game, so I'd definitely recommend a controller where possible.

Also, yeah it runs short (and if you're an Ueda fan then you're probably used to that sad inevitability), but there's a lot of replay value.  Collectibles carry over at the end of the game, so you can play at your own pace and not worry so much about missing out.  And the multiple levels are sprawling, with a lot of different tones, so in most of them it's very easy to get distracted from your goal by exploration.  I'm definitely looking forward to poking around again without having to worry about advancing.

So yeah I recommend it.  I don't know how to end this.  I'm gonna go rest my feelings now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249107560', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1559096938}
review:
ok, i'm coming here directly after finishing the game, because i need to get my feelings about this game out somewhere. kind of long, scroll to the end for the tl;dr

GAMEPLAY: i was wary when starting out because a lot of these adventure walking-simulator puzzle games seem to have beautiful artwork and assets, while the actual controls are...not so enjoyable. but this game? the camera is amazing. the hitboxes make sense. there were maybe two or three instances where the camera was annoying and caused me to miss a jump and/or fall, but those barely affected my overall experience. 

the attention to detail in this game is ASTOUNDING. i think the very first thing that let me know this was a story made with a lot of love in the first *two minutes* of opening the game, was how the walking animation changed when MC was in knee-deep water. you know when you're at the beach and you're trying to walk through the water but it's hard because water is like, actually really heavy? the animators and devs actually kept that in mind, and changed MCs walk cycle and speed to reflect that. such a tiny detail, but one that delighted me a lot. and that's just the very first one i noticed!

now for the story...

i won't spoil it, because it's genuinely unexpected enough that to witness it for yourself is something worth doing, but despite my own doubts about it that persisted up until literally the Very End of my playthrough, there IS  a story, and it IS absolutely incredible. it changes the way you think about the entire game -- and when i say the entire game, i mean the entire game; the main parts of it, and the collectibles as well!

tl;dr: excellent controls, heartwrenching story, and while i bought this game for the summer sale, it's more than worth the standard selling price. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064399542', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1531105710}
review: The story is simply beautiful but with a sad ending. The concepo art and visual are breathtaking, I really enjoyed the journey with this little kid and Nana the fox. Is a story about loss and how to overcome all that. The symbolism in all the game is just perfect, the meanings behind everything is so polished and well cared. I absolutely recommend this game, lot of puzzles to solve and a beautiful experience. Thank you Tequila Works

author: {'steamid': '76561197972888342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1529873942}
review:
I don't recall getting a signed permission slip for this feel trip.


Short, but worth it, grab it during a sale.
You're not playing this for the puzzles, but for the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065363152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1705104019}
review:
Breathtaking vistas, clever puzzles, amazing atmosphere. This is everything I loved about 'The Wind Waker' with an extra layer of depth to puzzle solving and platforming, which the game focuses on instead of combat. 
The music is spot on, the level design is brilliant, the mystery is engaging and at times eerie. I cant say enough good about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183874634', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1529750513}
review: 每一个亡魂，都是最美丽的星辰...

author: {'steamid': '76561198110727932', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1548580597}
review:
在steam夏季促销入手了在愿望单里躺了很久的《RiME》，
悠扬的配乐（大提琴，小提琴和钢琴）与美到窒息的场景，让我这个打僵尸爱好者清理完屏幕上的血浆与断肢之后，宛如一缕地中海微咸的海风拂面，整个游戏没有一点字幕提示，就这么误打误撞的开启了一个个关卡，都能看到游戏制作者的各种精心设计，主角还能和配乐一起哼唱，解开一个个谜题之后内心会有一点窃喜和成就感～
了解到这个游戏的很大原因是我喜欢的小提琴精灵Lindsay Stirling的那一个《Forgotten City from RiME》MV。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971163854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1529705288}
review:
Ich war leider schon nach 5 Std. druch, war dennoch die Zeit über gut unterhalten.

Allerdings nervt die Steuerung ab und zu, da einem ab und zu die die Kontrolle der Kamera geklaut wird und man dann nur noch im Zickzack laufen kann (Maus/Tastatur)

Durch den Fuchs u.s.w. wird man immer gut geleitet, so das man sich eigentlich nicht verlaufen kann.

Allerdings kann ich das Spiel nur im einem Sale empfehlen, 35€ wäre etwas viel für die 5std Unterhaltung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135704390', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1549660348}
review:
Оптимизация - 0/10. У меня ведьмак 3 с лучшими настройками шел, чем сие творение. А там минималки в разы лучше максималок здесь. Остальное описывать не берусь, ибо играть было невозможно.
UPD. А вот теперь берусь оценивать и остальное. На топовом компе на максималках просадки по fps до 40-45, и при том это происходит не разово, а с завидной регулярностью. Учитывая офигительно простую графику, уже хочу опустить оценку оптимизации ниже нуля. Это не норма.
О самой игре:
Она интересная, расслабляющая, но слишком затянутая. Для такого "мягкого" формата игр такая продолжительность слишком велика. Я успел заскучать за час до конца. Всё можно было сделать более лаконично.
Сюжет - с заявкой на звание "глубокого". Именно так я не считаю. К персонажу не привязываешься, к миру - немного. Финал можно описать так: "взяли с бухты барахты"
Определенно не советую к покупке, даже любителям добрых и спокойных игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067758848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1529199147}
review:
This game was absolutely amazing to play. I really liked the puzzles, none of them were that complicated... sometimes the only reason they took so long was because I was over thinking haha. The game is stunning, the soundtrack is phenomenal, and you really get emotionally invested in this game. I kinda got an Ori and the Blind Forest / Majora's Mask vibe from it. Prepare for some feels, and enjoy this spectacular game :)

Oh, and I definitely preferred controller instead of keyboard/mouse on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997906247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1529535387}
review:
If you played Submerged and felt like it needed more puzzles like Hob...
If you think Legend of Zelda has way too many fights and not enough intelectual challenges...
If you remember Myst fondly for its atmosphere and carefully paced story...

You'll like this game. 

If you're looking for PUBG, you're going to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087165950', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1529224479}
review:
在游戏刚发售的时候就已经购买了
最开始玩了一段时间 然后因为严重的优化不好和掉帧问题 所以停摆了
也是因为中间有一段的体验非常不好
过于冗长的解谜和毫无配乐导致中期一度因为太过无聊而放弃
尔后过了很久再有空想起这游戏还没玩完又接着拿起来游玩
刚好故事来到了末尾高潮部分
配乐的恰到好处和情节的渲染让我非常的受感动

不知道是因为UE4的优化问题还是游戏本身没有做好优化
至少是无法开SSAA阴影是无法开高
否则会只有30-45帧
这会对游戏体验有极大的影响

游戏的画风是我非常喜欢的类型
配乐也是恰到好处
不过会有一些无配乐的纯解谜环节 这点会让你觉得太过无聊
不过还是挺推荐这款游戏的
如果要给这款游戏打分的话我会给个7.5/10分

author: {'steamid': '76561197993295189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1528945030}
review: Интересная, приятная и очень красивая с графической и музыкальной точки зрения игра. А самое главное - очень трогательная и душевная! Здесь всё сделано с душой и большой фантазией. А в самом конце игра раскрывает все свои тайны и трогает буквально до слёз! Ещё одно настоящее произведение игрового искусства ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198336585661', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1528948621}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965303700', 'num_games_owned': 1019, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1652032892}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970393740', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1528411944}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153005431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1528190910}
review:
画面的艺术风格有点类似风之旅人和荒野之息，卡通渲染的感觉非常讨喜，整体的材质和光影都很惊艳，加上和谐的色调运用在视觉上使这段旅程让人感到非常舒服和享受，这画面能值回大半票价。感觉音乐和画面的契合度没有风之旅人当时给我的感受那么强，这点就见仁见智吧w

剧情和解谜要素上有些过于普通，其实剧情什么的也没看懂意思...如果一次通关后想集齐全收集要素有点麻烦，基本上等于再跑一遍地图，反正我是懒得再来一遍，重玩价值比较低。

艺术品一般的作品，推介打折入手~

author: {'steamid': '76561198263711976', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1526983972}
review:
브라더스와 비슷한 스타일의, 퍼즐 요소가 굉장히 많은 어드벤처 게임이다. 장르가 어드벤처라고는 하지만 거의 대부분이 퍼즐이라 워킹시뮬레이션+퍼즐정도로 생각하면 되겠다. 게임 분위기는 이코 3부작이나 젤다의 전설과 조금 비슷한 느낌이다.

파스텔톤의 미려한 그래픽이 정말 일품이며(인디게임 중에서는 상위권이라 할만하다) ost 또한 게임의 분위기와 잘 맞아들어가 심금을 울린다. 연출력이 굉장히 빼어나서 게임에 감정이입이 쉽게 잘 되는것도 큰 장점이라 하겠다.

퍼즐의 난이도는 크게 어렵지 않다. 공략은 거의 볼 필요가 없을것이다. 가끔 막히는 구간도 나비나 여우 및 바닥 문양들이 힌트를 주기때문에 막힘없이 플레이할 수 있을것이다. 피지컬이 필요한 부분도 아예 없다시피 하기 때문에 영화를 보는 느낌으로 즐길 수 있다.

곳곳에 스토리를 더 잘 이해할 수 있는 수집요소들이 있고 도전과제 또한 존재하지만, 엔딩보는데만 주력한다면 3~4시간정도면 무리없이 엔딩을 볼 수 있다. 복선을 충분히 깔아두었기 때문에 큰 반전이랄 것은 없지만 워낙 잘 만든 게임이라 엔딩본 후 한동안 깊은 여운에 잠길것이다. 충분히 사서 해볼만한 가치가 있는 게임이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388282525', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1652616826}
review: 很不错的剧情，玩到结局才后知后觉的冲击让我头皮发麻，可惜就是优化不是很好（换显卡是不可能的，这辈子都不会换显卡的）

author: {'steamid': '76561198092433902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1526665819}
review:
The game itself is beautiful and has amazing story with wonderful music. As for the gameplay, it lacks some refining and smoothness and feels slightly beta. As for the game itself, the storyline is short, about 5-6 hours. Despite it's breathtaking setting, it is not enough for the price in my opinion. Puzzles are basic and easy, there are few harder places but compared to other puzzle games, they felt lacking. There are a lot of collectibles and achievements but personally they are not enough since all in all the game doesn't provide enough content for the price point, again strickly my opinion. Game also lacks option to save, only way is to have the game do autosave, which can be frustrating,

I did enjoy the game despite it's rough gameplay (which you get used to) and loved the storyline. If you are looking for a game that you can spend hours and hours on, then this will not be the game for you. If you on the other hand enjoy the casual game with good storyline and opportunity to roam free while listening to beautiful soundtrack, then I'd recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994718314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1526671442}
review: Visually beautiful game, love the design and art work, very simple yet heartbreaking story, I liked it but I would never play it again, I would compare it to the Firewatch which is also wonderful, although I would never play it again, very tiresome in a way

author: {'steamid': '76561198121520253', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1526402917}
review: Simplemente ESPECTACULAR. Emotivo, triste, conmovedor, maravilloso y asi todos los adjetivos que quieras añadirle. Un 10/10 por la increible banda sonora, por la relacion que creas con el niño a lo largo del juego y por los puzles que tienen el punto justo de dificultad para tener que pensar pero no para frustrartre

author: {'steamid': '76561198083018726', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1526287500}
review:
Rime es un juego que te cuenta una historia sin decir una sola palabra, te imbuye de sensaciones, de bellos escenarios, puzles intuitivos que en general, no son excesivamente complicados, pero que te harán pararte a pensar en algún momento. Una banda sonora que acompaña perfectamente en cada momento a nuestro protagonista, que tendrá que seguir al pequeño zorro para guiarse e ir tras el hombre de la capa roja. En este juego no tienes un puntero, una guía, un tutorial, o una flecha que indique a dónde ir o qué hacer, debes ser tú quien, fijándote en los sucesos y el entorno, descubras el camino a seguir o la acción a realizar.

Es en definitiva, una obra maestra creada por Tequila Works, su belleza gráfica es de las que te hacen pararte a observar bien el escenario, un "must have" si disfrutas de los juegos de puzles o los que te provocan emociones.

10/10

Mi más sincera enhorabuena al equipo de Tequila Works por el juegazo que es RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297929701', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1526370615}
review:
[h1]标题释义[/h1]
[quote=剑桥英文词典]rime
noun UK /raɪm/ US /raɪm/
[ C or U ] mainly literary frost (= the thin, white layer of ice that forms when the air temperature is below the freezing point of water, especially outside at night).[/quote]

[h1]故事[/h1]
大部分时间，你会以为故事无非只是与《见证者》《纪念碑谷》《ICO》雷同，因此，结局到来时反而会多一分诧异。RiME 为你准备的是一个非开放性的结局。结局中，所有暗喻与伏笔都能获得唯一而合理的解释。全程不出现文字，也讲了一个这么好的故事，值得一赞。

[h1]游玩机制&关卡[/h1]
很无聊（tedious）

[h1]音乐[/h1]
是亮点。

[h1]画面[/h1]
容易惹晕。

[h1]总结[/h1]
值得一试。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992683011', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1526210080}
review:
엔딩을 보기전까진 너무 지루했습니다.
내용을 알고 나서는 여운이 남는 게임이 되긴 했습니다만, 그럼에도 불구하고 게임플레이는 재미가 없었어요.
퍼즐 요소가 좀 더 난이도가 있던지, 액션요소가 더 많던지 했었어야 됬다고 봅니다.
훌륭한 그래픽과 시나리오를 게임성이 받쳐주질 못했네요.
안타까운 작품입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004468195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1538269355}
review:
Un juego precioso de principio a fin. 
Mecánicas sencillas y divertido. 
Capaz de poder gustar tanto a pequeños como mayores.
Una historia que emociona. 
Una dirección artística exquista. 
Sinceramente, un oasis entre tanto shooter y tanto multijugador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230864148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1525215410}
review:
Oyun hakkında diyecek çok şeyim var. Oyunun olumlu yanları da var ancak tavsiye ediyor muyum diye düşününce olumsuz yanları ağır basıyor.

Birincisi; Oyun bug dolu. Bug'la karşılaştığında oyuncunun son kaydedilen noktaya geri dönebilmesini sağlaması gereken "Restart from last checkpoint" seçeneği konmuş ama bu checkpoint'ler o kadar seyrek ki geri dödüğünüzde son 15-20 dk'yı tekrar oynamak zorunda kalıyorsunuz.

İkincisi; ciddi optimizasyon sorunları var.

  Üçüncü olarak da hikayeden bahsetmek istiyorum. Oyun size oyun boyunca hikaye adına inanılmaz fazla şey vaadediyor. Son ana kadar size daha diğerlerini açıklamadan merak edecek birbirinden alakasız şeyler vererek "Acaba bunlar nereye bağlanacak" diye merak ettirerek her an dikkatinizi diri tutuyor. Ancak bu oyun da bana aklırsa finali açısından bir "The Witness" vakası. Oyun, oyun boyu "Nası yani?", "Bu ne şimdi?", "Bu ne alaka, dur bakalım ne çıkacak" dedirterek oyuncunun beynini yakan abuk subuk şeyleri gösteren sanki o değilmiş gibi aşırı alakasız ve klişe bir sonla bitiyor. Bu bana artık "Dear Esther yapınca olduydu bizde niye olmasın" diyerek yapıverilen bir çeşit çakallık gibi geliyor. Özellikle son dönem indie oyunlarda çok sık yapılan, formülize hale geldiği için de sinir bozucu olmaya başlayan formül şu: Oyuncuya, oyunun sonunu sanki aşırı kapalı şekilde anlatıyormuş da o salaklığından anlamıyormuş hissi yaşatacak acayip soyut sinematikler göstererek, aslında hikayeyi hiçbir yere bağlamamak. Bağlayacak yer bulamamayı kurtarmak için zekice bir yol ve Dear Esther'in başarısının ardından birçok indie oyun yaratıcısı tarafından bu formül kullanılmaya başlandı. Ancak Dear Esther'de zaten dolu dolu bir edebi dil hazzı vardı ve gerçekte hikayenin ne olduğu önemsiz bir teferruat olarak kalıyordu. Tahmin etmeye çalışıp teoriler üretmek de keyif veriyordu. Tek kelime konuşmanın olmadığı bir oyun için bunu söyleyebilmek pek mümkün değil. Görsel olarak çok güzel olması, oyunu kurtaramıyor bana kalırsa. 




Karşılaştığım bazı bug'lar;
-Başlarda bir yerde karakterim duvarın içine girdi ve orada hapsoldu. Restart etmek zorunda kaldım

-Üstü açık yerlerde durduğunuzda size kuş saldırdığı, ya kapalı alana girmeniz ya da su altına dalmanız gereken bölümde, girdiğim kapalı bir mağarada kuş sanki açık alandaymışım gibi gaipten saldırabilmeye devam etti. Aynı yerde respawn olduğum için de dirildiğim anda tekrar saldırıyordu. Oyun burada sonsuz bir döngüye girdi. 

-Sonlarda yağmurlu karanlık bölümde karakterim bir kayanın üzerinde aşağı düşme animasyonunda havada takılı kaldı tüm komutlar devre dışı kaldı. Bu en son 2001 Harry Potter'ın ilk oyununda başıma gelmişti. Restart ettim 

-Bunun dışında oyun boyu Prince of Persia tarzı duvardaki edge'lerde tırmanma sekansları var. Bu PoP oyunlarında sevdiğim bir şeydi ancak bu oyunda maalesef bu kısımlar da bug dolu. Kamera açıları siz tırmanırken sürekli sapıtıyor. Bazen tırmanma sekansı bitip yere indiğinizde normale dönmesi gereken kamera açısı dönmüyor, karakterimle ekrandan çıkıp gittiğimde duvarı göstermeye devam ediyor. *Restart*

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1524399400}
review:
[h1] Amazing. What an experience. Truly a masterpiece, this is one of the most gorgeous games I have ever played. No need for attacks, enemies, guns or vehicles. Just you, an incredible exploration Puzzle Adventure and a Story, without any Text or Story-telling. Only you in a Walking Simulator. [/h1]

[i] I'll be honest with you, when I first heard about this game, I wasn't sure what to make of it. It looked gorgeous, but I couldn't shake the feeling that it felt really reminiscent of a lot of other games (a lot of people throw around comparisons to "The Last Guardian," and I certainly see it). However, after hearing a lot more about the game and reading about it (and also seeing that it was a lower price), I decided to give it a go, and let me tell you, I had an incredible time.

I'll be the first to let you know, "RiME" is not for everyone. The game doesn't tell you anything: you interpret the story in your own way, you aren't told where to go or how to get there. Some people might get frustrated by that. Me? I was so moved by the game that I couldn't care less. The game is visually breathtaking, emotional, fun, exciting, heartbreaking, and all-around excellent (It reminded me a lot of The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker. The sound design is also incredible, and I can say without hesitation that the music really added to the experience as a whole.

Like I said, the game isn't for everyone: the story can be frustrating to understand, the puzzles can be frustrating to solve, and some may find it too slow. That's totally okay, you are entitled to your opinion. However, I personally loved "RiME," and I can definitely say that if your curiosity is piqued, then give this game a go. It was an unforgettable experience and a beautiful game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982367787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1524303130}
review:
Sublime ! Rime est une ôde au jeu. Tout le long de cette aventure jallonée de superbes musiques vous découvrez un univers en cell-shading très réussi. C'est un véritable voyage immersif qui a aucun moment ne vous donne d'objectifs ou d'indications très claires... et qui pourtant vous transporte dans une palette très complète d'émotions ! 

J'ai pour ma part pris une énorme claque et je le recommande à toute personne qui souhaite se voir proposer une expérience nouvelle, alternative, qui se veut être un très sérieux concurrent du cinéma ; car Rime est en fait un film d'animation intéractif ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053049300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1651430042}
review:

The atmosphere realy engulfs you. No where though the game do you have to spend time on elements that do not feel meaningfull. Had i been able to erase my mind so that i could play this game again for the first time i would have done it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279150280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1524253067}
review: Esse foi o melhor jogo que jogei na vida, tanto em qualidade de grafico quanto na historia, a historia é surpreendente, encantadora e intensa, trilha sonora incrivel. Eu poderia jogar esse jogo 100 vezes que ainda sim iria querer jogar a 101, sem enjoar. ESSE JOGO NÃO TEM NENHUM DEFEITO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410735612', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1524095969}
review:
Como notas negativas: no está todo lo optimizado que debería y aparte a veces la cámara falla algo. El gameplay es bastante dirigido, aunque con cierta (pseudo) libertad, y, en general, es sencillo.

Lo positivo (gana claramente): es MUY bonito, es pura poesía visual tanto por lo estético como por la historia que pretende reflejar. Te apela a los sentimientos y de seguro no te deja indiferente cuando lo acabas. La banda sonora es de CINE con mayúsculas. Se deja jugar muy fácil y es toda una experiencia, con un final muy emotivo. Las animaciones están muy cuidadas. El sonido es muy bueno también.

¡Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198385831142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1554480937}
review:
一个美到我不忍心通关的游戏，一部没有台词却毫不空洞的佳作。
（以下个人理解）
那个男孩，在Rime的幻灭中，得到却又失去，经历痛苦的蜕变，沉淀前世过往，将灵魂交予星辰，涅槃新生。
那个老人，在落满尘埃的房间中，吹起了风车，那撕裂的红披风，让它随风去吧，将眼泪寄给风浪，放下噩梦。
想起sodagreen的一首歌。
没有不会谢的花，
没有不会退的浪。
没有不会停下来的绝望，
你在忧郁什么？
时间从来不会等，
是片刻组成永恒。

author: {'steamid': '76561198399957826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1532335478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198255241269', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1525208354}
review: This game is truely exquisite. I found the whole experience of playing this to be relaxing, fun and emotional. It is mostly puzzle based and you will not find yourself dying or losing lives. It does not work like that. It is mostly simple platforming and as stated, puzzle based, though the puzzles are not of the type you would find in say a typical point and click game that have a habit of driving one mad. The soundtrack is exceptional and the story, though may seem rudimentary, is not. The game runs on the Unreal 4 engine and is sadly poorly optimised (it is from an indie studio I believe). If you have a poor GPU it will struggle, though I mostly got a solid 60fps on a GTX 980.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078922903', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1522882942}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073198378', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1522434748}
review:
Nun äußere ich mich einmal zu RiME

Story 

Eine am Anfang etwas verwirrende  aber doch schöne Story .
Das Spiel ist schön zu Steuern , sowie auch genial Gestaltet es macht von Stunde zu Stunde immer mehr spass da die ,Story einen mitreißt und das auf geniale weise . 

Die Rätsel sind gut gemacht in manchen hinsichten ein wenig zu einfach ^^.
 
Nun kommen wir zu den Pro und Contras.

Pro
-   Geniale Story /Tiefgreifend
-   Schön Gestaltete Welt 
-   Gute Rätsel


Contra

-   Kurze Spielzeit
-   Begrenzte wege (man muss auf Schätze aufpassen man kommt nicht zurück)


Im großen und ganzen hat das Spiel viele Stärken aber auch ein paar schwächen , ich persönlich bereue es nicht das Geld dafür ausgegeben zu haben ( im Sale). Das Spiel hat eine wirklich geniale Story und das Geld ist das Spiel alle male wert selbst da es (kurz) ist . 

Ich hoffe es wird von diesem Publisher mehr in dieser Richtung geben aber mit einem besseren Ende , die Bewertung ist meiner Meinung nach  von 10 Punkten eine  8 wert .

author: {'steamid': '76561198202733986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1521835080}
review:
아름다운 영상미와 사운드가 최고 장점.
생각지도 못한 반전스토리 때문에 여운이 남는다.

대사 따위 없으므로 직관적으로 길찾고 퍼즐풀고 스토리를 이어가기 어렵지 않으나 10번에 한두번은 꼭 길잊어버린다..
퍼즐난이도는 높지 않으나 비슷한것들이 계속 반복되고 시간을 잡아 먹다보니
중간에 내가 이 게임을 왜하고 있는걸까..하는 생각이 들때가 있다.

단숨에 깨버려야지 라는 생각을 버리고 천천히 영상미와 사운드를 즐기면서 해야 재미있는 감성 게임!

author: {'steamid': '76561198801205118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1522209184}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025161691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1654559570}
review: $30 seems pricey for a 5 hour game.  If you catch it on sale, you must buy this game. The environments are gorgeous.  The soundtrack is exceptional.  The story is very well told.  [spoiler] This game doesn’t tug at your heart strings.  It grabs a fistful and yanks. [/spoiler]    The puzzles aren’t very challenging but they serve their purpose and the gimmicks are used just enough to be interesting without getting boring. The only complaint I have is that the character would sometimes get stuck on nothing but I was able to jump and get unstuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353357468', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1522218508}
review:
这个游戏带着浅浅的笑容欺骗了所有人，没有人能在第一章就察觉出其背后挥之不去的忧伤。

说实话我不是有耐心玩探索解密类游戏的人，但是看着视频中单薄的男孩和耀眼的狐狸一路走来，不由想到了圣埃克苏佩里的《小王子》，也许，那么，不可不玩。我是个对小王子放弃狐狸耿耿于怀一辈子的人[strike]当然这个游戏也很好的选择了这个结局[/strike]，带着这份冲动所以我玩了下去。

如果这是一个推理游戏，那么还没有开局我就已经判断失败。男孩黝黑的皮肤是最直白的证据，何况那艘贯穿始终的帆船。我却胡乱猜测出西方传统民间故事里失落王子的背景，想着这是个被巫师诱骗的可怜王子通过破解诅咒唤醒失落的祖国，被诅咒的国王和皇后的故事。记忆碎片也是不断佐证我的错误猜测。

却未想到却是满盘皆输。人的记忆是经过伪装而呈现在人的大脑的，少年通往万物生灵最终归宿的这场旅行就像《卖火柴的小女孩》一样在冰冷和困意中自己送给自己最后的礼物。没有哪个少年不想畅游于古堡中探险，儿童文学中也经常有这种题材。死亡之旅也许就应该像古埃及人在亡灵书中所畅言的欢乐安详，在此祝愿游戏里的少年得到一个安徒生式的结局。

游戏记忆和现实交织在那艘令人悲伤的帆船上，父子二人记忆中的相互错位是游戏在表达：既是我失去了你，也是我失去了你。玩家承受了父子两人的两份失去，以及从手中滑落的红色披风。双重的无力感实在令人窒息。

还有最让我想寄刀片的就是旅途之中，机器人和狐狸的相继磨灭，好友和伙伴为了我的旅途而消亡，悲哀莫过于此[strike]当然不得不说动画中设计男孩推门有些多此一举，因为前一道门如何打开男孩是亲眼所见[/strike]

随着进程一点一点的忧伤和失落浅浅的溢出，这种感受让我无法一口气玩下去，以至于通关拖到现在

author: {'steamid': '76561198124418310', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1604107702}
review:
This is an amazing short game, that is visually good and peacefull looking while also maintaining a nice playable expierence. The game puzzles are not that hard which for the average player is not a problem, I actually enjoyed the simple puzzles because it means that you won't get stuck on one section for way to long. Visually the game is very pleasing on the eyes and it gives you a relaxing expierence while progressing through the game.

The only downsite is that the game is hard to run, so i reccomend playing with controller because playing at 30 fps with a controller feels better then playing it with keyboard and mouse.
Some sections will run smoothly, others don't but appart from that it's just an amazing game overall and it is definitely worth playing. it only takes around 5 pleasant hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110234880', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1522265370}
review: Este jogo chega a ser poético! Joguei apenas umas 3h e vim correndo fazer uma análise. A trilha sonora, os desafios, os gráficos, a necessidade de usar seu raciocionio lógico para avançar... A imaginação que age enquanto você vê gravuras e tenta identificar a história conforme joga... Fantástico! É um jogo de fantasia em que você precisa resolver charadas para ir adiante, sei que parece meio parado... Mas eu não consegui piscar por 3 horas seguidas. E apenas parei porque antes disso tinha jogado 6h de South Park antes de testar este aqui. Já faz um tempo que tenho ele no Steam, mas se eu soubesse teria começado a jogar antes. Está na prateleira para dar uma atenção diária :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157718507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1550086234}
review:
RiME got me so excited and now, after finishing it, I'm absolutely amazed about this beautiful game. 
All components are fitting perfectly together and result in an harmonic atmosphere. I'm a huge fan of it's graphical design, the music, the puzzles and it's somehow interpretational storyline. But what thrilled me the most, was this unexpected ending. *Ninja's cutting onions.* 
It's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330425429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1521518707}
review:
Just beat the game. I was not ready for that ending. By the time the credits rolled everything sort of blended together to give the full picture of what was happening. I loved this game. I don't have a single bad thing to say about it.

The story was pretty gripping, the characters were all very emotive as you knew what they were feeling without them having to say a word, and  the mechanics were pretty unique. I bought this game a while ago placed it on the backlog. Had I played this the year it came out I'd be screaming GOTY CONTENDER.

Anyway if you liked games like 'The Witness' or 'The Talos Principle', this game is right up your alley although I didn't find the puzzles to be as mind-numbingly difficult.

The pace of the game for me personally was perfect. I walk up to a puzzle, don't understand it one bit. After some pondering and playtesting with the physics/mechanics the eureka moment hits and it all makes sense. I never felt like pulling my hair out.

If you like an immersive, well paced story, progressively harder puzzles with different mechanics for most, and an eye for the art style (It only gets more beautiful) GET THIS GAME :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198099882601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1521478383}
review:
This game is a hidden gem in the gaming world. Gorgous graphics, amazing storyline, and great gameplay. The game is one of very few on steam that I absolutly love that has no violence in it whatsoever. While some darker areas on the map may scare small children, and certain mobs as well, overall it is a very great game I could recommend to anyone looking for something to sink their money into. However, without spoiling the game I will say this, the objects and objectives in the game are highly symbolic. I recommend AFTER completing the game to go look for a simpler explanation online as the game, espeacially the ending, is not very obvious in its meanings. This is also a very puzzle and story centric game, keep that in mind before purchasing if your looking for something faster paced, as this game is generally very slow, and mostly aims to invoke different emotions in the player.

As for the cons, there aren't very many. They are on the development side, but here they are in order from greatest complaints to least:

For one, Anti-Aliasing in this game is broken. I am running a Vega 56 card overclocked and I COULD NOT run SSAA even in 1080p medium settings. I was getting 20fps tops with horrible input lag. TXAA also has issues barley letting me hold on to 40-50 fps with some massive frame rate spikes dipping into the 20s. Honestly however, FXAA looks fine and seems to work great in this game. I was able to hold 60fps (as the max allowed in this game is 60fps for some reason) at 2k resolution max settings with FXAA on. I really wish the developers would fix this, but since this game is ported from console I can see why they would have issues like this.

Second, the parkour mechanics (at least on PC) can be frustrating at times. The main character you play has issues grabbing onto ledges you are supposed to climb or jump onto if you are already on another platform. Even if the distance is small and it is obvious that is where you need to go next. To make your life easier here is a TIP: While climbing be sure that your character is reaching out for the next platform BEFORE your make any jumps, this will tell you if he will make the jump or not without uneccesarily falling to his death.

Third, even without VSYNC, Freesync, Gsync, or whatever else you have, 60FPS is the max allowed in this game, I don't see why but that is just the way it is. Mabey it's for the physics engine or something but I doubt it. You really don't need more then 60fps in this game but I thought I would mention it.

Fourth: By far the most minor complaint, but it shows a small lack of polish with the port of this game to PC. MINOR SPOILER AHEAD!!!!!!!!!....... With that being said in certain spots in the game where you have to run from a mob (like in the above game pictures and preview section where you are running away from the bird) you character does not run straight across the bridge because of the camera angle. Because of this it is way to easy to fall off the bridge while running for your life. Its easy to fix this by just tapping the direction you need to go to compensate for the slight drag you have while trying to go straight but it needed to be mentioned so a dev can fix this small issue in an otherwise amazing game.

Overall: This game recieves 8/10 for what it is, and only loses the 2 points due to some issues with the port to PC. Keep in mind, I am a harsh critique. With that said, if you are on the fence, BUY THIS GAME!
