author: {'steamid': '76561198009996058', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1502361059}
review:
[h1] [i] RiME, 	[/i] una experiencia inolvidable	[/h1]

Todo en conjunto hace de este título una cautivadora aventura en un paraje mediterráneo. Su banda sonora, su apartado artístico, su trama y su jugabilidad, lo convierten en un imprescindible de este año, o quizás de la década.

Solo unos pocos me han emocionado, pero con [i] RiME	[/i] me he visto por encima de esa experiencia, llegando a sentir algo que ni [i] Brothers: A tale of two sons	[/i] consiguió ni creo que otra obra lo haga jamás. Podríamos decir que este juego desprende más pasión que la planteada por los desarrolladores del mismo.	

[h1] Análisis sin destripe	[/h1]

Debería hacer una reseña en frío, pero me ha entusiasmado tanto esta mágica y emotiva aventura, que he decidido analizarlo desde mi más cercana experiencia cronológica, pues es un título que puede variar su propuesta según tu estado, ya sea solo o acompañado, al jugarlo prestando atención al detalle, etc.

Respecto a la jugabilidad, en principio aparenta simpleza, pero la mecánica de utilizar la voz del protagonista es tan única que convierten una aventura con plataformas sencillas en un mundo construido a base de puzles. Arrastraremos bloques, "cantaremos" y nos moveremos cual marsupial en la jungla por los salientes, todo con un detalle impresionante. 

La primera ver que vi a la [i] IA	[/i] me quedé atónito de lo impresionante que es. No sé si dependerá del motor gráfico, que es el [i] Unreal Engine 4, 	[/i] pero igualmente nos hará sentir como niños curiosos, tal como mencionaron los creadores. El mundo nos guía como un chavalín a la aventura, cada vez más inmersiva.

Con relación a el apartado técnico, [i] RiME	[/i] no pretende ser un portento gráfico en ningún momento, y para ello lo demuestra mediante su apartado artístico, que es lo que dota de identidad a los mejores títulos. Sin esa belleza de dibujos, que pueden semejarse al espléndido [i] The Legend of Zelda: Breath of The Wild, 	[/i] no cautivaría lo mismo.  

Todo este cuidado al mínimo, tanto los cangrejos de la playa como el fondo submarino, pasando rayos de luz desde el agua más bella que he visto, a excepción del océano de [i] Sea of Thieves. 	[/i] Ello acompañado de unas animaciones espectaculares me incitan a revivir esos grandiosos escenarios, sobre todo los de lluvia, que, para mí, son los más destacables.

En cuanto a la trama, es una parte esencial del videojuego, y los señores de [i] Tequila Works, 	[/i] la desarrolladora, saben cómo contarnos una historia sin palabras. Esta empresa española está formada por exempleados de maravillosos estudios como [i] Blizzard Entertainment	[/i] (algo cuestionable según quienes), [i] MercurySteam	[/i] (creadores de [i] Castlevania: Lords of Shadow) 	[/i] y otros estudios. Esto es perceptible a la hora de llevarnos por la senda de la exploración, la cual nos incitará a descubrir más sobre esta inédita historia, con un trágico final que resultará en algún que otro sollozo.

En lo relativo al apartado sonoro, podría ser catalogado como la mayor identidad del título. Desde el comienzo hasta el final, nos acompañará la excelente banda sonora y los redundantes efectos de sonido que convertirán nuestro camino en toda una experiencia.

Absolutamente digo y diré, que es una de las mejores, aunque hay otras muy destacables también, bandas sonoras que he escuchado en mi corta vida. Emotiva cuando debe serlo, cautivadora, y, por supuesto, trágica en los mejores momentos. Asimismo, los efectos de sonido son una delicia. Desde los pequeños pasos del chico, hasta el briznar de la lluvia o el soplido del viento en la naturaleza son meros ejemplos que se extienden a lo más mínimo del plano.

En conclusión, creo haber conseguido englobar [i] RiME	[/i] en esta minúscula reseña, que ha pasado a ser una de mis obras preferidas por siempre. Viví de todo: curiosidad, impresión, alegría, tristeza y lo principal, lo he vivido yo, así como tú también deberías.

[i] *Análisis reeditado en octubre de 2018. Publicado el 10 de agosto de 2017. 	[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198114157228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1502288000}
review:
Para mi, el mejor juego Indie y atmosferico al que he jugado. Banda Sonora de 10 (mi lista de reproducción de música ya contiene todos sus temas principales), emocionante historia que te lograr saltar una lagrimilla que otra aun esforzandote por no llorar. 
Graficamente me ha dejado tambien sin palabras, muy luminoso y vistoso, a la par que oscuro y brillante cuando tenía que serlo y siempre acompañado cada bioma por una bso impresionante y acertada al momento.
Espero más juegos de esta compañia por favor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011504864', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1502155473}
review:
Une petite claque qui aurait pu être plus grande.
Quelques problèmes d'opti mais rien de bien méchant (surtout niveau son parfois, petite pertes de FPS aussi...)
Le jeu est beau, les enigmes un peu courte et facile. 
L'histoire est terriblement touchante, je vous conseil de le finir ce jeu, tout (ou presque) s'explique.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998642227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1567108266}
review:
This game gives me a double feeling, there are a lot of neat ideas and I actually liked playing the game but I can't really recommend it though.

It looks really nice, the graphics are clean with excellent lighting and a lot of attention has been spent on the artistic side. The sounds and music all fit very well and add to the immersion. 

I knew what to expect before I bought this, it's more or less a linear walking simulator with some puzzle elements and some minor storytelling. A bit like Abzu you could say.

So why am I still giving it a negative review?
- It's rather short for the price.
- not good optimized for PC, I'm getting a lot of fps drops which really break the immersion, even on lowest settings. (I can run games like DOOM and KF2 on very high-ultra without fps drops)
- It can be a bit boring at times, there is no action and not a lot of life in the game (unlike abzu which is brimming with life).
- navigating the character can be a bit tricky sometimes.


I do recommend it to people who like:
-pretty and relaxing games,
-exploring ruins,
-mediterranean climate,

but I would wait untill the price drops

author: {'steamid': '76561197963316840', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1502049336}
review:
This game sucked me in from the start. I liked the art style, loved the music, enjoyed the gameplay and was engrossed in the story.
What an adventure it was with a fulfilling ending. 
Nice little game that I couldn't put down.

Well done to the team behind it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114873144', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1502043213}
review: Best pleasant color harmony since Mad Max the game. Rime is definitely an eye candy especially if you are a sucker for a visual aesthetics. Cell shaded look reveals somehow minimalistic but very compelling experience. You can find a mix of zelda, ico, shadow of colossus aesthetics in here with a good taste. The gameplay is ok. Not groundbreaking, just standard walking, jumpings, simple puzzles but it's ok for me. Everything works great and you can absorb the story wiyhout any frustration. Overall a solid spiritual take by Spanish guys immitating a Japanise style of team ico but in a good way. Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197996121797', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1502042240}
review:
Mucho ha llovido desde que se vio RiME por primera vez.
Lo mejor que pudo hacer SONY fue perder los derechos del juego, si no lo hubiera hecho no hubiese podido disfrutar de esta grandiosa aventura. La sombra de la cancelación ha estado rondando muchísimo tiempo, demasiado tal vez.
Quizás RiME no sea un juego de los que te llevarías a una isla (a pesar de que se desarrolla en una), quizás no esté en ningún Top-algo de casi ningún jugador. Quizás no sea ese juego que le guste a todo el mundo... Pero, eso... quizás.
No considero a RiME como un superventas, ojalá lo sea porque realmente se lo merece, pero pienso que es de esos juegos que todo jugador debería de jugar al menos una vez en su vida. Pocos juegos de este tipo, creado con mucha pasión se hacen estos días.
Lo primero que entra por los sentidos es el estilo gráfico e inmediatamente después es la música, sublime para mi gusto. RiME quizás no se pueda entender o jugar igual sin la música que lo acompaña.
Me parece increíble como los chicos de Tequila han contado una historia sin usar ni siquiera unas breves líneas de texto.
Cierto es que recuerda en parte a Journey o a ICO e incluso a The Last Guardian, pero RiME tiene una identidad propia que los hace a la vez muy distintos a los títulos mencionados.
Los primeros compases de RiME sean probablemente los más sencillos del juego y nos sirven para poder aprender los controles. Éstos son muy básicos ya que sólo usamos tres botones y los sticks. Los primeros puzles que nos pone el juego nos dan una idea de que, sin llegar a ser complejos, nos va a poner a pensar un poco con bastante frecuencia. 
He de decir que la resolución de todos los puzles está en la misma habitación, casi siempre a la misma altura o en la planta superior. La primera zona es llamativa con árboles y sombras y una maravillosa playa para nosotros solos. El pequeño zorro que pronto se nos une (su misión es parecer para indicarnos a dónde ir para a continuación desaparecer) consigue que le cojas cariño y te alegras cada vez que lo encuentras de nuevo.
Gráficamente el juego luce bastante y bien y va muy fuído, aunque he sufrido un bug que me ha hecho perder no más de cinco minutos.
El sonido fx es correcto, pero sin duda, lo mejor del juego esla música, al menos para mí. Y, es que como he dicho antes no concibo RiME sin su banda sonora. Simplemente de las quince mejores soundtracks de juegos de todos los tiempos. Se adapta como un guante a lo que se está viendo en pantalla en todo momento.
Los puzles a medida que vamos avanzando van haciendo que tengamos que pensar un poco más, pero no llegan a ser desesperantes y una vez que los superas te das cuenta de que no son para tanto y que con un poco de intuición y picardía no son realmente difíciles.
Si el apartado gráfico es bonito, sin duda es en parte por los escenarios que componen el juego. Desde la playa del comienzo a la zona del diluvio universal (por lo menos lo parece) del final son paisajes realmente bellos. La zona submarina está muy lograda y es realmente bella, sin embargo, la zona del desierto ha sido la zona que menos me ha gustado.
Las cinco zonas del juego, o los cinco estados (cuando os paséis el juego lo entenderéis), están bien realizadas y tienen arquitectura y estilos distintos. Comenzamos en una paradisíaca playa, para dar paso a una zona desierta que nos lleva hasta una zona bajo las aguas para llegar a una zona de arboleda interior que nos lleva a una zona, la final, que llueve a mares. El agua de ésta última zona está representada de una manera muy realista. 
Los dos aspectos negativos que le he encontrado es que no se puede tener más de una partida a la vez. Es decir, si yo empiezo una partida, mi hija o sigue por donde voy o empieza una nueva borrándome todo lo avanzado. Y el segundo, y esto es una opinión personal, es el final.
¿Qué les pasa últimamente a los que diseñan las historias? Sinceramente creo que esta historia merecía un final más… Otro final.
Como nota yo le daría un 8.5 ya que, aunque sublime, tiene unas mínimas carencias que lo hubiesen encumbrado al olimpo de los videojuegos actuales. 
Muy bueno, pero levemente mejorable. Para los autores: Por favor cambiad el final.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015219621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1502029866}
review:
RiME

Ein aufgeblasenes 3D Journey, welches durch ein sehr gutes Art-Design und toller musikalischer Untermalung glänzt. Leider gibt es später im Spiel auch auf guten System Framedrops, die auf den Konsolen noch deutlicher ausfallen sollen. 
Die Story lädt zum spekulieren und interpretieren ein, aber mich hielt RiME nicht über die gesamte Spielzeit bei der Stange. Auch die Rätsel hätten variabler sein dürfen...
Trotzdem schönes Ding!

6.5-10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970608083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1502031343}
review: I am loving this. Slowly revealed mysterious story, everything looks so very pretty. This game is a work of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962228863', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1501983963}
review:
Really good game, beautiful artstyle/graphics and atmosphere that the music adds, the puzzles are not overly complicated so should be playable for kids.

Some parts af the game do feel a bit choppy altho its above 45fps all the time(GTX 1080 on 3440x1440) that and considering the short playtime(6-8hours), i would recommend getting it on sale... if you get it for around 15$ it would be worth every penny :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978330367', 'num_games_owned': 4132, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1502003517}
review: Enjoyable puzzle-platformer that's clearly inspired by games like ICO and The Last Guardian. You play a young boy who explores a mysterious locale by platforming and solving puzzles. None of the platforming or puzzles were particularly difficult but they were involved enough to be compelling. There's a little bit of jank, with occasionally clunky camera and controls and some pretty bad performance drops in a few areas. However, for the most part, the game runs and plays fine. Also, the game is a bit short (~6 hours) for $30. $15-20 seems more reasonable. Definitely worth a look within that price range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025288449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1501985223}
review:
Although the middle of the game felt rather padded (pseudo-puzzles, lots of climbing/backtracking), the final act was emotionally impactful enough to warrant a recommendation.

PROS:
Beautiful aesthetics, lots of care went into the environments
Great score, music rises and falls at the perfect moments
The story really picks up in the final act of the game, very satisfying ending

CONS:
Lots of climbing "puzzles" which just constitute holding a direction and hitting jump for a period
Middle of game had a little too much backtracking
Puzzles were extremely easy

author: {'steamid': '76561198240551510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1502026856}
review: I haven't finished the game yet but can only see that I'm completely taken away by the visuals of the game. Such a beautiful game and loving the solving puzzles. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants to sit back relax and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966267968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1501971055}
review: Sehr interessantes Spiel mit Elementen, die sehr gut umgesetzt wurden. Vom Stil über Story bis hin zur Musik finde ich alles stimmig und es macht sehr viel Spaß zu spielen. Leider ist es etwas kurz geraten und bei einem Preis von 35 € für 5 Stunden Spielzeit ist das leider ein großer Negativ-Punkt, aber da sonst alles sehr gelungen ist würde ich dem Spiel 8/10 Punkten geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211522696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1552455982}
review: Bon je ne vais pas passer par de long discours mais juste pour dire que ce jeu est juste une merveille!  le jeu est parfaitement fluide, l'ambiance de ce jeu me fait des frissons du debut et ce jusqu'a la fin. Les musiques sont somptueuses et la fin boulversante! cela me rappel un certain animé de ma jeunesse '' Esteban Les Mystérieuses Cités d'or '' bref un veritable bijou et honettement j'ai pas du tout accroché au videos mais une fois en main, il m'etait impossible de lacher la manette. Bravo au develloppeurs! on en demanderai presque une suite, tellement c'est bon mais court mais quand c'est bon, tout semble court, compter entre 7h et 8h pour en venir a bout, sans devourouillez tout les succes, bref j'ai envie de replongez dans cette aventure juste pour tout debloquer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162171279', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1499857861}
review:
QUE BANDA SONORA, LA MADRE QUE ME PARIO. EL JUEGO ES PRECIOSO.

Es un 10 en cuanto a apartado artistico y la banda sonora (sobre todo esta ultima; hacia bastante tiempo que no encontraba una banda sonora asi). En cuanto al protagonista me recuerda muchisimo a las obras del Team ICO (mi estudio favorito). Tiene problemas de rendimiento en algunas zonas y el juego es muy corto, demasiado. Muy recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065046011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1501973438}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044202278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1514789568}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073393602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1501843646}
review:
As a fellow spaniard I am very proud of this game. It has proven that spanish video games are slowly but surely raising their quality standards. 
So what's this game about? I am not gonna tell you, because that would ruin the ending. That's right, you get tiny pieces of the story here and there throughout the game but until the very end you don't know what is all about, and let me tell ya, when the moment comes, the goosebumps hit you hard. RiME is another great example of the unique way video games can handle storytelling.
Playing RiME I felt like I was replaying games I loved like The last guardian, The witness, Journey, Zelda, ICO, and others. It's a nice amalgamation of influences that accomplishes to be its own thing. 
Lastly I'd like to congratulate David García for this gorgeous soundtrack that helped me get immersed and lost in the game and took the whole experience to another level.
Good job guys, I am already looking forward to playing your next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122349087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1564104896}
review: I bought this game because it looked beautiful and the nature of the puzzles intrigued me. I was not prepared for just how beautiful the visuals and score were, the inquisitive, child-like wonder of the main character, or the emotional connection and twists the game takes, especially at the end (no spoilers though). I would very highly reccommend the game. The puzzles aren't the most challenging out there, but the way the story progresses, and the beautiful surroundings and music make you feel like the puzzles don't really need to be challenging, more that they're just part of the story of the game progressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072105704', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1501836767}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977473283', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1510240934}
review:
This game left me feeling immensely depressed.

There, consider that something of an... I don't know. Disclaimer? Anyway, now that that's out of the way, the actual review.

RiME is a game about a boy (or a very tomboyish girl? I'm not 100% sure about this), who wakes up on a beach and explores a brightly coloured and mystical island full of ancient ruins, colourful vistas, clever little puzzles and cute cuddly-wuddly animal-friends. It's all nice and lovely to start off with, but as the very start of this review may have clued you in: the game takes some dark turns. Personally I have to say I didn't enjoy the change in tone, although I cannot say it was poorly executed or anything. Just... not my thing. 

Visually the game is gorgeous, although even with a GTX 1080 I couldn't manage to wring out a steady 60 fps out of the game. The animations are fluid and detailed, the environments are full of life and hidden secrets to discover. All of this is enveloped in a lovely ambient soundtrac and some perfectly pleasant SFX work. 

The platforming is fairly basic, mostly ledge climbing with very few, if any, options allowing for the player to make mistakes. The game feels like it was made to toe the line between a walking simulator and a proper puzzle platformer, so don't expect any headache inducingly difficult puzzles here. 

All in all, I enjoyed the vast majority of RiME greatly and would recommend it, save for one thing. It's a SPOILER so I hid it down, below the meaningless scores.

Playtime: 5+ hours (Single playthrough)

Ratings (1-10)
Visual: 9 
Audio: 10
Story: 8
Gameplay: 6
Overall: 8

.
.
.
.
.

SPOILER: The cute fox dies! It just dies. Of sadness, I guess. I cannot recommend a game where the canine companion dies. Even Call of Duty didn't stoop that low! Bad RiME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991424838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1584889775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008734850', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1546714436}
review: Très très bon jeux avec une bande sons de fou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052941330', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 472, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1691263181}
review: I orginally beat this game in 2017, so this is an updated review. Now that I'm a bit older, I appreciate it even more than the first time I played it. The music is beautiful and compliments the wonderful artstyle. The story is simple, but bittersweet nontheless. I'd say this is a must play indie game. Still holds up fantastically to this day if you don't mind games that focus on exploration and puzzles. Definitely worth it, even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969243445', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1640340263}
review:
Wow, just beautiful.

I just finished playing it, took me about 6 hours over a couple of days (it felt longer), and am very moved emotionally.

Probably my favourite game ever is Journey (is a close tie with Portal), and feels like it has a lot of Journey DNA in it, along with the puzzle parts of Tomb Raider, with graphical reminders of Inside and Zelda BOTW.

I have been a gamer since the start, and this is one of the most beautiful games I have played, it gave me goosebumps on several occasions.

At its heart it is a puzzle game, and the puzzles are the right amount of difficulty IMO, some can leave you thinking a bit, but not enough to have to run off to Youtube to find a walkthrough.

I absolutely loved playing this, bravo to the dev team, you can tell it was a real labour of love. It will be high on my personal GOTY list.

While it is fairly short, I will definitely be replaying it over the years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123323083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1501526462}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073704591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1501500998}
review:
Ein sehr schönes Spiel, welches von Level zu Level schwieriger wird, auch wenn es nie wirklich schwer ist. ;)
Grafik könnte besser sein, ist aber okay!
Steuerung (PC) keine Probleme!
Das Ende ist etwas überraschend, ich finde aber es passt.
Mir hat es von Anfang an viel Spaß gemacht und es kam nie Langeweile oder Frust auf!
Der aktuelle Preis ist allerdings heftig und man sollte warten bis es billiger angeboten wird!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017822348', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1708532812}
review: Una delicia de jugar. Altamente recomendable, aunque quizá no a este precio. Debería estar a unos 15 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973830104', 'num_games_owned': 5845, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1501329008}
review:
I finished my first run through the game and I have to acknowledge that this is a true gem. While puzzles are quite easy, they use a wide variety of mechanics along many different places with different atmosphere. Level design itself must have been a long and careful work to achieve such a nice result. I won't spoil a word on the story, but there's no mystery why so many people say it's great. My advice is to play the game as it is meant to: with no information, just discover, and the magic will happen :)
If you are a puzzle / exploration lover, playing Rime is a no-brainer, it's simply wonderful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001386123', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1625666213}
review:
RiME es de los pocos juegos que sin decir una sola palabra consigue transmitir una historia emotiva a la par que triste. Posee una gran ambientación, buena estética y una banda sonora genial que hasta cuenta con un tema de Lindsey Stirling. La jugabilidad se basa en ir resolviendo puzzles no demasiado complicados combinándolos con una serie de plataformas.
No es un juego tampoco demasiado largo (aunque puedes rejugar para obtener secretos) pero sin embargo posee cierta "magia".

author: {'steamid': '76561197966296255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1501427732}
review: Simply beautiful from beginning to end, touching, thoughtful and thought provoking, amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561198289325364', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1548859156}
review: 剧情很棒，谜题一般不算难。好游戏[spoiler] 结局太 感动了	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198103602152', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1501379090}
review: RiME is not a challenging puzzle game; it's more of a thoughtful (and tearful) explorative journey with minor puzzle elements, but don't let that hold you back. It's the most beautiful and artful story I've seen in a video game in years. Short, sweet, and highly memorable; get it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007187027', 'num_games_owned': 2402, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1501345293}
review: A wonderful game and well worth a play

author: {'steamid': '76561198370880466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1602387980}
review:
真的是一款非常好的游戏了，无论是从音乐，画面还是风格方面来看，这都是令人感到无限的美妙。
剧情也有点出乎意料，但非常新颖。
从一开始的充满希望，到后面逐渐消失的同伴，感到绝望和失落，也让玩家身同感受，这种对玩家情感的传达实在是很棒。
总之，钱没有白花，真的是一个很好的游戏！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198271792984', 'num_games_owned': 2500, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1501329519}
review:
我觉得这个游戏可以称得上是一部艺术作品了。以下无剧透。
类型应该是剧情加解谜加动作，好多人都说像最后的守护者，仁者见仁智者见智吧。
在剧情发展过程中，情感的铺垫非常到位，极具代入感，反正玩去月球全程面瘫的我很菜的哭了两次（中间一次、结尾一次）。
整体的设计感觉很舒适，人物操作感很强，动作细节刻画相当出彩，经常让我忍俊不禁的是游戏中主角非常洒（zhi）脱（zhang）的奔跑以及踩水姿势，还有在玩家afk的时候挠屁股绑鞋带等。而且我有时候玩得太着急还经常摔得狗吃屎，主角还会揉屁股呻吟，以至于我后期都心疼得坚持让他走楼梯。
有些游戏不可避免地让玩家在解密过程中来回走的都是重复的路，RiME巧妙地化解了这一点，可以说是很讨喜了。
游戏流程4h左右，我是一边探索收集一边玩的，所以花了10h。
总结来说就是一部休闲娱乐佳作：（9-0.6）/10推荐。还有0.6是因为我狗2画质全高稳60的笔记本玩这个开全高，帧数波动太大，有的地方甚至掉到17帧，我觉得制作组可以考虑一下加强优化。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079019119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1501322687}
review:
はじめにＰＶをみて、ＩＣＯに雰囲気が似ているな～と思いつつ購入してプレイしました。
ＩＣＯに影響を受けたのかなと思われる描写が実際たくさんありました。
コレクションなど一切気にせずストレートにクリアして５時間くらいでした。

全体を通して音楽が美しいです。
風景も綺麗で雰囲気もよく、ＩＣＯなど雰囲気ゲーが好きなら楽しめると思います。

クリアまでプレイすることで真価を発揮する作品です。
ぜひ最後までプレイすることをおすすめします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198060700530', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1670367757}
review:
il gioco è diviso in cinque capitoli: 1 negazione 2 rabbia 3 patteggiamento 4 depressione 5 accettazione, esattamente come le cinque fasi dell'elaborazione di un lutto elaborate dalla psicologa Elisabeth Kubler Ross nel 1970.
E' incredibile come ogni fase venga rappresentata nel mondo di gioco attraverso le immagini e la colonna sonora, una delle piu toccanti che ho mai ascoltato. Ho trovato il gioco molto immersivo ed emozionante. I puzzle sembrano molto semplici e banali ma sono funzionali al messaggio del gioco o almeno a come l'ho interpretato io e cioè che bisogna mettersi nella giusta prospettiva, trovare un energia diversa, forse un amico, un animale e andare avanti. Poi dicono che i giochi non servono a niente... 
Ve lo consiglio, uno dei miei giochi preferiti di quest'anno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021941395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1501210009}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067483150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1511633048}
review:
Felicitar al estudio español Tequila Works por su gran obra. Desde el primer momento me encontré inmerso en un mundo colorista, una gran ambientación y un diseño artístico que denota el gusto por el saber hacer del equipo responsable de este proyecto. Otro de los puntos más destacables e su  gran banda sonora, y el acierto con  que acompaña los giros que van aconteciendo a lo largo de la historia. 

Pocas pegas puedo poner ante estre trabajo, quizás en algún situación puntual, la cámara no se coloca en el mejor de los ángulos, pero es algo muy esporádico y que se puede pasar por alto, teniendo en cuenta la calidad global del producto, ya que se nota en gran medida el cuidado por los detalles a lo largo del proyecto.

Sin duda un must-have para los amantes del género.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998895447', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1501070050}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968572375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1543009964}
review:
Excellent.
Mostly an exploration game with mild environmental puzzles.
To me it felt similar to an early Tomb Raider or Prince of Persia, but without the combat.  (You've got no weapons, but starting in level 3-ish there are things actively trying to hinder you.  Most of the game, no arcade reaction skills are required.  There's also never a big penalty for missteps, just a minor rewind to a safe location.)
There's a pleasant differentiation between the five main levels, both visually and through the addition of new (sometimes minor, sometimes major) gameplay elements.
It might be worth noting that there's no in-game map, despite some huge locations. But there was sufficient visual differentiation (and landmarks) that I never felt lost. 
This is a very pretty game, and despite a lack of true speech (nonsense sounds are used, but they convey plenty of emotion), it manages to tug one's heartstrings.
I enjoyed the gameplay enough that I'm going back to replay levels to find all the collectables.  (After completing the game, you're allowed to chose to restart any level.)
If you enjoy exploration/puzzle games, I heartily recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142096502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1500853773}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995369485', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1500762183}
review:
Ah Rime, Rime, Rime, you had so much potential. I can see why both Sony and Microsoft dropped this game as an exclusive. Rime is a glorified running simulator, the games vast areas have you running from point A to point B solving annoying puzzles where, get this, the boy has to scream at statues?! There is basic platforming along the way that would make Mr Drake raise an eyebrow. The game can't decide whether its trying to ape Ico or Zelda and fails at both spectacularly. Also starring a creepy bird and nosey fox, Rime has a weird latency problem with its controller responsiveness, everything felt slow and laggy despite running at the supposed 60fps. I had to use Steam's controller config to reduce the analog stick's dead zone to the point where even a teeny nudge had the character do a sprint, that's how frustrated I was with the controls.

Didn't take me too long to finish the game but I had to force myself to the finish line, there is no point to exploring, no other meaningful gameplay, its pretty much 70% running, 20% screaming and 10% jumping. That's all there is. The one positive, the game has good music that can sometimes be downright amazing, gave me strange Tomb Raider Underworld music vibes. I regret buying this game at full price and wouldn't recommend it to you even if it were on sale and if you were bored and had nothing else to play.

Finally the graphics, I feel are good but not optimized. My GTX 980 Ti couldn't run the game at 60fps unless I toned down a few settings and selected FXAA (SMAA or TXAA made the game run worse).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052449251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1500750652}
review:
Absolutely breathtaking, and fun to play.

The story keeps you interested, the visuals are superb and the relaxed atmosphere manages to draw you in to see what happens. The puzzles were not too hard, but could usually be figured out with a little looking around.

I look forward to re experiencing this tale, almost like playing a gorgeous Miyazaki film. Try it! It's fun and has a great heart, emotional story with a real twist of an ending that, if you pay attention in the story, won't really be a total suprise.

Thank you Tequila for a wonderful experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979348554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1500692755}
review:
Summary: Beautiful game, not too hard, only frustrating bits result from some unfortunate camera decisions, but the atmosphere is silent and melancholy and strange and ultimately quite sad. Don't play this one if you're depressed.

The puzzles in this game are environmental/atmospheric - figure out how to get to this place, move this object a certain way, what can I drag to put on this floorplate switch - that sort of thing. You will not suddenly have to stop and break story to do a math or logic puzzle. Platforming elements are jumping and ledging; grabbable ledges are always very clearly marked by what some sites and walkthroughs call "chalk marks" but to me looked like bird droppings. I am a lousy jumper and I only missed maybe one jump in the course of the whole game, so that should tell you how forgiving the jumping is.

You don't get voluntary saves; the game saves at checkpoints (look for the shell icon to appear at the top right corner of the screen briefly). They're frequent enough, and it's hard enough to mess up, that this isn't much of a problem in practice. Note that there ARE one or two places where you can blow past a collectable or achievement easily and you won't get another chance at it without replaying the game - which would likely be pretty tedious, once you've seen it all once you likely won't want to see it again.

The only annoying decision is that the game sometimes locks you into a particular fixed camera angle for whatever perverse reason of its own, and this can make some of the jumping and so on in that area much harder. Also, if you're playing with keyboard you'll find that the keys change depending on your orientation, so you ledge around a corner by pressing D, then stop moving for a moment, and now the direction you were going is "up" so if want to keep going that way, now you press W. This matters for backward jumps in particular. Fortunately, the character gives good visual cues, looking over his shoulder when he's ready for a backward jump or reaching out to the side when he's poised to jump sideways to another ledge.

Also, some of those fixed camera angles require you to move diagonally with precision, particularly two long bridges where you could easily fall off, and this is nearly impossible with a keyboard. Bottom line: Playing with a controller is probably better.

Note that Denuvo has officially been removed from the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131212854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1500644781}
review:
I like this game. It's like ABZU but with puzzle elements, so if you are into puzzle like me, I could reccomend it. However, when it only takes 5 hours to beat WITH exploring and smelling the roses, I cannot reccomend it for 40$. I adored the game's setting, and I liked the speculation-orientated story, however, I felt as if I didn't care for the characters as much as the game wanted me to. If it goes on sale for around 20$, pick it up.

(Addition: I feel like some mechanics didn't get as fleshed out as they should have been. They end up just feeling like one/two-time gimmicks, like that day/night cycle affecting ball.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003973336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1500946914}
review:
ABZU and RiME are two games I've played recently that feel very similar: really nice/simple/beautiful aesthetic, wondrous exploration, and story telling without a single printed or spoken word. and I love them both! I wish there were more games like these!

since the games seem so comparable in my mind, I may as well compare them more: RiME is a little more platform-y and puzzle-y than ABZU, but never anything that requires any crazy reflexes. both have lots of hidden goodies to find, and they're hard! when you find one, you feel good and smart. RiME is a longer game. I do not believe that more length == more value, but having said that, RiME is not longer because it's padding the gameplay with mindless tasks; I feel like the game is constantly throwing new mechanics, or settings, or... "characters"? at me. which is great! I keep thinking "surely this is the end," but it's not, and there's yet more cool stuff I've never seen before!

the only bad thing I'll say about RiME is that it has a couple things that make me go "did they have to rush this part?" the menu has some weird issues (every time you go into the controller settings, it reverts to keyboard, even if you've previously selected gamepad), and the swimming controls are a little janky? they're fine, it just feels less polished than the swim mechanics of most 3rd-person action games, and it's weird to see that when the rest of the game is blowing my mind on so many other fronts. maybe they just decided their time was better spent on the game itself. or maybe the keyboard+mouse swimming is PERFECT - I haven't tried it. who knows!

again, it's a super-minor point. this game is beautiful; it's amazing. the world feels like something out of a Miyazaki movie. I recommend it 100%. play RiME. play ABZU.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027513634', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1506733431}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970599286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1506801341}
review:
Some people would call this an Ico clone, but it's more like a beautiful love letter to Ico, if anything.

I love Ico is one of my most beloved games of all time, so the Ico associations that well up inside of me while playing RiME, is just a really nice thing, but that should not suggest that RiME does not have it's own charm and originality, because it truly does.

The world of RiME is absolutely gorgeous and nothing like the dark setting of Ueda games, even though i love that.
It has beautiful cartoonish/wind waker type graphics, and the world is very big for a puzzle game!

The often breathtaking scenery and charming but also melancholic score left me in awe several times!

The music is mostly playfull and contemplative piano pieces often accompanied by strings.

While there is no leitmotif to speak of, the music sort of reflects the game worlds free roaming spirit, but will often break out into grander themes in tanden with what you are doing in the game! So the game often responds to you by lifting the music and tempo and harmony up a notch or two!

Sometimes the music felt very inspired by Joe Hisaishi, there is almost the main theme for "Mononoke Hime" in there, but hey, that's not a bad thing, not a bad thing at all!

Absolutely gorgeous game that i would recommend to everyone who loves games, especially fans of Zelda and Ico/Shadow of the Colossus/The Last Guardian type of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030637029', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1498297684}
review:
https://youtu.be/TiSYGT4Nx6M

un jeu indépendant d'aventure dans lequel on incarne un jeune garçon qui se retrouve échouer sur une ile.
[list]
[*]l'ambiance visuelle est plutôt bien travaillée avec des teintes pastelles, des jeu de lumiére, de couleurs et de décors qui donnent vie aux niveaux en les dinstiingant des autres avec des ressentis différents
[*]l'ambiance sonore est minimaliste mais plutôt efficace
[*]l'aventure est assez linéaire mais on ne resent pas vraiment le coté "couloir" car le monde est suffisement ouvert (cela reste un bien grand mot) pour nous sentir libre d'explorer l'ile et ses batiments.
[*] il y a des amulettes, jouets et berceuses cacher dans les niveaux
[*]le jeu en lui même ne présente pas de grande difficultés l'histoire et le ressenti est au premier plan.
[/list]

le jeu m'a bien plu il a des défaut suffisement présents pour être ressenti. je ne me suis pas forcé pour aller au bout mais si un autre jeu mavais taper dans l'oeil j'aurais pu faire cette erreure.

ce jeu ne plaira pas a tout le monde. ceux qui n'aiment pas les jeux narratifs contemplatifs passez votre chemins. Les curieux, ce jeux vous offrira quelques heure de plaisir. mais c'est un jeu qu'il faut faire jusqu'au bout pour le savourer a sa juste valeur (il faut bien savoir si l'on apprend ce qu'on fait sur cette ile ou non)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084182639', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1610838041}
review: I Absolutely Love this game. There is no dialogue in the game but it works well with the mechanics and exploration. You exploring the island with your fox buddy is the way to progress through the story. I have a little RiME fox plush myself and it is the most adorable little thing. I recommend this game because it pulls you into the screen making you feel as if you are the little boy figuring out where and why you are there on the island.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994460596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1500661359}
review:
Pero.. pero.. este juego es una obra de arte!. 

Menudo descubrimiento, asi, como sin querer, voy a dar con uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en muchos años. Esteticamente es magnifico y su banda sonora increible. Es sencillo pero maravilloso, todo un placer jugarlo.

Mi mas sincera enhorabuena al estudio responsable y ojala nos sorprendan con futuros juegos de esta calidad o similar. Muchas gracias por este magnifico juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007757733', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1500398947}
review:
I'm so glad I played this game, so far it makes it to 2nd place in 2017 releases for me personally. 

The graphics are really good, I love the slightly cartoony style of it. What's even better is the sound design, 
it's really well done and the music just tells the story and gives you the right atmosphere and feels. 

That being said, the game doesn't have dialogues but with the music, paintings and a few cutscenes there's 
absolutely no need for it and you'll get a very magical, maybe Disney, feeling. The puzzles aren't too hard so 
you won't get the feeling that it's a drag, Rime is about the story. Though I do feel that they could have 
been a bit more challenging. 

If you want to get a glimps of Rime, feel free to check out my streams: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EaTv88fQMMY&list=PL9jE2xkXx_UgLAdrwUsGeTmmkbp1JArlN

author: {'steamid': '76561198357039675', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1651756256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198277992785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1500301474}
review:
以前在微博上就看到过游戏的宣传片。挺好的游戏，集大成的3d解密游戏，画面和配乐都很棒，故事讲的也挺让人动容。通关以后还能看美术设定的插画。

author: {'steamid': '76561198313293276', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1500214599}
review:
Si os gustan los juegos artísticamente hermosos y con una buena historia RiME debe estar en vuestra libreria de steam casi por obligación. Los puzles son algo simples y tiene caidas de fps importantes que deberian solucionar, pero aparte de eso no deberíais dejad pasar esta obra maestra.

Le doy un 8.5 por las caidas pero en si es un juego de 9

author: {'steamid': '76561197970943751', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1527108727}
review: Alguns problemas de desempenho e estabilidade iniciais que vão provocando ao longo do jogo algumas quebras. Esquecendo esses problemas é um jogo com uma boa historia em volta de um grande mistério onde podemos explorar uma ilha e descobrir os seus segredos sem nos preocuparmos com inventários e itens, apenas temos que resolver os quebra-cabeças que vão aparecendo. O jogo está muito bom também ao nível sonoro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986052853', 'num_games_owned': 1550, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1500117915}
review:
RIME es uno de los videojuegos con mas calidad narrativa, sin soltar una sola palabra en toda la aventura que he jugado jamás. Solo por eso ya merece la atención de mucha gente que busca algo diferente y original. 

En lo jugable no es innovador en nada, no hay practicamente acción, nuestro personaje solo puede saltar y pegar un grito, que es como interactua con el entorno. Pero por contra esta plagado de puzzles muy variados que nos hacen usar un poco la matéria gris. Ya sean jugando con sombras, con objetos en diferentes posiciones, jugando con la perspectiva etcétera.

Por otro lado tenemos las plataformas, que es el típico sistema de subir por paredes o saltar a diferentes repisas de distintos niveles, pero realizados con un nivel sublime, que se te hace cómodo e intuitivo desde el primer segundo y con la cámara perfectamente ubicada, sin problemas de saltar cuando no debe, ni "muertes" por caída inesperada como en muchas otras aventuras. Si habéis jugado a ICO o Shadow of the Colosss, es un muy buen ejemplo para compararlo.

En lo gráfico, yo creo que es donde mas destaca RIME. Es un estilo parecido a los dibujos, con colores pastel muy al estilo de Journey, con un diseño de decorados brutal, dónde no tenemos mapa ni falta que nos hace. Lo cual nos quiere decir lo bien diseñados que esan, porque al igual que DARK SOULS, no lo necesitamos ya que no nos vamos a perder en eningún momento. Y si así fuera, no aparece un amigo que nos acompaña toda la aventura, que es un zorro muy simpático que nos ayuda con sus ladridos.

RIME no es un videojuego para niños, porque es probable que no entiendas la metáfora que nos pretende transmitir y que iremos entendiendo a medida que lleguemos a los compases finales de la aventura, que es cuando atamos cabos y entendemos el porque de cada zona y entendemos a su vez el motivo de la aventura y lo que nos ha querido explicar.

Uno de los mejores de 2017 sin ninguna duda, lástima que no venda lo que merece por el echo de ser un proyecto "pequeño".

author: {'steamid': '76561198043762737', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1500079132}
review:
This game is incredible!

It starts as a curious game, since the story is presented without any narrative or dialog, so you'll draw a lot of conclusions yourself about the "why's" and the "where's". Soon, the game will show you it has a spiritual side, that somehow the wreck of the boys ship and the scenes and figures of the island are connected.

I won't talk more about the story, because it's very well done and it's a good thing (and a sad one as well) to figure out. The grafics are also amazing, following the "cartoon" kind of style, but very well polished and detailed. Gameplay flows smothly as well.

Overall, great. I hope to see more titles like this in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396645540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1539221897}
review: Very pretty, great puzzles... However it's gotta have the most DEPRESSING ending of any game I've ever played. I was all set to give a 10/10 review up until the ending, which kind of ruined the experience. I'll never be replaying, and will only recommend to those who like having their hearts ripped out mercilessly. I'm all for ambiguous and/or existential endings and storylines, but they really should have some form of catharsis.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993919351', 'num_games_owned': 3224, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1627432713}
review:
Polecam, pięknie zrobiona gra, acz nie dla każdego. 
Jeżeli chcecie raczej coś przeżyć niż przejść grę, tak.
Jeżeli chcecie poskakać po platformach, i generalnie macie w niskich priorytetach elementy fabularne to nie jest gra dla was. Elementy zręcznościowe są zrealizowane poprawnie, ale to wszystko.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055562045', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1500031940}
review:
I don't always write reviews. But when I do, it's for an awesome game. Like this one.

This game is so beautiful. So mesmerizing. It's a game where you can actually feel like you are the character you're playing as. You will feel overwhelmed and you are going to be hit right in the feels by this game. You will be happy, angry and sad. 

This game is one of the most beautiful games i have played. The environment. The different enemies you will face. You will have a blast playing this game.

I really reccomend this game. Yeah, it's short but on these 7 hours I spent in this game I have experienced a story that i won't forget in a long while!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048847463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1497744263}
review:
Сперва вам покажется что это просто красивая игрушка, чистая, лёгкая и светлая. Но это не так. У этой игры зубы как у смилодона. И она их покажет - вы в полной мере ощутите ужас, боль и тоску. Несправедливость? - вы незнаете ЧТО это такое. Всё тлен, всё пепел и лёгкого ветра достаточно чтобы ничего не стало. "Нет, этого не может быть!" - это ВАШИ слова. Они СТАНУТ вашими. 
 Катарсис, как он есть.

 P.S.
 Прямо сейчас - вцепитесь в плечо того кто рядом и не отпускайте, ни за что - слышите? - ни за что не отпускайте!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009344426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1499941058}
review:
Lo recomiendo al cien por cien.
Al principio cuesta un poco entrar en su mundo. El movimiento del personaje se puede hacer un poco tosco, empiezas en una playa en la que nadie te dice nada y no sabes por dónde ir... 

Al menos a mí me paso eso, me costó un poco entrar en la historia, pero poco a poco el juego me fue enganchando y metiendo en su ambiente, las mecánicas se van descubriendo por sí mismas si eres un poco paciente y al final la historia se abre ante ti y termina sobrecogiéndote y arrugando el corazón.

Desde luego es uno de los mejores juegos españoles a los que he jugado, eso sin ninguna duda.
Hay toques evidentes del Team Ico, del Studio Guibli y de todo ese tipo de contar una historia sin tomarte por tonto, que sea el propio jugador el que con sus actos y su exploración vaya entendiendo todo.

La banda sonora me ha recordado mucho al gran maestro japonés  Joe Hisaishi, han hecho un trabajo excelente.
Al principio pensé que era una pena que Sony se hubiera bajado del proyecto y no confiara en este estudio, pero con este juego demuestran que hay mucho talento e ideas muy muy buenas, así que me alegro un montón de que hayan podido sacarlo adelante y que esté teniendo el reconocimiento mundial que está teniendo.
Recomendado sin dudarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984869541', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1499908620}
review:
This game was a really excellent experience that I think everyone should play.  Could be picked up and beaten by anyone,  not too challenging, keeps the flow going, really pretty to look at and a nice sense of wonder throughout.  Amazing music, some of the most memorable from a game I've heard in a bit -- even though I played this directly after BOTW.  This is a game that provokes feelings like not many other games can, made me think of Journey at times with some of its sequences.  

If I have to complain about this game, it crashed on me a few times when alt-tabbing on a 3-screen setup and it has some stuttering issues when outdoors at points.  Very minor flaws and although it's not the most innovative game in the world once again it's definintely something everyone should play.  Very worth a pickup and will be making my non-gamer GF give it a try soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965864092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1498995048}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052770199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1499353442}
review:
RiME is one of my most anticipated Indie project as soon as it was announced that it was no more a PS Exclusive , and it was available for all Platforms.

Current PC scenario, pre-ordering a product is absolutely the most riskiest decision to make. I still did it, 

Day 1 - So many bugs, Screen Tearing all over the place inspite of keeping V-sync, on and Double buffering on in the settings.

Patch 1.01; Still lots of issues were faced, lot of people started asking for Refunds, especially some users wrong mouthed the developer in the Steam forum {Darius].

Patch 1.02; A little better but not the best, at least the Framerates were a bit stable

Patch 1.03; Denuvo was cracked , and so Denuvo was removed with this patch, the game performed a lot better inspite of RiME developer Darius stating that Denuvo didn't hamper performance.

Final Patch {My Guess} 1.04 ; The game now runs beautifully and some settings like Bloom and Depth of Field are off Defualt, so far its runs smoothly.

Despite all these issues and Intial negativity, let us all as Gamers get this clear, regarding these issues, RiME,,,,RiME is a Beautiful Masterpiece !!! Nothing else to say....... Throughout the game the soundtrack was the highlight, how beautiful it is too listen, the ambience it creates, the atmosphere that is produced, is impecable ! 

Into; 

Stage 1 (Denial) ; The breathtaking view we all see in the beginning of the Story, is absolutely Beautiful , stunning and Interesting to explore !! Gameplay asthetics are very cute like throwing the fruit at the Pigs so they leave a way for you to shout at the statues, Foxy companion is so cute !! Love it !! 

But the issue i had, Puzzles were very  Easy ....too Easy...maybe they were targeting even  younger generation Kids to play.

Stage 2 (Anger) ; This stage is interesting for Puzzles and the Big Bird boss battle , the atmosphere here is searing scorching hot dessert like atmosphere, the story drags you into a rutheless scenario.

Here we were having lot of framedrops in this level, but its fixed now !

Stage 3 (Bargaining) ; The atmosphere completley changes as soon as this stage begins as you end up in a foresty area, feels like we are inlands of the island ! 

The main problem i had with this stage was the Achievement 'Hold your Breath' where we restrict ourself when swimming to 1 bubble of air as we go underwater and pop up on the other side ! so many retries, it was crazy...But i achieved it !!! 

{BTW; All my Indie games has a 100% completion rate in terms of Achievements]

Stage 4 (Depression) ; This is by far the Stage when Sadness hits us as everyone we know and our Knowledge of ourselves, starts to vanish, the Wet Rainy atmosphere, the melancholy soundtrack, and the depressing boys emotions starts to hit you before the final stage.....

Stage 5 ( Acceptance) ; This is the ending , shocking Revelation !!!! This makes you realize the way we viewed the story was actually from a totally different scenario, a Different Perspective as the Realistion hits us on what happened actually ......Its so emotional, there are two endings , the alternative ending is the best one and you can achieve it by getting the White shade achievement ( Sweet Memory). Now is when most people start crying !!! 

At the end of this game, you can now unlock each stage individually !

This is when to all the people who had asked a refund made a BIG Mistake !!!!! 

Thank you Tequilla Works, Greybox for publishing this game and Unreal 4 Engine for bringing this game to light !!!! 

Thank you Darius and Rubio for this Masterpiece !!! Never regretted Pre-ordering this game !

Get it during the Sale !

author: {'steamid': '76561197978069247', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1589122978}
review:
RiME is a simple puzzle game with a backstory that you won't understand until the end of the game. There aren't many hazards in RiME, you may incidentally fall off a clip but other than that, there are a couple areas that have 'bad guys' which are barely a nuisance as long as you keep your distance. Due to the game's linearity, the puzzles are fairly straight-forward; there are hidden collectibles, but you'll have the opportunity to replay the levels after finishing the game.

I completed the game in around 6.5 hours, the graphics, sound, and performance were good and I enjoyed playing something relaxing. I played through and did a little searching for collectibles but didn't get them all, there is replayability in going back and finding the collectibles.

I recommend this if you're looking for an easy-going game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079092998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1636514543}
review: Basically Legend of Zelda for Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050462598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1590506500}
review:
Games como este me fazem refletir muito. Primeiro sobre o quanto vale a pena jogar algo que te adiciona coisas positivas ao zerar. 
Tudo que posso dizer para quem for jogar é: Coloque seu fone de ouvidos, e jogue sem expectativa alguma. O game é muito bem feito. 
A trilha sonora colabora muito para a imersão durante o progresso.

Finalizei o game e muitos desafios ficaram sem sucesso. Mas o criador do game disponibilizou a escolha das fases para procurar eles sem ter que fazer todo o jogo.
Um game que não há diálogo algum, nem itens nem ninguem para você conversar. Mas ao mesmo tempo, a cada fase, uma cascata de pensamentos bailavam enquanto jogava, 
Nos primeiros minutos de game já havia me encantado com a primeira transição de dia para noite. No meio do jogo já estava envolvido com o personagem. No final... reflexão... compreensão... alegria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003949842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1499392099}
review:
RiME est une expérience apaisante où l'on incarne un petit garçon. Le gameplay est simple et se résume au strict minimum : se déplacer, crier et intéragir avec des objets. 
Cela se joue facilement et agréablement malgré les mécaniques de gameplay finalement assez répétitives. Les énigmes sont simples dans l'ensemble, faisant de RiME un voyage plutôt qu'un casse-tête. La durée de vie est ainsi assez courte (comme tous les jeux du genre ^^). Elle peut être un peu allongée avec la récolte des collectibles secondaires. 
La DA se rappoche d'un Firewatch ou d'un The Witness, c'est joli et agréable mais rien de bluffant. 
Mais là où le jeu excelle, selon moi c'est dans le choix de ses thèmes musicaux et dans sa construction. 
En effet, difficile de ne pas spoiler le jeu dans mon avis, tant la construction du jeu est significative et bien réalisée. Du coup j'ai essayé de choisir des mots adéquats et à double sens ^^
Au début l'on ne comprend pas grand chose, on se contente de jouer et les thèmes musicaux insufflent petit à petit les émotions. La fin est très réussie, même si les développeurs auraient pu, selon moi, aller encore plus loin dans leur construction pour la rendre parfaite. 
Après honnètement RiME n'a pas été une révélation ou une baffe pour moi non plus, seuls les thèmes musicaux, la construction et la fin (et l'émotion) sont réellement excellents. 
Le jeu, ou en tout cas cette version PC souffre de baisse de fps à certains moments. (même si la dernière maj semble avoir amélioré ce point), mais rien d'insupportable non plus.
À prendre donc pour passer un bon petit moment apaisant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982403017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1499788309}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970259503', 'num_games_owned': 1612, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1511382618}
review:
Dejando de lado los problemas tecnicos que pueda tener cada uno, yo no he tenido ninguno al jugarlo practicamente

Me parece una maravilla, desde la historia: como lo vives, como avanzas por ella, como se desenlaza.
Aristicamente es realmente precioso, sin mas, todo esta cuidado al minimo detalle, es realmente bonito
Y la musica, esa banda sonora es realmente impresionante

Hacia tiempo que un juego no me hacia experimentar sensaciones como lo ha conseguido RIME

Gracias Tequila Works por compartir esta historia con el mundo y del modo que lo ha hecho

author: {'steamid': '76561197967434391', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1499629812}
review:
RiME ist ein wirklich tolles Indie Game aus dem Hause Tequilla Works. Es ist ein sehr stimmig erzähltes (non verbales) Jump and Run mit einigen Puzzles. Die Puzzles sind nicht gerade schwer, daher praktisch keine Frust Momente. Gespielt habe ich das Spiel mit einem XboxOne Pad, die Steuerung war somit ziemlich gut, nur manchmal machte die Kamera Sicht das ganze gehüpfe schwerer als es eigentlich wäre.

+ Story
+ Artstyle
+ Rätsel
+ Soundtrack

- Steuerung ab und zu etwas hakelig
- Kamera Sicht ab und zu etwas doof gewählt

Ich habe das Spiel als #letsplay gespielt. Hier findet Ihr die gesammte Playlist:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hdmDRh4TAQM&list=PL1IvjoJolYhqkoDn5y09zQXhSimHgA55E


Ein wirklich tolles Indie Spiel, ich kann es nur weiter empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147662492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1498532442}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101640357', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1499622733}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010640985', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1502457392}
review:
This game reminded me of ICO whe I first saw the trailer. And gameplay-wise it is very much like that. Just without a girl to cary around and without the nasty combat.
You climb around the island and the tower, solve some easy but fun puzzles and collect some secrets on the way. Or you just stop for a moment and admire the beautifull scenery.

It took me around 9 hours to finish the game and I found a bit more than half of the secrets... so there are some more hours in it for me.

Rime manages to stay interesting and never puts you in situations that feel tedious or unmanagable. And you are gently guided by your little fox companion, if you ever get a bit lost.

The soundtrack is also great and reminded me a bit of Journey. (In a good way)
Combined with the optical style of the game it never gets old to look at the scenery.

And the story... is unexpected, sweet and... the rest would be a spoiler. ;P

[h1]Tl;dr[/h1]
It's a very beautiful game in every aspect. It's very polished and a great and emotional journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007472616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1553480923}
review:
RiME is an adventure game which carries on the tradition of popular contemplative adventure titles, such as "Journey" or "Abzu", while succesfully pursuing its own distinct direction.

You are tasked with exploring and solving puzzles inside a dreamy set of landscapes in order to unfold the real reason behind your journey; the contemplation of the incredible level design is of course an integral part of the experience but RiME, unlike the aforementioned games, offers a very satisfying and layered exploration gameplay which at times resembles the popular "Legend Of Zelda" saga.
The worlds you are going to visit aren't simply vast corridors to traverse, but intricate sets of structures filled with collectables, secret passages, hidden treasures and very engaging puzzles.

Just like the previously mentioned "Zelda" saga, RiME offers some very pleasent puzzles which won't prove to be too hard to solve, but most of them definitely showcase some very clever designs, especially when it comes to the handling of light sources.
I'm not saying more on that simply to avoid giving spoilers.

Since the very beginning of the game it's clear that most of the areas are very vast and intricate, and sometimes you are even treated with some breathless views of the landscape you just traversed; it feels like exploring "small" worlds, rather than separate maps, and the level design is alkways top notch.

Of course the second biggest appealing factor of the game are the "dreamlike" qualities of the experience itself; the worlds you are going to traverse whisper to you of ancient worlds, mind abstractions and physical manifestations of fears, ranging from ancient ruins caressed by the sun, to shady hallways roamed by dark spirits, and while you'll be busy taking in all of this, a superbly melancholic soundtrack will guide you to the end of the adventure.

It can't be denied that RiME is a game that is made with and speaks to the heart but, while still recommended, I have to describe its evident shotrcomings.
The game is simply a bit rough on the technical side; the graphics themselves are delightful, but the game simply doesn't seem to run well, not even if you have a decent PC or try to be humble with the antialiasing and such.
A recent patch made things better and there's no Denuvop working in the background anymore, but unless you lower all the settings you have to be prepared for some stuttering here and there.
Also some of the game aspects, like the climbing mechanics (not featured that much, fortunately) aren't nearly as smooth as in "Uncharted" or "Tomb Raider", leading to a couple of frustrating moments, when the character doesn't respond exactly as intended.

If you don't mind a couple of rough spots I still highly recommend playing RiME, especially because it shows that you don't always need to sacrifice gameplay to create an engaging dreamlike experience.

Pros:

- Intricate and vast level design
- Delightful graphics and style
- Captivating melancholic feel
- Real exploration of the environments
- Very original puzzles
- Misterious and dreamlike
- Nice rythm
- Fun to play as well as to "experience"

Cons:
- Technically rough (It simply doesn't run very well)
- Imprecise controls

To consider:
- Short (if you don't care about the achievements)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986493358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1499016537}
review:
Opinión de RIME:

Historia:

Un niño se despierta es una isla después de un naufragio.

Sobre el juego:

-Juego de aventura puzzle de misterio y exploración.
-Sobre las 12 horas de duración sin completarlo al 100%
-Cuenta con muchos desbloqueables.

Lo que me ha a gustado:

-El como han enfocado la historia y en mantener la intriga hasta el final.
-El apartado artístico y sonoro, es un juego muy contemplativo.
-Que no haya nada en el hud
-La ambientación 
-Los puzzles (Aunque son fáciles)


Lo que no me ha gustado:

-Pequeños fallos de programación 


Conclusión:

Se lo recomiendo a todas las personas que disfrutaron con ICO porque le encuentro muy parecido, es un juego muy bonito artísticamente con una historia que te engancha de principio a fin. Uno de los mejores juegos al que he jugado en mucho tiempo, muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987912199', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1499392156}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035815127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1585842780}
review:
A RIME látványvilága, hangulata, zenéje magával ragadó.
Szeretném is, ha nem volna folyton "Fatal error".
Remélem, egyszer rendbe teszik és akkor végig tudom játszani rendesen.
Nem tudom, hogy a fejlesztők-e a bénák, vagy a motor ilyen optimalizálatlan, de jelen pillanatban játszahatatlan.
Úgy érzem magam, mintha megloptak volna, elvették a pénzem és kiszúrták a szemem egy gagyi valamivel.

Konfig: 
i7 3770K 4,6GHz+G.Skill 16GB+ GTX970....... és ezen nem képes rendesen futni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112101388', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1497181324}
review:
몇년전 이 게임을 만든다고 소개한 동영상을 보고는 그때부터 기다려왔던 게임이었슴다.. 그때 상상했던 분위기는 같았지만 조금 더 퍼즐 형식에 가까워서 조금 당황스러웠는데 별거 아니었슴다.

 라나뭐라나. 버벅대고 끊겨도 부드러운 느낌의 그래픽이라 그런지 짜증보다는 천천히 둘러보듯 즐긴것 같슴다. 퍼즐의 난이도나 맵을 헤메는건 그렇다 쳐도.. 그래도 여우가 길을 알려주기도 하고 거이 외길인 셈이라 크게 어렵진 않은것 같습니다. 헤메는 과정도 주변을 둘러보는 것이라 생각하면은요. 배경이 아름다우니까요!

 플레이 타임도 2회차 요소도 있어서 좋았습니다. 세삼 2챕터는 체감상 플레이 타임이 더 길었던것 같습니다. 마냥 평화로울줄 알았던 이 게임에 쫒기는 요소가 있다는것 때문이죠! 그래도 역시 그래픽때문에 딱히 지루하거나 하진 않았습니다. 그런 황금색으로 빛나는 곳을 아무런 제약 없이 돌아다닌다면 그냥 슥 보고 지나쳐버릴것 같기도 하고.. 뭔가 여러모로 기억에 남는것 같네요.

 결론?은 아름다운 그래픽과 노래, 독특하고 준수한 난이도의 퍼즐이 뒷받침되어있어 좋은 게임이라고 생각함다. 어드벤처와 퍼즐을 좋아하는 사람이라면 추천하는 바이고, 길치이거나 팡팡 터지는걸 좋아하는 사람이라면...... '')..
 그랬다고 한다. 마지막에 할 말을 까먹었다.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198089956620', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1547658405}
review: Rime est un jeu exellent mais j'ai malheureusement du y jouer en qualité "bas" malgré une configuration largement au dessus de ce qui est requis pour le faire tourner en ultra. J'espère de futurs patchs d'optimisation afin de pouvoir le refaire en haute qualité en 60 fps

author: {'steamid': '76561198017080060', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1515794280}
review: RiMe, prende spunto da giochi come Journey o The Witness, e c'è anche qualcosa che ricorda un po' di Studio Ghibli al suo interno. E' un gioco di avventura ed esplorazione ambientato in un mondo spettacolare. In Rime non ci sono combattimenti, però ci sono comunque dei pericolo. Il gioco non ha dialoghi quindi la storia in se si deve capire giocando e scoprendo i collezionabili. Quindi sta al giocatore entrare in contatto con il protagonista e il gioco. Colonna sonora assolutamente stupenda, il gioco cerca di nascondere il proprio scopo. Il gioco ha una longevità abbastanza lunga, esplorando dura ancora di più. Una composizione artistica stupefacente, RiMe lascerà un segno alla persona che lo giocherà, con i suoi momenti tristi e felici. Un gioco che va giocato con molta calma per riuscire a catturare tutta l'atmosfera che offre. Non voglio spoilerare niente sul finale ma dico solo, che probabilmente a molta gente lascerà l'amaro in bocca. Uno dei migliori giochi a cui abbia mai giocato sicuramente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304849054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1514385646}
review: This is an absolute amazing game. First off its very sound based, the puzzels, the music, even the characters every decible played in this game will be absolutely stunning. Secondly, it has an incredible story that you wont realize until the very end. The only problems that I have faced was the sound would cut out every once in a while, that could have been my audio, but its honestly not enough to not get this game. Rime is beautiful, atmospheric, perfect for the audiophile such as myself, and honestly a great game for anyone looking to do some puzzles. It caught me so off guard in the best way possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146846308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1500918775}
review:
Una historia cuyo desenlace llega hasta lo más profundo del [b]alma[/b].

Los puzzles no son nada del otro mundo, quedándose en un segundo plano en algunos puntos en la trama, pero esto es cubierto gracias al atractivo visual, llegando al punto de querer explorar como el mismo niño haría, de ahí el acierto de los coleccionables. Sin embargo, este periplo se me ha hecho algo corto, pero bueno, [i]no le busquemos tres pies al "zorro"[/i].

Nada más que dar mi enhorabuena por el gran trabajo al equipo de diseño artístico por este trocito de mundo idílico inspirado en la cultura mediterránea clásica. No menos se merecería la maravillosa banda sonora que la acompaña.

Uno de los apartados que deberían revisar exhaustivamente es la optimización del rendimiento gráfico, [spoiler]sobre todo en el capítulo de "Negociación"[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198090834122', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1546615240}
